industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Capital Markets, and Financial Services
description:
Position: Senior Data Analyst






Location: Mississauga, Canada



Responsibilities:


Focus – Strong SQL (relational/non-relational DB), Analytical skills and communication skills – Must and Hands-on experience in Scripting Languages (Python), APIs , Message bus and Linux environment – Preferred





Responsibilities:


• Work with business partners to design new workflows to transform business requirements into concrete insights

• Onboard financial markets data via multiple consumption methods (Message Buses, SFTP, SQL connectors, APIs).

• Parse, Normalize and Explore datasets and utilize algorithmic thinking to develop new robust controls

• Monitor existing controls’ effectiveness and develop automated procedures to optimize workflow

• Work as Part of a global team with internal/external stakeholders

• Engage with R&D teams take active role in the development lifecycle and design sessions.


 



Experience & Qualifications:


Data Visualization, Design and concept build, and Decision metrics are some of the key things that are needed

Need someone who is very hands on. No one will give the requirements but the candidate should be able produce a POC/Prototype for Tableau development team to build the solution

industries: Retail
description:
Come join Canada’s fastest growing grocery retailer in an exciting and challenging Data Analyst role! 





With a team of 22,000 of the world’s best grocers at more than 180 stores from B.C. to Manitoba, Save-On-Foods is one of BC’s Top Employers, B.C.’s Most Loved Brand, and a great place to grow your career. Our legacy of outstanding value and customer service dates back more than 100 years and continues in every community we serve, every day.




We value service, people, innovation, fun and integrity, and we strive to provide the best customer experience in every market where we do business. At Save-On-Foods we provide opportunities for continuous development, competitive total compensation and a fun working environment. We demonstrate corporate responsibility by living our core values supporting local and celebrating our world class team.




We currently have multiple opportunities across our organization for Senior 
Data Analysts 
to join our world class data team in 
Langley, BC
.




With one of the 
largest, most comprehensive data sets in Canada
, we use data to support all functions of the business (retail operations, supply chain, finance, customer, marketing, etc.) with the goal of providing the best customer experience in every market where we do business.




As a Senior Data Analyst, you will use all aspects of data & analytics and drive large-scale, continuous experimentation initiatives to guide decision making and deliver high-quality insights. Each day you will face new challenges and learning is a necessary part of the job – where 
predictive modeling
,
 big data technologies
 and 
statistical analysis
 are part of your daily routine.





You will be responsible for:






Working closely with stakeholders to understand business questions, processes, and KPIs.

Formulating testable hypotheses that align with business questions and executing statistical experiments in a live environment.

Writing SQL scripts to automate data pipelines and workflows.

Building modular data structures and models in collaboration with data engineers to support continuous experimentation.

Writing Python scripts in a Jupyter Notebook environment to conduct exploratory data analysis, data wrangling, statistical testing, and predictive modeling.

Mentor and cross-train data analysts in experimentation best practices and statistical designs.

Building dashboards and visualizations to convey insights and deliver reports on KPIs and test results using Power BI.

Learning cloud-based analytics environments and big data tools to build analytics workflows on terabytes of data.

Collaborating with IT and the Data Scientists to identify technical & data requirements to deploy analytic solutions catered to the business.

Finding unique and creative insights that identify new opportunities to drive business value.

Becoming the resident expert in the relevant datasets within your analytics domain.

In order to qualify for this role you will have a Degree in a STEM discipline and at least 3 to 5 years of relevant experience in data analytics and/or data science.






You have:






Advanced Python coding skills. Experience in other programming languages such as Java, Scala, or JavaScript is a plus.

Expertise in SQL.

Experience using experimental design principles such as A/B and multivariate testing, as well as experience working with business stakeholders to formulate testable hypotheses.

An understanding of advanced analytics and data science methods such as anomaly detection, forecasting, and supervised and unsupervised learning.

Experience with a visualization and reporting tool such as Power BI or Tableau.

A working knowledge of cloud environments, such as Azure, GCP or AWS. Experience with cloud environments and big data tools such as Spark and Databricks is a plus.






You are: 






A quick learner.

An exceptional written and verbal communicator with the ability to communicate a story with data and insights to non-technical stakeholders.

A problem solver with strong analytical, and critical thinking skills.

Effective in task management and deliver high quality work.

Able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.






What we offer





In addition to a 
highly competitive salary
, we offer a 
great range of benefits, a company pension plan
, 
free access to our onsite gym, free parking,
 
exclusive
 
team member offers
, and 
opportunities for development and career progression
.




Save-On-Foods is an inclusive team-oriented environment where we recognize achievements and celebrate them.




If you want to be part of an organization that makes an impact every day in our local communities, apply online today!




This position is based at Save-On-Foods’ Langley office and the successful candidate is expected to work in person at the office. While we’re currently operating with a hybrid work-from-home and in-office schedule, Save-On-Foods has a long history of innovation and collaboration, and we look forward to the day provincial health guidelines allow us to all work together in the office again. Ensuring the well-being of our team members remains our top priority as we transition back to working in the office, and as always, we will continue to follow the guidelines set by our Provincial Health Officer.

job_title: Conseiller(ère) principal(e) - Scientifique de données - Centre d’expertise - Modélisation et Recherche
industries: Banking, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
Le Mouvement Desjardins est le plus important groupe financier coopératif au Canada et l'un des principaux employeurs au pays. Il offre toute la gamme des produits et services financiers et regroupe les expertises en gestion de patrimoine, en assurance de personnes et de dommages, en service aux entreprises de toutes tailles, en valeurs mobilières, en gestion d'actifs, en capital de risque ainsi que des modes d'accès virtuels sécuritaires, à la fine pointe de la technologie.





Niveau d'emploi


NV-10




Vous êtes emballé(e) par la valorisation de données? Votre curiosité est sans limite lorsqu’il est question d’innovation? Vous souhaitez en apprendre toujours plus en relevant de nouveaux défis? En intégrant l’équipe de Modélisation & Recherche, vous serez au cœur du développement de solutions novatrices misant sur l’analytique avancée et contribuant à l’atteinte des objectifs d’affaires de DGAG. Également, vous évoluerez au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire composée de professionnels et gestionnaires de différents domaines : statisticien(ne)s, actuaires, scientifiques de données et spécialistes en systèmes d’information géographique (SIG).




La nature des dossiers exige des connaissances étendues et approfondies dans votre domaine. Vous contribuez à la résolution de problèmes d'affaires de complexité opérationnelle et conceptuelle élevée, nécessitant l'exploration de multiples sources de données, une analyse et une compréhension globale et détaillée du domaine d’affaires et de l’organisation. Vos mandats requièrent une appréciation des méthodes afin de formuler des recommandations et des solutions innovantes d’analytique avancée adaptées au contexte de nos partenaires internes.




Vous exercez un rôle de spécialiste-conseil et de contenu relativement à l'exploitation des données auprès des divers intervenants et agissez à titre de personne-ressource auprès d’instances décisionnelles. Vous êtes appelé à interagir avec un grand nombre de parties prenantes œuvrant dans des domaines d’expertise variés afin de comprendre et communiquer les enjeux et d'influencer la prise de décision. 




À titre de Conseiller(ère) principal(e) - Scientifique de données - Centre d’expertise, Modélisation et Recherche, vous aurez les tâches suivantes :


Responsabilités principales 






Analyser les besoins d'affaires des partenaires, produire des hypothèses et mener des mandats en considérant les particularités liées à leur opérationnalisation et en assurant l'arrimage lors de leur déploiement

Assurer la programmation nécessaire à la préparation et l’exploration des données, au développement et à l’évaluation de modèles de complexité élevée

Assurer l'exploration et l'évaluation des différentes données disponibles, leur caractérisation, l'inspection de la qualité, les ajustements et la sélection des prédicteurs dans le cadre de mandats diversifiés et complexes en modélisation prédictive

Utiliser des méthodes avancées en statistiques, en apprentissage automatique et en intelligence artificielle en vue d'exploiter les données, de développer et d'optimiser des modèles et des segmentations répondant aux besoins d'affaires

Produire, communiquer et vulgariser des présentations et des visualisations de données pour influencer les décisions d'affaires de son secteur auprès de la direction

Rédiger les encadrements et les méthodes de modélisation des données et s'assurer du respect des spécifications permettant une performance optimale des modèles construits. S’assurer de l’élaboration de la documentation, de la préparation et de la diffusion de formations

Cibler des opportunités d’optimisation des règles et des systèmes, anticiper les impacts sous-jacents aux changements et apporter des évolutions aux outils de gestion des données

Assurer une vigie externe afin de maintenir ses compétences à jour et demeurer à la fine pointe des nouveaux développements en science de la donnée.






Conditions particulières






Lieu de travail : Présentement en télétravail régulier découlant du contexte de la pandémie. Place d’affaires Montréal ou Lévis, selon la préférence du candidat retenu. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-Hybrid

Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1







Profil recherché







Baccalauréat en statistiques, en mathématiques, en actuariat, en informatique ou dans une discipline appropriée 

Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente dans le domaine de la science des données, notamment en développement de modèles prédictifs ou toute autre expérience pertinente

Diplôme de 2e cycle en statistiques, mathématique, intelligence d'affaire, intelligence artificielle (un atout)

Expérience pertinente en assurance de dommages (un atout)

Expérience dans le traitement de données télématiques, géospatiales ou autres bases de données non-traditionnelles (un atout)





Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées





Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire






Connaissances spécifiques



Maîtrise des outils de visualisation (Power BI, Tableau) (un atout)

Maîtrise d’au moins un langage de programmation en analytique de données (Python ou R) et d’un langage de manipulation de données (SAS ou SQL)

Très bonne connaissance des approches statistiques et des méthodes d’apprentissage automatique (régression, arbres de décision, SVM, machines de renforcement du gradient, clustering, réseaux de neurones, méthodes d’ensemble, etc.)

Connaissance pratique des principales librairies de science des données (apprentissage automatique, apprentissage profond, traitement automatique de la langue naturelle, visualisation)

Connaissance des plateformes infonuagiques (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) (un atout)

Connaissance des environnements et des outils de gestion de versions décentralisés (Git, Bitbucket, etc.) (un atout)

Fortes habiletés de communication en français et en anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
 







Compétences transversales Desjardins


Apprécier les différences, Apprendre avec agilité, Être orienté client, Être orienté vers l’action


Compétences clés au profil recherché


Gérer la complexité, Maîtriser les relations interpersonnelles, Stimuler l’innovation


Lieu de travail


6300, boul. Guillaume-Couture Lévis


Syndicat


Non Syndiqué


Date de fin d'affichage


2022-03-28


Famille d'emplois


Donnée (GF)

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,

Senior Associate, Data Analyst

At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Analyst at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in distributed computing technologies and operating across billions and billions of customer transactions to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time, and agony in their financial lives.



On Any Given Day, You Could Be




Writing SQL to clean, transform, investigate, and augment large, complex database tables

Working closely with business partners to make sure our business strategy is as data driven as possible

Designing rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to customers or company leaders

Ensure data and intent integrity by automated data quality verification pipelines

Supporting and consulting with the business to propagate data management best practices

Investigating the impact of new technologies on the future of digital banking and the financial world of tomorrow




The Ideal Candidate Will Be




Curious: You ask why, you explore, and you’re not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You know SQL and are constantly exploring new open source tools, and hitting up stack overflow on a regular basis.

A Wrangler: You know how to programmatically extract data from a database or an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and convert into a human-readable form (Matplotlib, QuickSight, Tableau, etc.).

Creative: Big, undefined problems and petabytes of data don’t frighten you. You’re used to working with abstract data, and you love discovering new narratives in unmined territories.

Proactive: You will want to share your knowledge with your peers and contribute back to inner/open source projects which you might consume.




Benefits




Your choice of hardware - latest MacBook Pro or HP EliteBook

With Manager approval, you can travel to a conference of your choice annually (senior+) - PyCon, PyData, AWS re:Invent, KDD, etc.

Various internal training opportunities across our US and Canada locations

$5000/yr education budget

Flexible work hours and casual environment


Twenty-five years after Capital One was started it’s still led by its founder. Be ready to join a community of the smartest people you’ve ever met, who see the customer first, and want to use their data skills to make a difference.



Basic Qualifications




At least 1 year of experience with relational databases and programming in SQL

At least 1 year of experience with version control systems like GitHub.




Preferred Qualifications




Experience working with AWS (EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, etc.)

Experience working with advanced Git Workflows (Pull Requests, Code Reviews, Issues, and Branching)

At least 1 year of experience in open source programming languages for large scale data analysis (Python or Scala)


Capital One Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to 
Careers@capitalone.com


Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).

Job Category - Strategy, Analytics

1.      Experience in C proramming

2.      Exposure to ARM architecture.

3.      Expertise in embedded testing domain eg: storage, medical, aero, network tc.

4.      Proficiency in devops or CI/CD are added+

5.      Knowledge of c/c++ are added+

6.      Good communication skills and should be based out of VC. They might need to come to office whenever site opens. Permanent remote working is not possible.

description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.


Job Level


NV-09

As a data analyst, you collect, process, analyze and use data that comes through different channels. You extract, describe, analyze and interpret the data needed to make informed business decisions.

You provide guidance and support to clients for analytics solution mandates that involve using data and designing reports adapted to business needs.

You use your analytical skills and extensive knowledge of your line of business to work on complex business projects and initiatives using data from different databases. You prepare recommendations, solutions and action plans based on the organization’s objectives and priorities.

Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your field.

You serve as a data use resource for various stakeholders. You interact with stakeholders working in other fields to understand needs, and present and explain analysis results.


General Information on the Position




Other Working Conditions




Work place : Currently regular telework because of the pandemic. Position located in Montreal. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work 

Number of jobs available : 1

Bachelor's degree in a related field

A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience


Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered


For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required




Desjardins Cross-sector Skills



Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Business insight, Complexity

Complexe Desjardins Montréal

2022-03-29

industries: Manufacturing
description:
Description




Position Summary:


The company is growing fast, and so is the data science team. The data science team’s main focus is automating the adjudication of claims. Using natural language processing and machine learning, we are able to auto-adjudicate claims in matter of seconds compared to the industry standard of one week. Expediting the laborious claims process not only allows our customers and partnering veterinary clinics to focus on providing the best care for their pets, but also allows Trupanion to operate at scale as our business grows. This transformative shift in user experience, as well as operational efficiency is critical in achieving the company’s goal of market-wide adoption.

As a data scientist, you will be responsible for making improvements to models currently in production, with a focus on our state-of-the-art Optical Character Recognition (OCR) pipeline that allows us to scrape and process claim data from invoice images. You will also have the chance to dream up new and interesting projects. Trupanion has a strong culture around making data-driven decisions. All teams collect and maintain clean, structured data. As such, there will be no shortage of opportunity to make a significant and lasting impact across all verticals of the organization.

Candidates for this position have the option to work remotely from anywhere in the US or Canada. US candidates have the option to work out of our Seattle office, depending on their preference.



Key Responsibilities Include




Create and take ownership of data science projects from start to finish: conceptualization, data gathering, modeling, analysis, presentation, productionalization, monitoring, and iterating on improvements 

Display an infectious intellectual curiosity while maintaining the rigor of the scientific method and producing high-quality, production-ready code 

Cultivate effective working relationships with key internal business partners across the organization to create an environment of collaboration and knowledge sharing 

Thrive in uncontrolled environments where problem definitions and success criteria can be ambiguous 

Solve problems that no one has ever solved before 




Skills, Knowledge & Abilities




Possess strong writing, data visualization and communication skills with the ability to describe complex concepts succinctly to non-technical audiences 

Be intimately familiar with statistics and probability 

Flexibility to work both independently and closely with the team 

Expertise in at least one programming language (we use Python and SQL) 

Experience developing and deploying machine learning models and/or OCR 

Strong problem-solving abilities 




Benefits And Perks




Bonus opportunities 

Employer-paid extended health coverage for you and your family 

Four weeks paid time off 

Five weeks, paid, sabbatical after five years of employment 

Restricted Stock Units 

Employer-paid medical insurance for one pet (cat or dog) 

Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations 

Open, casual, pet-friendly, and fun work environment 




About Trupanion



We’re all about helping pets. We promote a cohesive and nimble team environment, and we hire, develop and promote team members. We trust each other. We are transparent and honest. We care about one another and want to see our team members succeed, personally and professionally. We strive to promote from within and reduce bureaucracy to allow creative thinking. We’re focused on providing continuous training and support to all team members to encourage long-term happiness and success.

Take a look inside our office and see for yourself:


https://www.facebook.com/Trupanion/videos/10155423763702974/


We’re more than insurance – we’re a tech company too! Learn more about how you can use Trupanion to pay your vet directly here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdWZ4KHiPTQ



Trupanion Team DNA



At Trupanion, we achieve great things together when we are:


Caring: We are kind to each other and assume positive intent. 

Collaborative: We work together to achieve company goals (we not me). 

Courageous: We are determined, take risks, and make bold moves. 

Curious: We seek new information to continually better ourselves and our work. 

Honest: We believe candid communication leads to successful teamwork. 

Inclusive: We welcome and value all people and perspectives. 

Nimble: We readily adapt and evolve in pursuit of progress and innovation. 



For more information about Trupanion, visit http://trupanion.com/about 


Trupanion is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, abilities, perspectives, and skills.

We will ensure that individuals are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

description:
Design your lifestyle as a top freelance data scientist, with the freedom to work however, wherever, on your terms.

Freelance work is defining the careers of today's data scientists in exciting new ways. If you're passionate about working flexibly with leading Fortune 500 brands and innovative Silicon Valley startups, Toptal could be a great fit for your next career shift.

Toptal is an elite talent network for the world's top 3% of developers, connecting the best and brightest freelancers with top organizations. Unlike a 9-to-5 job, you'll choose your own schedule and work from anywhere. Jobs come to you, so you won't bid for projects against other data scientists in a race to the bottom. Plus, Toptal takes care of all the overhead, empowering you to focus on successful engagements while getting paid on time, at the rate you decide, every time.

As a freelance data scientist, you could join an ever-expanding community of experts in over 120 countries, working remotely on the projects that meet your career ambitions.

That's why the world's top 3% of developers choose Toptal. Data Scientists in our elite network share:


 At least 3 years of professional experience in Data Science

 Project management skills

 A keen attention to detail

 Full-time availability is a strong advantage


If you're ready for a career shift to impactful freelance work, take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
FLO | AddÉnergie is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join the new « Data » team which purpose is to develop the data ecosystem of our next digital platform while delivering insights using machine learning and statistics to our customers and internal stakeholders.

B Y JOINING OUR TEAM, YOU WILL BE CALLED TO 



 Make our objective your own. Evolve the data platform from our current descriptive capabilities to future diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive capabilities. In concrete terms, work in a cross-functional team to establish a data science process and therefore play a key role in digital product development. 

 Create the FLO | AddÉnergie data ontology to discover the available data, the business domains, the corporate objectives, and their relationships. 

 Participate to data organization, contribute to the design of data preparation and transformation pipelines, up to feature production and results that will lead to actions. 

 Own the proof of concepts and model development cycle : define needs in terms of data, train, test models, validate hypotheses, and finally document methodologies that lead to observable results. 

 Collaborate with the software development teams to implement tools that will measure the performance of our algorithms and digital products that use them. 

 Present to the leadership team and clients on the outcome and impacts of research and development efforts and the various opportunities that data science has to offer. 




About You (requirements)




 Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or equivalent. 

 At least three (3) years of experience in the industry, in a role involved with building a data infrastructure in a cloud production environment. 

 Working experience integrating or leveraging one of the following products: Snowflake, Databricks, Apache Kafka. 

 Working experience using statistics and machine learning algorithms in a context of business data valorization. 

 Advanced skills in Python and a good understanding of its data science ecosystem. 

 Proven capability to simultaneously manage concurrent workloads and priorities. 

 Make things work, get things done, and is a great team player 

 Strong writer and communicator, in French in English, and feel at home in a product development team 




About Us


AddEnergie is a leading North American charging network operator for electric vehicles and a major provider of smart charging software and equipment. Every month, AddEnergie charging stations and its FLO network enable approximately half a million charging events and the transfer of 5.5 GWh in electricity, thanks to 30,000 high-quality stations deployed on public networks, commercial and residential installations. AddEnergie’s headquarters and network operations center are based in Quebec City, and its assembly plant is in Shawinigan (Quebec). The company also has regional offices in Montreal (Quebec), Mississauga (Ontario), Vancouver (British Columbia) and Rochester (New York).
For more information, visit addenergie.com and flo.com.


What We Offer




 Diverse and stimulating projects 

 Flexible hours 

 Full group insurance coverage 

 Charging days in addition to vacation time! 


To learn more about AddEnergie and FLO, follow us on LinkedIn!

industries: Marketing Services
description:
Position Summary


This role provides a unique opportunity to use your analytics and data skills in the marketing industry. We are looking for someone who is passionate about pulling insights out of the data; someone who is experienced with reporting and data visualization.

The role of a Data Analyst is to provide reporting and analytics for some of our more complex clients and their diverse marketing portfolio. Some of the data you’ll be working with include social media data, display and video programmatic buys, site data and market research data. You will play a key role in driving an ongoing learning agenda and fostering a data driven decision making process, working collaboratively with various internal partners and client teams.





Key Responsibilities



Use analytical skills and business acumen to provide data and analysis to assist in solving marketing problems

Leverage the use of technology for data processing and workflow automation

Maintain and update client dashboards in Tableau, Datorama, Domo, Data Studio or any other BI platform

Lead campaign reporting process and deliverables, establishing the standards for how campaign results are delivered to clients.

Collaborate with the media planning team and campaign team to uncover meaningful insights and develop client relevant recommendations.

Analyze data to recommend campaign execution and visualization improvements, based on data and observed trends

Manage QA process and data governance for our internal data warehouse solution

Create performance forecasts and track actual performance against forecasted plans






Desired Skills & Experience



2-3 years of experience in a data analytics or reporting role

Demonstrated proficiency in Google Sheets, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, SQL, and Python

Experience with using Tableau, Domo, Google Data Studio, Datorama or any other BI visualization platforms

Familiarity with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics exposure

Strong communication skills (verbal & written); ability to provide concise, clear reporting and actionable analysis

Proven ability to self-check work to ensure results are error-free

Keenness to learn new skills, platforms and technologies

Travel or tourism industry exposure highlight valued

Experience in marketing and/or media performance (digital experience desired)

Familiarity with social media marketing and programmatic media channels

Familiarity with Marketing Mix Modeling and/or econometrics

High-level knowledge of media attribution

Familiarity with Marketing, Business Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), Benchmarks and KPI correlation, Brand Lift Study and Measurement Research

Audience Segmentation, Targeting and Analytics experience

BS/BA in Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Marketing or similar field, or any relevant/applicable experience






About Us





Initiative is different to other media agencies.




We are not trapped by a legacy structure primarily centered on paid advertising. Instead, we are liberated by a new world structure designed to deliver highly differentiated and highly effective communications strategies for our clients. We’re not the biggest agency in town. So rather than outsize our competitors we must outsmart them. That’s why we’ve built the strongest strategic capability of any agency in the market. Core to this strategic capability is an obsession with culture and how brands can pivot from brand advertising (which is forgettable) to cultural branding (which is memorable). Our new world model is comprised of four central “craft centers” – Client Advice and Management, Strategy, Communications Design and Partnerships. OUR BEHAVIORS Initiative respects that everyone has something unique to contribute to the agency. We are a bunch of eclectic and brilliant misfits with diverse backgrounds that represent the unique fabric of consumers and culture. We want you to be yourself. We want to hear your opinions. We want to see your passion and energy. If you disagree with something you see or hear then speak up. We will never punish or penalize you for bringing something important to our attention. If you believe you can improve something in the agency then speak up. We will always listen to your ideas and suggestions. We will not tolerate harassment, bullying or corporate politics. We will not tolerate discrimination of any kind. We expect you to be responsible on social media and remember that you represent the agency and should not bring us into disrepute. We are committed to your learning and development. The agency will organize regular training to enhance and accelerate your career – we expect you to prioritize training and actively participate. We strive for world-class work on every client, every time. We believe that good enough is not good enough.

industries: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
PURPOSE
:


Ensure client queries and concerns regarding IQVIA offerings are addressed in a timely manner within standard agreed upon response times. The candidate will consistently research and respond to all client queries and work with a team of analysts to share knowledge and support workload across various offerings and databases.


JOB DESCRIPTION:



 Receive and review all client queries submitted by the client services analysts for clarity and completeness

 Research client query using all available tools and perform cross database analysis to ensure accuracy of datasets

 Determine if issues exist and recommend correction/improvement to the data

 Work with several support teams to complete research and analysis

 Communicate with client service analysts to provide updates and resolutions for the client



RESPONSIBILITIES:



 Use expert knowledge of IQVIA data, Pharma market, programming and statistical methods to understand, research, interrogate, analyze and evaluate available information to respond to client queries and questions

 Consult with internal teams to resolve and recommend corrections/changes to data/processes

 Communicate findings and resolutions clearly and concisely through IQVIA query tracking tool process to all stakeholders

 Identify opportunities to improve query process and research/analysis process

 Ensure quality of work in processing queries is maintained and improved



REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:



 Knowledge of IQVIA datasets/databases an asset

 Knowledge of MS-Excel, MS-Access

 Strong knowledge SQL and relational database concepts

 Knowledge of the Canadian Healthcare/Pharmaceutical industry

 Strong analytical skills

 Strong client focus and communication skills

 Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and multi-task



Required Education and Experience:



 University degree (Science, Business, MIS) or 4 or more years of relevant work experience

 Knowledge of IQVIA departments, product, services an asset

 Knowledge of the prescription, sales and claims databases and claims reimbursement landscape



IQVIA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of any applicable prohibited ground of discrimination, including but not limited to race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability. Accommodations for applicants with disabilities are available at all stages of the recruitment process upon request. If you have a physical impairment or a disability that requires an accommodation, we encourage you to disclose this during the recruiting process so that IQVIA can appropriately accommodate you.



IQVIA est fière d'être un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances et nous nous engageons à créer un environnement diversifié et inclusif. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la base de tout motif de discrimination interdit applicable, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil ou le handicap. Des accommodements pour les candidats avec un handicap sont disponibles à toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement, sur demande. Si vous souffrez d'une déficience ou d’un handicap physique nécessitant un accommodement, nous vous encourageons à le divulguer lors du processus de recrutement afin qu'IQVIA puisse vous accommoder de manière appropriée.


IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.


Job Level


NV-10

As a data analyst, you collect, process, analyze and use data that comes through different channels. You extract, describe, analyze and interpret the data needed to make informed business decisions.

You lead stakeholders in projects for designing analytical solutions adapted to a wide range of business needs and in complex strategic data collection, processing and analysis interventions.

You make recommendations on the planning and execution of operationally and conceptually complex analytical projects and initiatives that involve using your ability to use multiple databases, your analytical skills and your in depth, comprehensive understanding of the line of business and the organization.

Your initiatives require extensive, in-depth knowledge of your line of work.

You serve as a data use specialist advisor and subject matter expert for various stakeholders, and as a resource person and coach for decision-making bodies. You interact with many stakeholders in other fields to understand and communicate issues, and influence decision-making.


General Information on the Position




Other Working Conditions




Work place : Currently regular telework because of the pandemic. Position located in Montreal. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work 

Number of jobs available : 1




Qualifications




Bachelor's degree in a related field

A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience


Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered


For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required




Desjardins Cross-sector Skills



Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning


Key competencies for the job


Business insight, Complexity

Complexe Desjardins Montréal


Trade Union


Non Syndiqué

2022-03-29

industries: Transportation, Logistics and Storage
description:
Data Scientist 






Client: 
Logistics


Role: 
Data Scientist


Permanent 



Rate: 
Open 
*depending on experience



Location:
 Mississauga, ON 


Environment:
 Hybrid





Our client, an established freight and logistics company is hiring for a Data Scientist on a on a Permanent Basis to join them on their mission to re-shape how Canadians ship and receive goods.






Your New Company


Our client is a leading North American freight, package, and logistics provider with one of the most extensive networks in Canada able to ship to many of the most remote regions of the country. For more than 60 years, they have prioritized helping business and individuals meet their needs with diverse shipping and supply chain solutions.





Your New Role


 We are looking for a seasoned 
Data Scientist
 who is enthusiastically driven to generate actionable insights and create new growth opportunities. 
The focus of this role is on developing and implementing advanced analytics/ predictive solutions based on solid statistical foundation.
 You will lead analytics initiatives including advanced statistical modelling and developing data-driven solutions across several lines of business and domains. This is a unique opportunity to apply your analytics skills in a uniquely Canadian organization rich in history and data.





What You’ll Need to Succeed:




M.Sc. or B.Sc. in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics
, 
Applied Mathematics
, Computer Science, or other related discipline).

Should have 
2+ years of professional experience
 in the applicable field.

Significant experience solving problems with the required use of advanced 
statistical modelling techniques 
from
 development through implementation. Must be able to 
demonstrate strong 
statistical knowledge of underlying theory, statistical foundation/ understanding and professional application.


Proven programming skills in one or more statistical programming languages such as Python (preferred), R, etc. and demonstrated skills in massive parallel processing, e.g., Spark/ Apache Hadoop (nice to have). 


Experience with Machine Learning and predictive modelling
 (e.g., Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, Decision Trees, Regression), time series (ARIMA/ ARMA/ SARIMA), NLP, clustering/ segmentation, test/ control significance testing, and geospatial analytics (nice to have).

Experience with 
data visualization tools including Power BI
 to summarize modelling results.

 Proven professional experience working with large scale and complex datasets including data retrieval, data cleaning, data manipulation and data modelling.

Excellent communication skills and ability to describe and present complex technical/ statistical concepts in a clear and concise language across an audience with varying levels of understanding.

Excellent presentation skills to both technical and non-technical people.

A track record of distilling complex and ambiguous problems into actionable business recommendations based on sound data analysis and insights.






What You’ll get in Return


The client is offering an opportunity to work with a well established business in an exciting period of growth. You will have the opportunity to work on projects that are re-shaping the way Canadians ship and receive goods with a company that prioritizes employee development and well-being at a competitive rate for an incorporated contractor.

 


Interested?


If you’re available and interested in this role, please reply to this email as soon as you can attaching your updated resume and salary requirement.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
Working with one of the top financial clients this role calls for a Data Analyst – Talent Insights Analytics who will be responsible for supporting key transformational initiatives in leveraging analytics to identify trends and provide Talent Acquisition insights through dashboards and presentations to leadership and provide support and consulting on technical implementations. This candidate must build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate has over 3 years of experience in recruitment and talent acquisition.





Responsibilities:



Data Analytics



Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions. Designs, develops and implements innovative analytical solutions

Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards

Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics,

Cleanses manipulates and transforms data through programming/scripting for model training and validation.

Designs develop and implement innovative analytical solutions through regular and ad-hoc reports and dashboards.

Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and trends on talent acquisition data

Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data-driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.

Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end-users; may include presenting dashboard & insights to audiences.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.






Digital Analyst



Supports Product Owners in the configuration and administration of tools

Performs user acceptance testing for projects of various complexities, including but not limited to supporting the development of test cases, executing test cases, escalating issues, logging outcomes, facilitating/participating in defect meetings, reviewing & validating defect resolutions

Leads or participates in change management activities of varying scope and type

Develops in-depth knowledge of business processes and project requirements through close partnership with business/group stakeholders.






Desired Skill Set:



Knowledge and technical proficiency gained through business experience

Excellent verbal and written communication skills 

Solid collaboration and team skills

Analytical and problem solving and data-driven decision-making skills 






Nice to Have:



Knowledge of the Talent Acquisition space, recruitment cycles

Working knowledge of LinkedIn Talent Insights and Talent Acquisition tools like ATS, CRM







 
BeachHead is an equal opportunity agency and employer. We advocate for you and welcome anyone regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age.

industries: Marketing Services
description:
At TrackDDB, data is the driving force behind our creative solutions. Our team of talented professionals – from analysts and technologists to strategists and creatives – works together to exceed our clients’ business objectives through the perfect mix of data, strategy and creativity.




We are searching for a dedicated, team-oriented 
Data Marketing Analyst
 who is a strong, confident communicator and is adaptable to different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets. In this role, they will pair their digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. They will find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. They must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy. Does this sound like you? Then, keep on reading.

 


 



What we want from you:


 

Work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategy

 

· Improve profitability and drive revenue through creating effective KPIs and optimization of metrics that affect them

· Guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of development

· Lead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data mining

· Ensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and training

· Drive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark data

· Interpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needs

· Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environment

· Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offers

· Creation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualization


What we can offer you:



A friendly culture deeply rooted in mutual respect for everyone’s time and individual goals

Opportunity for professional growth, training and industry leadership in our category

DDB perks, including competitive benefits, referral bonuses and our unique FUEL program to help fund inspiration outside of working hours



And, the basics:


· Curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environment

· Undergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline

· 1-3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation

· Deep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communications

· Experience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformation

· Keen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadership

· A strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-oriented

· Experience with marketing attribution modeling

· Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including KPI development, tagging and report automation.

· Intermediate level capabilities with SQL

· Intermediate level capabilities with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics

· Familiarity with R and/or Python

· Demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects

Bonus Points for:

· Experience with Tableau

· Proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis)

DDB Canada is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer that values diversity. We also offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know when you submit your application.




We appreciate all expressed interest in this position, however, only the candidates selected for interview will be contacted.

Business Data analyst
Canada
6+ Months
Only Citizens & PR’s(who has been in Canada more than 5 years)
Must be able to attain Canadian Reliability Security Clearance (RCMP to conduct 5 year history checks)
•	Work directly with data engineers, business data analysts, data scientists and clients in Canadian Operations throughout the entire engagement life cycle including technical analysis, design, development, implementation and consulting efforts
•	Maintain best practice standards for analysis and reporting at all levels including data governance, documentation, testing and visualization techniques
•	Expert knowledge of VBA and Microsoft Excel
•	2-4 years relational database experience (SQL Server, MySQL, etc.)
•	2-4 years of experience with visualization and analytical tools like Tableau 
•	Strong problem solving and analytical skills
•	Proven experience consolidating and analyzing data sources
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills with experience in related complex concepts to non-technical users
•	Proven ability to work collaboratively within a cross functional team environment
•	Ability to succeed in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and quickly find alternative solutions to business and data challenges
•	Attention to detail and in-depth planning, organizational and time management skills
•	Comfortable learning new applications quickly with minimal direction
Education and Experience:
•	Minimum undergraduate degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent
•	2-5 years+ of experience in related field.
•	Developing rich portfolio of design uses cases demonstrating excellent user experience
•	Working in an agile development environment including rapid prototyping
What will be nice to have?
•	Tableau development experience and designing dashboards / decision enablement tools
•	Experience in developing and maintaining large databases with complex relationships between tables
•	Knowledge of Group Benefits, Group Retirement Services, or Individual Insurance products and systems

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




 What You'll Be Doing 


You’ll be joining CIBC’s Corporate Centre Technology. You’ll be hands on with all aspects of the systems testing process and provide suggestions that will ensure client needs are met with the highest quality. As an Analyst, IT Quality Assurance, you’ll be a team lead on CIBC’s Technology team, assigning and overseeing the execution of test cases and providing coaching to your team members. You’ll create test plans, develop strategies, and provide estimates that will help build the bank of the future.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.



How You'll Succeed




 Testing Expertise – Lead the analysis and translation of business requirements into test cases. Design and manage end-to-end testing activities for various projects across the business. Use your expertise in software development testing to provide clients with quality products that meet business and system requirements. 

 Leadership Skills – Provide advice to your team, including ongoing feedback, support, and mentorship. Proactively identify any potential issues throughout all test phases, and suggest possible improvements or enhancements. 

 Project Coordination – Identify obstacles or risks that may impact a project’s timeline or success and provide regular status updates to the business. Keep the lines of communication open with stakeholders, and escalate issues when necessary. Ensure that all test deliverables are received, approved, and aligned to your project’s timeline, budget and objectives. 




Who You Are




 You can demonstrate experience in software development testing, automation, and software process improvement. It’s an asset if you have experience writing and executing SQL queries, and have software development experience in Java, C#, Python, VBScript, etc. 

 Review requirements & Document Gaps. 

 Work closely with BA’s to close requirement gaps. 

 Prepare or Review offshore deliverables (Test Scenario & Test cases) 

 Execute Test cases during onsite hours 

 Review and provide inputs to Test Plan. 

 Share daily execution report with project team 

 Participate in QA execution status meetings and share your inputs. 

 Testing support to upstream or downstream applications. 

 Values matter to you . You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 




What CIBC Offers



At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.


We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.




What You Need To Know




 CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com 

 You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit 

 CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation. 



Job Location


Toronto-483 Bay St;. 8th Floor


Employment Type


Regular


Weekly Hours


37.5

job_title: Jr. to Intermed. C# .NET Application Developer - Remote, BC Time zone
description:
Equinox Software Design Corporation
 (http://www.equinox.ca) is hiring a 
Jr. to Intermediate C# .Net Application Developer
 to help contribute to the success of our flagship product, 
CROW 
(Control Room Operations Window). Our multi-platform enterprise solution helps over 1,000 electric utilities and independent system operators all over North America to efficiently and safely schedule and report outages and incidents on the grid. You will be instrumental in ensuring CROW meets the future needs of our current and present customers. This is a full-time position, working remotely, and the primary duties are as follows:





Qualifications and Skills


The core requirements of these positions are as follows:


C# .Net development experience.

MS SQL Server experience is an asset (alternatively, experience with: Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)

HTML5, SASS, and Typescript.

Must understand key visual design principles, be able to read and carefully implement visual design guideline requirements.

Must be self-motivated, self managed, and able to work independently; carrying on a project from start to completion.

Must have impeccable communication skills both written and oral.






Knowledge of, or a desire to work with:



Angular (alternatively, experience with React)

PrimeNG

XML/XSLT/XSD/WSDL

ORM techniques.

LINQ






Responsibilities Include:



Developing and maintaining new and existing features of our flagship product

Conducting all phases of the product development lifecycle of our product, including translating customer requirements, detailed design, implementation, test and fix, build, and delivery

Working collaboratively in a project team alongside other developers

Work closely with customers and end users to build relationships, gather requirements and provide product support

Reporting on project status and developments to customers and team members

Work in partnership with Quality Assurance ensuring issues get resolved quickly, accurately, and efficiently






Benefits



Work from home. This role is remote based in North Vancouver, B.C.

Fantastic career prospects in a fascinating ever-changing recession-proof (and pandemic-proof) industry.

A chance to demonstrate your potential.

New high-end workstations.

Good remuneration.

Full medical and dental benefits.





Naturally collaborative, Equinox team members are intrinsically motivated in helping customers reach their goals by way of creating amazing technical products and features. Moreover, you will enjoy working closely with other developers and designers on complex growing projects. Equinox, entering our 29th year of business in 2022, is a small group of dedicated long-term professionals. We value work life balance and a close-knit enjoyable workplace. A calm and patient demeanor and a desire to build friendships with your co-workers is a must.





If you wish to build a long term “best in class” career, apply now.

We are currently seeking competent individuals to fulfill the role of Data Engineer to join our dynamic team for our client.

Responsibilities

• Design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable data management systems.

industries: Transportation, Logistics and Storage

description:
Airdrop makes software that helps founders raise capital from capital allocators like venture capitalists, private equity investors, and solo general partners. Our work is permanently remote - we believe the best founders and capital allocators are everywhere - so we are everywhere too.




At airdrop we hire people over resumes. Expect a tenacious, transparent, and respectfully hard working small team that believes capital is lifeblood for founders.





About Your Team





A Data Analyst on our Strategy and Operations Team captures, analyzes, and benchmarks data across all companies in our Series A pipeline.




In this role you will help with strategy and execution for ongoing processes including both fund and company management, budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and any other strategic, operational, or financial analysis as needed.





Do You Enjoy Doing Any of These Things?






Benchmark key data across both our own internal portfolio and external companies we review

Build / maintain a database and ensure data is up-to-date and standardized

Continuously incorporate and enter new data from new companies in pipeline

Run high-level comparable company and other types of analysis based on data collected

Monitor various external data sources proactively for leading indicators of success

Assist with financial modeling, including budgeting, forecasting and planning

Help develop, implement and maintain strong and robust systems and processes to support financial planning & analysis activities. Monitor data accuracy and drive continuous improvement

Help develop systems that enable business managers to be able to satisfy their own reporting requirements

Continually partner and collaborate with management to achieve strong results.

Provide support on strategic ad-hoc analysis / projects related to Airdrop's priorities and initiatives.






Qualifications






Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work cross-functionally across the portfolio and various operational groups within Airdrop

Ability to quickly build trust with and connect with other team members and cross-functional partners regardless of background or financial aptitude

Demonstrated personal and professional achievement

2-3 years of relevant experience in consulting, FP&A, financial forecasting, accounting, modeling, or corporate finance experience. Experience in a high growth and/or rapid scaling environment is preferred

Proven track record to multitask, apply initiative and creativity on, and lead projects

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Economics or a technical field preferred but not required






Airdrop Culture






Founders first

Sweat the details

Never give up

Celebrate big wins






Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make companies better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. 






At airdrop, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to our team - so if your experience is close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

industries: Retail
description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 


Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.

The Fuels Marketing team within the Petroleum division has a wide range of accountabilities around the sourcing, pricing and promotion of motor fuels through our Retailer network and to final customers, including management of the Canadian Tire Loyalty and Rewards programs.

Fuels Marketing is responsible for the bulk propane business as well as all programs related to the overall propane business including exchange propane as well as bulk (cylinder fill).

This role provides support using existing data and analytic processes. The role is also responsible, working with the team, to identify improvement opportunities around such areas as fuel cost / price / margin data management and reporting, and then developing, documenting and implementing these improvements.

This also extends to providing support on, the design, execution, analysis of and recommendations for marketing programs that the fuels team implements around fuel, propane and reward offers.



Responsibilities




Monitor and support existing reports, processes and analytics for the fuels team and division.

Work with team members on Fuel Marketing programs to facilitate design, test, execution, monitoring and analysis.

Prepare analyses, reports and, or presentations/recommendations on Fuels Marketing programs or topics.

Work with Kent Marketing Data in conjunction with internal data for site and, or market analysis.

Design, build and document new or improved analytic and reporting tools as needed

Conduct cost / retail / margin analytics that are required to meet business needs.

Develop and maintain documentation on processes and end user applications

Respond to site or internal inquiries related to fuel / propane and rewards by telephone, personal or written communication.

Enter and update data in applications. Verify from source documents that information entered into the applications is accurate and complete. Create and maintain related files.

Use and, or develop system queries and reports to understand business results.

Work with data users to identify, design and implement enhancements to current processes

Work with the Petroleum Financial Planning and Analysis team in managing data requirements.

Provide back-up support to other members of the fuel team – especially the Fuel Price Analyst.




Qualifications




Proficiency with the MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint & Access) is a key component for success in this role.

Experience in MS Access database query design and, or SQL knowledge is required.

Education or experience equivalent to a four year college degree is required.

At least one year related experience is required

Excellent communications skills with the ability to prepare/present data and analysis to various audiences

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Strong data / process diagramming and documenting skills.

Bilingualism would be an asset.




About Canadian Tire Corporation 



As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of  Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on  LinkedIn . 

CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Ontario-Toronto

Full-time

industries: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, Staffing and Recruiting, and Truck Transportation
description:
This role is open to remote based candidates in Canada with a preference for PST based individuals **


We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and be part of our next stage of growth. As our Data Analyst your top priority is design and development and maintenance of SQL scripts to support migration of Client's legacy data to Salesforce. This role directly supports our professional services, customers' success and product teams. The Data Analyst is focused on how to make our customers' lives easier during initial system migration, operational upgrades and support situations.



Who We Are



Traction Rec empowers customers with great technology. Built on the Salesforce platform, we enable YMCA's, Jewish Community Centres (JCC's) and Boys & Girls Clubs of America (BGCA) to deliver their services and achieve their missions. At the heart of Traction Rec is our desire to support non-profit community centres and the amazing good they do.

Traction Rec is an independent product company launched by Traction on Demand, one of North America's largest dedicated Salesforce consulting partners. Traction Rec was recently recognized by Salesforce as Nonprofit Sales Partner of the Year, ISV Partner of the Year, and featured in the 2021 Ready to Rocket List. Traction Rec takes pride in the development of product and services, and building strong relationships with partners and customers.

At our core, we love community. We are looking for people who want to join an active group of engaged individuals who see business as more than just a vehicle to make money. We care about our people, wider community, and planet. We welcome you to experience a vibrant personal and professional journey by joining our diverse team.

Traction on Demand's hiring philosophy is based on culture, intelligence, and then skills. Here's what we mean by that:


Culture


Culture at Traction on Demand isn't about drinking beer and playing ping-pong - it's much more. We are looking for people who want to join an active community of engaged individuals who see business as more than just a vehicle to make money. We care about our people, wider community, and planet. Come join us on this journey! Traction is a group of entrepreneurs committed to creating ecstatic clients, doing enjoyable work, and being efficient in everything we do. We fail fast and love to innovate. Change is our middle name. Our values don't just sit on a glossy page. We live by them every day. Our values are the cornerstone of who we are - do they resonate with you?

Embrace Knowledge


 Do the right thing

 Seek adventures and smiles

 Healthy hearts and heads

 Pursue opportunity

 Build community



Intelligence


People often ask what it takes to succeed at Traction on Demand - you've got to be smart, without having an ego. What does that mean? Imagine working with a group of your smartest friends who all love to learn. Everyone is always pushing each other to grow and innovate at a pace that can only be called furious. We are never idle or stagnant. We seek and share knowledge. We are comfortable with the unknown. We just "git 'r done."



Skills



Tractionites come from a variety of backgrounds, and we are eager to find people that are from non-traditional backgrounds. Typically, we find that people are successful in this role when they have:


Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

Experience with data modeling, and building ETL pipelines.

Experience delivering solutions on the Azure platform is an asset

Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.

A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.

Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

Strong communication for working with internal and external stakeholders




What You Will Be Doing




Analyzing external/legacy system data structures (Relational data model) and developing data migration/integrations with Salesforce

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.

Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements

Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.

Build and maintain reusable data tools for professional services data migration 

Custom script development, data migration or manipulation to support customer success or professional services teams

Support customer success team data needs during new product releases or upgrades

Propose and maintain data solution strategies and roadmaps



If you're interested, so are we! Send your resume our way, and we'll reach out to you if we are interested in moving forward.


We are an equal opportunity employer and love diversity at our company! We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

For Traction Rec, we aim to change the world by creating impact technology to serve organizations whose mission is one of our core values, to Create Community. At our core, we're about improving the way organizations do business by leveraging technology.

Value

description:
PURPOSE
:


Ensure client queries and concerns regarding IQVIA offerings are addressed in a timely manner within standard agreed upon response times. The candidate will consistently research and respond to all client queries and work with a team of analysts to share knowledge and support workload across various offerings and databases.


JOB DESCRIPTION:



 Receive and review all client queries submitted by the client services analysts for clarity and completeness

 Research client query using all available tools and perform cross database analysis to ensure accuracy of datasets

 Determine if issues exist and recommend correction/improvement to the data

 Work with several support teams to complete research and analysis

 Communicate with client service analysts to provide updates and resolutions for the client



RESPONSIBILITIES:



 Use expert knowledge of IQVIA data, Pharma market, programming and statistical methods to understand, research, interrogate, analyze and evaluate available information to respond to client queries and questions

 Consult with internal teams to resolve and recommend corrections/changes to data/processes

 Communicate findings and resolutions clearly and concisely through IQVIA query tracking tool process to all stakeholders

 Identify opportunities to improve query process and research/analysis process

 Ensure quality of work in processing queries is maintained and improved



REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:



 Knowledge of IQVIA datasets/databases an asset

 Knowledge of MS-Excel, MS-Access

 Strong knowledge SQL and relational database concepts

 Knowledge of the Canadian Healthcare/Pharmaceutical industry

 Strong analytical skills

 Strong client focus and communication skills

 Excellent organizational skills; ability to prioritize and multi-task



Required Education and Experience:



 University degree (Science, Business, MIS) or 4 or more years of relevant work experience

 Knowledge of IQVIA departments, product, services an asset

 Knowledge of the prescription, sales and claims databases and claims reimbursement landscape
