BUSINESS ANALYST



 


The Construction and Equipment Division, a part of the J.D. Irving, Limited's group of companies, is a key player in the North American construction industry. With five operating units within the division, the group provides heavy equipment and crane services, civil construction, modular home and and commercial buildings, wallboard manufacturing, and steel and fabrication services to its customers.




We are currently seeking a talented professional to join our Construction & Equipment Finance team and showcase these talents in the role of Business Analyst. As the successful applicant, you will be located at Gulf Operators focusing on their business.

Chartered Professional Accountant designation

Strong Communication skills, and previous experience working with senior management

Demonstrated competency in assessing, working through, and revolving issues related to project accounting

Demonstrated commitment to your ongoing professional development







Key Responsibilities


:


The primary function for this role is to provide accurate and timely business analyst functions for Gulf Operators. This will be achieved primarily through:


Preparing complex project accounting reports and maintain ledgers for associated costs

Monitoring, assessing, analyzing, and reviewing project costs and expenditures

Preparing weekly and period project reports

Providing periodic variance reporting requirements

Responsible for gathering appropriate documentation for internal and external auditors

Other ad-hoc requests as required

Please apply online by!

new solutions

platforms

data management solution. (Adobe, Salesforce, Oracle, Google, and similar

Title: IAM Engineer (SailPoint)
Company: Leading financial organization
Location: Scarborough, Ontario (100% remote until further notice)
Length: Full-time permanent
Salary: Negotiable base salary + 10% bonus + 4 weeks vacation + benefits + extras

The Team:
The objective of the Engineering Team is to develop and integrate IAM solutions for various IAM domains including identity lifecycle management, Directories, authentication & authorization, data access management, and access governance leveraging best practices and adhering to the Bank’s policies and information security standards

The Role:
The SailPoint Development Engineer is responsible for the practical analysis, design, development, implementation and support of mission-critical Identity and Access Management systems of medium to high complexity.

 Is this role right for you?
-You have a portfolio of work in Java that you are proud of and can share with us (GITHUB, etc.)
- You are passionate about programming and enjoy working on your own projects outside of work
- You are not a order taker but like to think through troubleshooting problems, guiding team members, stakeholders and clients, and leading a team of developers
- You enjoy implementing new systems or enhancements by reviewing programs written by team members, establishing, and executing system test procedures, developing an implementation plan, developing the required program and system documentation and ensuring all functionality has been delivered as required.
- You take pride in making recommendations towards developing new code standards or the reuse of existing code.
- You excel in working with a team of Business Analysts, testers and team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions.
- You thrive in the total system life cycle and the responsibility of designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting applications software that is delivered on time and within budget.
- You can provide post-implementation support and training to the computer operations staff on the production processing functionality.
- You can participate in an on-call pager rotation to provide after-hours maintenance support.
- You love initiating proactive communication with internal/external teams.

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?
- You have solid experience with SailPoint IIQ
- You have a strong sense of programming languages (Java, JSP/Servlets, Shell scripts, etc.)
- You are familiar with multiple operating systems, such as Linux
- You are confident in your database skills (SQL/NoSQL)
- You have working experience with DevOps CI/CD pipelines and tools
- You have experience with DevOps Delivery and tools such as Jira and Confluence
- You possess advanced communication (verbal/written/presentation).
- You have knowledge of API Gateway (bonus)
- You have a Test Driven Development (TDD) mindset (bonus)
- You have 5+ years of experience developing, deploying and maintaining complex enterprise web applications (asset)

description:
Location: Calgary, AB, Canada Job Type: Permanent Date: 2/4/2022 Job ID: MT729631224 Category: Information Technology

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to recruit for a Business Data Analyst (BDA) to be the data subject matter expert who will use MS Stack to develop, design, and deliver a comprehensive suite of operational reports. The BDA will also analyze data to support projects and business decisions.

This is a permanent opportunity in a hybrid work environment, and is available to candidates in Calgary, AB.


The Role:


Reporting & Business Intelligence


Develop and design a comprehensive reporting suite for management

Prepare/compile ongoing trend reporting as required, monthly, quarterly, and annually

Prepare meaningful and visually appealing reports and dashboards for management and the Board



Insightful Analysis of Data


Develop and maintain company database

Develop and prepare reports and analyze the existing portfolio for trends and performance

Perform ad hoc analytical requests and research projects for internal parties

Become an expert on company data

Effectively translate business and project needs into data extraction and manipulation plans




The Ideal Candidate:



5+ years of hands-on data analysis experience in a business environment

Degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Business, Commerce, or a related technical field

Experience and strong skills with SQL, SSRS, Report Manager, Visual Studio, SharePoint, advanced experience with Microsoft Stack, Power BI with the ability to build complex reports and dashboards

Able to deliver meaningful and impactful reporting that enables insights and solutions

Experience with making data visually appealing and simple to both navigate and comprehend

Strong experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets

Strong critical thinking aptitude and analytical problem-solving skills, able to transform data into business insights and actionable recommendations

Ability to interact and communicate with individuals at various levels of management, including top-level executives

Strong mathematical aptitude with superior attention to detail and accuracy

Experience in Insurance is a strong asset



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Meagan Tunley, Team Lead, Western Canada. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

job_title: New Grad - Associate, Data Analyst - Full Time - EVENT ATTENDEES ONLY
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,

New Grad - Associate, Data Analyst - Full Time - EVENT ATTENDEES ONLY


Please only apply if you have attended our events. 
This is a pre-application for event attendees only. Our recruitment cycle begins in Fall of 2022. At that time, the role will be opened up for all applicants.
At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. When we launched as a startup we disrupted the credit card industry by individually personalizing every credit card offer using statistical modeling and the relational database, cutting edge technology in 1988! Fast-forward a few years, and this little innovation and our passion for data has skyrocketed us to a Fortune 200 company and a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making.

As a Data Analyst at Capital One, you’ll be part of a team that’s leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in distributed computing technologies and operating across billions and billions of customer transactions to unlock the big opportunities that help everyday people save money, time, and agony in their financial lives.

Capital One has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst who is looking to assist the Compliance Department harnessing the power of data to deliver on its mandate. You will be working with the second-line compliance testing team to write SQL scripts on the basis of legal and regulatory attributes. You will be assisting the compliance advisory team querying data for its reportable concerns. You will also be assisting the Anti-Money Laundering team in conducting independent script validation, querying data to support targeted and/or off-cycle risk reviews, calibrating test results, and querying ad hoc data requests to support risk and impact analysis or recommendations for various initiatives.



On Any Given Day, You Could Be




Writing SQL to clean, transform, investigate data.

Working closely with business partners to harness the power of data in compliance testing.

Designing rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas.

Ensure data and intent integrity by automated data quality verification pipelines.

Supporting and consulting with the business to propagate data management best practices.

Investigating the impact of new technologies on the future of digital banking and the financial world of tomorrow.

Investigating the use of technology to automate compliance testing.




The Ideal Candidate Will Be




Curious: You ask why, you explore, and you’re not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You know SQL and are constantly exploring new open source tools, and hitting up stack overflow on a regular basis.

A Wrangler: You know how to programmatically extract data from a database or an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and convert into a human-readable form (Matplotlib, d3 visualization, Tableau, etc.).

Creative: Big, undefined problems and petabytes of data don’t frighten you. You’re used to working with abstract data, and you love discovering new narratives in un-mined territories.

Proactive: You will want to share your knowledge with your peers and contribute back to inner/open source projects which you might consume.




Benefits




Your choice of hardware - latest MacBook Pro or HP EliteBook and all the monitors you want!

Various internal training opportunities across our US and Canada locations.

$5000/yr education budget.

Flexible work hours, dress code and environment.



The Basics…What We Need from You!



Will obtain or have obtained a Bachelor’s degree or higher and graduating in 2021-2023



The Extras…What would be great for you to have:



Pursuing a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or another quantitative discipline

Experience analyzing and manipulating large data sets using tools such as SQL or Python through co-op or school programs

Experience building and maintaining data pipelines

Experience in a Linux/Unix environment, with Git, AWS, or APIs through co-op or school programs is considered an asset

Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Capital One Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to 
Careers@capitalone.com


Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
We are looking for a talented, self-motivated Data Engineer with broad technical skills to dive deep into large amounts of data and the desire to influence key decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. The position collaborates closely with the Marketing & Commercial Analytics team to implement data strategies for marketing, develop complex ETL pipelines and support dashboards that promote deeper understanding of our games.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing and establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses and possess excellent problem solving ability dealing with huge volumes of game data. The position will also stay apprised of latest trends and research on all aspects of data engineering and analytics. You will work with leaders from the Marketing, Commercial and Studios organization by providing them with data to understand campaign and commercial performance across multiple channels and territories.



Responsibilities




 As a Data Engineer you will be involved in the entire development life cycle from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to derive data insights 

 You will gather requirements, model and design solutions to support reporting analytics and exploratory analysis 

 You will design, build, and launch efficient, scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data 

 You will work with analysts, understand requirements, develop technical specifications for ETLs, including documentation 

 You will be responsible to support production code to produce comprehensive and accurate data artifacts. 

 You will oversee the process of adoption of new technologies and applications we use to collect, integrate, analyze, and deliver relevant analytical solutions. 

 You will guide communications between our users and studio engineers to provide scalable end-to-end solutions. 

 You will promote strategies to improve our data modeling, quality and architecture 

 You will work with big data solutions, data modeling, understand the ETL pipelines and dashboard tools. 

 You will be engaged in every step of the development life cycle, from collecting requirements, communicating to users, design, development and testing the products. 

 Explore data and suggest new opportunities to measure and assess the performance of our marketing and commercial actions 




Qualifications




 4+ years relevant industry experience in data engineering role who has Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. 

 Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions. 

 Experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing. 

 Experience with at least one of the programming languages like Python or Java 

 Experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Looker, Tableau or similar BI tools. 

 Experience working with unstructured datasets 

 Experience in the physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses and data lakes. 

 Knowledge of latest data pipeline tools such as Airflow. 

 Developing APIs and integrating with 3rd party APIs 

 Summarize technical details to non-technical audience 

 Comfortable working with a multi-functional team, both locally and remote, understanding the perspectives of each partner. 

 Experience working in an agile development environment and familiar with Process Management tools such as JIRA, Target process, Trello or similar

industries: Marketing Services, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Our mission is to bring community and belonging to everyone in the world. Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. With more than 50 million people visiting 100,000+ communities daily, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. From pets to parenting, skincare to stocks, there’s a community for everybody on Reddit. For more information, visit redditinc.com.

"The front page of the internet,” Reddit brings over 430 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousands of communities. Come for the cats, stay for the empathy.

As a data warehouse engineer, you will build scalable tools on top of Reddit's petabyte-scale warehouse to support all data customers of Reddit. Your work will enable data scientists, machine learning engineers, and product teams to create and access data at a massive scale. If you have a passion for building and maintaining high quality data tools, and want to improve how Reddit makes strategic decisions at the company level, then this is the team for you!



What You’ll Learn




You will be exposed to the full lifecycle of data at Reddit, and as a result will gain expertise on how to scale and improve the data culture across the entire company

You will work directly with a diverse team set including data science, experimentation, infrastructure, machine learning, and senior leadership

You will work with one of the largest and richest datasets in the world, and get exposure to leading data technologies (including the ones Reddit builds from the ground up)





What You’ll Do




Build and scale data orchestration services that support complex analysis across Reddit

Consistently evolve data model & data schema based on business and engineering requirements

Own data quality for crucial systems at Reddit, and serve as a primary resource for data expertise

Define and manage SLA for datasets that support production services





Who You Might Be




3+ years experience in the data warehouse space

3+ years experience working with large scale ETL systems (implementation, strategy, and maintenance)

3+ years of experience building clean, maintainable, and well-tested code

Fluent in Python and SQL

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the company

Bonus points for background in data science, analytics, or data QA




Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at 

ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com

.

Le Renard
 est une petite entreprise de service-conseil spécialisée en développement logiciel. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un 

développeur
 
pour se joindre à notre équipe de programmation.





En rejoignant l’équipe de Le Renard, vous serez responsable de:

Développer de nouveaux logiciels et modules à partir de zéro

Créer de rapports et de formulaires provenant de différentes bases de données.

Analyser et élaborer la conception technique du code et des structures de données;

Concevoir, programmer, exécuter les scénarios de test

Fournir un support fonctionnel aux clients au besoin;

Maintenir à jour la traçabilité/documentation des tâches effectuées et du temps attribué pour chacun des projets en cours;

Participer au partage de connaissance et à l’amélioration continue de l’équipe;






Pourquoi postuler chez Le Renard?



Projets variés et stimulants au sein de plusieurs entreprises québécoises.

Possibilité de télé-travail à 100% (possibilité de travailler au bureau selon votre préférence)

Horaire de travail flexible et équilibre travail-vie personnelle

Banque de congés de maladies transformable en vacances si non-utilisé durant l’année

Temps consacré à la formation et au développement des connaissance mensuellement

Programme de référencement






Ce que nous recherchons:



Baccalauréat en informatique/programmation logiciel/TI ou combinaison DEC + années d’expérience jugée pertinente au poste;

2 ans d’expérience en développement logiciel;

Expérience en SQL

Intérêt en expérience usager et UI

Un « Fit » avec nos valeurs d’entreprises :

Quelqu’un qui sait s’adapter

Quelqu’un qui croit que tout le monde est important

Quelqu’un d’audacieux et créatif

industries: Construction, Oil and Gas, and Financial Services
description:
Who We Are



“Powering Economies and Communities”

TransAlta owns, operates, and develops a diverse fleet of electrical generation assets in Canada, the United States and Australia, providing municipalities, industries and businesses with safe, low-cost and reliable clean electricity. For over 100 years, TransAlta has been a responsible operator and proud community-member where its employees work and live. We are committed to fostering a dynamic, productive, and safe work environment. Our employees contribute to a diverse, open, and transparent culture with clear accountabilities, strong leadership, and challenging opportunities for personal career growth.

For more information about TransAlta, visit our website at, www.transalta.com .



About The Role



We have an exciting new opportunity for an Environmental, Social, and Goverance (ESG) Data AnalystG Data Analyst to join our TransAlta team! The EDSG Data Analyst will be an important team memmber of our Policy and Sustainability team. This team is responsible for TransAlta’s ESG strategy and disclosure including climate change; and proposes ESG corporate targets, tracks performance and engages with stakeholders on ESG matters.

As the ESG Analyst, you will support TransAlta’s sustainability efforts by compiling, maintaining, and analyzing key ESG metrics across the business. You will prepare data and dashboards that will be used for both internal and external purposes, to drive progress towards the company’s ESG goals and inform company strategy and target setting. You will play a critical role in supporting TransAlta’s external ESG reporting and the achievement of corporate ESG goals. This role involves interactions with internal and external stakeholders at various levels.

This is a full-time salaried position based at our Head Office in Downtown Calgary. Hybrid work schedule options are available.



Accountabilities / Responsibilties




 Compiling, maintaining and analyzing ESG metrics across for inclusion in internal and external reporting, including annual external reporting, and ESG questionnaires 

 Maintaining inventory and modeling of carbon and energy management data to support the monitoring and reporting of climate change-related disclosures 

 Preparing ESG data and dashboards to support the development of sustainability targets and monitor progress towards the company’s sustainability goals 

 Implementing quality assurance and quality control processes for ESG data, including working with third-party providers to obtain assurance over ESG data prior to external reporting 

 Supporting the continuous improvement of ESG disclosure, including alignment with leading frameworks (SASB and TCFD) 

 Participating in the development of TransAlta’s annual integrated report, including non-financial content, sustainability targets, sustainability performance table, third-party assurance statement and any other required information 




About You



To be successful in this role, we are looking for the following must-have qualifications and experience:


 Degree or diploma in ESG-related field (e.g., economics, commerce, engineering, or environmental science) 

 3-5 years of relevant experience 

 Knowledge of ESG issues in the energy sector, and experience in ESG data analytics and/or database development 

 Experience in ESG reporting for the energy sector 

 Knowledge and experience in calculating GHG emissions 

 Perform advanced statistical analysis of data; inquisitive and able to identify key variables, drivers for change and discover the root cause 

 Exceptional information processing with high levels of accuracy and attention to detail 

 Proven ability to aggregate and assimilate significant amounts of data and relay most salient points to our business and action requirements 

 Strategic, problem-solving mindset, along with experience in analysis to support decision making 

 Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to articulate and present complex concepts in a clear and simple manner 

 Influence, negotiate and facilitate buy-in with a variety of stakeholders across function, and build trusting relationships. 

 Lead and engage in complex quantitative analysis to support clear understanding of potential development opportunities and policies 

 Working within global, vritual, and cross functional teams and build consensus across all groups to provide the most robust analysis available for senior decision makers 

 Values the work, is motivated and committed to putting energy into the work 

 Willingness to work flexible hours as required during high reporting periods 


Our comprehensive and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, incentive, and rewards programs form the foundation of TransAlta’s excellent employment proposition.


Become part of our TransAlta team today! We look forward to reviewing your application. All applications will be reviewed in a timely manner to the best of our abilities. We appreciate your patience and understanding during the recruitment process. 



 COVID-19 Vaccination Policy 


As TransAlta continues to navigate through unprecedented challenges from the COVID-19 pandemic, we want to assure prospective employees of our continued commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace and that we are taking additional measures to help protect our employees and their families from contracting and spreading COVID-19.

All employees hired, or who begin employment, after November 15, 2021 must provide proof of full vaccination as a condition of employment. Those applicants with appropriate exemptions must identify themselves at the time of interview and provide documentation of the exemption to the TransAlta Disability Management team prior to an offer of employment being made.


 Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion 


It is our collective mission to ensure that every single employee feels a sense of inclusion and belonging and can show up to work as their true authentic self. TransAlta is committed to hiring a diverse workforce including women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and members of the LGBTQ2+ community. TransAlta believes that diversity enhances the quality of its performance, is an essential element to effective corporate governance, and cultivates a strong workplace culture. Click here for our Diversity and Inclusion Pledge.

T ransAlta has received certification from Diversio , a technology company setting the global standard for equity, diversity, and inclusion, for its continued commitment to and meaningful performance on ED&I in the workplace.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Closing Date March 14, 2022

Are you an experienced CPA who would like a fantastic opportunity in the Corporate Controllers group for a large prestigious resource company?

This is an ideal position for a driven and analytical professional interested in leading the global consolidation of a multi-national corporation. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

The Senior Analyst, Consolidation & Systems, is actively involved in the financial close and consolidation process of the Company's global operations and the implementation and sustainment of Hyperion HFM and OneStream, the Company's existing and incoming consolidation reporting systems. This position also plays an integral role in the assessing the accounting treatment of complex consolidation transactions, preparation and review of annual and quarterly Financial Statements, and ensuring SOX compliance in the consolidation process.



Responsibilities




 Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures

 Prepare consolidated financial statements including the statement of cash flow, and consolidation and intercompany journal entries

 Review and analyze consolidated financial data and accounting treatment of complex consolidation transactions in accordance with IFRS

 Prepare and review internal and external financial statements and notes for annual and quarterly reporting

 Maintains consolidation reporting system administrator activities, including metadata design and implementation, new user provisioning, procedure manual design, and training design and delivery for the global user group

 Recommend and implement enhancements to consolidation process and system to enable efficient reporting, satisfy new reporting requirements, and achieve corporate transformation initiatives

 Coordinate with operations to develop solutions to ensure accurate and efficient information is being provided through consolidation system to support high quality data reporting

 Act as key business process owner in a new consolidation system, OneStream, particularly in the area of system implementation and design, user training, and future system sustainment

 Collaborate with cross functional teams, and lead in the design and development of processes and reports on consolidated financial data to support management review of operations, dashboard reporting and other enterprise wide initiatives

 Maintain SOX compliance for all consolidation and system processes




Qualifications




 A CPA with at least 2-3 years of post-designation experience preferably in public practice auditing publicly listed companies, or at a publicly listed company working in consolidation and reporting

 Strong technical accounting background, with in-depth knowledge of IFRS accounting standards and the ability to analyze complex accounting transactions; experience in the mining industry and knowledge of US GAAP are assets

 Strong understanding of Sarbanes-Oxley legislation and internal controls

 Experience in the financial close and consolidation processes for a large organization with a multi-jurisdiction and multi-currency operations

 Experience as system administrator or superuser in financial consolidation and reporting systems (Hyperion HFM, OneStream, SAP BPC, COGNOS, Essbase)

 Strong interpersonal and communication skills with experience working with cross-functional teams and with non-finance individuals




About Teck



Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.

At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person's unique perspective and contribution.

Qualified applicants interested in joining a dynamic team are encouraged to submit a resume and cover letter electronically.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.

Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2018, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the ninth straight year, indicating that Teck's sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world's 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.

description:
12-month contract Business Systems Analyst role working with an enterprise organization working on a business transformation program 


BSA contract role with an enterprise retail organization

Great team who has delivered consistently for the business

Full remote work capability 






What & Why: 


As a result of growth our global enterprise client is looking to add a contract BSA to their large program team transforming how they do business. This is a technical role that would suit a senior person who has a passion for providing on-going analytical and process developments to meet project needs. You will be working closely with business teams to develop user stories and provide technical specifications for the development team. You will also be coordinating and supporting software releases and post deployment validations with the business and technical teams. Bonus points if you have experience working with retail organizations!





Who:


This client has a global presence and is one of the most recognizable Canadian brands. They are well known for their corporate culture and won major awards for their accomplishments in 2019. 2020 remained a very strong year for them which included a major strategic acquisition. 2021 has them investing majorly in bleeding edge technology as they looking to be a global leader in retail technology. They have an all-star leadership team who keeps you accountable and provides support while still affording you tremendous autonomy. They are located close to rapid transit in newly renovated offices in downtown Vancouver and have full remote on-boarding capability during Covid19 with a hybrid work model following that, this role can be fully remote for the right person. 





You:


You will bring the following education, skills and experience to the role:


Solid Experience in managing business process definition and direct liaison with development teams (Min. 2 years)

Working experience with cloud platforms namely AWS and Azure

Working Experience with cloud-native technologies a bonus

Working experience in dealing with big data and data manipulation. 

Must have strong JIRA/Confluence background

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Break down complex user requirements into precise technical requirements

Ability to manage and complete multiple tasks within tight deadlines / changing priorities

Bachelor’s degree in CompSci or related experience

If the sound of this opportunity excites you, and you’re confident that it’s a good fit for your experience and career goals, then we’d love to hear from you! Please send your updated resume to us by applying to this posting and one of our awesome team of recruiters will be in touch.

description:
Empowering players to create is an exciting future for the gaming industry. At Electronic Arts we have many examples of players creating content, whether it be a skateboard park in Skate or fantastical mansions in the Sims 4. The future definitely has our players being more empowered to create with their imagination being the only limit.

To allow more players to become creators, we are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to shape the technology that powers creation. If you have experience with building services for user generated content through modern techniques connecting multiple services together we want to hear from you.

You will work with an experienced team that has collectively built and worked on games and backend services for more than two decades. You will work with multiple developers to bring the next game services to life.

We aim to improve in our development approaches and with our services. Many of our software engineers are "polyglots" and strive in multiple environments.



Responsibilities




Work in partnership with game teams to design shared services

Develop and launch high-traffic services for multi-platform AAA titles

Perform service load testing to resolve bottlenecks

Work with the engineering and DevOps teams on best practices

Research and integrate new technologies

Oversee the health, quality, maintainability and style of the server codebase




Qualifications




6+ years of technology industry experience

BS in Computer Science or other relevant experience

Experience with client/server architecture

Knowledge of HTTP and how to design and work with RESTful web services

Expert ability to analyze and interpret technical data

Experience with throughput, latency, memory and CPU use

Development experience with either Kotlin, Java, Go, and Node.js

Experience with source code management (Perforce, Git)

Public Cloud providers (AWS, GCE, Azure)

Understand containers, orchestrators and service mesh technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Envoy, Istio, Linkerd, and Jaeger)

Understanding of different database and their performance characteristics (SQL and NoSQL)

Experience working with CI/CD technologies

Passion to investigate and adopt new technologies and practices


Bonus Skills


Experience shipping AAA games

Experience working with PlayStation and Xbox online systems

Experience with or exposure to micro-services

Experience with or with cloud native application development

Knowledge of gRPC, Protocol buffers and FlatBuffers

job_title: Data Analyst, Fall Co-op 2022 - EVENT ATTENDEES ONLY
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,

Data Analyst, Fall Co-op 2022 - EVENT ATTENDEES ONLY


Please only apply if you have attended our events. This is a pre-application for event attendees only. Our recruitment cycle begins in May of 2022. At that time, the role will be opened up for all applicants.




About Capital One



At Capital One, data is at the center of everything we do. Our information-based decision making culture creates new opportunities at the intersection of business strategy and technology. As the pioneers of analytics in the financial industry, we thrive on using data to solve complex problems and build a world-class business. We offer exciting opportunities for innovation as the industry becomes increasingly focused on digital technology, and the amount of data available to ground our strategies continues to grow. With your help, we will build the next generation of banking in Canada based on customer-focused values, compelling products and great engineering.

As a Data Analyst co-op, you will work with cross-functional teams to identify, design and develop tools that address challenges in our business processes. As a creative problem-solver, you will be challenged to consider multiple options and select the optimal solution to meet the needs of your customers. You will own the recommendation and resolution to an existing business problem and will be involved end to end, from problem identification to solution deployment.



Types Of Projects Our Data Analysts Deliver




Build, automate, and maintain critical business reporting using cuttingedge tools

Design and develop data solutions that provide seamless execution of business intent

Consult on and influence design of critical business processes and controls

Create, enhance and maintain wellmanaged critical data processes that meet regulatory requirements

Enable delivery of business ideas from concept to implementation

Identify data process improvements and deliver on them

Perform ad hoc analytics on large/diverse datasets




The Ideal Candidate Will Be




Curious: You ask why, you explore, and you're not afraid to blurt out your disruptive idea. You know SQL and are constantly exploring new open source tools, and hitting up stack overflow on a regular basis.

A Wrangler: You can quickly learn to programmatically extract data from a database or an API, bring it through a transformation or two, and convert into a human-readable form (Matplotlib, d3 visualization, Tableau, etc.).

Creative: Big, undefined problems and petabytes of data don't frighten you. You're keen to work with abstract data, and you love discovering new narratives in unmined territories.




Preferred Qualifications




Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or another quantitative discipline with a strong programming background in 
Spring 2023 or earlier
Familiarity with SQL. Python experience would also be an asset.

Ability to shape and develop requirements into practical solutions

Ability to clearly explain technical terms to a non-technical audience

Experience in a Unix/Linux environment



Application Details




Please include your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcripts in ONE PDF in the attachment section under Resume/CV when you create your profile to apply

Job Postings will close on Friday, January 21st at 11:59pm EST

Once you submit your application, you will receive an Online Assessment to complete. Please complete this assessment no later than Sunday, January 23rd by 11:59pm EST

job_title: SW - System Software Quality Engineer (Toronto OR Remote)
industries: Software Development, Wireless Services, and Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Test Engineering



General Summary



As a System Software Quality Engineer, you are responsible for working with a team to verify the production worthiness of a complete system stack of Qualcomm hardware and software. You will collaborate with hardware designers, software/firmware developers, platform engineering teams and post-silicon verification teams. In this role, there will also be an opportunity to engage with our customers and third parties on the drive for a quality product release.



Role And Responsibilities




Design, develop, execute and maintain software tools and automated test suites for the purpose of verifying quality and compliance of Qualcomm products at the system level

Manually test, where appropriate, the customer experience of installation and deployment of Qualcomm hardware and software in a data center environment

Assist in the creation of a Quality Engineering/Release engineering process with emphasis on continuous integration and continuous development

Assist in the definition of future server class SoCs and platforms by identifying opportunities for enhancement of Qualcomm products

Assist in identifying skills requirements and building a team of engineers working on production software readiness, customer use-cases, workload analysis, workload creation, and collaborating with other teams on bring-up/debug/diags

Focus on ensuring that existing Operating Systems and customer usage environments run well, while identifying strong opportunity for enhancements





Preferred Qualifications




5 years+ of demonstrated software test engineering experience

Strong understanding and experience in data center environments and related test automation techniques

Strong Linux programming skills with experience in C/C++ and build systems

Experience in working with Linux Open Source projects and toolchains

Experience developing software for server platforms and platform bringup

Experience testing for production quality software, on schedule, particularly in an organization that delivers software to enable silicon hardware

Additional Asset qualification: Experience in release engineering, continuous integration and continuous development environments





Physical Requirements




Frequently transports between offices, buildings and campuses up to ½ mile.

Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs.

Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting).

Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.

Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers and vendors both in person and remotely.





Education




Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering, Bachelors - Information Systems



Work Experiences



1+ years experience with Programming Language such as C, C++, Java, Python, etc.



Skills




Certifications:




Education




Preferred Qualifications




Skills

: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to 
accommodationsupport



To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies
: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

industries: Financial Services
description:
Description



Analyste en TI (bilingue)


L’équipe de iA Gestion privée de patrimoine procède à l’heure actuelle à une grande transformation numérique. Entre autres, nous désirons procurer une expérience numérique exceptionnelle à notre réseau de conseillers indépendants en gestion de patrimoine, à notre équipe des marchés des capitaux et à nos clients. Pour ce faire, nous sommes à la recherche d’un développeur au sein de l’équipe des solutions informatiques et de l’expérience numérique qui viendra prêter main-forte aux services de l’exploitation, de la conformité, juridique, des finances de iA Gestion privée de patrimoine et à la division Marchés des capitaux. Vous collaborerez également avec les cellules Agiles des données, des clients et des conseillers afin de trouver des moyens d’améliorer l’expérience de la conception à la livraison.

En tant qu’analyste en TI, vous travaillerez en collaboration avec les analystes principaux, les développeurs, les propriétaires de produits et les partenaires d’affaires pour analyser les occasions, documenter les projets et soutenir les partenaires et vos collègues afin d’apporter des améliorations aux systèmes et de procurer une valeur ajoutée à l’entreprise.

Responsabilités


Comprendre, analyser, documenter et soutenir les partenaires/utilisateurs dans la clarification de leurs besoins.

Réaliser des analyses complètes pleinement documentées, étayées et s’appuyant sur des données probantes.

Examiner des données et des rapports pour déceler les tendances sous-jacentes, les écarts importants et identifier les causes profondes de diverses problématiques.

Identifier, comprendre et profiler les sources de données requises pour répondre aux besoins déterminés par les analyses opérationnelles.

Soutenir les utilisateurs durant tout le processus de livraison en s’assurant de la qualité du service rendu.

Aider à définir les fonctions, services ou éléments techniques requis.

Aider à la conception de la solution en collaboration avec l’équipe

Participer au développement et à l’application des règles fonctionnelles, des spécifications techniques et à la conception de la solution et aux normes de prestation.

Contribuer activement, avec d’autres experts dans le secteur, à la mise en œuvre des solutions et à l’exécution des activités (p. ex. : démonstration de faisabilité, diverses validations, stratégies d’essais, essais, opérations et documentation pour les utilisateurs, etc.)

Participer aux essais à différents niveaux de détails ou les effectuer, tant du point de vue fonctionnel que technique, et prêter main-forte aux partenaires.

Contribuer activement à la mise à jour de la documentation nécessaire à la viabilité des éléments conçus ou courants et aux plans de développement de l’actif des TI sous l’égide de l’équipe.

Aider à surveiller, développer et soutenir les applications, les systèmes et les pratiques du secteur

Lorsque les circonstances l’exigent, exécuter certaines tâches techniques, liées au développement, à la configuration ou à l’assurance de la qualité.

Contribuer aux plans de développement des applications et des systèmes technologiques.

Participer activement à toutes les activités d’équipe (préparation des cérémonies, définition du mot terminé, etc.).




Profil recherché



Diplôme d’études collégiales ou baccalauréat en informatique, en administration ou toute autre formation pertinente de même niveau et de 2 à 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire.

Connaissance des principes Lean/Agile et capacité de les appliquer dans un contexte de travail d’équipe.

Démontrer de solides compétences en matière d’analyse, de traitement, de coordination et de collaboration.

Expérience de base en programmation des langages, bases de données ou autres technologies (atout).

Expérience particulière avec les bases de données MySQL

Connaissance de base d’autres bases de données (p. ex. : MSSQL, Mongo, Oracle, Hadoop, etc.) (atout).

Être familier avec le cycle de vie du développement des logiciels, DevOps et ITIL et avec les meilleures pratiques dans ces domaines.

Faire preuve de curiosité, d’autonomie, de rigueur et d’un bon esprit de synthèse.

Démontrer une volonté d’apprendre sans cesse.

Démontrer que vous avez un très grand esprit d’équipe au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire.

Excellentes aptitudes de communication et de collaboration.

Bilinguisme, très bonne connaissance du français et de l’anglais (tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit).

Connaissance de l’industrie des services financiers et de l’assurance (atout).



Lieu(x) de travail : Montréal, Québec ou Toronto; pour le moment, en télétravail


IT Analyst (Bilingual)


Our IA Private Wealth Team is currently undergoing a major digital transformation. Among other things, we are looking to provide an outstanding digital experience to our network of independent Wealth Advisors, Capital Markets team and our clients. To this end, we are looking for an IT Analyst that will reside in the IT solutions and digital experience team supporting iA Private Wealth's Operations, Compliance, Legal, Finance groups, and the Capital Markets business. You will also collaborate with the data, client, and advisor experience agile pods to bring forward opportunities for the end-to-end experience.

As an IT Analyst, you will work with Senior Analysts, Developers, Product Owners and Business Partners to analyze opportunities, document and support partners and colleagues to actively deliver enhancements that add value to the business.


Responsibilities



Understand, analyze, document and support partners/users in clarifying their needs.

Perform complete, fully documented, and substantiated analyses that are based on solid evidence.

Examine data and reports to identify underlying trends, major gaps, and root causes of a various issues.

Identify, understand, and profile data sources required to meet needs identified in business analyses.

Support users throughout the delivery process while guaranteeing the quality of the service provided.

Assist in defining the functions, services or technical elements required.

Assist in designing the solution in collaboration with the team

Participate in the development and application of functional rules, technical specifications, and solution design and delivery standards.

Actively contribute, with other experts in the sector, to the implementation of solutions and the execution of activities (i.e. proof of concept, various validations, testing strategies, testing, operations, and user documentation, etc.)

Assist with or carry out testing at various levels of detail, both functional and technical, and support partners in this area.

Actively contribute to the maintenance of the documentation necessary for the sustainability of designed or current elements and to the IT asset development plans under the team’s responsibility.

Assist in monitoring, developing, and supporting applications, systems and practices in the sector

As needed, perform certain technical, development, configuration or quality assurance activities when required by the context.

Contribute to the applications and technological systems development plan.

Actively participate in all the team’s activities (ceremony preparation, definition of done, etc.).





Desired profile




College diploma or bachelor’s degree in computer science, administration or other relevant training of a similar level and two to five years of experience in a similar role.

Knowledge of Lean/Agile principles and ability to apply them in a teamwork context.

Strong analytical, processing, coordination, and collaboration skills.

Basic experience with programming languages, databases, or other technologies an asset

Specific experience with MySQL databases

Basic knowledge of other database technologies (e.g. MSSQL, Mongo, Oracle, Hadoop, etc.) an asset

Familiarity with the software development life cycle, DevOps and ITIL, and related best practices.

Curiosity, autonomy, discipline, and analytical thinking.

Desire to continue to learn.

Act as a high-performing team player on a multidisciplinary team.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Bilingual, very good knowledge of English & French (verbal and written).

Knowledge of the insurance and financial services industry is an asset.




Locations (s)
 Montreal, Quebec City or Toronto; currently working from home

9 month contract for a bright and enthusiastic individual with a “can do” attitude working with Account Services and Producers to manage the client’s production budgets, estimates and cash flow. Must build and maintain a strong working relationship with Account and Production teams and work as a liaison assisting them with client financial requirements and to uphold internal control policies. 


What you own: 



Management Reporting - Client Finance 



Ensure that all client financial reporting and processes are implemented and executed 

Design and create monthly budget control report on assigned clients. Review with Account Services for issues and resolve prior to client presentations 


WIP management
: 

Ensure all projects are setup according to client contractual requirements and comply with internal/external reporting policies. Maintain accuracy of records in the financial information system 

Issue invoices in accordance with client requirements in a timely and accurate manner, ensuring all applicable taxes (provincial or country) and foreign exchange are applied to fees and costs prior to generating. Monitor project cash flows and liaise with client A/P teams for payments 

Ensure job costing is compliance with all internal control processes and all project related documentation is appropriately archived for audit in a timely manner 

Review project estimates with account services and producers to ensure, complete, and accurate before client presentation 

Plan and lead monthly billing meetings with Account Service and producers to review all active client projects. Prepare unrecognized revenue analysis for review and recognize revenue in compliance with SBOX requirements 

Work with producers to reconcile the job upon completion and notify clients regarding the job status (i.e. reconcile within 60 days from date of completion) 

Review aged purchase orders and work-in-progress. Follow up with budget owner or supplier to resolve issues 

Lead Client Y/E processes with oversight from Client Finance manager. 

Document & provide an accurate up to date WIP report to Client’s finance team and internal AM team identifying amounts to be accrued that are unbilled 

Provide Client and AM team with Final Aged A/R Statement highlighting that all amounts that are unpaid must be recorded or accrued on their end 

Ensure all jobs are closed and reconciled unless carrying over the year end. 

Work with Account team to set up new Fiscal time tracking jobs according to the way scopes are sold or must be reported against in time reporting. 


Cash management
: 

Bi-monthly account receivable statements are sent to client 

Follow up collections Emails to appropriate Finance and Agency account management. 

Escalation - Items greater than 45 immediately flagged to Client finance manager and Sr. Account lead. 

Monitor A/R against approved credit limits. Escalate approaching limit (A/R + unbilled) 


Risk management
: 

o Assist with analysis and review of departmental revenue forecast for budget/operational plan inputs. Assess reasonableness and report directly to Client Finance Manager 

o Mitigate risk exposure of JP\TBWA and our clients by enforcing any control issues and escalating risk items to financial management 

o Address various requests between the clients, account services, producers, and finance when necessary, including any ad hoc client financial reporting and analysis (client audits, quarterly reporting, and time reconciliation) 






Financial Reporting – As assigned to you / cross train as back-up to peers 



Weekly 



Prepared and distribute Monday morning Weekly WIP report shared with all accounts 

Weekly Time report 

Semi- monthly Aged A/R report and Credit monitoring for Client and internal management 



Monthly 



Prepare and analyze reclassification of client advances (WIP) 

Revenue recognition – including accruals & deferrals Intercompany revenue (OMD), and foreign exchange non-Canadian billed revenue 

Monthly client reporting - Time & costing for Account team to share with clients (client facing slides for decks as needed) 

On-going research and analyze of accounting issues as they arise, recommending appropriate accounting treatment when necessary 

AD-HOC - Assist with ad hoc financial reporting needs and analysis as required by the Client Finance Manager, Director of Finance & Operations, and Chief Financial Officer 






Audit (Client and or SOX) 



Provide back-up as required for quarterly internal audit samples – SOX 

Perform Client audits with supervision, document findings, and form appropriate conclusions 






Continuous Process Improvement Contributions: 



Recommend continuous improvements to increase productivity 

Coordinate with Client Finance Manager and system administrator to test new system updates and enhancements 






What qualifies you: 



Degree in accounting/finance 

Designated or enrolled in CPA program 

Optimistic attitude and keen analytical instincts 

Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills and able to work well with people at all levels of the organization such as Clients, Account Service, Finance, Studio Print/Broadcast Production, Traffic, and Media 

Relentless drive for answers and results, intrinsically motivated 

Ability to prioritize and have self-discipline. Highly ORGANIZED. 

Ability to adapt and manage multiple projects while meeting both fixed and moving deadlines 

Excellent proficiency in Excel 

Media Ocean (DDS) experience preferred 

Advertising Agency experience an asset 





At JP\TBWA we respect and value differences and we pride ourselves in attracting diverse talent from around the world. We encourage and foster an environment in which everyone feels respected and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We appreciate people from different backgrounds with different points of view as this fosters creativity and enhances the quality of our work. We are an inclusive employer and recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, disability or age. We offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. Accommodations or assistance due to a disability are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All resumes will be reviewed and those selected for interviews will be contacted.

job_title: Data Engineer, Product Analytics | Ingénieur de données, analyse de produits
industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Every month, billions of people leverage Meta products to connect with friends and loved ones from across the world. On the Data Engineering Team, our mission is to support these products both internally and externally by delivering the best data foundation that drives impact through informed decision making. As a highly collaborative organization, our data engineers work cross-functionally with software engineering, data science, and product management to optimize growth, strategy, and experience for over three billion users, as well as our internal employee community. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction. Beyond this, you will work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, and you'll have a unique opportunity to solve some of the most interesting data challenges around efficiency and integrity, at a scale few companies can match. As we continue to expand and create, we have a lot of exciting work ahead of us! -------Chaque mois, des milliards de personnes utilisent les produits Meta pour se connecter avec leurs amis et leurs proches dans le monde entier. Au sein de l'équipe d'ingénierie des données, notre mission est de soutenir ces produits en interne et en externe en fournissant la meilleure base de données qui stimule l'impact par une prise de décision éclairée. En tant qu'organisation hautement collaborative, nos ingénieurs de données travaillent de manière transversale avec l'ingénierie logicielle, la science des données et la gestion des produits afin d'optimiser la croissance, la stratégie et l'expérience pour plus de trois milliards d'utilisateurs, ainsi que pour notre communauté interne d'employés. Dans ce rôle, vous verrez une corrélation directe entre votre travail, la croissance de l'entreprise et la satisfaction des utilisateurs. En outre, vous travaillerez avec certains des esprits les plus brillants du secteur et vous aurez l'occasion unique de résoudre certains des défis les plus intéressants en matière de données concernant l'efficacité et l'intégrité, à une échelle que peu d'entreprises peuvent égaler. Comme nous continuons à nous développer et à créer, nous avons beaucoup de travail passionnant devant nous!

Data Engineer, Product Analytics | Ingénieur de données, analyse de produits Responsibilities:



Manage and execute data warehouse plans for a product or a group of products to solve well-scoped problems | Gérer et exécuter des plans d’entrepôt de données pour un produit ou un groupe de produits afin de résoudre des problèmes bien déterminés.

Identify the data needed for a business problem and implement logging required to ensure availability of data, while working with data infrastructure to triage issues and resolve | Identifier les données nécessaires à un problème commercial et mettre en œuvre la journalisation requise pour assurer la disponibilité des données, tout en travaillant avec l’infrastructure de données pour trier les problèmes et les résoudre.

Collaborate with engineers, product managers and data scientists to understand data needs, representing key data insights visually in a meaningful way | Collaborer avec les ingénieurs, les gestionnaires de produits et les scientifiques des données pour comprendre les besoins en matière de données, en représentant visuellement les principaux aperçus de données d’une manière significative.

Build data expertise and leverage data controls to ensure privacy, security, compliance, data quality, and operations for allocated areas of ownership | Développer une expertise en matière de données et tirer parti de leurs contrôles pour garantir leur confidentialité, leur sécurité, leur conformité, leur qualité et les opérations pour les domaines de propriété attribués.

Design, build and launch new data models and visualizations in production, leveraging common development toolkits | Concevoir, construire et lancer de nouveaux modèles de données et de nouvelles visualisations en production, en tirant parti des boîtes à outils de développement communes.

Independently design, build and launch new data extraction, transformation and loading processes in production, mentoring others around efficient queries | Concevoir, construire et lancer de manière indépendante de nouveaux processus d’extraction, de transformation et de chargement de données en production, en encadrant les autres autour de requêtes efficaces.

Support existing processes running in production and implement optimized solutions with limited guidance | Soutenir les processus existants fonctionnant en production et mettre en œuvre des solutions optimisées avec un encadrement limité.

Define and manage SLA for data sets in allocated areas of ownership | Définir et gérer les ANS pour les ensembles de données dans les domaines de propriété attribués



Minimum Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience | Être titulaire d'une licence en informatique, en génie informatique, dans un domaine technique pertinent, ou justifier d'une expérience pratique équivalente.

2+ years of work experience in data engineering (a minimum of 1 year with a Ph.D) | Justifier de 2 ans d’expérience professionnelle en ingénierie des données (1 an minimum avec un doctorat)

Experience with SQL, ETL, data modeling and at least one programming language (e.g., Python, C++, C#, Scala, etc.) | Expérience avec SQL, ETL, modélisation de données et au moins un langage de programmation (par exemple : Python, C++, C#, Scala, etc.)



Preferred Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a STEM field | Licence dans un domaine scientifique et informatique

Experience with one or more of the following: data processing automation, data quality, data warehousing, data governance, business intelligence, data visualization, data privacy | Expérience avec un ou plusieurs des éléments suivants : automatisation du traitement des données, qualité des données, entreposage des données, gouvernance des données, business intelligence, visualisation des données, confidentialité des données

Experience working with terabyte to petabyte scale data | Expérience de travail avec des données à l’échelle du téraoctet au pétaoctet

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
502825BR


Introduction


At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.


Your Role and Responsibilities




Understand and translate business needs into logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality, reduced redundancy, and that support long-term solution.

Be responsible for the development of the conceptual, logical, and physical data models.

Providing expertise on data modeling tools and techniques for designing data models for applications and related systems.

Assure that the modelling complies with the data modelling standards (normalization, data validation)

Working closely with business stakeholders, as well as potential users of the information system to define and analyze data requirements needed to support the business processes within the scope of corresponding information systems in organizations.

Ensure compliance with technical processes and standards.

Identify, communicate, and mitigate Risks, Assumptions, Issues and Decisions throughout full lifecycle.




Required




Fraud modeling, Fraud analytics, commercial payments (e.g. ACH, Wires, EFTs), Safer Payments




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




A minimum of 10 years of experience related to Data Modeling

Strong Data Modeling Skills in designing, creating and maintaining conceptual, logical, and physical data model

Must have a strong understanding of Data modeling principles (3nf/dimensional), methods and techniques

Good knowledge of data profiling, integrating, and modeling data from different source systems

Should have hands-on experience in relational, dimensional, analytic data modelling using RDBMS, dimensional, NoSQL data platform technologies, and ETL and data ingestion protocols.

Should have strong knowledge in creating the data model for OLAP and OLTP systems

Strong knowledge of Database Architecture, normalization concepts and NFR requirements

Good Hands-on expertise on any of the data modeling tools like Erwin, IBM InfoSphere, Toad, IDA, ER Studio, and the current tools for large data warehouses

Experience with data warehouse, data lake, and enterprise big data platforms.

Experience working with extracting business rules to develop transformations, data lineage, metadata, data catalogue

Must have knowledge of metadata management

Experience with data stewardship/quality assurance solution

Experience working with validating legacy and developed data model outputs

Strong experience in data analysis and architecture, ability to influence end-to-end design decisions based on data.

Hands-on experience in preparing data mapping documents from source-to-target and the data quality assessments for the source data

Strong communication skills

"If you are applying to the role-based in Quebec, you confirm you are fluent in the French language, both written and verbal."




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Exposure to AWS, Azure

Exposure to orchestration tool

Data Vault Modeling

Exposure to WhereScape

Design Bachman Data Diagrams

Logical and physical data modeling on NoSQL databases

ETL knowledge background



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.
