Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
489488BR


Introduction


Menez IBM vers l'avenir en traduisant les exigences systèmes dans la conception et l'élaboration de systèmes personnalisés dans un environnement agile. Le succès d'IBM est entre vos mains au fur et à mesure que vous transformez les besoins d'affaires essentiels en code et que vous stimulez l'innovation. Votre travail fortifiera mondialement IBM et ses clients, par la collaboration et l'intégration de code dans les systèmes d'entreprise. Vous aurez accès à la formation, aux outils et aux technologies les plus récents, et à un cheminement de carrière illimité avec le chef de file mondial de la technologie. Venez chez IBM et ayez un impact à l'échelle planétaire!

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

En tant que programmeur-analyste, vous serez membre d’une équipe de développement agile au sein de la grande équipe des 
technologies de l'information (TI).
 Votre équipe immédiate se composera d'employés dynamiques qui ne cessent d’enrichir leurs compétences techniques et personnelles. L’entraide et l'ambiance font de cet endroit un environnement de travail très recherché. Dans le cadre de votre poste, vous assumerez les tâches d'analyse, de développement et de soutien des applications de niveau 2 associées à la fabrication. Plus précisément, vous pourriez être appelé à participer à l'adaptation de solutions existantes et à la création de nouvelles applications, ainsi qu’au passage de notre parc applicatif aux nouvelles technologies. Vous pourriez également contribuer à la réalisation de divers projets de modélisation numérique et d’amélioration qualitative des applications existantes.


Environnement De Travail




Méthodologies Scrum et/ou Kanban. 

Horaires flexibles. 

Espace de collaboration à aires ouvertes/travail en mode hybride.

Climat de travail jovial, collaboratif et dynamique.



Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



Baccalauréat en informatique

Posséder 3 à 5 ans d'expérience pertinente

Programmation Java

Connaissance du langage SQL

Bonne maîtrise de l’architecture logicielle

Bon esprit analytique

Bonne maîtrise de GIT, GitHub, Maven

Développement de services Web (RESTful API, WebSocket)

Notions de programmation orientée objet, modèles de conception




Aptitudes recherchées




Facilité à communiquer et à travailler en équipe

Intérêt pour de nouveaux apprentissages

Bon sens de l’organisation et de l’autonomie

Bonne capacité à concevoir et à rechercher des solutions

Ouverture à un travail diversifié et flexibilité d’esprit



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié



Connaissance du cadriciel Spring.

Connaissance de Docker et de Kubernetes. 

Connaissance de l’environnement Linux.



Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Systems aide les chefs de file en TI à penser différemment leur infrastructure. Les serveurs et le stockage d'IBM ne sont plus inanimés - ils peuvent comprendre, raisonner, et apprendre de façon à ce que nos clients puissent innover tout en évitant les problèmes informatiques. Nos systèmes alimentent les plus importantes industries du monde et nos clients sont les architectes de l'avenir. Rejoignez-nous pour aider à constituer notre portefeuille technologique de pointe conçu pour les affaires cognitives et optimisé pour l'informatique en nuage.

Votre vie chez IBM

Qu'est-ce qui est important pour vous lorsque vous êtes à la recherche de votre prochain défi professionnel? Peut-être voulez-vous participer à un travail qui change vraiment le monde. Que diriez-vous d'un endroit offrant des possibilités de carrière et de perfectionnement incroyables et diversifiées, où vous pouvez vraiment découvrir votre passion. Vous recherchez une culture d'ouverture, de collaboration et de confiance - où tout le monde a une voix? Qu'en est-il de tout cela? Si tel est le cas, IBM pourrait être votre prochain défi professionnel. Rejoignez-nous, non pas pour faire mieux, mais pour tenter des choses que vous n'auriez jamais cru possibles. Impact. Inclusion. Infinité d'expériences. Faites votre meilleur travail.

À propos d'IBM

IBM est une société qui est chef de file dans les plateformes infonuagiques et les solutions cognitives. En perpétuelle réinvention depuis 1911, nous sommes le plus grand employeur de technologie et de services-conseils au monde, avec plus de 380 000 IBMistes au service de clients dans 170 pays. Avec Watson, la plateforme d'IA pour les affaires, alimentée par les données, nous élaborons des solutions sectorielles pour des problèmes réels.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

industries: Marketing Services, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Yelp, it’s our mission to connect people with great local businesses. From a coffee connoisseur’s review of a neighborhood cafe, to a homeowner’s request for a quote to remodel their kitchen, Yelp’s data captures millions of user-business interactions every day.

The Data Science & Analytics team prides itself on harnessing the power of this data. We test and learn, build tools and lead meaningful analyses to extract insights that influence Yelp’s product and business strategy.

We’re looking for a self-motivated critical thinker whose intellectual curiosity is met with a healthy dose of skepticism. You value the integrity of your work, sanity check analyses before drawing conclusions, and take pride in telling stories with data. You are a team player who is an excellent communicator, quick learner, and as excited about Yelp as we are.

We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

Vaccination against COVID-19 is not required for this role. We nonetheless encourage all employees to get vaccinated. Employees who are not vaccinated may not visit Yelp’s offices or participate in any in-person work activities, and are not eligible to transfer or be promoted to a role that requires vaccination.



Where You Come In




Lead broad analytics projects core to Yelp’s business, communicate key insights to decision makers, and help product leaders uncover new opportunities.

Manage tight deadlines and quickly iterate analyses to answer unstructured business questions, deliver actionable learnings, and make strategic recommendations.

Work cross-functionally with product and engineering to define, log, and track Yelp’s key product metrics and opportunity size new initiatives.

Generate dashboards and automate reports that empower teams across the organization to make data-driven decisions.

Grow and maintain impactful relationships with stakeholders of both technical and non technical backgrounds with clear and frequent communication.

Think critically about experimental design and advocate for thoughtful experimentation.




What It Takes To Suceed




BA/BS or graduate degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, economics etc.)

3+ years of quantitative industry experience, ideally within the consumer product space

Excellent SQL skills, fluency in Python, and experience with at least one statistical package (R, Pandas/NumPy/SciPy/matplotlib, Stata, Matlab).

An eye for compelling data visualization and extensive experience with related tools (Tableau, Mode, Looker).

Solid understanding of statistical inference, experimental design and analytic bias. Familiarity with financial modeling and advanced statistics (regression, non parametrics, predictive modeling) a plus.


Local businesses are turning to Yelp because we’re uniquely positioned to help them reach their customers during these challenging times. Our Engineering & Product teams have responded by quickly identifying their needs and building innovative products and features to support them. Our commitment to connecting people with great local businesses has never been stronger.

About the company


Stellar Wholesale Inc proudly distributes some of the best brands in the hydroponics, greenhouse and garden industry to retailers and commercial growers across Canada. Over the years, Stellar has evolved to be one of the industry's preferred supplier.





Duties:



Write, modify, integrate and test software code

Maintain existing computer programs by making modifications as required

Identify and communicate technical problems, processes and solutions

Prepare reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software

Assist in the collection and documentation of user requirements

Assist in the development of logical and physical specifications

May lead and co-ordinate teams of computer programmers

May research and evaluate a variety of software products



Employment requirements



Education



A Diploma in computer science or in another discipline with a significant programming component or completion of a college program in computer science is usually required.

Specialization in programming for engineering and scientific applications requires specific post-secondary study or experience.



Experience



1+Years of Experience Including:

Strong knowledge in the following coding language

Python

Postgress and MySQL DB

Odoo

HTML

CSS

Github

Windows

Linux



Additional information



Be able to communicate in English.

Be able to understand the workers and customer problems and needs.

Be proactive, be able to give ideas and implement them. Develop software to make easy the office workers tasks.



Schedule



8 hour shift



Benefits



Extended health care

Dental care

Paid time off

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Information Services
description:
6-month PowerBI developer contract with an enterprise organization who has made significant investments into PowerBI


6-month PowerBI Developer contract 

Enterprise organization with significant investment into PowerBI

Full remote work






What & Why: 


Our client has selected PowerBI as their enterprise reporting and analytics tool and as a result of this, they are looking to add a 6-month contract PowerBI developer to their team. You will be responsible of the design, documentation and development of complex MS Power Platform (PowerBI, Power Apps, etc.) solutions. You will also be working closely with the application solution architects, data scientists and data engineering teams to develop BI solutions, enhance and/or define new data integrations and/or modeling efforts and providing database development, architecture and data pipeline support for data engineers and architects. This role will be responsible for project work as well as some ad-hoc requests that come in from the business. 





Who:


This client is one of the most recognizable Canadian brands, a true Vancouver success story who has expanded globally. They are well known for their corporate culture and has won major awards for their accomplishments. They have invested majorly in technology and have had an incredibly successful past few years, including a major strategic acquisition. They have an all-star leadership team who keeps you accountable and provides support while still affording you tremendous autonomy. They are located close to rapid transit in newly renovated offices in downtown Vancouver and have full remote on-boarding capability during Covid19 with a hybrid work model following that, however this role can be fully remote if you would prefer.





You:


You will bring the following education, skills and experience to the role:


5+ years’ experience providing IT Business Intelligence solutions related to Power BI, data warehousing, BI testing, and analytics engineering.

Min 2+ years’ experience specifically with Power BI Reporting (Power BI Embedded application experience would be an asset).

Knowledge and experience with the Power BI REST API.

T-SQL, SQL - database modeling, design, testing, implementation, and integration.

Data profiling, and discrepancy analysis.

Power BI performance modeling and optimization.

Experience building tabular data models in Power BI and/or Analysis Services.

Strong T-SQL and Database development skills.

Experience with Data Warehousing and Data Lakes (Preferably on Azure) and general big data architecture patterns.

Knowledge of Microsoft Azure Services – Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Warehouse, Delta Lake, DataBricks, On-Premise Data Gateway and Azure DevOps Automation.

Knowledgeable in Agile Software Development Methodology

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field






Next Steps: 



If the sound of this opportunity excites you, and you’re confident that it’s a good fit for your experience and career goals, then we’d love to hear from you! Please send your updated resume to us by applying to this posting and one of our awesome team of recruiters will be in touch.

industries: Financial Services
description:
This role operates in English.


Work Model: 
Hybrid

The work location for this role is flexible within Canada.




Our Information Technology team aspires to be a leader in applying technology to power business strategies. We connect concepts with solutions to create value and efficiencies for our clients, employees, and communities. Our success is driven by our skilled and diverse team who are passionate about excellence, innovation, and agility. As the Senior Business Systems Analyst you will liaise between the team and business stakeholders for functionality enhancements and new developments. You will be a part of an exciting team responsible for translating concepts and requirements into client focused and effective system-based solutions. You will contribute to complex and diverse initiatives through formulating and defining system scope and objectives based on both user needs and a comprehensive understanding of the applicable business applications.

 




Technologies you have experience with:


You have experience with ANSI SQL

You have experience working with and testing datasets.

Having experience with Dimensional Data, Atlassian Cloud tools (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket), Microsoft SQL Service, Microsoft Power BI/SSRS, and Microstrategy is an asset.


 

What you’re responsible for:


Participating in the assessment and selection of technical design solutions, acting as intermediary between the team and the stakeholders.

Contributing to the preparation of business case and project planning by gathering required information while working with the team and Business stakeholders.

Facilitating discussions with and business partners to collect, document, and validate detailed analysis of business functions, processes, requirements and test plans for highly complex projects.

Ensuring that the implemented software solution is effective and may include preparing training material, delivering training, and engaging in production support activities.

Leading the continuous improvement of the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) practice through research, devising improvements, establishing more efficient processes, and providing guidance to other team members.


 

What to expect:


You will travel occasionally. 

Extended work hours, including evenings and weekends, may be required. 

You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate. 


 

To be successful:


You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs. 

You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions. 

You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view. 

You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues. 


 

To join our team:


You have five years of experience in an analytical role within a project-related environment

You have completed post-secondary education in Information Technology, Business Analysis, or a related discipline.

You are an experienced intermediary between client and IT teams participating in technical solution design activities including process mapping, requirement solicitation and refinement, documenting data and business rules, communication of technology constraints and gap analysis and overall test and implementation activities. You have experience partnering with third-party technology vendors and effectively managing vendor deliverables.

You have experience working in an Agile environment and contributing to Agile team operational practices through innovation and delivery of business value. 

You have advanced knowledge of SDLC methodologies, processes as well as project planning methodologies and LEAN process improvement tools and techniques 


 

What we offer: 


Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Employers. 

Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs. 

A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture. 

Paid volunteer days to give back to your community. 

A comprehensive total rewards package, including competitive salary, bonus, pension and benefits.

job_title: Analyste principal, données et analytiques / Data & Analytics Senior Analyst
industries: Dairy Product Manufacturing
description:
*** ENGLISH VERSION FOLLOWS ***





L'
analyste principal données et analytiques (services et applications)
, soutient et accompagne les clients internes dans la création de valeur autour des données. À ce titre, vous serez responsable de gérer la relation d’affaires avec notre partenaire de soutien pour le suivi des incidents, améliorations, requêtes analytiques et service conseil. Vous gérerez également le processus d’escalade pour les incidents et les améliorations et serez le point de contact central dans la gestion les différentes priorités analytiques en cours et/ou projets à venir. Le support du volet applicatif commercial, incluant le service à la clientèle et les forces de vente, feront également partie de vos responsabilités.




Vous travaillerez directement avec tous les départements de l’entreprise, ainsi que différents partenaires externes, afin de soutenir nos opérations.




Plus spécifiquement, le(la) titulaire de poste :





Travaille conjointement avec notre partenaire de soutien afin d’effectuer le suivi sur les incidents en cours et éviter les ruptures des services.

Définit une stratégie pour impartir des améliorations à notre partenaire de soutien et en assurer l’exécution et la transition.

Gère les attentes des différentes fonctions d’affaires en ce qui a trait aux taux de service des données analytiques et applicatives.

Conseille les différentes fonctions d’affaires sur l’usage des solutions, meilleures pratiques et standards d’usage.

S’implique lors des activités de transition vers l’organisation de support (RUN) pour les projets BI, les améliorations et les suivis.






Exigences






Baccalauréat en informatique de gestion

Minimum de 10 années d’expérience pertinente

5 années dans la gestion et supervision de partenaires externes

Connaissances élevées en ERP gestion (Oracle, SAP, JDE, etc.) et ETL

Connaissances infonuagiques (Snowflake, AWS, GCP, etc.)

Excellentes compétences en communication, en français et en anglais, tant au niveau verbal qu’écrit





.....................................




The 
Data & Analytics Senior Analyst (Services & Applications)
 supports and accompanies internal clients in extracting value from data. In this role, you will manage business relations with our support partner, ensuring follow-up in relation to incidents, improvements, analytics requests, and requests for advice. You will oversee the escalation process for incidents and improvements and will be the main point of contact for managing current and upcoming analytical priorities and projects. Support for commercial applications, including customer service and sales force, will also be part of your responsibilities.




You will work directly with departments across the organization and with various external partners in support of Agropur operations.




More specifically, the Senior Analyst will:





Work with our support partner to ensure incident follow-up and to prevent service interruptions.

Define a strategy for outsourcing improvements to our support partner, execute the strategy and oversee the transition.

Manage expectations with respect to service levels for analytical and application data.

Advise business functions on applying solutions, best practices, and usage standards.

Participate in transitional activities that move projects, improvements, and follow-up towards a “RUN” approach.






Requirements:






Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science

Minimum 10 years’ relevant experience 

5 years experience in managing and supervising external partners

Extensive knowledge of ERP management systems (e.g.: Oracle, SAP, JDE) and ETL tools

Strong understanding of cloud computing (e.g.: Snowflake, AWS, GCP)

Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and French

industries: Banking and Financial Services
description:
Address



4100 Gordon Baker Road



Job Family Group



Technology

Ensures the quality of the products that technology delivers, working closely with all applications, common services/middleware, and infrastructure teams throughout the development/engineering lifecycle. Designs, develops, executes, and maintains observability dashboards of infrastructure, common services/middleware, data, and applications in various environments. Provides immediate response to production program problems.



Qualifications





Manages people and leads a team capable of delivering the desired business results

Provides strategic input into business decisions as a trusted advisor

Provides guidance on reviewing, evaluating and driving requirements for testability to ensure review processes are adhered to

Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business

Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making

Leads initiatives. Able to coordinate resources and manage problems to resolution when necessary

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues

Acts as the prime subject matter expert for internal/external stakeholders

Enable reporting on the overall health of systems

Enable reporting on system state as experienced by customers

Enable monitoring for key business and systems metrics

Enable tooling to help you understand and debug your systems in production and lower environments

Enable tooling to find information about things the programs did not previously know (identifying the unknown or uncaptured issues)

Enabling access to tools and data that help trace, understand, and diagnose infrastructure problems in your production environment, including interactions between services

Monitors and tracks performance and addresses any issues

Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations

Leads the execution of operational programs; assesses and adapts as needed to ensure quality of execution

Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and systems in the organization to improve overall efficiency and improve the bank

Communicates the overall quality of a deliverable and ensures metrics are used to drive delivery and identify any areas of concern

Participates in programs/projects across the enterprise

Participates as an active stakeholder in every initiative, driving quality based on fact-based metrics

Ensures development teams’ unit testing practices are in place and confirms core criteria met prior to integrated testing delivery

Proactively provides improvement opportunities to the team to enhance the customer experience

Drives the testing automation capabilities

Identifies opportunities to strengthen the quality assurance capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks

Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning

Operates at a group/enterprise-wide level and serves as a specialist resource to senior leaders and stakeholders

Applies expertise and thinks creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine

Implements changes in response to shifting trends

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed

Typically, 10-15 years of work experience in IT or business environment and/or BS/BA or MBA/MS in computer science, engineering, information systems, math or business

Knowledge of the SDLC, testing concepts, methodologies, metrics, automated testing frameworks

Problem solving skills including the ability to troubleshoot and identify problem areas throughout testing

Collaborate well with others. Ability to translate technical concepts into easy to understand terms

Able to analyze data and use testing metrics to highlight improvement opportunities

Seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth / Expert

Analytical and problem-solving skills - In-depth / Expert

Influence skills - In-depth / Expert

Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration - In-depth / Expert

Able to manage ambiguity

Data driven decision making - In-depth / Expert



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
We are looking for a talented, self-motivated Data Engineer with broad technical skills to dive deep into large amounts of data and the desire to influence key decisions with data-driven analysis and insights. The position collaborates closely with the Marketing & Commercial Analytics team to implement data strategies for marketing, develop complex ETL pipelines and support dashboards that promote deeper understanding of our games.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing and establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses and possess excellent problem solving ability dealing with huge volumes of game data. The position will also stay apprised of latest trends and research on all aspects of data engineering and analytics. You will work with leaders from the Marketing, Commercial and Studios organization by providing them with data to understand campaign and commercial performance across multiple channels and territories.



Responsibilities




 As a Data Engineer you will be involved in the entire development life cycle from brainstorming ideas to implementing elegant solutions to derive data insights 

 You will gather requirements, model and design solutions to support reporting analytics and exploratory analysis 

 You will design, build, and launch efficient, scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data 

 You will work with analysts, understand requirements, develop technical specifications for ETLs, including documentation 

 You will be responsible to support production code to produce comprehensive and accurate data artifacts. 

 You will oversee the process of adoption of new technologies and applications we use to collect, integrate, analyze, and deliver relevant analytical solutions. 

 You will guide communications between our users and studio engineers to provide scalable end-to-end solutions. 

 You will promote strategies to improve our data modeling, quality and architecture 

 You will work with big data solutions, data modeling, understand the ETL pipelines and dashboard tools. 

 You will be engaged in every step of the development life cycle, from collecting requirements, communicating to users, design, development and testing the products. 

 Explore data and suggest new opportunities to measure and assess the performance of our marketing and commercial actions 




Qualifications




 4+ years relevant industry experience in data engineering role who has Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. 

 Proficiency in writing SQL queries and knowledge of cloud-based databases like Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery or other big data solutions. 

 Experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing. 

 Experience with at least one of the programming languages like Python or Java 

 Experience with business intelligence tools like Power BI, Looker, Tableau or similar BI tools. 

 Experience working with unstructured datasets 

 Experience in the physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses and data lakes. 

 Knowledge of latest data pipeline tools such as Airflow. 

 Developing APIs and integrating with 3rd party APIs 

 Summarize technical details to non-technical audience 

 Comfortable working with a multi-functional team, both locally and remote, understanding the perspectives of each partner. 

 Experience working in an agile development environment and familiar with Process Management tools such as JIRA, Target process, Trello or similar

B-Hive Canada


Fondée en France en 2017 et implantée depuis 2019 à Montréal, B-Hive est une jeune compagnie à forte croissance spécialisée dans le conseil en informatique : nous proposons aux Directions TI des services de consultation, consistant en la mise à disposition de personnel. Avec +500 consultants actuellement en activité dans une variété de métiers informatiques, B-Hive assure un soutien réactif et flexible aux opérations et projets de nombreuses compagnies, que ce soit pour leur permettre de faire face à un pic d’activité ou pour répondre à un de leurs besoins spécifiques.





Un(e) développeur(se) Applications Mobiles (iOS / Android)


B-Hive vous propose de rejoindre les équipes d’un acteur majeur du streaming proposant un vaste éventail de produits et services haut de gamme destinés aux consommateurs et aux entreprises (chaînes télévisées, stations de radio, services VOD, app musicales). Vous intégrerez une équipe ayant la responsabilité des applications mobiles du groupe (équipe de 8 comprenant 2 testeurs, 1 chef de projet et 5 développeurs). Votre rôle : développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités et interfaces utilisateurs.





Responsabilités :



Développer et maintenir les différentes applications mobiles sur les plateformes Android et iOS 

Supporter le cycle de vie complet des applications (conceptualisation, mise en production, tests et support) 

Collaborer avec différentes équipes comme le backend, design, marketing 

Rester à la fine pointe de la technologie 






Descriptif du profil :



Baccalauréat ou maitrise en informatique ou génie logiciel (ou diplôme équivalent)

Bonne connaissance des plateformes Android et iOS

Expérience avec un ou plusieurs de ces langages : C#, Java, Kotlin, Objective-C et Swift

Expérience dans le développement d’interface usager

Aisance orale en français et en l’anglais

Autonome et minutieux 

Intérêt pour apprendre des nouvelles technologies

industries: Information Services and Insurance
description:
Work at an award-winning top employer! If you are looking for an empowering and progressive place to shape your future, then you’ve landed in the right place at BCAA. With our corporate Head Office in Burnaby and locations around BC, we offer a wide variety of opportunities all across the province. Share our purpose to together mobilize a brighter future for all and help British Columbians down’s life’s many roads.




Full vaccination against COVID-19 is a precondition of new employment. A successful candidate offered employment at BCAA will need to provide proof of full vaccination prior to commencing employment. Exemptions permitted under applicable employment and human rights legislation.





Senior Data Engineer... If you know the title, you know the role! Contact us today.


BCAA’s Data and Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) is a growing team of data scientists, developers and analysts who deliver value across the organization by leading the development of data science, information governance and digital solutions through best practices, research, support, and training for the organization’s analytics community. As a Senior Data Engineer within the DnA Centre of Excellence, you will provide hands-on leadership while working on a cross-functional team that is passionate about innovation and collaboratively solving complex problems.

The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to address business problems and support insight-driven decision making, while working alongside team members within the Data Science and Information Governance practice. Your ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical leaders and team members, and to support the implementation of solutions from self-serve analytics to advanced machine learning will be key to your success.




As a Senior Data Engineer, you will also work closely with BCAA’s Infrastructure and Product & Platform teams in the development of BCAA’s Data Lake, which enables new capabilities for our analytics community to leverage in exploring, developing, and deploying solutions that deliver value within the organization and to our customers. As part of maturing organizational practices, the DnA team provides support and education across various business units around the democratization of analytics and driving a culture of data-driven decision making.

The Data and Analytics CoE is part of a broader Chief Technology and Transformation Office (CTTO) team, which leads BCAA’s Information Services through several initiatives and programs, guided by a customer-centric approach. Our work as a Data and Analytics COE spans across the organization, collaborating with teams in several business units, including Roadside Assistance, Home Insurance, Travel Insurance, Marketing, Evo Car Share and the BCAA Call Centre, to name a few.





Key Responsibilities


Data Engineer/ETL 


Leads BCAA’s Data and Analytics Operations (DnA Ops) Data Engineering Practice

Designs scalable solutions that are flexible and can evolve within an ever-changing environment

Deploys data models and analysis for business processes, data usages (flow), process design and data design.

Develops solutions that strengthen data governance, security frameworks, data integrations and data integrity.

Works closely with DnA CoE data scientists, BI developers, information governance and business stakeholders to lead data processing solutions that deliver value throughout the enterprise

Provides organizational engineering and data architecture expertise; consulting services to design, deploy and maintain systems to enable downstream analytics, ensuring standards and best practices are embedded

Collaborates with stakeholders at all levels of the organization on a range of business problems, identifying and supporting the implementation of solutions to drive improved business results through advanced analytics

Thoroughly documents assumptions, requirements, methodology, test plans and facilitates knowledge sharing and insight on engineering and usage of new data engineering and data discovery tools

Analyzes both structured and unstructured data to identify patterns, trends/dependencies and communicate the results to the relevant stakeholders

Coordinates model-driven process engineering and automation initiatives

Assists with embedding the use of advanced analytical tools and techniques across analytics teams at BCAA.

Develops automated data and metadata processes for leverage organizational insight and action

Supports and enables collaboration across the business to democratize information and remove ‘data silos






Qualifications


Education

Bachelor’s Degree and/or Master’s degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences or other STEM discipline




Experience 


Minimum of five years as a data engineer or ETL developer

Demonstrated experience building data warehouses, scalable data pipelines, provisioning self-serve analytic data models, AWS cloud stack



OR
 equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

 

Other Skills / Qualifications


Superior communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to navigate and influence throughout the organization both technical & non-technical audiences

Technical leadership: you are considered the go-to expert in data engineering best-practices amongst industry peers

Data engineering champion: proven advocate for advancing core data engineering practices and engaging with the analytics community

Experience leading data projects from problem identification to production.

Experience supporting ML and AI experiments, business intelligence, data science models and reporting.

Experience handling large and complex data sets in all stages from extraction to modelling, structuring, filtering, discovery, and development of visualizations.

Industry experience developing, optimizing, and implementing machine learning models in a production environment.

Solid understanding of foundational statistical concepts

Strong analytics background: demonstrated experience with quantitative data analysis and utilizing data to drive decision-making, specifically related to measuring and demonstrating effectiveness.

Ability to connect systems using API’s, Python code or Bash scripts

Attention to detail and the ability to solve problems through technical solutions.

Strong working knowledge of source and target data structures, ETL and CDC processes and products, analysis, troubleshooting, and code review.

Working understanding of high-volume data processing and analysis, relational and NoSql Databases, and Machine Learning Tools/Frameworks.

Capability to learn and develop new engineering techniques as required.

Experience with the following tools/languages for data management and manipulation: Informatica, MapReduce, Rest APIs, Attunity Qlik-Replicate, Scala

Extensive experience in:

Python, SQL, NoSQL

AWS stack (certification preferred)

PowerBI, Tableau


We aspire to be one of the best places to work with those who share our beliefs:


We believe in:


DOING THE RIGHT THING

We stay true to our word, and help British Columbians move forward.

THE POWER OF COMMUNITY

Together, we create a more vibrant, inclusive and connected province for everyone.

PUTTING PEOPLE FIRST

We treat each other with the same care and respect that we treat our Members.

PROTECTING OUR HOME

It's our responsibility to protect life in BC now, and for generations to come.

SHAPING THE FUTURE

We look to new horizons and actively embrace change.

By putting these beliefs in to action each of us will do engaging work with inspiring people and grow personally and professionally.

industries: Telecommunications
description:
Code de demande: 355715

Chez Bell, on ne se contente pas de construire des réseaux de calibre mondial, d’élaborer des services novateurs et de créer du contenu pour des médias multiplateformes : on transforme la façon dont les Canadiens communiquent entre eux et avec le reste du monde.

Si vous êtes prêt à donner corps à des idées innovatrices et à vous joindre à une entreprise qui encourage, le développement professionnel et le bien-être de ses employés, l’équipe Bell est faite pour vous.

L’équipe Services opérationnels clientèle de Bell fait preuve d’avant-gardisme et offre l’expérience de service par excellence à ses clients des services résidentiels, sans fil et pour petites entreprises. Nous dirigeons le développement et l’exécution stratégiques des activités quotidiennes, nous élaborons des outils et des processus contribuant à améliorer les services, nous gérons la loyauté et la fidélisation de la clientèle et nous misons sur les mégadonnées et l’intelligence artificielle afin de soutenir la création de propriétés intellectuelles.



À Propos De Nous



Le groupe Science des données au sein des Services opérationnels clientèle fournit des renseignements stratégiques au moyen de données d’analyse, assure l’alignement multidisciplinaire des objectifs et de l’exécution, et aide les clients internes à favoriser les partenariats stratégiques et les nouvelles initiatives à l’avenir.

L’équipe Science des données au sein des Services opérationnels clientèle fournit une perspective et une orientation judicieuse sur la stratégie opérationnelle et le rendement de l’unité d’affaires primée Expérience client de Bell. L’équipe se concentre sur les solutions de pointe en matière d’informatique décisionnelle de bout en bout qui soutiennent la création et la livraison de l’information au sein des lignes d’affaires et aux premiers dirigeants dans l’ensemble des unités d’affaires de Bell.

Les membres de l’équipe sont des experts en stratégie et en exploitation d’affaires; ils sont dotés d’un esprit analytique et stratégique, tout en étant très pragmatiques et en ayant une approche axée sur les résultats. En tant qu’analyste du groupe Science des données des Services opérationnels clientèle, vous travaillerez sur des projets qui s’occupent de certaines des solutions d’affaires les plus évoluées de l’industrie des télécommunications. Alors que vous relèverez du gestionnaire principal, analytique avancée, vos connaissances sur la stratégie et les opérations, alliées à vos aptitudes pour la communication et à votre rigueur analytique, façonneront notre façon de faire des affaires.



Ce Que Nous Attendons De Vous




Vous devez avoir du cœur! Pour votre travail. Pour vos clients. Pour vos collègues.

Passion et enthousiasme pour l’analyse de grands ensembles de données et la prise de décisions concrètes.

Capacité de diviser les problèmes les plus complexes en éléments concrets plus petits.

Capacité d’aider l’entreprise à « tisser des liens » et à comprendre « le portrait d’ensemble », sans jamais perdre de vue celui-ci.

Intérêt envers l’utilisation des données et des technologies pour aider à résoudre les problèmes d’affaires.



Ce que nous espérons obtenir de votre part :



Diplôme de premier cycle en affaires/commerce, en ingénierie, en mathématiques ou dans un autre domaine quantitatif. Cependant, si vous avez un diplôme en anglais et que vous êtes intéressé par ce poste, veuillez postuler.

D’expérience avec le langage SQL dans les données de production d’entreprise.

Expérience avec SQL (Teradata), SAS et logiciels de visualisation (MicroStrategy/Tableau).

Expérience dans l’industrie des télécommunications, de la vente au détail ou des services-conseils.

Expérience en création de rapports et de tableaux de bord d’informatique décisionnelle, et en analyse de données en profondeur

Aptitudes efficaces pour la gestion de projet et de processus et capacité de coopérer avec les parties prenantes et de les influencer.

Excellentes aptitudes pour la communication et aisance à interagir avec des partenaires et la haute direction.

Expérience en analyse d’affaires et de marketing.


Le bilinguisme est un atout (français et anglais). Une connaissance adéquate du français est requise pour les postes offerts au Québec. Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement

dans le but d'alléger le texte.



Renseignements Supplémentaires




Type de poste : 
Cadre
Statut du poste : 
Employé permanent - temps plein
Lieu de travail : 
Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : Mississauga
Profil de travail flexible : 
Travail mobile


Date limite pour postuler : 
2022-03-18



Afin que votre candidature soit prise en considération pour ce rôle, veuillez postuler directement en ligne. Les candidatures soumises par courriel ne seront pas acceptées.



Chez Bell, nous n’acceptons pas seulement la différence, nous la célébrons. Nous nous engageons à créer un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible, où tous les membres du personnel se sentent valorisés, respectés et soutenus, et peuvent atteindre leur plein potentiel.

Nous encourageons les personnes handicapées à soumettre leur candidature. Des accommodements sont mis en place sur demande pour les candidats qui prennent part à toutes les étapes du processus de sélection. Pour faire une demande en toute confidentialité, envoyez un courriel directement à votre recruteur ou à l’adresse recrutement@bell.ca afin qu’il soit possible de prendre les dispositions nécessaires. Si vous avez des questions au sujet des mesures d’accessibilité aux emplois chez Bell, écrivez à notre équipe Diversité et inclusion à l’adresse inclusion@bell.ca.

industries: Biotechnology Research and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
About AbbVie


AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Joining AbbVie means, you will be part of a team of outstanding professionals dedicated to making a remarkable impact on patients' lives. At AbbVie, we conduct ground-breaking science on a global scale every day. AbbVie Canada is one of the Best Workplaces in Canada whereby 92% of our employees are proud to say they work for AbbVie.

When choosing your career path, choose to be remarkable.

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health, and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio.

We have an opportunity for a Data Engineer Specialist to join our Business Technology Solutions (BTS) team, responsible for integrating AbbVie's data in a modern, scalable, cloud-based environment (Foundry).

The Data Engineer participates in the acquisition, cataloguing, and harmonization of information aligned with the needs of business stakeholders and supports data consumers in understanding information context, generating fit for purpose datasets, and effectively utilizing advance analytic tools. In this role, you will be working primarily with the data analysts from functional disciplines and the local (BTS) Data and Analytics team (business analyst, business intelligence developer). The selected candidate will collaborate closely with the Winning with Data team for implementing strategic initiatives that drive business value. This position is based in Montreal (Saint-Laurent) and reports to the Lead of Data and Analytics within BTS.

Key responsibilities



Design, build, test and maintain data ecosystems to support Analytics capabilities across AbbVie's business functions.

Demonstrate high proficiency across a wide range of technologies and platforms related to software design and development, programming languages, data integration, data warehousing, data analysis and visualization tools, data storage, network connectivity, and virtualization/cloud environments.

Running enterprise class information management solutions across a variety of technologies (e.g., big data, data profiling, batch processing, and data indexing technologies).

Build data pipelines in Palantir Foundry using programming frameworks/languages like SQL, Apache Spark, Python (preparing, mapping, joining and stitching ingested datasets).

Ingest external vendor data into Palantir Foundry platform using a secure file transfer protocol (SFTP) server.

Define and enforce data quality management standards by implementing health and content checks.

Ensure appropriate security and compliance policies are followed for information access and dissemination.

Define and apply information quality and consistency throughout the data processing lifecycle.

Collaborate with information providers to ensure quality data updates are processed in a timely fashion.

Enforce and expand use of AbbVie's Common Data Model and industry standard information descriptions (ontologies, taxonomies, vocabularies, lexicons, dictionaries, thesaurus, glossaries, etc.).

Build a strong data governance framework by working with global and affiliate stakeholders.

Create a learning environment, open to suggestions and experimentation for improvement.

Embrace the ideas of others, nurtures innovation and transform it into reality.




Qualifications


Education / Experience required



Bachelor or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or in a related field is required.

Previous experience in a similar role (minimum of seven years). Data processing exposure in roles such as database developer/administrator, extract, transform, and load (ETL) developer, data architect and/or business Intelligence developer. Comprehensive business understanding of the technology strategic role.

End-to-end role with data, including data modelling, querying, aggregation, analysis, and visualization (minimum of seven years).

Ability to gather requirements and develop and prepare use cases, functional specifications, mapping documents for data integration and technical requirements for data warehouse/data lake applications.

Demonstrated history of successful execution in a fast-paced environment and in managing multiple priorities effectively.




Essential Skills And Abilities
 

Must be at ease with technology (use of various tools/systems to perform day-to-day tasks).


Strong understanding of distributed data processing frameworks like Hadoop/Spark Expertise and knowledge in programming languages like Python, Java, SQL to build data pipelines (minimum of five years).

Preferred technical skills: Snowflake, Teradata SQL, SQL Assistant, Oracle SQL Developer, IBM SPSS Modeler, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Access, SAS, Relational Databases.

Experience with Veeva, Reltio, SAP and/or Palantir Foundry is a plus.

Affinity to either performance optimizing, user experience design, automated testing and/or data science is considered an asset.


Skilled with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc.).

French and Advanced English language proficiency (oral and written).



Key leadership competencies



Operate and communicate effectively in a matrix environment.

Facilitate internal information sharing.

Prepare and deliver effective storyline presentations.

Demonstrate strategic understanding and focus in verbal and written communication.

Use strong analytical skills to solve business problems and think independently.

Quick learner and ability to multitask effectively.

Actively listen to internal stakeholders to understand their business needs, challenges and views to translate these into appropriate market research goals.

Work collaboratively with team members.

Prioritize decisions and activities to ensure efficient use of resources and address critical issues impacting the business.

Keen attention to detail.



AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply.


Covid vaccination new hires amendments:


Full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment for this position, with possible accommodation for validated exemptions, within the limits of applicable legislation. AbbVie employees are also required to comply with any COVID-19 related external requirements, including any testing requirements, applicable to their work activities outside AbbVie premises (for example, travelling and visiting stakeholders and customers).


Travel


No


Job Type


Experienced


Schedule


Full-time


Job Level Code


IC


Equal Employment Opportunity


At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients. As an equal opportunity employer we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic.

job_title: Digital Business Automation Group - Software Developer
industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
529716BR


Introduction


Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.


Your Role and Responsibilities


IBM Robotic Process Automation is a growing part of IBM Automation, following the acquisition of WDG Automation in summer 2020.

Robotic Process Automation (RPA) allows users to record and run automated smart robots that interact with their desktop. These robots are orchestrated and managed by the RPA server, which also provides monitoring and dashboarding capabilities.

The product is available both as SaaS and on-premises, and in 2Q 2021 the team brought the product to Red Hat OpenShift and created the RPA operator.


We Are Looking For Candidates With Particular Interest And Experience In One Of The Following Areas


As part of the IBM RPA development team you will work to improve the product as part of a motivated and skilled team.



OpenShift operator development (Golang)

CI/CD (Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, GitHub Enterprise)

Server-side development (C#, ASP.NET Core)

Frontend web development (React, Carbon X)




Successful Candidates Will Have




Passion for developing high quality software and “doing it right the first time”

Experience working in an agile geographically distributed team

The ability to absorb new technologies quickly and rapidly

Desire to work in a fast-paced team on a new and growing product

Belief in the value of automated testing

The success of our customers as their North Star




Required Technical and Professional Expertise




At least 2 years experience with .NET and C#

At least 2 years experience with Windows technology such as WPF, WCF, MSMQ, etc

Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)

Level of professionalism when working collaboratively across functional areas

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering or related field




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




At least 2 years experience with JavaScript

At least 2 years experience with Java

At least 2 years experience with HTML5

At least 2 years experienced with CSS / LESS

At least 2 years experience with REST / Swagger

At least 2 years experience with REST API development

At least 2 years experience with Database/SQL

At least 2 years experience with Lucene and Elasticsearch indexing



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

job_title: Développeur intelligence d'affaires et Big data / Business Intelligence and Big Data Developer
industries: Airlines and Aviation
description:
Qui sommes-nous? : 


Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un cœur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.





Description de la fonction: 


Le développeur d’intelligence d’affaires et Big Data travaillera avec l'équipe analytique et gestion des données de l'organisation Logistique Globale & Planification d'activité intégrée. Le candidat sera responsable du développement, de la maintenance et l’assistance aux outils d'analyse de données (bases de données SQL Server et procédures stockées, rapports Power BI, algorithmes d'apprentissage machine, etc.) pour soutenir les processus de logistique d'entreprise. Le candidat travaillera avec l’analyste en intelligence d’affaires et de la chaîne d'approvisionnement pour remodeler les outils existants et créer la nouvelle génération d'outils d'analyse numérique dans SQL Server, Big Data Hadoop et Cloud (Azure et AWS). De plus, le candidat doit collaborer avec les différentes équipes de l'organisation de technologies numériques pour assurer la qualité des données et la viabilité des ETL dans les systèmes d’entrepôts de données de l'organisation Logistique Globale & Planification d'activité intégrée. (SQL Server DataMart et Hadoop DataLake).





Énoncés de responsabilité: 



Automatisation de la transformation et intégration de données

Faire la conception, programmation, contrôle et documentation des ETLs, base de données, rapports, OLAP et outils analytiques

Développer des requêtes complexes SQL dans l’environnement SQL Server, HIVE et SPark

Effectuer de la programmation Python avancée

Produire une programmation de haute qualité qui est durable et bien documentée

Travailler en collaboration avec l’analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement et d’intelligence d’affaires afin de mettre en place des outils analytiques et Big Data

Exécution et documentation des tests d’approbation d’utilisateur

Créer et maintenir la documentation du design conceptuel et le code généré

Travailler avec différentes équipes technologies numériques afin d’assurer l’intégrité des données

Assister le développement et la maintenance de rapport Power BI

Fournir une assistance technique à l’analyste Intelligence d’Affaires et Chaîne d’Approvisionnement






Qualifications requises: 



Baccalauréat avec 3 ans d’expérience dans un rôle similaire.

Certificat en intelligence d’affaires et Big Data (atout majeur)

Forte expérience dans la conception et l’utilisation d’outils Microsoft Business Intelligence (T-SQL, SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI), Big Data (HDFS, Hive, Spark, SQOOP, etc.) et Cloud (Azure et AWS)

Expérience avec SAP et données de chaîne approvisionnement (atout majeur)

Forte communication et auto-motivation pour travailler avec des données complexes de chaine approvisionnement;

Solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes

Compétences en gestion de projet (approche agile)

English version 






Who we are:


At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed – and will continue to transform – the world. That’s why we work with an explorer’s heart and a perfectionist’s grit to design, build, and service the world’s most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.





Function Description: 


The Business Intelligence and Big Data developer will work with the Analytics & Data Management team in Global Logistics and Integrated Business Planning organization. The candidate will be responsible to develop, maintain and sustain data analytics tools (SQL Server databases and stored procedures, Power BI reports, Machine Learning algorithms, etc.) to support Enterprise Logistics processes. The candidate will work with the Supply Chain Analytics Scientist to revamp the existing tools and to build the new generation of the digital analytics tools in SQL Server, Big Data Hadoop and Cloud (Azure and AWS). Also, the candidate has to collaborate with the different teams in the Digital Technology organization to ensure the data quality and sustainability of the ETLs in the Global Logistics Data Warehouse systems (SQL Server DataMart and Hadoop DataLake).





Responsibility Statements: 



Automate data integration and transformation

Design, code, test and document ETLs, databases, reports, OLAP and analytics tools

Develop complex SQL queries in SQL Server, Hive and Spark

Perform advanced Python programming

Deliver high quality codes that are maintainable and well documented

Work with the Supply Chain Analytics Scientist to deploy the new Analytics and Big Data tools

Conduct and document User Acceptance Tests

Create and maintain the documentation of the logical design and codes produced

Work with the different IT teams to ensure data quality

Support the development and maintenance of Power BI reports

Provide technical assistance to the Global Logistics Business Intelligence analysts






Qualifications required:



Bachelor’s degree with over 3 years' experience in a similar role

Certification in Business Intelligence and Big Data (strong asset)

Strong experience with design and use of Microsoft Business Intelligence tools (T-SQL, SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, Power BI), Big Data (HDFS, Hive, Spark, SQOOP, etc.) and Cloud (Azure and AWS)

Experience with SAP and Supply Chain data (strong asset)

Strong communication and self-motivation to work with complex supply chain data

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Project Management skills (agile approach)

Bilingual, must be fluent in English (oral and written)


Field of studies:
 Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering,






What we offer:



Long-term deferred compensation programs

Daycare for young children

Advancement programs to enhance education skills

Flexible work schedules

Leadership and training programs

Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans

Financial support for parental leave

Reward programs for outstanding work






Diversity and inclusion: 


The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

description:
Req Id: 355715

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.

If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.



About Us



The Customer Operations Data Science group provides critical insights using analytics, ensures cross-functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps internal clients drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward.

The Customer Operations Data Science team provides insightful perspective and direction on operational strategy and performance of Bell’s award winning Customer Experience business unit. The team focuses on cutting-edge end-to-end business intelligence solutions that support information creation and delivery within business lines and to senior executive across Bell’s business units.

Team members are experts in business strategy and operations, analytical and strategic, yet highly pragmatic and results-oriented. As an Analyst in Customer Operations Data Science, you will work on projects that take on some of the most cutting-edge business solutions in the Telecommunications industry. Reporting to the Senior Manager - Advanced Analytics, your knowledge of strategy and operations combined with your communication skills and analytical rigour will shape the way that we do business.



What We Need From You




You must care! Care about your work. Care about your clients. Care about your colleagues.

Passion and enthusiasm for analyzing large datasets and making actionable decisions.

Ability to break down the most complex problems into smaller actionable pieces.

Ability to work with and make appropriate decisions with incomplete datasets.

Help the business “connect the dots” and understand “the big picture” - and to never loose sight of this.

Interest in using data and technologies to help solve business problems.




What We Would Like From You




An undergraduate degree in business/commerce, engineering, mathematics or other quantitative fields. Nevertheless, if you have an English degree and are interested, then please apply.

2-4 years of SQL experience using enterprise production level data.

Experience with SQL (Teradata), SAS and visualization software (MicroStrategy/Tableau).

Experience in telecommunications, retail or consulting industries.

Experience creating BI reports/dashboards and conducting deep-dive data analysis.

Effective process/project management skills and the ability to navigate and influence stakeholders.

Excellent communication skills with the ability to comfortably interact with partners and executive management.

Experience with business and marketing analysis.


#talent

#tech

#indeed

Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Management
Job Status: 
Regular - Full Time
Job Location: 
Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Ontario : Mississauga
Flexible work profile: 
Mobile

03/18/2022

description:
Role Overview



We are looking for someone to join our McAfee team who is passionate about problem solving of both simple to complex solutions. this person should share our passion for mauling internet access-restriction, digital privacy, and giant digital bear humor.

You will be responsible for managing and expanding data pipelines, writing code in Python, making SQL queries, and working with other teams. This role will offer exposure to optimizing the software that runs on a network of VPN servers distributed in 45+ countries. This position reports directly to the Engineering Manager.

This is a remote position in Canada. We will only consider candidates currently in Canada and are not offering relocation assistance at this time.



About The Role




Write concise, well-tested code in Python, and occasionally in Scala and other languages.

Manage data-pipelines: monitoring and expanding Airflow, fixing pipe errors, managing AWS infrastructure (SQS, Lambda, S3, DynamoDB, Redshift).

Create new and expanding on data pipelines to collect more analytics.

Ensure the privacy and security of our user management services.

Work with our connection’s analytics and censorship circumvention teams to determine data warehousing requirements and specifications.

Work as part of our data team to store and handle immense amounts of user data while respecting the privacy of our users.

Manage our Amazon Redshift database according to analytics needs.

Create and enhance our Periscope dashboards




About You




You are very comfortable working the terminal, with Linux or MacOS.

2+ years’ experience in Python (or similar)

2+ years’ experience working with data engineering technology

You have a strong knowledge of which tools to use and why

Experience with Apache Airflow and Amazon Lambda, DynamoDB, and Redshift.

Demonstrative experience using SQL, and star schemas/dimensional database design.

You take ownership and pride over your projects.

You have strong verbal and written communication skills and can tailor communications base on the audience. (business vs. technical)

Knowledgeable with anti-censorship technologies

Experience creating dashboards for data visualization




Company Overview



McAfee is a leader in personal security for consumers. Focused on protecting people, not just devices, McAfee consumer solutions adapt to users’ needs in an always online world, empowering them to live securely through integrated, intuitive solutions that protects their families and communities with the right security at the right moment.



Company Benefits And Perks



We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.


Pension and Retirement Plans

Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage

Paid Time Off

Paid Parental Leave

Support for Community Involvement


We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.
