description:
ACT TODAY. INSPIRE TOMORROW.
 




FigBytes attracts passionate change-makers who are seeking the chance to build a better future and a healthier planet. For this team, personal and professional values are the same – which is why our integrated ESG platform supports organizations around the world with their sustainability goals, connecting data with purpose. 




With FigBytes, you will: 





Experience our energy.
 




Whether it’s through virtual parties, committee gatherings, group chats, happy hours, or yearly in-person retreats, everyone here bonds over cultivating change and cohesion within the business and beyond. You will immediately feel like part of the team when you join FigBytes. United by our common sense of purpose, you will feel a positive energy as our team thrives and grows together. 





Plant new seeds. 
 




No two days are the same at this fast-growing company, which means you’ll have the flexibility to pursue new skills and experiences. Plus, we offer frequent Lunch + Learns, mentoring/buddy programs, and specialized Teams channels to nurture your curious side. 





Choose your future. 
 




At FigBytes, everyone gets the opportunity to design the company's future and work how they work best. That means you will own your role from top to bottom – we won't force you to adhere to a set schedule, dress code, office setup, or specific workflow. If you see an opportunity to change things for the better, we’re all ears! 





Perks
 





Flexible schedule 

Employee stock options/equity plans 

Work from home 






What You’ll Do 
 




As a business analyst on the product team, you are the connective tissue between our product management and software engineering teams. You will operate in an agile environment, to keep our velocity high while ensuring customer needs are met. You will be a valuable member of the team and a product champion. You are an expert at engaging the rest of the team to solve problems and achieve desired outcomes. 





Responsibilities: 
 





Clarifying business ideas and needs. 

Perform technology needs, research, and analysis. 

Analyze new requirements and translate those into functional specifications for the product developers.

Validate requirements with stakeholders and the project team. 

Assist in defining tasks and features for the development team to fulfill requirements and bug fixes. 

Assist the team in developing and scoping backlog items and tasks for sprints. 

Review the acceptance tests associated with the acceptance criteria.

Evolve the details of user stories through conversations with the developers.

Act as a customer proxy for the development team during the development cycle.

Contribute to standardizing the requirements and documentation process. 






Requirements: 






2+ years experience writing detailed functional business requirements, preferably for enterprise B2B software. 

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Computer/Software), Engineering (Electrical/Electronic), Computer Science/Information Technology, or equivalent. 

Agility and comfort with changing requirements and frequent customer feedback. 

Strong organizational skills, autonomous, self-motivated, curious and open-minded. 

Experience following agile principles using Scrum or other agile frameworks. 

Experience with illustrating ideas using wireframes, storyboards, and process flows. 

Practical experience working in an agile development environment. 

Experience with cloud-based technologies such as Microsoft Azure, AWS. 

Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to develop and foster business relationships. 

Good written communication skills. 






Added Bonuses:
 





Experience in or knowledge of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) as it relates to operating companies and financial institutions. 

Experience in working with distributed remote teams.

description:
We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing People Analytics team. The People Analytics team’s mission is to use data to help business leaders make smart decisions about people. People data underlies decisions related to hiring, promotions, compensation, engagement, development, attrition, benefits, diversity, and other HR business domains. In partnership with People Ops, you'll work on the design and implementation of our People Data platform that supports key People Analytics initiatives. If you have strong software, analytical and data modeling skills and share a passion for building robust and high-performing data infrastructure, we’d love to talk to you.



Qualifications




3+ years of experience in data engineering and/or business intelligence

Thorough understanding of modern data warehouse architecture

Hands-on experience designing and building data pipelines

Experience with managing Google Cloud Platform resources

Strong analytical skills, proficiency with BI tools like Google Data Studio




Responsibilities




Build a robust and high-performing People Data infrastructure on Google Cloud Platform

Design and build datasets to meet the needs of business critical applications and analyses

Establish and maintain rigorous data quality standards in our data pipelines and analytical datasets, deploy automated data pipeline management and quality monitoring

Help drive process improvement by implementing best practices in data management and governance




Benefits




Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options

Unlimited PTO

100% remote work, WeWork All Access Pass OR Work-from-home stipend

Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business

Open communication with management and company leadership

Small, dynamic teams = massive impact

100% employer-paid telemedicine, medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans

Access to a Retirement Savings Plan




More About Hopper



Despite the pandemic’s impact on the travel industry, Hopper has emerged stronger than ever. As the travel industry continues to rebound, Hopper has demonstrated significant outperformance with its category-leading mobile-only marketplace, delivering value to customers and supply partners with the company’s proprietary suite of fintech offerings.

Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company’s recent growth:


 Hopper’s valuation is now over $ 5B . The company’s valuation has more thantripled since early 2020.

 The company grew its revenue by more than 300% YoY in 2021. Hopper’s monthly revenues are now 375% higher than its pre-pandemic high point and Hopper Cloud, Hopper’s new B2B initiative, is already 15% of its revenues and growing.

 According to Apptopia, Hopper was the #1 most downloaded OTA in the US in 2021. The app has over 70 million downloads.

 Hopper’s recovery is faster than the market and its share of the air travel market in North America is now 300% higher than prior to the pandemic, according to MIDT.

 The company sells over $2B in travel and travel related financial services annually

 Hopper’s fintech offerings, such as Price Freeze and Rebooking Guarantee, now represent over 70% of its air revenue.

 Given the success of its travel fintech, Hopper recently launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud, where any travel provider can unlock a totally unique revenue stream by seamlessly integrating and offering Hopper’s travel content and fintech products. Hopper Cloud partners include Capital One, Kayak, Marriott, Amadeus, Trip.com , and MakeMyTrip.

 The industry opportunity for Hopper Cloud is enormous as projections estimate that if all travel distribution channels offered travel fintech, it could increase the total consumer spend for the sector by $200 billion annually.


All this recent growth is just the beginning. There are still so many new opportunities we’re excited to tackle in the next year!

Must-haves 
- 4+ years of experience writing C programming on embedded firmware
- Strong knowledge of Real Time Operating Systems – RTOS, including threads, scheduling, synchronization, and memory management
- Understanding of PCB Schematics and product lifecycle
- Experience with state machine design and implementation
- Experience debugging load level boards
- Strong Python skills for writing automated python tests

Plusses 
- Experience with TI C2000 processor family
- TDD
- Experience with control and monitoring systems

Day-to-Day 
Insight Global is looking for a Firmware Design Engineer to support out client in the solar energy space.  We are looking for someone that can jump right in to support the team and their new project initiative to create next generation products like power converters.  Responsibilities include:
-	Write in C for new features and the fixing of issues for embedded applications
-	Write and maintain tools in Python 3.7 to support firmware development (e.g. Pytest, code generation, SQL queries, Excel reports)
-	Perform manual and automated bench testing during development 
-	Research inverter features and technical requirements including regional grid code compliance
-	Write test plans, unit tests, and integration tests

industries: Marketing Services
description:
Position Summary


As the global performance marketing agency of Mediabrands, we are obsessed with building and accelerating Customer Flow, the continuous movement of customers along the path to purchase journey. We do this by unifying our digital craft experts which include search, social media, SEO, eCommerce, content creation and strategy under a single operating system with a consultancy lens.

 

Our expert team of specialists deliver integrated initiatives that help the world’s leading brands connect to the people who drive their business forward – efficiently and effectively. Reprise is headquartered in New York with over 60 offices around the world.

 

We are currently recruiting for the position of
 eCommerce Reporting Specialist
 to support the Reprise Commerce team, a specialty unit within Mediabrands Canada designed to support brands across their end-to-end eCommerce needs. 

 

Reporting into the Director of eRetail, the 
eCommerce Reporting Specialist
 is responsible for providing customized reporting and insights for an assigned top tier client, including managing and executing content best practices to accelerate the brand’s digital shelf presence online across key eRetailers in Canada. The role will also be responsible for supporting stakeholders including directors and business managers, by providing insightful data analytics to help guide strategic client recommendations that will optimize their key eCommerce initiatives.

 


Key Responsibilities


You will be the main agency lead working cross-functionally with an assigned client and their stakeholders to help deliver on digital shelf content key performance indicators (KPIs) including:


Prepare, analyze and communicate reports to the assigned client’s cross-functional teams regarding status and results of their eCommerce visibility and conversion metrics across multiple eRetailers, in adherence to defined global digital shelf standards.

Establish rapport and communicate directly with eRetailers to address outstanding content gaps and verify asset execution on behalf of the client.

Collaborate with the Reprise Director eRetail in reporting KPI trends, provide education and identify opportunities to further impact and improve upon online merchandising strategy and workflow


Additional Responsibilities: 


Develop and implement eRetail customized audits to identify areas of opportunity for clients within the full spectrum of eCommerce: Demand Forecasting, Sales & Retail Performance, Operations & Supply Chain, Content & Experience.

Must be comfortable leveraging multiple sources of data to analyze the state of clients’ businesses across various dimensions. Provide reporting and PowerPoint decks that synthesizes data into clear, concise insights and recommendations for senior leadership and relevant teams.

Act as support for specific reporting related to Performance Marketing and its correlation with eRetail Performance, when applicable.






Desired Skills & Experience



Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite; advanced reporting & analytical skills with Microsoft Excel.

Highly developed organizational skills with strong attention to detail and a passion for data analysis.

Proficient knowledge of utilizing automated business analytics and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Google Studio preferred 

1+ year(s) experience as an Analyst for an eRetail company or consultant agency preferred

Experience with Amazon Vendor Central or other eRetailer content management tools preferred 

Excellent communication (both written and verbal) with strong presentation skills

Agile approach to working independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams

Ability to work well under pressure, be flexible and multi-task in a fast-paced environment

eCommerce is a fast-growing industry and ever evolving – we want you to grow with it! You should possess a strong passion for curiosity, with an eagerness to learn and continuously develop.

University or College degree with a concentration in Economics, Marketing, Finance, Business Administration, Commerce or Mathematics preferred.






About Reprise


Global Leader in Performance Marketing.

We are the world’s largest performance marketing network, with over 3,000 experts across 68 offices in 48 markets. We offer a complete suite of digital crafts designed to deliver customer-centric performance marketing via services including, but not limited to, Strategy, SEO, Paid Search, Social, eCommerce and Content. Part of the Mediabrands division of the Interpublic Group, Reprise is headquartered in New York. To learn more about how we can empower your business, visit www.reprisedigital.com now.

industries: Banking, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com
 


Department Overview


What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise. 

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before. 
 


Job Description


Ready to be TD's top business intelligence specialist and to champion a significant and diverse set of business activities including the design, development and implementation of all things reporting? We're looking for someone to package and provide leadership, tactical and technical direction as well as ongoing collaboration to identify data elements within TD, establish business needs and implement reporting solutions to address them.

This may include complex reports, dashboards, scorecards and more – because as data begins to play a larger and more complex role across our organization, we'll look to you to support an array of business needs via reporting. 


As a Business Intelligence Specialist, you will: 



Initiate and provide leadership, tactical/technical direction and planning input for all business relevant information

Collaborate with business leads to elicit information requirements and articulate those requirements in a manner that can be easily understood by Business Intelligence Specialists

Collaborate with data owners to identify data elements to address reporting requirements and with various partners for metric definition activities

Streamline and improve existing reporting to eliminate errors and redundancies

Identify business drivers, definitions and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide significant direction

Own the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, portfolio growth, profitability, etc.) 

Elicit business requirements for reporting projects

Supply data analysis identifying operational and/or product trends

Craft and provide complex BI reporting, analysis and assessments at the function or enterprise level. 

Build and/or deliver presentations communications to management or broader audience

Adhere to internal policies /procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines

Conduct the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities to improve operation efficiencies

Provide ongoing project status communication and knowledge transfer within team and across businesses 

Manage the development and/or/implementation of standards, policies, procedures, and solutions that mitigate risk and optimize availability of service, efficiency and effectiveness



 


Job Requirements



What can you bring to TD? 
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes: 


Undergraduate degree or technical certificate

Seven (7) or more years relevant experience



 


Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve.  If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

industries: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Manufacturing
description:
Purpose



The Category Insights, Analyst role will enable the BUs and support our selling teams/customers insights team to develop category visions, selling stories, and deliver key strategic projects in service of increasing share of shelf and distribution share.



Accountabilities



Deliver insights driven growth strategies for retailers:


Lead Category Growth stories for priority businesses in collaboration with the Business Units and in support of Sales.

Advise Customer Insights and sales to win influence with external delivery of the Category Growth Stories for priority businesses.


Enable organization to drive category strategies:


Provide Category analytics to enable LRP strategies and identify category growth opportunities for priority businesses.

Enable team to understand delists risks, determine corporate disco’s, and SKU distribution opportunities based on performance and distribution trends by delivering tools & training.

Contribute to development of NPI go to market strategy with BU (distribution, assortment, shelving) for priority businesses.


Drive increased engagement with US category insights counterparts to support continued integration with NAR:


Evaluate capabilities and processes for Canada that serve as an enhancement to current tools and processes that will increase agility for Canada with a goal to bring one new capability/process/enhancement to Canada each year.


Own the optimization of category analytics and tools:


Support the GBS team in the ownership of Nielsen database structure and ongoing database maintenance to uphold data integrity (i.e. NIA, unspecifieds).

Lead the development of reporting tools to simplify opportunity identification, as well as distribution risk (i.e. The DOT, Performance dashboards).




REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS



Reports to the Category Insights, Manager.

Partners and collaborates with: BU, Sales, Aisle Development Team, Customer Insights




Qualifications




Bachelor Degree, preferably in Business

2+ years’ experience in Sales and/or Insights

Experience with Nielsen and Customer data sources preferred

Direct Account and Retail sales experience an asset



KEY COMPETENCIES



Problem Solving & Analytic skills

Strategic Business Planning skills

Integrity and drive to always do the right thing for the category

Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and retailers


General Mills is committed to Employment Equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with disabilities taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.



Company Overview



We exist to make food the world loves. But we do more than that. Our company is a place that prioritizes being a force for good, a place to expand learning, explore new perspectives and reimagine new possibilities, every day. We look for people who want to bring their best — bold thinkers with big hearts who challenge one other and grow together. Because becoming the undisputed leader in food means surrounding ourselves with people who are hungry for what’s next.

Salut ! Nous sommes Playmind, un studio créatif spécialisé dans les jeux vidéos et les expériences numériques



Nous avons présentement des ouvertures pour des postes TEMPS-PLEIN PERMANENT en programmation pour des développeurs Gameplay Unreal de niveau intermédiaire ou senior.



Voilà ta chance de faire partie du core-team d'un projet multiplayer au sein d'une entreprise en pleine expansion! Viens mettre ton plein potentiel à l'œuvre et développe plusieurs aspects du projet au sein d'un studio où les journées passent super vite!



RESPONSABILITÉS:




Faire un jeu tout en ayant du fun;



Être fier de son travail;



Participer aux nombreux playtests en gang lorsqu'on test nos nouvelles features;



Implémenter et peaufiner les éléments de gameplay (mouvements personnages, ingrédients gameplay, structure, features, et un slider de fun-factor qui monte jusqu'à 11)



Supporter les autres membres de l'équipe dans l'intégration du visuel, animations, effets spéciaux, sons.



Analyser et comprendre les besoins de programmation de l'équipe et analyser leur faisabilité technique



Suggérer des innovations aux problématiques rencontrés lors du développement du projet;



Assurer le bon fonctionnement du multiplayer avec notre engin externe



Collaborer avec les autres métiers pour développer les outils nécessaires pour leur permettre de faire des ajustements aux systèmes de façon efficace;



Participer aux code reviews;



Former, au besoin, les autres programmeurs du projet pour qu'ils soient en mesure d'utiliser correctement les fonctionnalités de Unreal ou celles développées à l'interne.



Gérer le management des données et des serveurs via des outils externes.




EXPÉRIENCE:




Minimum de 2 ans d'expérience dans l'industrie du jeu vidéo en tant que programmeur Unreal ou équivalent



Baccalauréat en informatique (ou équivalent)



Forte connaissance en c++



Forte connaissance de Unreal Engine 4



Expérience sur un jeu multijoueur est un plus




C'EST ENCORE MIEUX SI...




Tu tripes sur les jeux vidéo



Tu as une attitude positive et entraînante



Tu as de l'expérience de jeu multijoueur (un plus)



Tu as de l'expérience sur console (un plus)



Tu as déjà chipé un jeu ou plus...




AVANTAGES :




Salaire compétitif



Possibilité de mettre ses multiples talents et connaissances en oeuvre;



Travailler sur tout, plutôt que sur un petit aspect du jeu;



Grandes possibilités d’avancement au sein du studio en pleine évolution;



Projets novateurs et engageants;



Assurances collectives;



Événements 5 à 7 jeux vidéos, bières occasionnelles, Game Jams, etc.



On a hâte de te rencontrer.




Étant un petit studio, les postulants idéaux seront enthousiastes à l’idée de participer au développement d’une entreprise innovatrice où chaque voix et chaque talent sont reconnus.



N’hésitez pas à nous envoyer votre CV accompagné d’une lettre de présentation !

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
ACT TODAY. INSPIRE TOMORROW.
 




FigBytes attracts passionate change-makers who are seeking the chance to build a better future and a healthier planet. For this team, personal and professional values are the same – which is why our integrated ESG platform supports organizations around the world with their sustainability goals, connecting data with purpose. 




With FigBytes, you will: 





Experience our energy.
 




Whether it’s through virtual parties, committee gatherings, group chats, happy hours, or yearly in-person retreats, everyone here bonds over cultivating change and cohesion within the business and beyond. You will immediately feel like part of the team when you join FigBytes. United by our common sense of purpose, you will feel a positive energy as our team thrives and grows together. 





Plant new seeds. 
 




No two days are the same at this fast-growing company, which means you’ll have the flexibility to pursue new skills and experiences. Plus, we offer frequent Lunch + Learns, mentoring/buddy programs, and specialized Teams channels to nurture your curious side. 





Choose your future. 
 




At FigBytes, everyone gets the opportunity to design the company's future and work how they work best. That means you will own your role from top to bottom – we won't force you to adhere to a set schedule, dress code, office setup, or specific workflow. If you see an opportunity to change things for the better, we’re all ears! 





Perks
 





Flexible schedule 

Employee stock options/equity plans 

Work from home 






What You’ll Do 





As a senior business analyst on the product team, you are the connective tissue between our product management and software engineering teams. You will operate in an agile environment, to keep our velocity high while ensuring customer needs are met. You will be a valuable member of the team and a product champion. You are an expert at engaging the rest of the team to solve problems and achieve desired outcomes. 





Responsibilities: 
 





Clarifying business ideas and needs. 

Perform technology needs, research, and analysis. 

Analyze new requirements and translate those into functional specifications for the product developers.

Validate requirements with stakeholders and the project team. 

Assist in defining tasks and features for the development team to fulfill requirements and bug fixes. 

Assist the team in developing and scoping backlog items and tasks for sprints. 

Review the acceptance tests associated with the acceptance criteria.

Evolve the details of user stories through conversations with the developers.

Act as a customer proxy for the development team during the development cycle.

Contribute to standardizing the requirements and documentation process. 

Assist with onboarding new members to the product team. 

Mentor less senior Business Analysts. 






Requirements: 






5+ years experience writing detailed functional business requirements, preferably for enterprise B2B software. 

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Computer/Software), Engineering (Electrical/Electronic), Computer Science/Information Technology, or equivalent. 

Agility and comfort with changing requirements and frequent customer feedback. 

Strong organizational skills, autonomous, self-motivated, curious, and open-minded. 

Experience following agile principles using Scrum or other agile frameworks. 

Experience with illustrating ideas using wireframes, storyboards, and process flows. 

Practical experience working in an agile development environment. 

Experience with cloud-based technologies such as Microsoft Azure, AWS. 

Strong interpersonal skills and proven ability to develop and foster business relationships. 

Exceptional communication skills with proven ability to relate with both technical and business professionals.

Strong written communication skills. 






Added Bonuses: 






Experience in or knowledge of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) as it relates to operating companies and financial institutions. 

Some people management experience: this is an individual contributor role with the potential to move into a management position over time if desired. 

Experience in working with distributed remote teams.

job_title: Sr Associate Software Application Engineer - Student Systems
industries: Software Development
description:
Do What You Love. Love What You Do.


At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.


About The Team


Join our Student Product team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.


About The Role



About the Role


Do you want to transform the student experience? We’re looking for talented software engineers to design and build Workday's newest SaaS offering - Workday Student. You will join a dynamic team of developers that is reimagining the student experience including everything from registering for classes to financial aid. Starting with a clean sheet of paper, we are transforming the way that colleges enable their students for success. Our solutions are built using the most modern technologies, providing an unparalleled level of agility, ease-of-use, and integration capability - all in the cloud.


About The Team


Workday Student is expanding its team to Vancouver, BC! This is an amazing leadership opportunity to recruit and build a team from the ground up. The team will be focused on accelerating the delivery of new features in an agile environment for our Workday Student product. This is a highly visible and crucial position that will involve working with development leadership and product management to impact delivery milestones for a core part of the Student application. In addition, there will be opportunities to work with Workday Student’s largest Canadian customers to ensure that we are meeting the needs of Canadian colleges and universities.


About You


Basic Qualifications


Must be a collaborative team player with good communication skills.

BS+5 or MS+3 years of experience with UML, Web application development or SaaS (Software as a Service) technologies

OO design and Java development experience




Other Qualifications



Experience with XML and Integration technologies is a plus.

Metadata-driven definitional development experience is a plus.

Experience designing/developing business applications – functional knowledge of Student Information Systems is a plus.

Knowledge of Test Driven Development practices

4 year degree in a computer related field or equivalent in-progress




About The Product


Workday is the only software for higher education designed to stay current with your institution’s changing needs. Click here to learn more!

This video provides an overview of Workday Student, which allows students, faculty members, and staff to perform tasks on any device, anytime, and anywhere. With Workday Student, institutions can provide endless engagement and in-the-moment notifications to ensure informed academic decisions


About Workday Vancouver:


Workday Vancouver is located in the heart of the downtown financial district and is walking distance to public transportation, residences, Coal Harbour and more! The location is home to many of Workday's new up and coming development and emerging technology teams. This means you will have the opportunity to not only be part of the Workday Student team, but also collaborate and interact with some of Workday's outstanding innovation teams. Workday has recently been named as one of the Great Places to work in Canada and the culture in this office extends through to the core values of the company, encouraging a fun and diverse environment. Come be part of this dynamic and growing organization!


Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!

industries: Accounting
description:
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

RBC Capital Market Technology's Data Content team is looking for a highly skilled analyst to join the team. The analyst will be part of a team of Business Analysts and Data modelers with a focus on: documenting data requirements, identifying data requirements gaps, supporting the datasets registration, ingestion and consumption processes, standardizing data within the Capital Market domain (includes but not limited to Trades/Orders/RFQ's, Calculated Results such as Risk and Profit and loss reporting) and other structured & unstructured datasets used for analytics. He/She will be required to engage with senior Data Architects, IT System Owners, Business Analysts, Data Stewards, Data Owners to drive the standardization effort across different Lines of Business (LOB's) and functions (Front Office, Operations, Market Risk & Finance etc.)

WHAT WILL YOU DO?


 Participate on Intake forum for Data Fabric and DCM request, work with Business Analysts across different line of business and functions closely on the dataset registration for different project initiatives, ensure appropriate domain classification and provisioning point identifications, etc.

 Support the dataset ingestion, classification, registration and/ or consumption processes, working closely with DCM (Data Content and Modeling), Data Fabric teams, ETSS Data Fabric team in the SDLC process of the data content release

 Support data consumption strategy by creating queries/ views based on consumer requirements

 Perform the data discovery and research in data fabric platform to identify the data re-usability for new project initiatives

 Support the data registry migrations by providing the UAT testing to ensure the consistency of the data content catalog


WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?



Must Have




 Bachelor's degree or diploma in business, finance, accounting or engineering

 Data system analysts/data modelers /system analyst experience

 SQL

 Exposure to data analytics




Nice-to-have




 Cross Asset experience of Cash and Derivative Products (Rates, Credit, and Derivatives), Commodities, Equities etc.

 Good understanding of Trade Lifecycle (Pre, Post) and Front to Back functions (Operations, Product Control, Market Risk & Finance)

 Post graduate certification

 Data modeling experience

 Fmpl, Fix, reactj, json, java


What's in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

 A world-class training program in financial services

 Flexible work/life balance options

 Opportunities to do challenging work


RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Who is BGRS?


At BGRS, we move the people that move the world, enabling opportunities by connecting people and places.

We relocate people across the globe, supporting and guiding their journey by administering benefits on behalf of our clients. Synchronized with our clients for success, we transform mobility programs into a means of recruitment, development, and retention of talent. Our client partners include some of the largest global organizations, as well as mid-tier growth companies and government agencies. As a leading company in global talent mobility, we are committed to fostering an engaging, flexible, and inclusive environment that encourages growth and collaboration. We look forward to welcoming you to our team where you can experience what partnership and talent mobility can achieve.



Role Overview



The Business Systems Analyst provides analysis, development, maintenance and support services for core business systems for the Canadian Government Services division. These systems include content and document management for internal and external platforms, business operation systems including ServicEngine and iZone, websites, reporting and business intelligence dashboards leveraging tools such as MS Reports and Qlik. This role is responsible for the development and administration of additional tools, workflows and automation in support of the needs of the Division as well as the Division’s clients. This role requires a highly motivated self-starter that is able to design and deliver creative, technical and non-technical solutions to complex business problems, with the ability to work on multiple projects concurrently. The role requires someone who can work well in a team environment, is quality and results driven and can work with constraints to drive innovation.


In response to the COVID-19 pandemic all interviews are being conducted virtually.



If selected for an in-office position, you will work remotely while BGRS operates under mandatory telework.




What You'll Be Doing




 Content and Document Management 



 Coordinate with respective team members to discuss objectives and requirements, content organization and specific needs of the web properties. 

 Create, edit, publish and update content 

 Where applicable, coordinate translation, approvals and proofreading of copy, as well as timelines for both the posting and removal of content 

 Ensure all published content is brand compliant and meets the high standards of BGRS’s communication strategy 

 Recognize and recommend changes to content, design and functions of the web properties 

 Investigate errors and coordinate efforts to resolve issues 

 
 System Support and Maintenance 



 Maintain and enforce governance and usage policies for internal systems 

 Manage documents, web pages, division wide on-line announcements and communications 

 Assign access and permissions for users and groups 

 Conduct usage monitoring/analysis and prepare monthly reports for Management 

 Ensure all system issues are communicated to the appropriate IT resources 

 Provide intranet usage training to users as required 

 Action database report requests as required 

 
 Development and Analysis 



 Participates in business requirements sessions to understand the impact of change to systems and processes 

 Design and build solutions to specifications per approved business requirements in order to streamline processes and improve internal efficiency 

 Design and develop reports and dashboards that enable insights and business intelligence on Division business 

 
 Other 



 Perform other duties as requested/required in a changing work environment 




What You Bring To BGRS




 A post-secondary degree/diploma in a related field from a recognized college/university or equivalent experience 

 1-3 years of experience in development and programming in script languages such as JavaScript, HTML and CSS 

 Prior experience and working knowledge in Website Administration and agile development is an asset 

 Working knowledge of SharePoint (Designer, Workflow, Content Types, Templates) and MSSQL, QlikView Analytics and ServicEngine is an asset 

 Possess the ability to quickly learn new technical procedures and industry best practices 

 Strong interpersonal skills that clearly communicate technical concepts and ideas to a non-technical audience 

 Demonstrates excellent analytical and problem solving skills 

 Excellent written communication skills and documentation procedures 

 Able to prioritize, design, and deliver new initiatives efficiently and effectively 

 Provides a consultative approach when dealing with internal stakeholders about business problems and opportunities 

 Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and other modeling tools 

 Fluency in English (French is an asset) 

 You foster belonging and encourage authenticity. You are inclusive, value diversity, and recognize that these behaviors empower and inspire positive action and promote innovation. 




Other Information




 Reliability status security clearance granted by CIISD, PWGSC is required; the security clearance application will be facilitated via the BGRS Company Security Officer (CSO) 




What BGRS Offers




 Competitive salary and incentive plans 

 Workplace flexibility for a balanced work/life approach 

 Comprehensive benefits packages and wellness program 

 Generous company-paid vacation days and holiday time 

 Challenging, collaborative, diverse corporate culture 

 Ongoing opportunities for learning and career development 



Follow BGRS



 Equal Employment Statement 


BGRS’s global workforce welcomes and encourages growth, innovation, and sharing of perspectives and ideas. We value diversity in the workplace and are an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. To learn about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at BGRS, please visit our website. We thank all candidates who apply, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

Les effectifs de BGRS à l’échelle mondiale apprécient et encouragent la croissance, l’innovation et le partage des perspectives et des idées. BGRS accorde une grande importance à la diversité dans le milieu de travail et est un employeur adhérant aux principes d’égalité. Nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement accessible et inclusif. Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui posent leur candidature. Cependant, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidats retenus pour une entrevue individuelle. N’hésitez pas à communiquer avec nous si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement pendant le processus de recrutement. Nous travaillerons avec vous afin de répondre à vos besoins.

Alternatively, you can apply to this job using your profile on one of the following sites:

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Internet Publishing
description:
At realtor.com, we process terabytes of data everyday and transform that data into information that powers decisions for millions of home buyers, renters, dreamers, and real estate professionals. We aim to radically simplify home buying/selling and help more people achieve the American dream on our realtor.com website and mobile apps.


What will you do?


We have lots of data, in motion and at rest. Our goal is to use this data to make the home buying experience a breeze for our consumers. We empower them with the most up to date information on properties, and we help match our consumers with the most suitable realtors who are equipped to meet their individual needs.

The Enterprise Data Team works on the coolest data projects and products that reports, predicts and affects the outcome - using data. This impactful role will promote the build-out and usage of the Customer data platform, data-driven decisions and data products for realtor.com, it’s customers and partners. Additionally, this role will be part of the core team contributing to the design and development of realtor.com’s Customer Data platform.



Responsibilities




Design, develop, and operate highly scalable, high-performance and low-cost data pipelines in distributed data processing platforms with AWS/cloud technologies..

Collaborate with Engineers, Analysts and Data Scientists in the organization to construct complex data sources for algorithms and machine learning models

Own and Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS big data technologies.

Creation and support of Batch and real-time data pipelines built on AWS technologies including Glue, Kinesis, EMR, Lambda and Athena.

Develop tools, plug-ins and solutions for CI/CD workflow using tools such as Jenkins, Cloud Formation, Docker, Github and other microservices.

Continual research of the latest big data and visualization technologies to provide new capabilities and increase efficiency.

Drive and participate in architecture discussions, influence product roadmap, and take ownership and responsibility over new projects.

Maintain and support existing platforms and evolve to newer technology stacks and architectures.

Collaborate with the business applications team, product owners, Business stakeholders, Scrum-master to refine and estimate stories/epics.

Be an integral part of the scrum team to deliver on commitments on time and with good quality.

Review and ensure all code documentation is complete and updated periodically. Review work of Junior associates in the team.

Analyze the business Problems and deliver Optimal solutions using AWS Technologies.




Basic Qualifications




BS in Computer Science or equivalent degree; MS in Computer Science preferred.

10+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering, business intelligence, or related fields with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.

Demonstrated strength in data modeling, data transformation, and data warehousing.

Ability to write complex SQL statements.

Proficiency in programming language - Python.

Experience working with AWS big data technologies (S3, Athena, EMR, Glue, Lambda, Kinesis, API gateway, RDS, DynamoDB, Step Function etc).

Experience in architecting, implementing, and supporting Snowflake infrastructure and topologies.

Experience in Snowpipe for handling Streaming data is a plus.

Experience with software configuration management tools(Git) and CI/CD pipelines and their enabling tools such as Jenkins, Nexus, etc.

Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Takes pride in efficient designs and accurate results

Objectively analyzes the pros, cons, and tradeoffs of a design path and helps the team to arrive at the most optimal solution, which may not be their own.

Ability to work with Product and Sales Ops to gather requirements and translate them into data engineering tasks.

Effective team player. Honest and respectful of others.




Additional Preferred Skills




Experience in Web application development

Experience using business intelligence reporting tools (Tableau, Quicksight etc.).

Experience using big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Spark etc.)

Familiar with agile development and sprints.




About Realtor.com



At realtor.com®, we believe that everyone deserves a home of their own. We’re a community of nearly 2,000 employees who work hard to ensure that from the moment someone starts dreaming about a new home, to the moment they walk in the door and beyond, we’re there to lend a helping hand. Every month, over 85 million people trust us with their journey home by visiting our site and mobile apps, and we’d love to have you join our team to help.

We’ve got great offices in the U.S. and Canada with lots of sweet jobs to choose from, so we’re hoping you’ll join us on our journey to make buying, selling, renting, and living in homes easier and more rewarding for everyone.

Let’s make a difference, together. For Real.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need curious, thoughtful, and innovative people.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to join the Promotions team. Our team vision is to create an ecosystem in which customers can find a wide range of compelling promotional discounts across Amazon, and selling partners can grow their businesses through creating attractive offers to customers.

In this position, you will help define and manage goals and key performance metrics, as well as perform data deep dives to draw insights about selling partner and customer behavior that will impact product roadmaps, influence business outcomes, and contribute to documents for senior team members. The ideal candidate is a big thinker who obsesses over solving the most important customer problems, as well as an organized self-starter who breaks down projects into small pieces and adjusts plans based on customer feedback and the most recent learnings. This role entails stakeholder management, requiring coordination with worldwide partner teams, category teams, and finance.




Basic Qualifications




 3+ years of relevant professional experience in a quantitative or data intelligence role

 3+ years of professional experience working with large data sets and writing complex SQL queries to pull data

 Advanced Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau

 Experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting

 Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format, and to present findings in a clear and concise manner

 Ability to break down complex problems, and a strong will to get things done and deliver results




Preferred Qualifications




 5+ years of relevant professional experience in a quantitative or data intelligence role

 Advanced technical or business degree (MS) in a quantitative field

 Excellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines

 Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to work effectively with multiple teams and external organizations


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been leading the world into the cloud computing era since its inception in 2006. The AWS Partner Network (APN) is the vital ecosystem we have created with our tens of thousands of consulting and technology partners, to promote AWS in every industry, every size of company, and every region of the world. APN offerings include validating partner qualifications in distinct areas, lead/opportunity sharing, training and certifications, marketing assistance, funding reimbursement, et al. The AWS Partner Systems team is responsible for external and internal supporting Partner Sales, the APN, and other elements driving the AWS partner ecosystem. We serve three groups of stakeholders: partners who work with us to sell AWS, customers who use AWS, and internal users responsible for driving AWS sales and adoption via partners.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Are you interested in building secured, highly available, performant, and scalable systems, web services, products and integrations between cloud and on-prem applications that support AWS' current and future growth? Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Do you have a passion for ensuring a positive customer experience? This is the job for you.

AWS Partner Systems is looking for a results-oriented, self-driven individual who can help us create the next generation of distributed, scalable systems that support AWS' current and future business needs. In this role, you will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, relish working with high volume of data, the challenge of highly complex business contexts that are typically being defined in real-time. You will design and develop services that processes millions of transactions in secured environment.

As Salesforce Developer, you'll be a core member of the team supporting all of our partners. While the Salesforce.com platform will be your strongest focus, you'll be willing and able to learn and support other technologies such as AWS services , as needed. You will build highly secured, scalable, extendable, and performant solutions. Working closely with product and tech teams. You will design, build, test, iterate and deploy new features, system integrations, enhancements to existing features, and provide operational support. You'll play a leading role in code reviews, guiding junior resources towards better designs and clean, standardized coding.

Work/Life Harmony

Our team puts a high value on work-live harmony. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Our team is located in the Seattle office but we're flexible when team members need to occasionally work from home. We generally keep core in-office hours from 10am - 5pm. About half of us come in earlier and the other half of us stay later.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship.

We care about your career growth. We try to assign projects and tasks based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee- led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers; someone who will help us amplify the positive & inclusive team culture we’ve been building.




Basic Qualifications




 1+ years of post-internship, hands-on engineering experience on the Force.com platform

 1+ years of experience with Visualforce, Apex and/or SOQL/SOSL

 4-year college degree in computer science or computer engineering; alternate degrees that seem related may be considered; higher amounts of overall work experience may also be considered, in lieu of the 4-year degree




Preferred Qualifications




 Graduate degree in relevant area such as computer science, software engineering or information systems

 Proficiency in related web technologies (HTML/CSS, frameworks, libraries such as jQuery)

 Proficiency in related integration technologies (JSON, XML, REST, SOAP)

 Experience of working on one of the widely used programming languages such as Python or Java

 Force.com certifications - Administrator, Developer, Advanced Developer, Architect

 Experience with Force.com Communities and Lightning

 Prior experience as a dev, web dev, or dev on other technologies

 Knowledge of Agile practices, particularly sprint planning and estimation

description:
Our Client, an important company located in Montreal, is seeking a Financial Data Analyst for a temporary contract of 4 months with with a possibility to be permanent

Job Title: Financial Data Analyst

Location: Montreal (In Remote)

Salary : 45$-50$/hour depending on experience

Duration : 4 month contract with a possibility to be permanent.

You are passionate about Finance and data analysis., this role is for you then.


Advantages



 A Company with strong growth

 A dynamic team

 Positive environment

 Remote Work

 3-4 weeks vacation depending on experience




Responsibilities



 Extract, transform, load, and modeling data

 Analyze, interpret data for finance, production, supply, and other teams.

Automate Excel reports to map and transform data from different legacy systems




Qualifications



 Minimum of 3 to 5 years of experience Financial Analysis and data analysis

 Bachelor/Master in finance with IT knowledge ( a plus)

 Excel advanced/Expert

 French speaking environment

 Bilingual




Summary


This role intersted you? Don't hesitate to contact me!

To apply :


 Send me an email anytime at:



ava.raoui@randstad.ca

Armco Capital Inc


Founded in 1982 by members of the Armoyan family, Armco Capital Inc. has grown from a small family business into a diversified and dynamic group of companies spanning from Eastern Canada into the Southern States of the US. Today, Armco is among the largest organizations of its kind in Atlantic Canada and we’re not stopping. Armco continues to grow; both in business diversification, development and its team of dedicated professionals.





The Role: Senior Systems Analyst 



- On Site Role


As our Senior Systems Analyst, you will ensure the stability and integrity of company networks and systems including, voice, data, video, and wireless network services. This will be achieved by planning, designing, and developing local area networks (LANs) and wide area networks (WANs) across the organization. In addition, you will participate with the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of infrastructure systems. You will also be able to analyze and resolve server, storage, network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training where required.

Some of the essential responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:


Manage M365 and Active directory hybrid solution

Design and deploy company LANs, WANs, and wireless networks

Monitor network performance and troubleshoot problem areas as needed

Create and maintain documentation as it relates to network configuration, network mapping, processes, and service records

Support server and storage infrastructure

Manage VMware infrastructure

Monitor and maintain Veeam backup infrastructure

Participate in managing network security solutions

Participate in tier 1, 2, and 3 technical support

Assist with special projects as required


Requirements and qualifications for this role include:


3-5 years’ experience in network management

Proficiency with Fortinet network infrastructure

Knowledge of Infrastructure, Servers and Storage i.e. HP SANs, VMware, ESXi

Proficiency with Microsoft Active Directory

Experience with Exchange and Microsoft 365

Networking and security certifications (CCNA, CISSP, CISM, etc.) will be considered an asset

VMware certifications will be considered an asset

ITIL foundations an asset

Experience with access control and application support an asset

Able to participate in an on call rotation

Proven ability to work in a dynamic fast-paced environment, multi-task, and deliver under tight deadlines

Flexibility to work on projects as a team member and also independently

High level of integrity and professionalism

Must be adaptable, positive and bring a ‘can-do’, self-start motivation


If this sound like a role suited for you, please submit your resume.

While we greatly appreciate all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:


Dental care

Disability insurance

Employee assistance program

Extended health care

Life insurance

On-site parking

Paid time off

RRSP match

Vision care

Wellness program


Schedule:


Monday to Friday

On call

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Amazon Logistics (AMZL) is hiring a Business Analyst, Logistics to identify strategic initiatives that will form the next generation of Amazon Logistics. This position strives to solve complex cost and cycle time optimization problems that no one has solved yet.

In this role, the Business Analyst, Logistics will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. The individual will be responsible for the design, creation, management, and business use of extremely large datasets. This role will have an opportunity to help design and build our data infrastructure from the ground up, work with emerging technologies such as Redshift, while driving business intelligence solutions end-to-end: business requirements, workflow instrumentation, data modeling, metadata, reporting, and dashboard development. The Business Analyst, Logistics will work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing reporting solutions.

Key job responsibilities


 Manipulate/mine data from database tables (MySQL, SQL server, Oracle, Data Warehouse, FC log files)

 Conduct investigations into business problems and identify potential opportunities

 Identify and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation

 Improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers

 Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain, transportation and logistics teams, and software teams to identify new features and projects

 Identify ways to automate analysis through smarter software systems

 Track realized savings and impacts, and communicate results with senior leaders

 Maintaining database up-time to include restarting of servers, etc.

 Partner with internal stakeholders across multiple teams, gathering requirements and delivering complete solutions





Basic Qualifications




 Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or a related technical discipline

 3+ years of experience in data modeling, Extract Transform Load (ETL), data warehousing, and transformation of large scale data sources using SQL, Redshift, Oracle, or other Big Data technologies

 2+ years of quantitative and qualitative data science experience with impact to a business

 2+ years of problem solving using software systems, and the knowledge to create and maintain data warehouse systems




Preferred Qualifications




 Experience to source and combine disparate data sets to answer business questions

 Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or Math/Statistics/Finance or related discipline

 Knowledge with Data modeling skills, SQL with Oracle, MySQL, and Columnar Databases

 Knowledge to work in a deadline-driven work environment

 Experience to re-prioritize on a regular basis in order to remain current with business needs

 Knowledge to influence others in a positive and professional manner

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.
