Our multinational investment management client is looking for a Principal Data Management Analyst for their team




This is a full time 18-month contract opportunity with a potential for extension, located in Toronto and will be working hybrid (few days in office and remote)




Responsibilities


Provide support to colleagues in day-to-day operation and production support tasks when call upon

Lead the research and analysis of security master related data in support of the creation/maintenance of Invesco specific data elements

Ensure data provided fits the companies global needs

Represent the team as subject matter experts in cross-functional / global projects

Facilitate discussions to establish consensus and agreement with a win-win focus in mind

Lead, facilitate, coordinate and project manage the research, analysis, implementation, documentation, and training of new business requirements/projects (e.g. new instruments, new/change regulatory requirements, new systems implementation) globally

Establish and continually refine global support model while ensuring unique regional business needs are addressed

Ensure operation procedures are documented, shared with, and cross-train the global team

Perform independent research, review, and analysis of financial statements, organizational structure, business model, operational risks, performances, and securities / financial statements issued by organizations we invest in

Validate and ensure data override requests conform to Data Standard; conduct research/analysis and escalate the issue to appropriate Data Governance bodies as needed

Provide oversight for the standardization, acquisition, maintenance, and quality assurance of data 

Proactively contribute ideas, research and recommend continuous improvement opportunities (e.g. data standard enhancements, streamline/automate daily operations processes)

Lead approved continuous improvement initiatives

Provide oversight to ensure data integrity in systems we support and that data are reconciled across these systems

Serve as a mentor to Analysts and Administrators in the global Data Operations Team

Provide guidance by sharing knowledge and experience with the team

Provide feedback to location managers on the performance of global team members he/she interacts with

Research in new security instruments, lead the creation of support procedures, and train global team

Liaise and build strong business relationships with global colleagues, data vendors (e.g. Bloomberg, Reuters), and application vendors (e.g. Eagle, BlackRock)

Proactively identify potential operational risks, suggest mitigation strategy to the manager and lead the implementation of the agreed-upon mitigation strategy

Act as subject matter expert and the escalation point in production issues

Own critical production issues and ensure these issues are resolved accurately and efficiently





Qualifications


University degree in Accounting, Finance or business area of concentration (or an equivalent combination of education, training, experience that would provide the knowledge, skills and ability required)

Minimum 4-6 years' securities industry experience

Excellent knowledge of investment products globally is required

Knowledge of market data services such as Bloomberg and Reuters is required

Must have previous knowledge and work experience with data management applications (e.g. CADIS, Eagle PACE)

Trading applications (e.g. Charles River, Aladdin)

Portfolio administration applications (e.g. Eagle STAR, Portia, FMC) and fund accounting applications 

Must have a good understanding of the end-to-end investment services processes such as trade entry, trade process, settlement, valuation, corporate action processing and fund account

Must have a strong understanding on the impact of different characteristics of a security has on downstream data consumers and business functions (e.g. Compliance, Risk, Performance)

Must have a big picture view and deep data / process / business flow knowledge across systems GPRS used

Customer focus and with a keen interest in providing superb services to clients

Excellent written and verbal communication, interpersonal and conflict resolution skills

Experience in communication and facilitation with all levels within a global organization is required

Excellent organization skills, detail oriented, big picture perspective and work under pressure with tight deadline

Excellent research & analytical as well as problem solving skills

Self-managing and proactively prioritize his/her work as well as team tasks

Maintain a global focus and have strong connection with all levels of colleagues in a cross-functional global team environment

Strong Microsoft Office skills – in particular Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Project and Vision

Numerate and analytical

Ability to mentor and lead a global project team that is not his/her direct reports

Strong facilitation, project management and presentation skills

Is open-minded and a strong "out-of-the-box" thinker who challenges status-quo

An excellent listener with superb facilitation skills

Ability to understand technical details of system and data flow; and communicate/present technical concepts to business colleagues

MBA an asset

Certify Financial Analyst (CFA) or Professional accounting designation (CMA, CGA, CA, CPA) an asset

Working Conditions: 

Participate in Business Recovery testing on an as-needed basis as defined by manager  

Overtime, off-hours support and travel may be required

description:
Business Systems Analyst 







Apex Systems is a global IT services provider and our consulting practice has an opening for a Business Systems Analyst - Consultant 
who will be responsible for the solution requirements for multiple Fixed Income applications for a Top Five Bank.


 



Client:
 Big 5 Bank


Location:
 Remote currently, post COVID, WFH and hybrid after

6 Month Contract, Strong possibility of extension or converting fulltime based on project budget & candidate performance.


Hours:
 37.5 hours/week Monday-Friday, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm


 



Application Process:
 It is best to apply via the medium you are viewing this on. If you encounter technical difficulties, please contact 
dyba@apexsystems.com
 and reference 
Business Systems Analyst - Consultant



 



Group Information
: Repo, Sec lending, Prime Brokerage, OTC, Fixed Income Business Analysis team. Team is made of 8 BAs and the manager, supporting the back-office, middle-office, and the trading floor in relation to G1, Apex, ADP Bloomberg technologies. This team works closely with the development team and production support team which are both located on the same floor. )

Business knowledge: Repo, Sec lending, Prime Brokerage, OTC

System knowledge: G1, Apex, ADP

 

 



What You’ll Be Doing:




Working with Front Office / Trading teams, compliance, supervision and governance, trade control, development teams, production support, and regulatory reporting services (RRS).



Involved in requirement intakes with stakeholders, will be assigned project tasks, looking at making improvements and efficiencies, and addressing regulatory concerns.

Perform the analysis, design, implementation, modification, and daily functional support of all applications.

Works with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies.

Gathers requirements from business units and translates those to programmers and developers.

Prepares cost-benefit and return-on-investment analyses to aid in decisions on system implementation.

Demonstrates an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.

Supports one or more highly complex business processes.

Works on multiple projects as a project team member.

Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.

Ensure collection of information, accurate requirement gathering, data analysis, documentation of information, and presentation of findings advance initiatives and ensure project success.

Conduct analysis of client processes and functional or reporting requirements to prepare documentation and communicate the information.

Provide SME advice and direction to internal and external customers to ensure that the business requirements are appropriately defined.

Coordinate and lead cross-functional tasks or work packages to identify and document functional or reporting requirements, work flow, information sources and system specifications.

Partner with project manager, technical resources, vendors, and management to ensure accurate execution of projects.



 



Must-Have Requirements
:


5-7 years of experience in Business Analysis

Strong experience working in Capital Markets

Income Business knowledge:

Fixed Repo, Sec lending, Prime Brokerage, OTC experience highly preferred

System knowledge:

G1, Apex, ADP Bloomberg TOM Experience

Experience using SQL Queries as well as analyzing the data returned



 



Nice-to-Have Skills:



Regulatory Compliance experience (IIROC MTRS and/or MiFID II)

Automated RT integration between trading system, market data, collateral system, TriOptima, AcadiaSoft, Custodian, and internal downstream systems.

Automated RT STP settlement solution for collateral with GL posting and reconciliation

Ability to work well within a large team environment



 



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.

MBA or other related advanced degree preferred.

Knowledge of the banking industry, including operations, products, and services.

Regulatory knowledge/experience with IIROC MTRS and/or MiFID II.

Experience gathering requirements, and analysis including Use Case analysis.

Professional experience with system development lifecycle, application delivery and implementation.

Extensive experience in facilitating meetings with team members, management, and stakeholders.

Basic knowledge of programming languages in order to comprehend reading code and basic functions.

Ability to create business solutions that increase competitive advantage.

Ability to exercise good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.

Project management skills in order to handle diverse projects, often times simultaneously, and meet aggressive deadlines.

Ability to solve technical problems/ processes and understand complex details.

Ability to increase operating efficiency with produce high quality technical solutions.

description:
Our Exciting Opportunity: 


We are now looking for a Developer to maintain products (units, nodes, networks, systems and solutions). Your role will include all development activities such as: requirement analysis, system design, architecture design, hardware design, software design, integration, verification, simulations, tools design, Product Lifecycle Management support and product documentation. Our focus is on Lean and Agile ways of working. We organize in cross functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.


You will: 


Drive strategic technical leadership

Perform continuous analysis and requirement handling.

Develop and test high quality products

Perform trouble shooting and customer support

Drive continuous improvements of products and processes

Develop competence in technical domain


To be successful in the role you must have:


Education: (Recruiter to supply educational requirements)

Min years of experience: (Recruiter to supply)

Domain experience: (Recruiter to supply area of expertise – e.g.: Cloud, BSS, OSS etc.)

Product development knowledge and Product Lifecycle Management knowledge

Business understanding

Working with people and networking

Innovating, adapting and responding to change

Delivering results and meeting customer expectations

Planning and Organizing


Additional Requirements: 
(Recruiter to supply or delete category)


What´s in it for you? 


Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds – you will be redefining it. You won’t develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.


What happens once you apply? 


To prepare yourself for next steps, please explore here: https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/job-opportunities/hiring-process


COVID STATEMENT


The health, safety and well-being of our employees is our priority. Successful applicants will be required to disclose their vaccination status prior to employment. Except for those positions designated as 100% remote, successful applicants who did not provide the required proof of vaccination will be required to test weekly and wear masks at all Ericsson and customer facilities. This includes employees with medical or religious exemptions with testing as an accommodation.  Compliance with government and customer requirements regarding vaccination may preclude unvaccinated applicants from employment for a particular job.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more. If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com.

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

description:
NTT Data Services in Vancouver is seeking a motivated and experienced 
Business Analyst.
 If you are passionate about technology, client interaction, and all the challenges that go with being a consultant, you will want to be a part of our team. Our people have the skills and business savvy to provide exceptional consulting services to clients, helping them gain the optimum benefit from our solutions. We recruit professional results-oriented team players who have true vision and creativity. Our talented consultants are passionate about what they do and excited to delight our customers with their knowledge and capabilities.





Key Responsibilities:






Providing cost effective business systems and applications analysis in support of the development and/or implementation of business applications. Includes evaluation, analysis, documentation of requirements, translation into proper system requirement specifications and configuration

Formulating and defining systems scope and objectives based on both end-user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems, applications, and industry requirements. 

Conducting business process analyses, needs assessments, and preliminary cost/benefits analyses in an effort to align information technology solutions with business initiatives. 

Operating as a liaison between technical personnel and the end-users. 

Teaching end users new technology and enhancements using all appropriate communication tools.






Project Responsibilities:






Assess gaps between 
AdjudiCare 
and client requirements

Creates test plans for projects.

Analyzes model test discrepancies to find trends and works with programmers to resolve.

Establishes cost and time estimates for development and implementation of projects.

HealthCare 
or

 application implementation

industries: Software Development
description:
Overview



Visier is the global leader in People Analytics and Workforce Intelligence trusted by over 8000 customers and a third of the Fortune 500. Our solutions give customers valuable insight into their people, because people are a business' most important asset. Every day Visier employees work to help create more efficient, fair, and successful businesses through leveraging data. Recently closing a successful Series E funding round, and a landmark $1B valuation, Visier is embarking on an incredible phase of its 11-year growth journey.


As a member of Visier’s Customer Success organization, the Software Support Analyst will be responsible for supporting our external customer base once they are in our production environment. You will demonstrate excellent communication, analytical, and customer service skills, allowing you to gather detailed information about customer issues so you can work to resolve them effectively while providing a great customer experience.

A curious mindset, strong technical aptitude and the ability to learn the Visier platform is a must for the Software Support Analyst to be successful in this role. You will be interacting directly with Visier’s customers, and you must also be able to think on your feet, communicate clearly, and effectively manage expectations and competing priorities.


What You'll Be Doing...



Health & Safety at Visier


Visier is committed to creating a safe and healthy environment for our employees, customers and community. As part of this commitment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for an exemption.


Act as a product expert (technical and functional) for Visier’s SaaS product and services both internally and externally

Provide quality and timely support to customers per the severity of the issue and the contractual Service Level Agreement (SLA)

Work with enterprise, partners, and OEM customers to anticipate, identify and respond to issues they experience with Visier’s solutions, and address customers’ technical concerns and requests.

Monitor all cases in our ticketing system and ensure timely resolution and closure of these cases

Respond to and resolve alerts received from our monitoring tool in a timely manner

Create knowledge-based articles and documentation to support other support team members and customers

Coordinate Customer Service functions to diagnose, troubleshoot and solve our clients technical issues in a timely and professional manner

Work with our Professional Services, Customer Success, Development and Product Management teams to help communicate customer needs and urgency

Be part of our on-call rotation and be available to work evening, weekend, and holiday shifts when needed



What You'll Bring To The Table...


Most importantly, you share our values...


You roll up your sleeves

You make it easy

You are proud

You never stop learning

You play to win

Experience in a technical, customer facing support role is a plus

Post-secondary education in a related field, or equivalent 

Knowledge of data, database management systems, and Business Intelligence tools (SQL, Tableau, Qlik, Power BI)

Analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to think about complex problems and come up with creative solutions for online-based applications

Gathering and writing requirements from customers

Supporting/troubleshooting browser-based software solutions

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with polished telephone etiquette, and ability to comfortably present and explain complex concepts via phone and webinars 

Maintaining accurate customer interaction documentation and quality case management records

Efficient time management skills; ability to work under pressure and remain calm and organized

Ability to anticipate and predict potential cascading effects of changes made within customer environments

Working remotely with the ability to be a collaborative team player that builds positive relationships with other team members

Experience using Issue Tracking/Management systems like ServiceNow and JIRA is a plus

job_title: System-2 Deep Learning and Neural Reasoning Researcher
industries: Software Development, Wireless Services, and Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Machine Learning Researcher



Job Overview




General Summary


Qualcomm AI Research is looking for world-class researchers in deep learning, to join a high-caliber team of engineers inventing machine learning technology to provide best-in-class solutions while running with the most efficient use of power, memory, and computation.

Members of our team are part of a multi-disciplinary core research group within Qualcomm which spans software, hardware, and systems, and our members may simultaneously contribute to technology deployed worldwide by partnering with our industry-leading businesses across mobile, compute, automotive, cloud, and IOT. Our research team has demonstrated first-in-the-world research and proof-of-concepts in areas such model efficiency, neural video codecs, video semantic segmentation, federated learning, and wireless RF sensing (https://www.qualcomm.com/ai-research), has won major research competitions such as the visual wake word challenge, and converted leading research into best-in-class user-friendly tools such as Qualcomm Innovation Center’s AI Model Efficiency Toolkit (https://github.com/quic/aimet).

The R&D work responsibility for this position focuses on the following


 Fundamental machine learning research on neural reasoning and connectionist approaches to “System-2” cognition in a neural network.

 Study of approaches to integrating multimodal perception and language to push a neural network’s abilities towards reason and decision making.

 Research the role of language in instructing the neural network at run-time (“prompting”) and in guiding the network towards better solutions during training (“explanations”).

 Identify new applications that benefit from the increased ability to perform end-to-end sequential reasoning and decision making.





Ideal Candidates Will Demonstrate The Following




 Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related field.

 Extensive experience in training neural networks (including CNNs, RNNs, Attention/Transformers).

 Extensive experience in modeling, implementing, and training neural networks in high-level languages and frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow





Other Desirable Skills




 PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

 Track record of research excellence and high-quality publications (e.g. ICLR, NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICCV, etc.)

 Experience with recurrent neural networks and/or autoregressive language models, such as GPT and similar models

 Experience helpful in Reinforcement Learning and modern approaches to offline RL, such as Decision Transformers/Trajectory Transformers



Physical Requirements


Frequently transports between offices, buildings and campuses up to ½ mile.

Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs.

Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting).

Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.

Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers and vendors both in person and remotely.





Education




Minimum Qualifications


Masters - Computer Engineering, Masters - Computer Science, Masters - Electrical Engineering



Work Experiences



2+ years Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience.

6 months of experience developing and/or optimizing machine learning models, systems, platforms, or methods



Skills




Certifications:




Education




Preferred Qualifications


Doctorate - Computer Engineering, Doctorate - Computer Science, Doctorate - Electrical Engineering



Work Experiences



2+ years experience working in a large matrixed organization. ,1+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above). ,2+ publications at a machine learning conference ,1+ years experience with machine learning research related to new models, systems innovations, platforms, or methodology



Skills



AI Frameworks, Creating the New and Different, Deep Learning, Developing Prototypes, Machine Learning, Mathematical Modeling, Python


Applicants
: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to 
accommodationsupport



To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies
: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



La façon dont nous travaillons est en train de changer et la technologie qui aide les entreprises à gérer leur main-d’œuvre doit être alignée sur ce changement. Les gestionnaires sont tenus de prendre de meilleures décisions, plus rapidement, et les employés attendent davantage de leurs outils en milieu de travail. Chez UKG, nous construisons des applications modernes de gestion de la main-d’œuvre qui dotent les responsables de moyens, améliorent l’expérience des employés et soutiennent la flexibilité.

UKG (Ultimate Kronos Group) est à la recherche d’un(e) développeur(euse) de logiciels pour se joindre à son équipe d’ingénierie de classe mondiale à Montréal pour sa dernière plateforme infonuagique : UKG Dimensions. Le(la) candidat(e) idéal(e) a une expérience pratique du développement de solutions infonuagiques de qualité. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le développement de notre offre SaaS, dans un environnement hautement collaboratif et agile. Le candidat retenu aura de l’expérience dans les méthodologies de test modernes et les processus exécutés tout au long du cycle de vie du développement logiciel et aura de l’expérience avec les pratiques infonuagiques. Ce candidat serait responsable de la qualité du produit en développant et en exécutant des stratégies de test pour assurer des versions de qualité.



Vos Responsabilités Quotidiennes




 Assurer la fonctionnalité et les performances appropriées d’une grande variété d’applications et de plateformes.

 Une capacité démontrée à effectuer des lancements de produits de qualité dans les délais prévus en utilisant des pratiques d’analyse des risques et de confinement des défauts, d’automatisation des tests et d’initiatives d’amélioration continue est essentielle à ce poste.

 Responsable et imputable de la qualité du produit pour le projet.

 Installation/configuration/maintenance des environnements de test automatisés dans un paramètre d’intégration continue.

 Maintenir et améliorer le laboratoire de test et l’infrastructure de test (y compris les outils, les scripts, etc.).

 Aider au déploiement et au dépannage des environnements de test.

 Collaborer avec d’autres membres de l’équipe d’AQ et tous les membres de l’équipe géographiquement dispersée pour assurer la mise en œuvre appropriée des exigences fonctionnelles.

 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les développeurs pour reproduire et résoudre les bogues.

 Travailler dans une ambiance d’équipe pour effectuer des activités spéciales d’essai lorsque requis.

 Rester en contact avec la communauté des tests de logiciels et apporter les meilleures pratiques de l’industrie dans l’équipe.

 Améliorer continuellement la productivité et l’efficacité de nos efforts de tests automatisés à l’aide d’outils et de techniques innovants.

 Transformer la documentation manuelle des tests en scripts de tests automatisés, robustes et efficaces.

 Participer à l’élaboration de la documentation des tests, exécuter des tests et surveiller les résultats à l’aide des outils du cycle de vie des applications.

 Examiner les documents sur les exigences opérationnelles et fonctionnelles afin de créer la documentation de test appropriée.

 Capacité à décrire le comportement de l’interface utilisateur en termes de mise en œuvre technique correcte et de scénarios utilisateur client.


Exigences


 Baccalauréat en informatique ou diplôme connexe et plus de 4 ans d’expérience en assurance qualité logicielle (Java / Selenium) ou dans une autre discipline connexe avec implication directe dans les tests automatisés d’applications web.

 Solide compréhension des technologies web de Microsoft, Linux (Bash) et dans les technologies web de niveau N.

 Solide expérience dans les tests fonctionnels et les meilleures pratiques en matière de qualité logicielle.

 Solide expérience dans la gestion des défauts (création, suivi et validation du rapport de défauts).

 Exposition à Protractor, Javascript, Eclipse, Jenkins, Linux, JIRA, HP ALM, HTML5.

 Familier avec des technologies comme nginx, tomcat, postgresql, Jenkins

 Expérience avec les outils de contrôle de version (GIT, bitbucket).

 Connaissance pratique de Docker / Kubernetes / VM / Jenkins.

 Concentration sur les processus avec une grande attention aux détails et un bon suivi.

 Expérience avec des outils de test tels que xUnit, Selenium, mocking frameworks, etc.

 Capacité à écrire des requêtes SQL.

 Familiarité avec les outils utilisés pour automatiser le déploiement d’une solution logicielle d’entreprise sur le nuage, Concourse, Ansible, etc.

 Excellentes compétences en résolution de problèmes et en communication.

 Bonne expérience dans les outils de gestion des tests comme ALM, JIRA.

 Expérience avec Java, Python, etc. un atout


Profil de l'entreprise

À UKG, notre priorité, ce sont les gens. UKG combine la force et l’innovation d’Ultimate Software et de Kronos en réunissant deux cultures primées axées sur les employés. Nos employés forment un groupe extraordinaire de gens talentueux, énergiques et innovants qui ont à cœur bien plus que le travail. Nous nous efforçons de créer une culture d’appartenance et une expérience pour les employés qui les responsabilisent. UKG compte plus de 13 000 employés dans le monde et est reconnue pour sa culture organisationnelle inclusive. Êtes-vous prêt.e à être inspiré.e? Apprenez-en plus au www.ukg.com/careers.

Égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Ultimate Kronos Group est fier d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi et s’engage à maintenir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, au sexe, à l’âge, au handicap, à l’état matrimonial, à la situation familiale, à l’orientation sexuelle, à la grossesse, à l’information génétique, à l’identité de genre, à l’expression de genre, à l’origine nationale, à l’ascendance, au statut de citoyen, au statut d’ancien combattant et à tout autre statut protégé par les lois fédérales, provinciales ou locales contre la discrimination.


Accommodement aux handicaps


UKG s’engage à fournir un accommodement aux personnes handicapées durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue. Si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue, veuillez communiquer avec nous à

industries: Software Development
description:
About the role


The mission of the Success team is to make our customers and partners successful while improving our Enterprise-grade conversational platform. Our product is highly technical and, as a result, so is our Success team. Our customer base is growing quickly and we’re looking for ambitious developers to kickstart their careers by becoming product specialists. You will have the opportunity to work with and support many new, leading-edge technologies that solve real customer challenges.





Responsibilities



Working with Global 2000 companies to implement the Botpress solutions for their unique environments

Be the platform expert, knowing all the ins and outs of Botpress, and guide customers to build great conversational AI experiences

Diving deeply into complex technical puzzles and working collaboratively to understand and resolve customer issues

Be the champion of our customers by providing real-time feedback to internal teams about product performance and customer needs

Be a driver of innovation within the success team, the company and with our customers, by looking for better ways to do the work we do, improve the tools we use and how we raise the bar on the service we deliver to our Global 2000 customers

Contribute to product documentation, customer knowledge base, and best practices guides






Requirements



1+ years of professional software development experience

Excellent troubleshooting skills and a passionate problem solver

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English 

Experienced with: Javascript, PostgreSQL, Docker

A deep interest in Conversational AI, voice- and chat-based user experiences

Well-organized, excellent work ethic, pays attention to detail, and self-starting

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup and passionate about improving technical abilities

Upbeat, passionate, and unparalleled customer focus






Benefits & Culture



You will join a team of ambitious individuals passionate about speed of execution, data-driven decisions, and, obviously, chatbots.

You will contribute to the growth of one of the most popular AI chatbot dev tool in the world.

Top-tier health benefits and access to telemedicine for you and your family.

Flexibility to work remotely

3 weeks vacation per year + 2 weeks off for Christmas and New Year.

You get a laptop and top software to perform your best work.

Competitive compensation, because that matters as well.






About Botpress


Botpress is a VC-backed, fast-growing Canadian startup building open developer tools to understand text and automate complex conversations. We believe that the future of human-computer interactions will be in big part conversational, which will allow businesses to deliver services and software to customers with unparalleled customer experience and personalization. Botpress is the standard, reliable stack developers will use to build mind-blowing conversational applications.





Why join Botpress


Apart from joining an awesome team of talented, fast-moving and cutting edge developers, you’ll be working with/on:


A popular open-source project built for developers

A modern stack used by hundreds of thousands of developers

A product used by startups, schools, nonprofits and Fortune 500 companies

A backend runtime built for performance and deployment simplicity

A frontend application that devs like just as much as VS Code

A machine learning pipeline that evolves every single week

A data-science problem that has not been solved yet

A cloud infrastructure that can serve billions of API calls

A developer community with thousands of members

A company crazy enough to compete directly with Google and Microsoft

A workplace that is distributed and remote-first

A group of like-minded investors and advisors that has funded, built and scaled similar companies such as Elastic, Mongo, Snyk, Influx, Algolia, Twilio and Databricks.






Additional info



Seniority level: Entry level

Employment type: Full-time

Job function: Customer Service, Information Technology, Engineering

Industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services









Recruitment Process




 
Short screening with HR

Online screening test

Take at-home test (troubleshooting) 

Technical Interview (With the Head of Customer Success, Nadine, and a Success Engineer, David)

Final Interview (Nadine & a Success Engineer, Sebastien)

The overall experience of 8+ Years.

Strong experience in Pyspark, SQL.

Strong experience in Python.

QA background, good experience in testing, and willingness to do hands-on work.

Knowledge of SAS is advantageous.

Strong Communication skills & Stakeholder management skills.

Background in Finance / Risk domain is advantageous / preferred.

industries: Software Development and Retail
description:
About the Team:


Enterprise Integration Platform Services team provides Platform as Services by building, maintaining, and operating lululemon enterprise integration platforms - which includes Kafka, Apigee, and OSB. Teams provides tools and capabilities to the organization which allow easy, friction free adoption of integration platforms. 




The Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer is a key role facilities Enterprise Integration Platform Services team's cloud journey. The individual in this role will be collaborating with product managers, solution architects, and platform engineers to design and implement solutions that enable platform engineer agility to delivery capability that drive business value. 




The Senior Cloud Infrastructure Engineer will provide technical expertise to application and platform team to facilitate deployment of containerized platform components, reusable templates/libraries using Kubernetes, Rancher, AWS, and Azure. This individual will also design/implement the modularized CI/CD pipelines to achieve continuously development and deployment without major impact to production systems. 





Key Responsibilities:



Create the well-informed Integration Platform cloud strategy and manage the adaption process.

Develop cloud-based large-scale platform with high throughput and reliability.

Produce the architecture design solution with application/platform engineer in mind, making adoption easy.

Continuously drive improves in areas like performance, automation, quality, monitoring, and reliability of platforms.

Working closely with IT security team to implement and monitor the cloud security policies.

Offer technical guidance to other cloud/devops engineers.

Estimate/optimize cloud cost.

Response to technical issue in a professional and timely manner. 

Identify and anticipate top cloud architecture solutions and features to successfully meet the strategic needs of the company. 






Job Requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or relevant field

Professional level Cloud certification 






Required Skills & Experience
:


5+ years designing, executing, and supporting cloud-based solutions 

2+ years Kubernetes, GitHub, Jenkins, Terraform experience 

2+ years building and managing cloud monitoring infrastructure, such as Grafana, Prometheus, and Splunk

2+ years Vault Enterprise experience

Comprehensive experience with at least one major cloud service provider (AWS, Microsoft Azure, GCP, Alibaba Cloud) 

Lean Agile mentality 

Acknowledges the presence of choice in every moment and takes personal responsibility for their actions 

Ability to create clearly defined technical documentation (ex: Technical requirements, design documentation, Architectural review materials, technology guidelines and best practices)
