description:
530633BR


Introduction


Menez IBM vers l'avenir en traduisant les exigences systèmes dans la conception et l'élaboration de systèmes personnalisés dans un environnement agile. Le succès d'IBM est entre vos mains au fur et à mesure que vous transformez les besoins d'affaires essentiels en code et que vous stimulez l'innovation. Votre travail fortifiera mondialement IBM et ses clients, par la collaboration et l'intégration de code dans les systèmes d'entreprise. Vous aurez accès à la formation, aux outils et aux technologies les plus récents, et à un cheminement de carrière illimité avec le chef de file mondial de la technologie. Venez chez IBM et ayez un impact à l'échelle planétaire!

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

Nous sommes à un tournant de l'histoire où l'impact de la technologie sur les entreprises est suffisamment important pour transformer l'ensemble de leur mode de fonctionnement. La convergence des nouvelles technologies exponentielles telles que l'IA, le cloud, la mobilité, l'automatisation, l'internet des objets, la blockchain et la 5G ont le pouvoir de changer les modèles d'entreprise, de réinventer les processus et de réimaginer la façon dont nous travaillons tous.

IBM Consulting a pour vocation d'aider ses clients à gérer l'ampleur des changements nécessaires pour rester en tête et à innover sans relâche. Nous établissons des relations solides avec nos clients et créons ensemble des solutions à l'intersection de la stratégie, de l'expérience, de la technologie et des opérations. Nous agissons en tant qu'agents du changement : nous donnons aux clients les moyens d'élaborer une stratégie et de mettre en œuvre leur vision, ce qui leur permet d'évoluer à grande échelle avec rapidité et clarté.

Chez IBM iX au sein du groupe de transformation de la clientèle et de l'expérience d'IBM Consulting, nous sommes des pionniers réalistes, soucieux d'imaginer et de créer des solutions numériques de bout en bout axées sur le client final. Nous appliquons une conception centrée sur l'humain et des méthodologies agiles pour repenser la manière dont nos clients travaillent et s'engagent auprès de leurs clients, et pour donner rapidement vie à ces solutions numériques axées sur l'expérience. Voulez-vous faire partie de l'équipe qui définit l'avenir de l'expérience des supporters des équipes sportives professionnelles ? Que diriez-vous d'aider les institutions de services financiers à se transformer à l'ère de la transformation avec l'accélération de l'innovation numérique stimulée par le changement de comportement des clients dû à la pandémie ? Et qu'en est-il de l'aide apportée aux compagnies pétrolières et gazières pour améliorer la sécurité et la productivité des travailleurs sur le terrain ? C'est votre chance de faire partie d'une équipe où tout ce que nous faisons a un impact mesurable à grande échelle.


Tâches Et Responsabilités


En tant que Développeur-maître Angular Sénior chez IBM iX (sous IBM Consulting), vous êtes un membre de l'équipe qui permet de concrétiser la conception du produit de notre client dans les délais impartis et de manière sécurisée, fiable, réutilisable et évolutive. Grâce à votre expérience agile au sein d'organisations centrées sur le produit, vous êtes l'un des membres de l'équipe travaillant aux côtés d'une équipe de livraison pour assurer la fourniture réussie d'applications web et mobiles et d'autres expériences numériques de première mise sur le marché.Vos responsabilités en tant que Développeur-maître Sénior sont les suivantes :



Gérer le développement complet de logiciels pour nos clients, de la conception au déploiement, dans le cadre de leur transformation numérique, en assurant l'alignement sur l'architecture actuelle et en développement.

Participer aux réunions quotidiennes de la mêlée et fournir une orientation technique aux autres membres de l'équipe.

Collaborer avec les parties prenantes et les concepteurs d'architecture pour s'assurer que la solution est conforme aux exigences et à la stratégie. Participer à l'examen et à la sélection des technologies (langages / cadres et bibliothèques).

Appliquer les modèles de conception, les normes de codage et les meilleures pratiques pour produire un code sûr, fiable, réutilisable et évolutif.

Identifier, trier et analyser les causes profondes des problèmes spécifiques au développement.

Intégrer des implémentations d'interface utilisateur avec des API sécurisées et non sécurisées.

Travailler avec les parties prenantes internes et clientes pour définir et clarifier les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles.

Aide à l'estimation et à l'effort requis pour construire les composants clés

Préparer, documenter et présenter la conception et la documentation technique

Exercer un leadership technique grâce à son expertise en la matière et à sa connaissance du domaine

Contribuer à l'amélioration des processus, en signalant tous les problèmes et en contribuant activement à leur résolution

Animer des réunions et des séances de travail régulières avec les membres de l'équipe de développement et les différentes unités commerciales afin de traiter les questions en cours qui nécessitent une compréhension ou une analyse plus approfondie

Contribuer à l'élaboration du cadre architectural et de la conception



Votre profil



Vous apprenez rapidement et vous vous adaptez : vous pouvez vous familiariser avec de nouvelles technologies rapidement, de manière approfondie et avec confiance, en vous appuyant sur des concepts que vous comprenez déjà.

Vous avez un style de travail interactif : vous vous épanouissez en travaillant à la fois en équipe et individuellement lorsque cela est nécessaire, y compris avec des équipes mondiales et extraterritoriales pour la mise en œuvre.

Vous êtes un communicateur hors pair : vous avez fait preuve d'excellence dans la communication et la présentation d'informations complexes à des parties prenantes tant techniques que non techniques.

Vous êtes un gourou de l'estimation des tâches : vous pouvez rapidement évaluer l'effort relatif d'une tâche de développement, en tenant compte des ambiguïtés et de la complexité, en vous appuyant sur votre vaste expérience professionnelle antérieure.

Vous avez le sens de l'initiative et un grand souci du détail : vous effectuez des examens de code de qualité par des pairs et vous avez des exigences élevées et un grand souci de la réussite et de la satisfaction des clients. 

Nous recrutons dans les villes principales du pays. Les candidats retenus pour un poste à Montréal, QC, doivent être parfaitement bilingues en anglais et en français. 



Expertise professionnelle et technique requise


Qualifications Requises


Les candidats retenus seront en mesure de démontrer les caractéristiques suivantes :



Diplôme de Bachelor dans un des domaines suivants : informatique, ingénierie, MIS ou domaine connexe.

3-5 ans d' expérience dans la technologie ou dans un domaine connexe , avec une expérience pertinente dans les projets numériques centrés sur l'utilisateur. 

Expérience des technologies dedéveloppement web, notamment HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ainsi que de l'utilisation d'un ou plusieurs des outils Angular, React, Vue.

Expérience des technologies multiplateformes telles que Flutter, ReactNative, NativeScript.

Expérience avec un des deux systèmes NodeJS et Java

Familiarité avec l'intégration et la prise en charge de fonctionnalités fournies par des SDK ou des bibliothèques externes (par exemple, push, analytique, CMS).

Maîtrise de l'utilisation d'un système de gestion du code source tel que Git, ainsi qu'une connaissance pratique des pratiques devops (par exemple, l'intégration/livraison continue).

Compréhension des modèles de conception, de l'optimisation, de la sécurité des API et des meilleures pratiques de codage sécurisé.

Expérience dans la création de solutions pour le web responsable et mobile

Compréhension du cycle de vie du développement logiciel et des principes de mise en œuvre agile

Connaissance des systèmes de conteneurs comme Docker et de l'orchestration de conteneurs comme Kubernetes

Maîtrise des outils de gestion des projets agiles (par exemple, Confluence et Jira).

Une parfaite maîtrise de l'anglais.



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié


Qualifications Supplémentaires




Maîtrise ou l'équivalent;

Maîtrise du français




Ce que nous offrons




Une culture d'entreprise axée sur le travail d'équipe, qui met l'accent sur le bien-être et l'inclusion des employés, avec des commentaires constructifs et des possibilités d'apprentissage continu, y compris le développement des compétences en matière de gestion par l'intermédiaire de la Leadership Academy d'IBM

Rémunération compétitive, avantages sociaux complets et conditions de travail flexibles. Nous continuons à développer nos avantages et nos programmes, offrant ainsi un soutien, des conseils et une couverture parmi les meilleurs pour un personnel diversifié

Un tout nouveau bureau IBM situé au cœur du centre-ville de Toronto, au 16 York Street (ouverture en décembre 2021)




La méthode IBM



En Tant Qu'IBMers


Chez IBM , nos méthodes de travail définissent qui nous sommes et nous permettent d'atteindre notre objectif.



 Nous établissons un lien de confiance

 Nous collaborons pour réussir

 Nous évoluons avec une inlassable curiosité

 Nous innovons dans un but précis

 Nous livrons avec impact

 nous encourageons la diversité des perspectives (voir plus ci-dessous)




La diversité chez IBM


Chez IBM, nous encourageons la diversité des perspectives et nous nous engageons à apporter un large éventail de points de vue, d'expériences et de compétences à notre travail afin de favoriser un environnement véritablement inclusif. Nous encourageons fortement les candidatures de tous les candidats qualifiés qui représentent toute la diversité des communautés à travers le Canada. Cela inclut, sans s'y limiter, les peuples autochtones, les personnes issues de communautés noires et raciales diverses, les personnes handicapées, les personnes issues de communautés sexuées et sexuellement diverses et/ou les personnes ayant des identités transgenres. IBM est fier d'être un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances et s'engage également à respecter toutes les pratiques d'emploi équitables concernant la citoyenneté et le statut d'immigration.

Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Services est une équipe de conseillers d'affaires, de stratégie et de technologie qui conçoivent, construisent, et exploitent des systèmes de base et des services qui constituent l'épine dorsale de l'économie mondiale. IBM Services fait équipe avec les plus grandes entreprises du monde dans plus de 170 pays afin de bâtir des affaires plus intelligentes en repensant et en réinventant par la technologie, avec ses méthodologies axées sur les résultats, son portefeuille de pointe et son expertise en recherche et en activités de calibre mondial qui mènent à une innovation axée sur les résultats et à une excellence durable.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
Who we are:

 Micruity is on a mission to make secure retirement income accessible to all Americans.

 

Micruity provides the data network that enables the pensionization of defined contribution plans. Plan record keepers, life insurers, asset managers, and other vendors can easily build and distribute lifetime income products using Micruity’s infrastructure and API-based application development suite. Micruity's solution enables a more efficient, cost effective and secure ecosystem where all stakeholders in the retirement market can flourish. The end result: individuals have access to retirement income products through their 401(k) plan, getting them a step closer to their financial wellness goals. 

 



Who we're looking for:

 Our ideal candidate will learn quickly, will be creatively driven, is solutions oriented, has an entrepreneurial spirit, possesses a keen attention to detail, and has a confident demeanor.

 



What you'll do: 

The Business Analyst is responsible for supporting critical client onboarding projects. These projects involve working with 401(k) record keepers, life insurers, asset managers to integrate their products and processes through the Micruity data infrastructure platform.

 



Basic Requirements:




Bachelor's Degree

3+ years experience in the financial industry (education may substitute for industry experience)

Strong working knowledge of Excel and Excel processes

The ability to read functional and technical documents

Project management experience

Must be able to read data files and gain insight

Experience with field mapping, data conversion and generation, and analyzing client data


 



Nice to haves:




Basic knowledge of Python and/or Tableau

Experience working with JSON and XML files


 



Benefits:

 Health, vision, and dental. Company sponsored life insurance, stock options, and a remote friendly work environment. Supportive team, work/life balance, and the chance to be a part of a rapidly growing start up looking to revolutionize the secure retirement income industry.




Micruity is an equal opportunity employer.

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Our large, Fortune Technology client is ranked as one of the best companies to work with, in the world. The client fosters progressive culture, creativity, and a flexible work environment. They use cutting-edge technologies to keep themselves ahead of the curve. Diversity in all aspects is respected. Integrity, experience, honesty, people, humanity, and passion for excellence are some other adjectives that define this global technology leader.




As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing best practices and making architectural decisions to rapidly improve critical data processing & analytics pipelines. You will tackle hard problems to improve the platform’s reliability, resiliency, and scalability. 




We are looking for someone who thrives on autonomy and has experience driving long-term projects to completion. You are detail and quality oriented, and excited about the prospects of having a big impact with data. Our tech stack includes Airflow, Hive, EMR, PySpark, Presto, Jenkins, Snowflake, Datadog and various AWS services. 

 


 Qualifications 



5+ years of relevant industry experience in big data systems, data processing and SQL data warehouses 

At least 3+ years of experience on working with large Hadoop projects and building scalable applications using PySpark by leveraging Spark DataFrame and Spark SQL api. 

At least 2+ years of experience in optimizing Spark applications, spark memory management, and e2e spark process optimization. 

Strong overall programming skills, able to write modular, maintainable code, preferably Python & SQL 

Fundamental knowledge of distributed data processing systems, storage mechanisms, and compression techniques. 

Experience building code-driven infrastructure on public cloud platforms, preferably AWS 

Understanding of SQL, dimensional modeling, and analytical data warehouses, like Snowflake, Redshift 

Knowledge of Data Modeling techniques and high volume ETL/ELT design. 

Familiar with workflow management tools, like Airflow and Oozie 

Experience with CI and code management tools like Git, Jenkins 

Familiar with BI tools, like Power BI, Looker, Qlikview 

Problem solver with excellent written and interpersonal skills; ability to make sound, complex decisions in a fast-paced, technical environment 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience 






Responsibilities 



You will be tasked with modernizing and expanding a critical set of existing systems 

You will need a product-focused mindset. It is essential for you to understand business requirements and architect systems that will scale and extend to accommodate those needs 

Break down complex problems, document technical solutions and sequence work to make fast, iterative improvements 

Build and scale data infrastructure that powers batch and real-time data processing of billions of records 

Develop CI/CD ETL pipelines using Jenkins for deployment and automation testing. 

Take ownership of ETL pipelines, own data quality for your areas, and ensure SLAs are met. 

Interface with data engineers, data scientists, product managers and all data stakeholders to understand their needs and promote best practices 


 


Good to have: 



Any Certification in Spark 

Good Understanding of AWS EMR ecosystem and deploying spark applications on EMR.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
• Lead technical team for multiple data ingestion and data integration projects from on-premise Netezza Datawarehouse, Hadoop based Big data environment, Kafka to the AWS EMR - S3 and Hive.

• Provide solution approach and build data pipeline to ingest data on AWS S3 / Hive database.

• Establish Production operationalization of the Applications or data ingestion Jobs using Apache Airflow in AWS Cloud Data Lake.

• Manage enablement of AWS services / tools like SageMaker Notebook / Studio, Apache Airflow / Managed Airflow, Hue, Athena, Red Shift, EMR / cluster spin using CDK process.

• Manage the AWS Platform and Release Management Process / Change Requests for the AWS Cloud Data Lake environments

industries: Computer Games

description:
MapYourProperty has a big goal – we’re out to change the way professionals in the real estate business find and assess development opportunities. Our mission is to turn a dinosaur industry on its head with a cutting-edge cloud platform and we’re off to a great start. MapYourProperty, in collaboration with a consortium of NGOs, has recently been approved to build an end to end intelligence platform to inform the affordable housing sector in an attempt to address the housing crisis in Canada. The final platform will empower users to make better, faster decisions about affordable housing development.




	Our focus is to expand our data coverage geographically, approaching new regions throughout Canada with innovative techniques in geospatial data mining and manipulation. We are working on developing a scalable ELT data pipeline and online platform across 16 cities in Canada. We are looking to hire a Geospatial Manager with a strong interest in geospatial data creation, a passion for real estate, urban planning and housing. MYP is backed by Techstars, the largest seed VC in the United States and Colliers International, the largest commercial brokerage in the world.  The firm services the top 5 residential developers, real estate brokerages, and municipal law firms in the Greater Toronto Area.  




	The Geospatial Manager will be leading the data team through our rapid expansion into multiple Canadian markets over the next year. The position requires the candidate to be both an overarching project visionary and planner as well as hands on with technical projects (ie. both managing and developing). This includes acquiring data from each region or local municipality, conducting raster and vector manipulation, and geospatial analysis on a North American scale. This role is currently remote, with weekly or bi-weekly meetings in Toronto. 





Responsibilities



Responsible for project management and supervising a team of GIS professionals

Create custom and standardized scripts in python and SQL languages

Edit and manipulate data using ArcGIS Pro or QGIS

Utilize open data and in-house data extraction techniques to manipulate geospatial data and produce high quality cartographic maps

Data storage and management - following best practices, incumbent will extract, maintain and load data from desktop to cloud environments

Manage data and upload to GIS web application sites such as Geoserver or ArcMap Online

Maintain PostGIS database using best data management practices for spatial data

Work with the data engineering team to automate data collection, extraction and creation techniques using 

Working with other team members to update and edit existing data or create new datasets in a collaborative environment






Qualifications



College or university degree in related discipline, minimum 3 year college graduate diploma/degree or other equivalent

Minimum of 3-7 years of experience working with ESRI, SQL, Python and online mapping applications

Minimum of 2-5 years of experience in proven people and project management 

PMP certification or equivalent preferred, considered a strong asset

Experience with PostGIS/PostGreSQL and basic SQL required

Experience with database management, working with Geoserver and Mapstore

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Excel is required

Must be able to work collaboratively and with other team members

Being organized & following data management practices is a necessity

Strong written and verbal communication skills are required

Previous experience in planning or policy mapping is considered an asset

Passionate about affordable housing and solving the housing crisis an asset

Strong interest in maps and geospatial data around real estate, urban planning, demographics, and affordable housing.





If you are interested and qualified for this position, please submit your cover letter and resume to myra@mapyourproperty.com with the subject 
‘MapYourProperty Geospatial Analyst’
. We encourage timely submissions as we will be reviewing resumes on a rolling basis. 





At MapYourProperty, we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it. MapYourProperty is an equal opportunity employer. Employment at MapYourProperty is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications directly related to professional competence. MapYourProperty does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law.

ABOUT YOU

You are energetic and driven. You are looking to join a team of people that works together, solves tough problems, challenges each other and trusts each other. You can see and communicate the outcome of technical discussions in the real world. Ultimately, you thrive being part of a small, very talented and motivated group developing the next generation technologies that will change how the world uses WiFi.




WHAT YOU’LL DO

You will work with partner companies along with the platform system integration team to develop Cognitive’s WiFi Motion™ on other platforms. In this highly dynamic position, you'll port software onto multiple platforms, while maintaining high code quality and reliability in the code release. You'll develop application code features as per product specifications and maintain code quality through tests and regressions. You'll own all engineering aspects of the task at hand, from scoping, research and development, testing and delivery. You are passionate about working on bleeding edge technologies and are pragmatic when it comes to system design. Curiosity about how things work will help you solve the challenges we face. While the work will initially focus on embedded systems, we provide growth opportunities for ambitious life-long learners.




WHAT YOU’LL NEED


Solid Python and C application experience with embedded systems

Linux shell scripting skills

Experience in embedded systems development

Experience with system application testing

Curiosity for understanding complex systems

Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders on Issues and release notes

Problem solving skills on multi-layered systems

Excellent organizational and time management skills

Familiarity with Git version control systems

Understanding of automated build systems

Ability to work from the office as required





BONUS POINTS FOR


Understanding of embedded dynamic linking for Linux systems

Project experience in C (socket communication) and building Linux distro

Understanding of Python internals

Experience with WiFi stack

Knowledge of container framework (e.g., Docker)





Don’t tick all the boxes? We believe that motivation and growth potential are highly valuable characteristics in a job candidate




WHY COGNITIVE SYSTEMS?

We are always on the look-out for bright, highly motivated and energetic A-players to join our team. We encourage an open and agile environment where creative thinking leads to ground-breaking achievements and innovations. We promote a healthy work-life balance in a flexible work setting – on site or remote. We offer competitive salaries, an excellent extended health care benefits plan, 4 weeks of paid vacation annually, a fitness and wellness credit, and we even provide a free catered lunch daily! Most importantly, we are committed to creating the best, most innovative and impactful technology that people will love.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
Job Description




Job Responsibilities



Strengthen and optimize our development environment and workflows by improving automation, code quality and processes while reducing overall build times

Create, maintain, improve, and evolve our Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery processes for new and existing services to reduce manual/repetitive tasks

Architect robust technical design solutions with a focus on quality, scalability, real-time processing, and availability

Work collaboratively with several development teams throughout the company and around the globe to help deliver end-to-end products and features that support our latest Automated Driving and Active Safety programs/features

Ensure continuous operation of delivered services and framework by quickly fixing issues and preventing future failures

Travel as required




Additional Job Description




Required Skills and Experience



3+ years of professional experience in software integration, CI/CD and/or DevOps with experience in tooling, infrastructure solutions and automated testing

Experience working within both Windows and Linux platforms

Experience with virtualization and container-based solutions (ie., Docker, Kubernetes)

Prior software development experience, preferably in C/C++ with exposure to bash, python and windows batch

Experience with CMake build configurations

Experience with GNU gcc (and derived compiler toolchain)

Strong knowledge of Jenkins, pipelines and use of GIT-based review management tools

Experience providing guidance, leadership, and mentoring to team members

Ability to independently investigate issues based on limited information, demonstrating high level of analytical ability to resolve complex problems

Creative, disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery, and schedule commitment

Strong leadership and interpersonal communication skills




Preferred Skills And Experience




Strong understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain

Experience with Automotive Communication Protocols (Ethernet/CAN/LIN)

Experience with SAFe methodologies

Experience in working with distributed teams situated globally

Experience with the QNX OS and build toolchain QCC

Experience with Adaptive AUTOSAR service-based vehicle platform

Experience with Unit Test tools e.g. (CppUTest, Google Test etc) and respective Jenkins plugins



About GM



Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.


Why Join Us


We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.


Diversity Information


General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement


Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

job_title: Analyste Intelligence d'affaires, Chaine d'approvisionnement / Supply Chain Business Intelligence Analyst
industries: Airlines and Aviation
description:
Qui sommes-nous? : 


Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde. C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un cœur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde. Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel. C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.





Description de la fonction: 


L'analyste de la chaîne d'approvisionnement et d’intelligence d’affaire travaillera avec l'équipe d'analyse et de gestion des données au sein de l'organisation Logistique Globale & Planification d'activité intégrée. Le candidat participera à la collecte, à la documentation et à l'analyse des besoins d’entreprises et devra diriger des projets d'analyse de données pour répondre à ces exigences. Pour ce faire, il doit être capable de mener à bien le cycle complet d'analyse qui comprend : une analyse des besoins rigoureuse, une très bonne compréhension des données SAP, le développement du modèle conceptuel, la programmation, la visualisation des données et la communication. En outre, le candidat travaillera avec le scientifique de la chaîne d'approvisionnement pour appliquer des concepts avancés d'ingénierie industrielle, d'intelligence artificielle et de recherche opérationnelle afin d'améliorer la performance globale de la chaîne d'approvisionnement. 





Énoncés de responsabilité: 



Recueillir, analyser et documenter les besoins d’entreprises

Concevoir des solutions d'analyse commerciale pour les problèmes complexes de la chaîne d'approvisionnement.

Développer des bases de données, des rapports, et des outils d'analyse (tableaux de bord, modèles statistiques, algorithmes.)

Développer et mettre en œuvre des indicateurs de performance et des tableaux de bord visuels pour aider le processus décisionnel de l'entreprise.

Effectuer une programmation complexe en SQL Server, Hive et Python.

Contribuer à la numérisation des rapports d'activité

Assurer le coaching et la formation des utilisateurs finaux 

Répondre a des demandes ponctuelles






Qualifications requises: 



Baccalauréat avec plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans la planification de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, la gestion des stocks, la prévision de la demande, le génie industriel ou la veille économique.

Master ou certification en Business Intelligence ou Data Science (atout majeur)

Forte expérience dans la conception et l'utilisation de SQL Server et Hadoop.

Forte expérience des outils d'analyse et de visualisation BI (requis)

Connaissance de SAP (requis)

Expérience dans le domaine de la chaîne d'approvisionnement (requis)

Forte communication et auto-motivation pour répondre aux exigences de l'entreprise ;

Solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes

Compétences en gestion de projet (approche agile)

Bilingue, doit parler couramment l'anglais (oral et écrit)

Domaine d'études : Génie industriel, gestion de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, gestion des opérations, science des données, intelligence artificielle.






Ce qui vous attend 



Programme de congé à rémunération différée

Garderie pour jeunes enfants

Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation

Horaires flexibles

Programmes et formations sur le leadership

Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite

Programme d’aide de financement pour les congés parentaux

Programme de reconnaissance et de récompense






Diversité et inclusion: 


Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.








Who we are:


At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed – and will continue to transform – the world. That’s why we work with an explorer’s heart and a perfectionist’s grit to design, build, and service the world’s most advanced aircraft engines. We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers. This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.





Function Description: 


The Supply Chain and BI analyst will work with the Analytics & Data Management team in Global Logistics and Integrated Business Planning organization. The candidate will participate in the collection, documentation and analysis of the business requirements and will lead data analytics projects to meet these requirements. This requires being able to conduct the complete analytics cycle which includes: rigorous business analysis, very good understanding of SAP data, development of the conceptual model, programming, data visualization and communication. Also, the candidate will work with the Supply Chain Scientist to apply advanced Industrial Engineering concepts, Artificial intelligence and Operations Research to improve the overall Supply Chain performance. 





Responsibility Statements: 



Gather, analyze and document the business requirements

Design business analytics solutions for complex supply chain problems

Develop databases, reports, and analytics tools (dashboards, statistical models, algorithms.)

Develop and implement performance indicators and visual dashboards to help business decisional process.

Perform complex programming in SQL Server, Hive and Python

Contribute to the digitalization of business reports

Provide coaching and training to the end users 

Support ad-hoc requests






Qualifications required:



Bachelor degree with over 3 years' experience in Supply Chain Planning, Inventory Management, Demand Forecasting, Industrial Engineering or Business Intelligence

Master Degree or Certification in Business Intelligence or Data Science (strong asset)

Strong experience with design and use of SQL Server and Hadoop

Strong experience with BI analytics and visualization tools (required)

Knowledge of SAP (required)

Experience in supply chain (required)

Strong communication and self-motivation to meet the business requirements;

Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Project Management skills (agile approach)

Bilingual, must be fluent in English (oral and written)


Field of studies:
 Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Operations Management, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence






What we offer:



Long-term deferred compensation programs

Daycare for young children

Advancement programs to enhance education skills

Flexible work schedules

Leadership and training programs

Comprehensive benefits, savings and pension plans

Financial support for parental leave

Reward programs for outstanding work






Diversity and inclusion: 


The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

This job application remains open even when we don't have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening


The Moving Picture Company (MPC) is a global creative studio with a single goal: to create experiences that move people. With decades of storytelling experience, we are perpetually pushing the limits of what is technologically and artistically possible to tell visually stunning stories.

MPC continues to lead in an ever-evolving industry, building authentic and long-lasting connections with audiences across all channels.


Job Description


The 
Compositing 

Technical

 Director
 is a developer who creates and maintains Python, PySide, and C++ tools which interface with Foundry’s Nuke, Autodesk’s Shotgun, and proprietary software, to support compositing artists working in a VFX pipeline. Compositing TDs work directly with Compositing Supervisors and the Department Head to design and build tools and workflows to improve the efficiency of compositing artists and automate tasks.

Under the direction of the Department Head, your main missions will be:


Develop, document, and maintain Python tools, PySide UIs, Nuke Gizmos, C++ NDK plugins, Flask webapps, etc. 

Support show production with troubleshooting and custom development 

Determine, design, document and maintain re-usable code modules 

Write documentation for existing tools 

Design and deliver training to artists on our tools 

Submit your own code for code reviews and review other’s code 

Communicate technical issues to IT 


Prior experience with Nuke, Shotgun, or compositing is preferred but not required.


Minimum Qualifications



Qualifications


2+ years experience with:


Python

PySide/PyQt/Qt

Git and collaborative workflows (code review, standards, etc.)

Linux


Experience with some or all of:


Nuke, the Nuke Python API, Nuke Gizmos, BlinkScript

Shotgun Python API

Tractor API

C++, especially Nuke’s NDK

Flask webapps, including JavaScript/AJAX/reactive UIs




Desired Qualifications



Knowledge of the overall VFX or Animation pipeline

Strong Nuke skills

Experience as a compositing artist

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even imagine yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling, and fun.

Robotics Digital Solutions and Technologies is looking for an innovative, customer-obsessed Business Intelligence Engineer to join the Software, Systems & Data Science team in support of business scaling to deliver the next generation of robots. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, relishes having a hand in the future of robotics and is able to adapt and excel in a highly ambiguous environment. This role requires a unique combination of engineering know how, problem solving, curiosity, innovation, leadership, and effective communication.

Key job responsibilities


 Actively support and foster a culture of inclusion

 Collaborate with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Program Managers to define and deliver analytics tools and insights

 Use a combination of unified and disparate data sources to develop automated data visualizations

 Work with partner teams to refine the BI and visualization space across Robotics

 Lead technical excellence across the Data team raising the quality bar of all output

 Look for opportunities to simplify and automate redundant processes as well as tools to allow customers to self-educate and self-service data

 Translate the requirements of the stakeholders into technical requests to the partner tech teams





Basic Qualifications




 Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools

 3+ years analyzing and interpreting data and experience with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc.

 Experience in writing complex SQL queries

 Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines

 Bachelors in quantitative field (Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent)

 Advanced knowledge in writing and optimizing SQL to handle extremely large datasets

 Ability to consume and manipulate large data sets and articulate its business impact




Preferred Qualifications




 Familiarity with AWS and big data analytic tools (EMR, AWS Athena)

 Understanding of data warehousing and data modeling

 Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment

 Working knowledge in scripting with R/Python for statistical analysis


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1971384

Mandatory requirements:



A minimum of 2 years experience as a full-stack software developer (front-end and back-end) using modern languages, frameworks and JavaScript.

A minimum of 1 years experience working on Python and TypeScript.

Experience developing with an API gateway using service providers.

A minimum of 3 years Experience working as part of an agile team of which one year must be using scrum to incrementally deliver value for the users of a product or digital service.

Experience migrating digital services from legacy environments such as mainframe, and/or client/server to modern environments leveraging techniques/tools such as DevOps, Kubernetes, container and microservices based architectures.

Experience with RESTful API development, composition APIs management and integration.

Have experience working with cloud technologies






Preferred requirements:



Experience with search technologies, such as SOLR, Elasticsearch, Google Cloud Search.

Have delivered systems built in Flask, Vue.js and Nuxt.js.

Know JSONSchema.

Have delivered APIs that are OAS v3 compliant via Apigee.

Be fluent with PL/SQL, Oracle and PostgreSQL databases.

Have created and delivered training to customers on the items listed in the mandatory and preferable sections.

Have created technical documentation, diagrams and RFCs.

Have worked in an SRE environment.

Have knowledge of and implemented observability.

Have experience working on OpenShift platform

description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




 What You’ll Be Doing 


You’ll be joining CIBC’s Capital Markets, Global Derivatives Technology team. You will be responsible for providing analysis and second level support on client issues, technical issues, system/web site outages and questions from all Internal and External application by maintaining, prioritization and addressing to respective CIBC Technology groups and Vendors. You will also be responsible for maintaining the production applications and day-to-day operational activities, manage escalations and modify established procedures / approaches to suit specific situations.



How You’ll Succeed




 Problem Resolution : Identify and resolve high to critically complex production problems for support of applications. Make decisions and think critically when solving problems.

 Collaborate : Work closely with Business Analysts and Developers on bug fixes and new product releases that will be added to our supported portfolio. Advise on and research all aspects of effective and efficient application or technical service delivery.

 Relationship Management : Establish and build healthy working relations with the line of business we support as well as other related teams; work with external vendors and various technical teams to restore service during outages and to perform application validation after regular infrastructure maintenance. Communicate effectively with others verbally, recognizing that its more than just language but tone and style. Influence others to impact decisions and behaviors internally and with external vendors.

 Monitoring : Monitor and analyze services to identify opportunities for improvement and recommend solutions.




Who You Are




 You can demonstrate experience with: 5+ years of experience in a technology role (Support/Dev/BA/QA) for a Front Office Trading Application (Buy-Side or Sell-Side; Fixed Income Derivatives / Equity Derivatives exposure preferred). Strong technical trouble-shooting ability including knowledge of approaches, tools and techniques for anticipating, recognizing, and resolving technical (software, application or operational) problems and interpreting server logs. Expertise writing SQL queries for day to day troubleshooting and for creating adhoc reports as required. 

 Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

 You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

 You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

 You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.

 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.




What CIBC Offers



At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:


 Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

 Connect :Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

 Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning

 Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan




What You Need To Know

job_title: Sr. Business Analyst, Treasury Data Advisory & Solutions
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




What You’ll Be Doing


The successful candidate will be a key member of the Treasury Data Advisory & Solutions. As a Senior Business Analyst, the individual will be gathering requirements from the Treasury Stakeholders and translating them into transformation rules and/or developing ETL in our vendor's application (QRM Management Repository).The individual will also be supporting the production processes to ensure seamless end-to-end cycle and helping the BAU team to investigate or solve any production issues.


At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.




How You’ll Succeed




Business analysis: Work closely with Business partners to gather complex business requirements and lead the solution design discussions. Build strong relationships, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements. Use creative thinking to select the most suitable procedure/approach that provides the optimum solution to business problems.

Design and Development: Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions. Develop and maintain streamlined ETL processes in QRM/MR application. Test, debug, document, and manage changes to ensure the successful implementation of the application.

Leading and Mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve operational and process problems.




Who You Are




You can demonstrate experience in requirements analysis and solution design. You also have proven experience in areas of data warehousing, relational databases and Financial Reporting. Proficiency in SQL, VBScript, MS Access and Excel. SQL Advanced level is required and experience with Quantitative Risk Management (QRM) system is an asset.

You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business and technical problems and recommend solutions.

You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do.

You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

 Values matter to you . You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 




What CIBC Offers



At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.


We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.




What You Need To Know




 CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
ARE YOU READY to step up and take your technology expertise to the next level? 


There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that’s why we love it here! This is an extraordinary chance to create a rewarding career at 
Accenture Technology
. Working in a digitally-driven, innovation-led environment where you can help clients shift to the New using leading-edge technologies on some of the coolest projects you can imagine.


Delivery Excellence is an exciting and growing team to be part of! 
We have highly developed project management skills that fit in to nearly all types of client projects, from Business Process Outsourcing to new Application Development. We focus on delivery excellence, creating repeatable, efficient, scalable, delivery solutions in which we are sourced to support global projects with over 500 clients.


The Business Analyst (BA) or Product Analyst (PA)
 is responsible for optimizing business processes, analyzing data and defining requirements for technology solutions in projects or products. The role requires taking an unstructured business problem and produce and present clear, fact-based recommendations to the business partners, and ease their transition towards implementation.The recommendation could include an organizational structure, a people training, a process change, and modifications to business rules or implementation of new technology, or a combination of all.


WORK YOU’LL DO 


The BA/PA will utilize broad business and technology to recommend and implement solutions which address business needs.


Demonstrated ability to elicit, document, prioritize and define business needs and requirements in complex scenarios and/or enterprise analysis (multiple stakeholders across departments, unstandardized or undocumented processes, multiple systems, inter-related initiatives, etc.)



Proficient in process mapping, process modelling and/or process standardization



Familiar with process mapping techniques and process documentation standards (i.e. BPM)



Ability to translate a product vision into a roadmap of features/steps to develop and/or maintain



Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)



Demonstrated ability to communicate with and influence all levels of management



Demonstrated leadership skills



Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills



Structured and organized



Understanding of project management lifecycle, practices and methodologies



Team player



Flexible and quick to adapt to priorities



Excellent Microsoft tools knowledge (ex. Excel, Power Point, Visio, Word)



WHO WE´RE LOOKING FOR?



Previous experience with mapping process modelling



Demonstrated proficiency in MS Excel, MS PowerPoint



2-5 years’ related experience, Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required



Proficiency in Agile delivery



Advanced proficiency in English required



WHAT´S IN IT FOR YOU? 



Competitive benefits, including a fair and balanced parental leave policy.



Fantastic opportunities to develop your career across industries, local and global clients Performance Achievement and Career Mentorship – our performance management process that focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities.



Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
483928BR


Introduction


Menez IBM vers l'avenir en traduisant les exigences systèmes dans la conception et l'élaboration de systèmes personnalisés dans un environnement agile. Le succès d'IBM est entre vos mains au fur et à mesure que vous transformez les besoins d'affaires essentiels en code et que vous stimulez l'innovation. Votre travail fortifiera mondialement IBM et ses clients, par la collaboration et l'intégration de code dans les systèmes d'entreprise. Vous aurez accès à la formation, aux outils et aux technologies les plus récents, et à un cheminement de carrière illimité avec le chef de file mondial de la technologie. Venez chez IBM et ayez un impact à l'échelle planétaire!

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

En tant que Concepteur d'architecture Fiabilité des sites Nuage hybride d'IBM, vous aiderez nos clients à transformer et à automatiser leurs paysages opérationnels existants et en évolution pour accroître la fiabilité et l'agilité de leurs activités.


Vous Pouvez




Mettre au point des outils, des alertes et des réponses efficaces visant à identifier et éliminer les risques de fiabilité, y compris des outils de détection et d'atténuation des problèmes automatiques.

Contribuer à la conception et à la création de systèmes nouveaux et évolutifs, y compris de systèmes à réparation automatique.

Dépanner et améliorer les systèmes distribués à grande échelle. 

Conseiller les équipes répondant aux incidents majeurs.

Communiquer avec les équipes produits pour résoudre les pannes de production et prendre des mesures pour améliorer la fiabilité future.

Créer des processus automatisés à partir de cahiers d'exécution.



En tant qu'employé du chef de file mondial de la technologie, vous aurez accès à une formation, à des outils et à une technologie d'avant-garde et à un plan de déroulement de carrière illimité. Vous apprendrez les dernières technologies et outils pour les systèmes à réparation automatique et à fiabilité automatique, FinOps, AIOps, Edge computing et DataOps.

Expertise professionnelle et technique requise



Maîtrise de l'anglais (oral et écrit)

Maîtrise de l'anglais et du français pour Montréal et les régions du Québec

Solide expérience et expertise dans le développement et l'exploitation des plateformes infonuagiques hybrides, avec une ou plusieurs plateformes infonuagiques (AWS, Azure, GCP, IBM Cloud) et des technologies de plateforme d'orchestration de conteneurs telles que Kubernetes et OpenShift/Mentalité orientée DevOps.

Min 5 ans d'expérience confirmée de la résolution de problèmes d'ingénierie difficiles grâce à des interventions pratiques.

Bonnes compétences en génie logiciel; idéalement, possède de l'expérience dans Python, Go ou Java.

Compréhension du fonctionnement interne des systèmes Linux, bonne connaissance des piles TCP/IP, du routage réseau et de l'équilibrage de charge.

Compréhension de la sécurité, des certificats, de TLS

Capacité de faire du dépannage de façon systématique et grand sens des responsabilités, quelle que soit la tâche.

Bonne compréhension des modèles mathématiques et statistiques pour évaluer les tendances.

Capacité de trouver la cause fondamentale de l'instabilité dans un système distribué à fort trafic.

Expérience dans la configuration et le dépannage de systèmes Linux, Java/Scala et Docker.

Compréhension des aspects touchant la fiabilité des systèmes complexes à grande échelle.

Passionné de la résolution de problèmes de fiabilité et de la définition de stratégies visant à les atténuer.

Volonté de travailler dans un environnement en perpétuel changement.

Vous êtes passionné par l'automatisation et les innovations qui améliorent la productivité.

Connaissance des microservices, des technologies événementielles, de la conception API, des serveurs Web, des bases de données relationnelles et NoSQL.

Raisonnement systématique de bout en bout - Bonne compréhension des architectures d'entreprise et des systèmes (en arrière-plan) complexes (comprendre plus que le composant lui-même).



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié



Expérience avec de nombreuses technologies telles que : Java, Go, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Python/Ansible, IBM Cloud/AWS/Azure/Google, Ruby, Redis, PostgreSQL, Nginx, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, Telegraf, Sensu, Debian, PowerDNS, BIND, InfluxDB, SSL (OpenSSL), Grafana, haproxy, keepalived, Solr, Scala, Kafka, JVMs, RDBMS, NoSQL, Tomcat, WebSphere, WebLogic.

Expérience de la résolution de problèmes de fiabilité et de la définition de stratégies visant à les atténuer.

Connaissance des pratiques GitOps, AIOps et FinOps.

Expérience en création d'applications sur des infrastructures infonuagiques, par exemple, des nuages privés ou publics

Expérience travail dans une équipe agile

Expérience avec les principes « build to manage » (développer pour gérer).



Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Services est une équipe de conseillers d'affaires, de stratégie et de technologie qui conçoivent, construisent, et exploitent des systèmes de base et des services qui constituent l'épine dorsale de l'économie mondiale. IBM Services fait équipe avec les plus grandes entreprises du monde dans plus de 170 pays afin de bâtir des affaires plus intelligentes en repensant et en réinventant par la technologie, avec ses méthodologies axées sur les résultats, son portefeuille de pointe et son expertise en recherche et en activités de calibre mondial qui mènent à une innovation axée sur les résultats et à une excellence durable.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

job_title: Vehicle Connectivity Test Engineer, Voice Services
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Motor Vehicle Manufacturing
description:
Who We Are



Ford was built on the belief that freedom of movement drives human progress. As we look to the future and the changing needs of society, we are committed to becoming the world’s most trusted mobility company – delivering smart vehicles for a smart world. Join our team as we create tomorrow! We believe in putting people first, working together, and facing challenges head-on.



The Role



The TCU Software Development Team, within Enterprise Connectivity, is looking for a Software & System Test Engineer, focused on Voice Services.

The successful candidate will validate functionality pertaining to vehicle’s voice-calling services, running on the built-in cellular modem (TCU). These services consist of Emergency Calling (a.k.a. “eCall”) and Customer Care Calling (available in Ride Sharing Autonomous Vehicles).

If you want to expand your technical knowledge on CAN Networking, Vehicle Diagnostics, Telecommunications (e.g. Cellular, IMS Protocols) and related technologies (e.g. GNSS), improve troubleshooting and maybe do some python scripting along the way, this role is for you!



Your Impact




design detailed and quality test procedures (TCU standalone and system level testing);

support development teams, validating new feature implementation and bug fixes;

support downstream teams such as system test teams, feature owners and vehicle programs;

review and contribute to test strategy of other domains, to ensure thorough test coverage and system-level robustness;

triage, troubleshoot and log issues related to the TCU or other ECU’s Software bugs;

execute and report test results timely, to support periodic software releases into vehicle programs;

develop test automation and/or support automation developers working on these features.




What You’ll Need




BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: 



Bachelor’s degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering or Computer Science (Successful candidates will be required to provide proof of degree completion for the highest level of education attained. If the degree was obtained from a school outside of Canada, an Education Credential Assessment report showing Canadian equivalency is also required.)

3+ years of working experience in related role(s): product development, test design and execution, debugging logs, network management, etc.;

3+ years of working experience with Linux, QNX or Android OS




Preferred Qualifications



Experience working in telecommunications and networking areas:


3GPP cellular standards,

Network emulators,

In-vehicle eCall or infotainment systems,

GNSS technologies,


Modem Configuration and Logging Tools.

Software development and defect management tools and processes (Git, Agile, JIRA, TestRail),

Master’s degree in relevant field,

Experience automating test cases using Python,

Experience working with microcontrollers,

Excellent Oral and Written Communication.


We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Ford of Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to a culturally diverse workforce. Accommodations for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment, selection and / or assessment processes, where needed, are available upon request. Please inform Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.

Candidates for this position must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Ford Motor Company of Canada, Limited does not sponsor work permit applications.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Test Developer, Algorithms




About The Team



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


Who you are



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across.



What you will do 




Technical




Design, develop, and support automated tests and corresponding infrastructure enhancements

Analyze, scope, review, and estimate test development activities

Develop test strategies and plans




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where testers and developers share the same objectives.



What we are looking for 




Required




4+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Strong programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.
