industries: Software Development, Wireless Services, and Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Machine Learning Engineering



General Summary



This individual creates advanced machine learning techniques that enable a broad set of technology verticals or designs and extends training or runtime frameworks or model efficiency software tools with new features and optimizations. This individual may also model, architect, and develop advanced machine learning hardware (co-designed with machine learning software) for inference or training solutions. These enable the discovery and improvement of state-of-the-art machine learning solutions that has general applicability at functional platform level towards audio, camera, graphics, video, sensors, wireless, and other functionality over various operating systems running on ARM processors and other embedded hardware like DSP/NSP processors, GPU processors that are embedded into mobile, edge, auto, and IOT products, or on data center based systems such as GPUs or dedicated AI hardware. Other responsibilities include developing optimized software to enable AI models efficiently deployed on hardware, such as machine learning kernels, compiler tools, or model efficiency tools, to make sure of specific hardware features, and/or working closely with hardware teams for joint design and development. In this regard, the individual may need to work with and/or optimize machine learning software frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch to efficiently run machine learning algorithms on hardware.



The Responsibilities Of This Role Include




 Working under some supervision.

 Providing some supervision/guidance to others.

 Taking responsibility for own work and making decisions with limited impact; impact of decisions is readily apparent; errors made typically only impact timeline (i.e., require additional time to correct).

 Using verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question. May require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc.

 Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions).

 Completing most tasks with multiple steps which can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework.

 Exercising creativity to draft original documents, imagery, or work products within established guidelines.

 Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or conflicting; advanced data analysis and interpretation skills are required.

 May be solicited during strategic planning period.





The Responsibilities Of This Role Do Not Include




 Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility).





Principal Duties And Responsibilities




 Participates in and shares own perspective within domain of machine learning subject matter expertise in design or project reviews, and project meetings.

 Takes responsibility for small projects or owns part of a larger project and completes tasks in a timely manner according to project requirements; seeks assistance when needed to solve problems and helps other team members; collaborates with cross-functional peers on tasks when needed.

 Completes complex tasks and solves issues related to the engineering and management of machine learning data with minimal guidance from more experienced engineers.

 Develops, adapts, or prototypes complex machine learning algorithms, models, or frameworks aligned with and motivated by product proposals or roadmaps with minimal guidance from more experienced engineers.

 Conducts complex experiments to train and evaluate machine learning models and/or software independently.

 Creates and executes complex methods to optimize new or existing machine learning algorithms, models, kernels, and execution frameworks; suggests possible solutions to issues and documents lessons learned.

 Assists with the integration of machine learning algorithms into a platform or product for production; helps resolve issues during implementation.

 Seeks essential knowledge of machine learning industry trends, competitors' products, and advances within area of expertise from publicly available information and research; shares this information with others on the team.





Physical Requirements




Frequently transports between offices, buildings and campuses up to ½ mile.

Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs.

Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting).

Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.

Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers and vendors both in person and remotely.





Education




Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering, Bachelors - Information Systems



Work Experiences



2+ years Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience.



Skills




Certifications:




Education




Preferred Qualifications


Masters - Computer Science, Masters - Engineering, Masters - Information Systems



Work Experiences



1+ years of experience with low level interactions between operating systems (e.g., Linux, Android, QNX) and Hardware ,2+ years experience with one or more programming language suitable for machine learning (e.g., Python, R, C, C++). ,2+ years of experience working in a large matrixed organization. ,1+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above). ,2+ years experience with Machine Learning frameworks (e.g.,Tensor Flow, Caffe, Caffe 2, Pytorch, Keras) ,2+ years experience in embedded system development and optimization with application to a specific problem domain in ML (e.g., NLP, multi-media). ,2+ years experience using statistics and probability (e.g., conditional probability, Bayes rule)



Skills



AI Frameworks, Calculus, Data Manipulation, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Performance Optimization, Python, Statistics


Applicants
: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to 
accommodationsupport



To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies
: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.

If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Financial Services
description:
Our client, 
a major financial software company
, is looking for a 
Digital Business Analyst
, to join their team in Mississauga, ON!





**This begins as a 6 month contract with an opportunity to extend or convert at any time**






Responsibilities:



Driving business strategy: You will collaborate with Go To Market, Product, and design teams to ensure reporting solutions are scalable, repeatable, effective, and meet the expectations of various stakeholders and leaders.

Provide ongoing recommendations to leadership utilizing complex data, business knowledge, and strategic assumptions when data doesn’t exist Identifying opportunities and influencing partners to act:

Partner with a cross-functional team to develop hypotheses and experiments to leverage data and technology to deliver better outcomes for customers through deeply personalized experiences.

Own Performance reporting for Go To Market initiatives that include providing analytics on various marketing channels including search, email, social, and partners.

Participate in test strategies and support the execution of web/mobile experiences and marketing experiments through robust A/B testing.

You will build reports to drive discussions, facilitate decision making, and actionable insights by partnering with data engineering to scale and automate analytics on new products and initiatives

Partner with cross-functional teams to influence the overall mobile strategy for both product and Go To Market.

Partner with product teams to understand the mobile app performance and identify opportunities, support in-product experimentation strategy and execution plan by providing actionable insights.

Develop scenarios of success KPI/Metrics and assumptions.

Own performance dashboards for Mobile strategy and partner with other analysts on the team to provide E2E insights.





Requirements: 


Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Data Analytics, Finance, Advanced Analytics, or related field preferred

3+ years of experience working with marketing analytics, web analytics, mobile analytics, customer care analytics, or other customer experience analytics

Advanced proficiency in SQL, A/B Testing, and Data Visualization (Tableau, Qlkiview).

Familiarity with Marketing Analytics Tools (MMM, MTA, Braze, Segment, Adobe, Google Analytics, etc) 

Experience in defining metrics and instrumenting data tracking

Ability to simplify stories with data, and be concise in the insights and how they drive outcomes with leadership and stakeholders





If you are actively looking for a new position and open to hearing more about the role, send me over your resume!

industries: Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Reliability Engineer

GaN Systems is the global leader in GaN power semiconductors with the largest portfolio of transistors that uniquely address the needs of today’s most demanding industries including data center servers, renewable energy systems, automotive, industrial motors, and consumer electronics.

As a market-leading innovator, GaN Systems makes possible the design of smaller, lower cost, more efficient power systems. The company’s award-winning products provide system design opportunities free from the limitations of yesterday’s silicon. By changing the rules of transistor performance, GaN Systems is enabling power conversion companies to revolutionize their industries and transform the world. 





Responsibilities:





· Drive qualification and reliability testing for GaN products

· Interact with design/marketing/operations to develop appropriate qualification plans

· Develop test plans and procedures to test and calculate product lifetime

· Interface with external test houses and suppliers

· Develop root cause analysis of reliability test, initiate failure analysis work and propose corrective actions

· Prepare qualification/Reliaility reports/ papers for both internal and external customers

· Function as a technical resource for reliability lab operations

· Coordinate logistics in preparing samples, allocating test time, reviewing test data, initiating the FA process





Required Skills & Experience:





· MSC or PhD in microelectronics, physics or a related engineering discipline with 3+ years of experience as a Reliability, Product, Package or Process EngineerGaN HEMT Technology development and reliability knowledge

 · Strong data analysis skills, multi-tasking and attention to details required

 · Knowledge of programming using LabView, VB, or Python preferred

 · Customer and vendor management skills

 · Ability to work well in cross-functional teams in a fast-paced collaborative team environment




GaN Systems is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We strive to select the best qualified applicant for any opening and to reward employees based on their skills, experience and performance. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, pregnancy status, marital status, gender, age, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Software Engineer in Test (SDET), Algorithms - Remote
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
At Kinaxis, who we are is grounded in our common belief that people matter. Each one of us plays an important part in accomplishing our work, building our culture and making a global impact.

Every day, we’re empowered to work together to help our customers make fast, confident planning decisions. This is how we create a better planet – for each other, for our customers and for generations to come. Our cloud-based platform RapidResponse ensures that the products we need – everything from medicine and cars, to day-to-day items like toothpaste – make it to market and into our hands when we need them with minimal ecological footprint.

We make the world better, and you can too.


Software Engineer in Test (SDET), Algorithms




About The Team 



The Business Algorithms team at Kinaxis creates customized solutions to optimize supply chains. Ever wonder how the hundreds of parts in your new smart phone come together from different suppliers all over the world? Kinaxis solves problems like that every day.

Our customers have terabytes of data that needs to be analyzed for the largest supply chains imaginable. Our algorithms move the global economy-- in seconds, not hours, or days.

It’s Big Data with an impact; Data Science on the front lines.

The Algorithms team works in a dynamic environment where real life supply chain challenges are being translated into complex algorithms that are coded, tested and released to world-wide known manufactures. Developers and Test engineers are working together to achieve high quality supply chain solutions, develop Next Generation frameworks to address testing complexity, and interact with Product Managers and customers on a daily basis.

We believe in the DevOps culture – we serve our own tools, frameworks, infrastructure. Automation is certainly at the top of our priority list.


 Who you are 



You thrive on delivering a quality product to customers and care deeply about testing best practices and efficient test strategies.

You enjoy complex logic/algorithms, working with Big Data.

You are driven by customer success, love to participate in customer-facing projects.

You prefer a fast-paced agile work environment and take pride in finding product defects.

You approach testing with creative ideas and innovative techniques.

You collaborate with Software Developers and Product Managers, and your passion is to identify and solve product gaps.

You’re a strong believer in Continuous Integration, and the DevOps mindset

You communicate fluidly, at the level of your audience, and seek to understand and be understood.

You like working in teams, mentoring, and sharing neat things you come across. 



 What you will do 




Technical




Drive development/testing processes by introducing Next Generation frameworks

Enhance existing automation tools and test infrastructure

Design, develop, and support automated tests

Architect, implement and improve state of the art tools for Continuous Delivery.




Customer Facing




Learn Supply Chain business challenges and contribute to testing relevant Use Cases / Business Processes.

Participate in requirements elaboration and review product specifications.

Translate requirements into Test Strategies and Test Cases

Interact with Rapid Response customers directly and indirectly through Product Managers.




Process Oriented




Improve processes and efficiency of the team, always look for opportunities to strengthen the team.

Share your knowledge and mentor less experienced team members.




Team Player




 Be part of the amazing, collaborative, and supportive Business Algorithms Team that is practicing true Agile where QAs and developers share the same objectives. 



 What we are looking for  




Required




7+ years of experience in software test development and automation functions.

A degree in engineering and/or applied science.

Solid programming and scripting languages experience (Python, C#, .Net). 

Exceptionally strong analytical skills and experience working with complex data

Proficiency in requirements elaboration and test plans creation.

Ability to search for and structure information regarding complex processes / functionality.

The ability to ‘think outside of the box’ is crucial in this fast-paced environment 

Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills

Adaptable and flexible to changing priorities

Self-starter with strong initiative and results orientation




Definite Assets




Exposure to manufacturing/fulfillment/BI/Workforce Management/financial business requirements/practices. 

Knowledge of C++/Java

Familiarity with Jenkins CI/CD and release pipelines.

Knowledge and experience in relational database design and usage.

Experience working in agile development environment.



What we have to offer



Challenging Work - We love solving highly complex problems. And as the global leaders in our industry, we never stop innovating—our work is never “done. That’s because across our teams and in all roles, every employee is empowered to bring their best ideas forward and to jump in and solve the problems they’re passionate about.

Great People - We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously! It’s in our DNA to celebrate, laugh, and have fun. We are stronger, together, when we are open, honest, and above all, real. Every person is valued here and plays an important role in our shared success.

Global Impact - As a global team spanning continents, boundaries, and cultures, every day we are inspired by the impact our work has on our colleagues, our customers, our communities, and the world at large.

 Diversity, Equity and Inclusion - Diversity, equity and inclusion are more than words to us. They are the guiding principles for building a culture where we celebrate each others’ differences, continuously strive for equality and recognize that inclusion makes us stronger as individuals, a company and a global citizen. 


For more information, visit the Kinaxis web site at www.kinaxis.com or the company’s blog at http://blog.kinaxis.com/ .

Kinaxis strongly encourages diverse candidates to apply to our welcoming community. We strive to make our website and application process accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact Human Resources at accommodations@kinaxis.com . This contact information is for accessibility requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
Position Title: 
Enterprise Architect


 


Our very reputable Insurance Client based in Winnipeg Manitoba is looking for an Enterprise Architect to join their team for a full-time role. The ideal candidate must be willing to live or relocate to Manitoba. 


 


This role will be helping to lead an enterprise-wide Cloud (Azzure) migration journey from it's initial phases to delivery. 


 




SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND SCOPE 




 



Reporting to the Director, Enterprise Architecture, the Enterprise Architect is an advisor to the business, supporting business strategy and planning with a focus on the three-five-year roadmap. This role will be leading an enterprise-wide Cloud Migration journey. 



 



The Enterprise Architect is responsible for establishing the technology strategy and roadmap that enables a portfolio to support current and future business capabilities. This is achieved by working with business owners and Lean Portfolio Management to manage the enterprise portfolio, business epics and technology enablers, linking how change opportunities bring the corporation closer to the five-year ambition.



 



The Enterprise Architect:



· Makes decisions that have a major impact on the Corporation’s ability to attain its strategic directions while maintaining a rationalized portfolio that achieves synergy across the enterprise.



· 
Provides direction to individual work units on what are acceptable tactical objectives and plans how to move from tactical to the strategic architectural objectives.


· 
Works closely with leaders of the corporation to modernize and optimize lines of business and address and respond to market disruptors.


· 
Is responsible for monitoring and adopting technology innovations into the corporation’s technical footprint.

 

The Enterprise Architect needs to keep abreast of technology developments that affect systems, particularly those that are strategic in terms of corporate goals and direction. The position needs to understand how peer companies and agencies are leveraging new technologies, so that the Corporation can be positioned to be a “fast follower”.

 


 NATURE
 
AND
 
SCOPE



 



Enterprise Architecture 70%



· Collaborates with Lean Portfolio Management to provide a high-level vision of enterprise solutions and development initiatives.



· 
Reviews, develops, and implements architecture policies and principles.


· 
Builds and maintains a high-level enterprise model of systems, capabilities, and underlying technologies, current and future, that can be the basis for business and IT architecture direction that guides portfolio management.


· 
Assists the Agile Program Management Office (APMO) and Lean-Agile Centre of Excellence (LACE) to identify and design development value streams.


· 
Supports the value streams with adherence to the budget guardrails for retiring solutions (horizon 0).


· 
Participates in the strategy for building and maintaining the architectural runway via Enabler Epics.


· 
Understands and communicates Strategic Themes, and other business drivers for architecture, to System and Solution Architects and non-technical stakeholders.


· 
Drives architectural initiatives via enabler epics in the Portfolio Kanban system and participates in their analysis where applicable.


· 
Influences modelling, design, and coding practices.


· 
Promotes Continuous Delivery Pipeline and DevOps capabilities.


· 
Collects, generates, and analyzes innovative ideas and technologies to use across the business.


· 
Facilitates the reuse of code, components, and proven patterns.


· 
Ensures the implementation of each capability is designed for reuse and is only built once across the enterprise, where possible.


· 
Synchronizes the following disciplines across Solutions whenever applicable:


· 
System and data security and quality


· 
Production infrastructure


· 
Solution user experience (Lean UX)


· 
Non-functional Requirements (NFRs)


· 
Advises senior leaders, business, solution, system and data architects in accomplishing the overall objectives of the Enterprise Architecture.


· 
Communicates vision and leads technical staff in creating components of the Enterprise Architecture.

 


Research and Strategy 15%



· Supports the selection and use of technology, including identifying and monitoring new technologies that may offer opportunities in the future, researching and prototyping through a proof of concept engagement with business partners, understanding the applicability and scope, and assessing the maturity of innovative new technologies.



· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to ensure that individual program and product strategies align with business and technical objectives and satisfy business vision i.e. emerging solutions to local problems are consistent with the overall enterprise strategy.


· 
Develops and maintains plans for infrastructure, working with System Architects to assess the health of the technology, set principles, set in place epic enablers to address health issues and establish roadmaps.


· 
Works closely with the Business, Solution and System Architects to provide oversight to change initiatives, enabling channels of communication for coordination of work between solution and development value streams.


· 
Responsible for building the technical foundation needed to support business epics into the architectural runway delivering enablers just in time to support emerging business capabilities ensuring a continuous delivery pipeline is maintained and does not inhibit delivery velocity.

 


Architecture Matrix Leadership 15%



· Provides leadership to architects (system, data, business, security) on a matrix basis. Provides mentorship, feedback, and direction on approach and work solutions.



· 
Participates in the selection process, as required, and provides input on performance of matrix reporting resources.


· 
Participates in planning and budgeting for special projects and improvement initiatives.


Supports the implementation of new policies and procedures and corporate strategic initiatives 

Identifies training and development needs, ensuring technical expertise of the unit is maintained.

Participates on committees, cross-functional teams, and in meetings and other ad-hoc working groups established to address customer-service issues and initiatives at strategic and operational levels.



 




QUALIFICATIONS




1. Education:



· Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.



· SAFe Architect Certification or commitment to complete within 12 months.



 



2. Experience:



· Seven years of experience in information technology covering a wide range of technologies and disciplines, including:



· 
Five as an architect


· 
Three as a lead architect


· 
Experience of business transformation using lean/six sigma principles is an asset.

 


Technical Knowledge and Skills:



Working knowledge of application development using a variety of technologies including client/server and relational database technology.

Working knowledge of technology deployment using a variety of technologies including networking and platforms.


· Experience in large-scale, enterprise-wide, end-to-end Cloud migration 


· 
Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to problem solve and recommend solutions to enhance operations to improve service delivery.


· 
Advanced oral and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex information in a concise and straightforward manner, including formal presentations for management and technical staff.


· 
Interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships with business partners.


· 
Working knowledge of project management techniques.


· 
Ability to work in an environment that requires multiple on-going activities, which have tight deadlines and a degree of risk.


· 
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and provide leadership and influence the performance of others.


· 
Ability to solve problems and find creative solutions that meet business needs while maintaining the best interests of the corporation.


· 
Intermediate knowledge of applicable software (Microsoft Office, Project, Visio, SQL, and data analysis / management toolsets, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook applications).


· 
Working knowledge of insurance corporate systems is an asset.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Actalent is looking for a QA Engineer to help support our client for a fully remote position!


Position Description:* Develop and manage our industry-leading products all the way from initial ideas to product launches including R&D, engineering, software development and testing, project management, system testing.



As a QA Developer for AWS native application, you are an experienced AWS developer in the software QA team helping the development team with developing automated tests and cloud monitoring. You will be part of our R&D development team, working closely with the developers in an Agile/Scrum team. To succeed in this role we are looking for someone who will be an active team player with a genuine interest in quality assurance and help in providing high-quality products to customers.


Your key responsibilities include:* Actively communicate with the development team and stockholders to understand the current application requirements and infrastructure.



Develop and maintain automated integration and end2end test for Microservices infrastructure. Develop and maintain automated UI and application end2end test. Design software QA documents like test case, test plan, traceability matrix Define and document best practices in testing strategy based on company process and standards. Work collaboratively with software engineering to define infrastructure and deployment requirements. Build and maintain operational tools for deployment, monitoring, and analysis of AWS infrastructure and systems. Perform infrastructure cost analysis and optimization. Develop efficient DynamoDB queries.


Qualifications:* Bachelor’s in Computer Science and a minimum of 3 years of experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. 3 or more years of hands-on experience with AWS native application. 3 or more years of practical experience in the software QA field. Working experience with Cypress or Jest. Working experience with JavaScript. ISTQB or equivalent software QA training/certificate. Excellent team working and communication. Strong troubleshooting and conflict management. Programming experience with NodeJS. Hands-on experience with automated integration and end2end testing on Microservice based infrastructure. Familiarity with Linux and bash command. Good experience with git version management tool.



Thank you to all applicants! If you believe you would be a good fit for this opportunity, please do not hesitate to apply.

À propos d'Actalent:

Actalent relie la passion à la mission. Nos solutions de candidats talentueux et la performance de nos services produisent la valeur et les résultats, tout en apportant la compétence qui permet à nos clients de réaliser plus. Nos experts situés dans le monde entier inspirent au quotidien. Nous soutenons les initiatives essentielles en ingénierie et en sciences, par les expériences qui favorisent un développement continu. La différence, c’est nos gens. Actalent est une société d’exploitation d’Allegis Group, leader mondial des solutions de candidats talentueux.

L’entreprise souscrit au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et prendra en compte toutes les candidatures sans distinction de race, sexe, âge, couleur, religion, nationalité, statut de vétéran, handicap, orientation sexuelle, identité sexuelle, information génétique ou toute autre distinction protégée par la loi.

About Actalent:

Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
492934BR


Introduction


At IBM, we know that transformation drives change, and it is in our DNA to continuously transform. Our Business Transformation Consultants help drive large scale change that spans IBM business units and geographies. As a part of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to be a part of driving IBM’s ongoing transformation as a company that continuously innovates and leads the market.


Your Role and Responsibilities


At IBM, we know technology. But technology is only as good as the results it delivers. Are you interested and adept in application development methodology and tools? The IBM Client Innovation Centre (CIC): Nova Scotia occupies a unique position in the IT marketplace – at the intersection of business and technology.

As a member of our team, you will help IBM clients solve some of their most challenging business problems, capitalize on market opportunities and achieve real value in today’s tough economy.

We’re looking for passionate, original thinkers who want to drive progress, grow their network, and further their careers. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learning, who believes no problem is too big to solve, and who wants to unleash their potential, a Business Consultant role is for you.


Candidates Must


Have graduated no earlier than 2020, and will be graduating no later than 2022

Have an Associate’s Degree, College Diploma, Bachelor’s Degree, or Master’s Degree by date of employment


Exception: This program does not accept MBA or PhD candidates/graduates


Have no more than 2 years of full-time professional related work experience

Be eligible to work in Canada without current or future needs for visa sponsorship

Be willing and able to live and work in Nova Scotia, with minimal travel anticipated




Software Development - Hybrid Cloud Services (HCS)


We have a variety of IT Specialist / Technical Consultant employment opportunities available at IBM CIC Halifax including roles in the following practice areas:

HCS Canada Practice is the trusted services partner that provides open, secure, hybrid multi-cloud solutions aligned to our client’s business needs. Using advanced technologies, we transform enterprises and provide complete cloud solutions from strategy to modernization, testing, implementation, and ongoing management of critical business applications. If you like back end or full stack development then apply today and you could work as a 
Junior Integration Specialist
 or a 
Junior Full Stack Developer!



Software Development - Business Transformation Services (BTS)


This area focuses primarily in web development, mobile development and data analytics. You will work as either a 
Web Developer
, 
Mobile Developer
, or a 
Data Analyst
 based on your area of interest and your skills. If you enjoy front end development, mobile development, or working with data and you have a passion to work directly with clients then start your career in the BTS Software Development Practice!


Software Developer Roles & Responsibilities




You will use your experience in application development to design, code, test, and provide industry leading solutions for our clients 

You will troubleshoot any development issues reported by project teams or the clients

You will learn one or more of the following cloud technologies: AWS, Azure, RedHat, GCP

You will learn IBM's Hybrid Cloud Technology. MuleSoft, DevOps, Jenkins, Ainsble (for roles in HCS)

You will work in JavaScript, Node.js or frameworks such as React, Vue or Angular (BTS)




Quality Assurance Software Testing


Software Testers work closely with our development teams on to ensure the functionality of what’s been created and to ensure it aligns with the client specifications, they may also be connecting with the client to ensure functional specifications are being implemented through technical requirements.



Learn more about the iGNITE Quality Assurance Software Testing practice here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5B-7Qxxt2DU  




IGNITE Tester Roles & Responsibilities




You will track defects by identifying any bugs in the software and problem solve to make sure it is resolved successfully using JIRA - a software testing management tool

You’ll build and manage testing environments, assisting in debugging application issues.

You will cross reference data by looking at databases & repository to evaluate and understand user interface documents

You will translate requirements from the client into manual or automated test scripts 

You will complete the ISTQB testing training and exam certification during your first year at IBM: https://www.istqb.org/ 




Sap


SAP is multinational software corporation that develops enterprise software to manage business operations and customer relations. IBM is a premier SAP business partner with a large 200+ team located at our Halifax CIC. SuccessFactors is SAP’s cloud platform to enable employers to manage their employee records.


SAP Technical Consultant Roles & Responsibilities




You will be developing new functionality within the existing SAP software

You will learn to code and develop solution to client problems using a proprietary language ABAP (similar to C++)

You will learn how to analyze and consolidate business information into reports and models that will help clients make critical business decisions

You will learn the BASIS middleware and operating system that supports SAP applications and databases 




Oracle PeopleSoft


PeopleSoft is an Oracle ERP system with a focus on HR, payroll and accounting modules. Candidates interested in Oracle PeopleSoft MUST be eligible for Federal Government security clearance & MUST be available for shift work and on call support work in order to serve IBM's keystone Government client.


Junior PeopleSoft/Oracle Developer Roles & Responsibilities




Your main duties will be providing application support and ERP Software Development 

You will support & resolve application incidents & defects on Oracle/PeopleSoft ERP applications

You will be responsible for installation and technical configuration of the PeopleSoft ERP system and databases in multiple environments.

You will troubleshoot any database and application performance issues 




IT Specialist / Technical Consultant Required & Preferred Skills


You have the ability to work in an Agile, collaborative environment to understand requirements, design, code and test innovative applications, and support those applications for our highly valued customers

You are great at solving problems, debugging, troubleshooting, designing and implementing solutions to complex technical issues

You have experience coding and using databases

You have basic knowledge or hands on coding experience in one or more of the following technology areas:


C++, C, Java, JavaScript, Angular, React, Python, SQL, ASP .NET


You have basic knowledge or hands on experience using one or more of the following frameworks/libraries:


Spring/Spring Boot, Angular, React


You have an excellent understanding of the software development life cycle and software testing




Nice To Have Skills




You have experience or are familiar with the agile development methodology & framework

You have knowledge about or experience using cloud technologies - such as IBMCloud, Red Hat, Microsoft Azure, AWS, GCP




Required Technical and Professional Expertise


N/A


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


N/A

Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
About The Job



Toptal developers work with speed and efficiency to deliver the highest quality of work. We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business, and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups, with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career, enhance your skill set, and build connections around the globe, Toptal is right for you.



About Toptal



Toptal is an exclusive network of top freelancers from around the world. Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups hire Toptal for their most important projects. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers, designers, finance experts, product managers, and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers.

Toptal clients vary in sizes and industries, from enterprise organizations and big tech companies to Silicon Valley startups and renowned universities. Once you enter the network, our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. We have experts in over 120 countries who get to work remotely on projects that meet their career ambitions.



About The Role



As a Data Engineer, your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation, creativity, and solutions that will have a significant impact on the client’s velocity.



Requirements




 3+ years of professional experience in software development

 Working experience with Python and Pandas.

 Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling.

 Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns, including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures.

 Working experience with Airflow and Luigi is a big plus.

 Working experience with Scala is a plus.

 Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus.

 Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus.

 Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

 Full-time availability is a strong advantage


If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients, take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.

#RemoteJobDataEngineering

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We’re looking for a Solutions Engineer to join our rapidly growing Sales team. This role is for someone with a positive attitude, growth mindset and a sense of ownership to take projects to completion. As an excellent communicator, who is naturally curious and able to explain complex technical solutions to various stakeholders, you will serve as a partner to our Account Executives to help support and close business. You will be able to support a full sales cycle, beginning at technical scoping and solution architecture in presales all the way through proper handoff to the Customer Success teams.


What Your Team Does


Our Solution Engineering team is the swiss army knife of our entire sales organization. With hybrid skill sets, they serve as the technical encyclopedia communicating how the product, platform, channel and competitive landscape operates and solves specific problems while articulating value to the customer.


What You’ll Work On



 Provide business value and technical sales support for assigned opportunities 

 Collaborate closely with Sales to clearly articulate the following: Clio core platform capabilities, Clio App Ecosystem integration partners, Clio Certified Consultants offerings, competitive landscape and differentiation, database migration services, industry best practices, and the creation of ‘out of the box’ custom solutions 

 Serve as the technical lead and owner of technical deal strategy 

 Strategize with Sales to create business value, drive urgency and contribute to revenue goals 

 Provide and support proof of concepts of the technology and connect this back to business value, benefits and ROI 

 Enable Sales to deliver targeted, persona-based, business-value driven demonstrations and meetings 

 Stay on top of industry news, technology products, platforms and partners to ensure you and your team provide and maintain a deep industry and ecosystem expertise 

 Find ways to continually maximize efficiencies and revenue per account in the technical sales process and support sales efficiency across sales teams and segments, including deep knowledge and value of all of Clio’s core products (Manage, Grow, Lawyaw) 

 Collaborate closely with Product and Engineering teams to help collect, document, communicate and influence product roadmap based on market/customer requirements 

 Provide technical responses to RFPs and RFIs. 




What You May Have



 2+ years of experience working in either Sales or Customer Success (or other relevant experience) for a SaaS provider 

 Creative problem solver with a proven track record of success 

 Ambitious, curious mindset to always work to find creative solutions to difficult problems 

 Hungry to learn and help team deliver on ambitious goals in supporting the sales organization to meet revenue targets 

 Comfortable delivering technical sales presentations, product positioning, and objection handling 

 Ability to build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders 

 Strong technical experience and understanding of cloud technologies, including API’s, database migrations and security infrastructure 




Serious bonus points if you:



 Have worked in partnership with Solutions Engineers in previous roles 




Our Team


We are an award-winning team that is both human and high performing –and are setting new standards for what it means to be a tech company. Clio has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies .

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion and believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation.

At Clio, we pride ourselves in enabling our teams to do the best work of their careers and are committed to providing the tools and infrastructure needed, wherever you choose to log in from.


About Clio


Learn more about our culture and benefits at clio.com/careers

At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round which came with a US$1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology and trust us, you want to be a part of this! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

industries: Banking, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
TD Description



Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com



Department Overview



As part of 
TD Insurance,
 the 
Data, Analytics, and Insights (DAI)
 group supports internal business partners by providing valuable insights and analysis.

Within DAI, the 
Claims Insights
 team is a trusted partner to operational, actuarial, and executive stakeholders (Claims Operations, SEO (Strategy, Enablement & Optimization), Corporate Actuarial, Pricing, Product, Finance, Analytics and Modeling, and others). The Claims Insights team leverages and interprets data to provide business-specific insights and consultative support to their partners, helping guide decision making and strategic planning. Relied on to investigate emerging frequency and severity trends, the Claims Insights team generates broadly distributed reporting on internal and external trends, providing in-depth analysis and detailed insights to both operational and actuarial partners in support of planning, forecasting, severity management and capacity management.



Job Description



The 
Senior Business Insights Analyst 
is a key member of the Claims Insights team. You will leverage your analytical, programing and actuarial experience to deliver insights and analysis on a host of projects and initiatives. You will explore all aspects of claims data and claims processes with the opportunity to collaborate with key partners across the organization. You will develop a deep understanding of claims severity and frequency trends, drivers, and components while working on multiple complex analyses



Key Accountabilities



Under the supervision of the Manager of Claims Insights:


Contribute on key initiatives related to claims severity and severity management, capacity and workload management, and the development of innovative dashboards for the Insurance Claims Analytics Platform (iCAP) in collaboration with relevant partners.

Collaborate on end-to-end analytics solutions over a range of complexity: from the initial demand; to the delivery of reporting, analysis, or visualization; to the presentation of results and recommendations.

Be comfortable interacting and collaborating with business partners across the organization on a regular basis.

Develop and improve analytic tools and methods to support insight generation.

Leverage visualization to clearly communicate insights and illustrate key trends and concepts.

Serve as an authority on claims results and trends, putting analytics discoveries in broader context.

Develop a holistic view of claims and the ability to speak to both actuarial and operational aspects.

Participate in the timely delivery of recurrent analysis on claims frequency and severity results. Be able to summarize the results and explain the variances.

Perform deep-dive analyses on claims results and communicate the results effectively.

Proactive in the identification of issues, trends and opportunities arising from analysis and insights.




Job Requirements




Bachelor's or master's degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or relevant discipline.

Five (5) or more years of relevant work experience (Actuarial, Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Statistics, General Insurance Claims, or related fields).

Possesses sound judgement, an analytical mind, and demonstrated decision making capabilities.

Highly developed problem-solving and analysis skills with consistent rigor in quality of work.

Able to conceptualize technical problems to develop clarity and a global vision.

Effective communicator with skills to present, teach, and persuade.

Works openly and transparently in collaboration with business partners.

Creative in finding new solutions to complex problems.

Effective in managing multiple priorities with strong organization and time management skills 

Effective in a team setting and contributes to team spirit.

Quick learner and able to adapt to change.

Strong programming skills (SQL, Python, R).

Proficient with PowerPoint and Microsoft Excel. 

Proficiency with Tableau a strong asset.

General Insurance experience or expertise is an asset.

Claims experience or expertise is an asset.

Knowledge of TDI Data Warehouse an asset.

Shows initiative and a desire to win.

Demonstrates TD values.




Additional Information




Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

description:
TD Description



Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com



Department Overview



What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise.

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before.



Job Description



The successful candidate will be responsible for fulfillment supporting the growing needs of the Everyday Banking Group within the broader Marketing Technologies, Analytics and Insights group.

Your goal as a fulfillment analyst is to design and execute fulfilment processes to drive acquisition and retention across personal banking products. If you are detail oriented, driven by helping stakeholders understand data, obsessed with accuracy and continually strive to challenge the "process status quo" to make work flows run as efficiently as possible – this is the role for you.



Success In This Role Will Be Achieved By




 Translating key business objectives into accurate and efficient fulfillment workflows and processes

 Ensuring execution is done efficiently and with excellence

 Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of recommendations and optimizations.


Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.



Responsibilities




Qualify consumers and fulfill marketing offers

Continuously improve processes and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal

Execute with excellence and accuracy

Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met

Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI

Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure




Skill Sets




Job Requirements



Familiarity with mass and direct marketing principles

Deep understanding of how offers get created, communicated to customers and fulfilled

Technical and detail oriented

Familiarity with TD and its products an asset

Conceptual understanding of how marketing campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as SAS.

A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications

Team player while able to work independently

Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts

A profit driven mindset




Qualifications




4+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high-volume direct marketing industries)

Knowledge of SQL and SAS(Advance); knowledge of databases and data structures

Experience translating complex T&Cs in code (SAS) Asset

TD and PS&I , EDB experience an Asset

Familiarity with OMLC an asset

Experience with Python/Pyspark an asset

Degree in business, finance, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline

Track record of delivering successful and initiatives on time and on budget



Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

description:
Position Description



Ready to join an outstanding culture that cares about diversity and inclusion, corporate social responsibility and gives the freedom to innovate, influence decisions, and chart an exciting career.

CGI is more than just an IT company. Be part of a team that supports the local community with the ability to draw on global best-in-class talent! Benefits include a share purchase program, profit sharing, wellness credit, training and development programs, and flexible work schedules and locations.

CGI is expanding in Vancouver, BC Canada, and we need your skills, passion and dedication! Those who have applied to earlier postings are encouraged to re-apply.



Your Future Duties And Responsibilities




 Operate effectively as a senior mentor and member of the development team

 Design, development, testing and delivery of all our supported AEM websites and applications

 Site enhancements, support and defect resolution

 Design, code and test existing and new web sites based on detailed business requirements

 Assume responsibility for design and development of web pages, graphics, multimedia and GUIs

 Understand and address web related issues

 Operate effectively for quick turnaround of enhancements, fixes and solutions

 Use storyboarding, wireframes and predesigns to prepare detailed and accurate specifications and estimates

 Develop and maintain reference material and documentation, including user guide/help sites




Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role




 Development of Adobe AEM/CQ websites and applications

 AEM building blocks including templates, components, widgets and bundles using the AEM Framework and technologies such as HTL, Sightly, JAVA, JSP, XML, JavaScript, JSON and HTML5

 Design, implementation, testing and deployment of enterprise scale AEM web applications with experience using and configuring Author and Publish instances, Dispatchers and other Replication agents

 Practical exposure and/or experience in Sling, JCR Repository and Apache Felix OSGi Framework

 Practical experience designing and developing service interfaces and system integration in AEM to/from external systems and web services

 Practical exposure and/or experience with Responsive Design and Single Page Application development using best practices and modern frameworks such as Twitter Bootstrap, React and Angular

 Practical exposure and/or experience with some or all of the following: HTML, CSS, LESS, Sass, Ruby, Ajax, UML, XML and Wireframes

 Practical exposure and/or experience with Adobe Marketing Cloud such as Target, Analytics, Campaigns and Audience Manager is desirable attribute

 Practical exposure and/or experience with graphics creation with Photoshop, Illustrator and the Adobe Creative Suite

 SDLC, including design, testing, deployment, and documentation activities

 Use and management of source codes using repositories such as BitBucket, SVN, GIT and Sourcetree




Attributes




 Excellent written and oral communication skills

 Desire and willingness to work in a collaborative, innovative, flexible and team-oriented environment

 Flexibility, adaptability and the ability to learn quickly in various technical and creative environments, while delivering quality work by tight deadlines are required attributes.




Assets




 Successful completion of a 2 year or longer Computer Science/Information Technology program achieving a Diploma or Degree a plus

 Experience with other Web Content Management Systems such as Drupal, WordPress, Sitecore, Kentico, or Interwoven

 Adobe Certified Expert certification for CQ and AEM development




Skills




 Adobe Experience Manager AEM

 Communication (Oral/Written)

 Deployment Management

 Responsive Design

 System Integration

 Web Development




What You Can Expect From Us



Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change-supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.
