job_title: Intermediate Software Developer (4+ years) - Remote across Canada
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
Join McLean & Company, one of the world’s fastest-growing advisory companies!





Why work for us? 


McLean is a place where your voice will be heard - a place where you will see the impact of your work with our
 30,000+ members
. It is a place where you will find community and collaboration, where you will work with diverse individuals with their own unique stories and experiences. McLean is a place where success is celebrated by the whole team - a place where you are encouraged to stretch and grow.




You’d be joining a team of like-minded individuals in a work-hard / play-hard culture, where what you as an individual bring to the team is highly valued. Continued learning is a major part of our best-practice-driven environment, so we support our teams with a substantial budget for training and career development. We’re also very into work / life balance, so after-hours and weekend work are rare to non-existent.




You will work in a highly collaborative team that functions efficiently even in a remote work setting. You will have flexibility to work from home, at the office (located in London / Toronto Ontario and quite fun), or in a hybrid mode.

We offer great competitive salaries, benefits plan, and RRSP matching plans.




This role will be on the payrolls of the parent company, Info-Tech Research Group but will be responsible for working on projects for McLean & Company.




Our stack is built with 
Ruby on Rails, MySQL, and JavaScript 
frameworks. No experience with Ruby on Rails is required; developers should expect continued learning in their career, and we’ll support you as you get up to speed. We are open to hire exceptional candidates across Canada!




The 
intermediate software developer
 will translate software requirements into workable programming code and build scalable web applications that solve a variety of problems for our clients. This role will also assist in architectural decisions and leverage their technical knowledge to build solutions.


Key Responsibilities:


· Use a variety of programming languages and development tools to build, test, implement, and support the development of web software applications

· Collaborate and interact with interdisciplinary teams (interactive designers and software developers) to identify and resolve issues, review and complete projects

· Participate in an agile software development framework; proactively find and address areas of concern and identify potential roadblocks

· Assist in estimating resource needs and timelines to complete short and long term projects as well as daily operational tasks

· Assist in clarifying stakeholder requirements; communicate questions and address concerns; provide relevant and detailed updates and feedback in a timely manner

· Design appropriate technical solutions based on requirements provided while taking into account timelines and future re-use ability





Education and Experience


· Minimum 4 years of experience in a professional software development role

· Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Application Development, or Information Technology (nice to have but not required)

· Any certification is an asset





 Skills


· Solution Design - Ability to define and describe an architecture of a system and understand the cause and effect of their coding

· Collaborative communication skills (written and oral) - Ability to convert technical concepts into non-technical

· Backend Development - Some experience and applicable knowledge in backend development in any language (Ruby, PHP, .NET, etc.), relational databases, writing and optimizing queries (Postgres, MySQL, etc.)

· Development from specs - Ability to find requirements and break them down into an actionable execution plan for the team and proactively identify problems.

· Frontend Development - some experience and applicable knowledge with HTML 5, CSS3 or Java Script








Mclean & Company / Info-Tech Research Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected status or characteristic including Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

job_title: Team Lead Cloud Engineer, Scotia Digital (Vancouver Hub)
industries: Banking
description:
Requisition ID: 145032

At Scotiabank Digital Factory, the reach and opportunity of a global organization meets the passion and drive of a startup. Reinvention starts here—and it starts with you.

We believe that the pathway to success is paved with user feedback, so we’re constantly asking our customers how they want to bank. When we find an opportunity to make things people will love, we assemble teams of specialists to collaborate in Digital Factories in Canada, Chile, Mexico, Peru, and Colombia. We work fast, and we work smart. Join us to create meaningful experiences and build the bank of tomorrow for our customers around the world.

If you’d like to learn more about our Digital Banking career opportunities, explore our Communities of Practice, or hear from our leaders, check out our Technology at Scotia career page.

The role of the Team Lead - Cloud Engineering operates within the Cloud Platform Engineering team. This valuable member of the team will be responsible for leading a team of engineers to drive platform and services creation for the broad enterprise use.


Is this role right for you? 



Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems, and knowledge.

Key accountabilities include leading design, development and maintenance activities of services, and components for cloud platforms in order to enable safe enterprise-wide use of public cloud offerings

Technical ownership/leadership of a component of a larger product.

Designing, implementing, and refactoring code (typically Go, Python).

Ensuring software, programs and applications are developed and/or configured to meet high availability, integrity and reliability, security, and compliance requirements.

Leading meetings with other engineers, delilvery elaads and architects on breaking-down, scoping and estimating tasks.

Working with application teams for successful onboarding onto the Platform

Leading planning sessions, driving stand-ups, etc.

Be able to build and operate the highly available and scalable software and infrastructure.




What You Will Bring To Succeed




At least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience with Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

At least 4+ years of hands-on technical working experience with development languages (Go, Python)

At least 4+ years of hands-on technical working experience with container-based virtualization technologies (Docker)

At least 5+ years of hands-on technical working experience in the use of CI/CD Tools 

Superior oral and written communication skills

Expertise and understanding of Cloud Native Platforms, particularly Kubernetes, and associated technologies (e.g., Istio, Envoy, Anthos, Kustomize).

Experience working with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, etc.

Knowledge of software design patterns, and/or security considerations 

Focus on scalable, enterprise-level software system design (both on code and infrastructure levels)


Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver

description:

Our clients are manufacturers of computer electronics systems for business. They have been around for a few decades and have employees globally. They are looking for software developers with good development skills in C# / .net.






Scope of Work:






Design and implement robust software solutions to support our client’s manufacturing facilities

Participate in the full software development life cycle

Plan, design and co-ordinate the development using object oriented programming techniques.

description:
Travailler chez 
MS Solutions
, c’est s’aventurer dans une entreprise en constante évolution et où les employés et les clients sont au centre de nos priorités.

MS Solutions se place comme leader dans l’industrie des TI et la transformation numérique au Québec. MS Solutions c’est plus de 30 ans d’expertise en solutions Cloud, cybersécurité, Office 365, en services gérés et en services professionnels.




Si vous cherchez un environnement de travail innovant, stimulant et un endroit où pousser votre savoir-faire, en lien avec les dernières technologies sur le marché, vous êtes clairement au bon endroit! En plus d’évoluer dans un espace en constante évolution, 
MS Solutions vous permet d’avoir un équilibre sain dans votre travail et votre vie personnelle. C'est notre priorité !


Voici le rôle d’un 
Architecte TI
 chez MS Solutions. C’est simple, Accompagner le client tout au long d’un projet. Le titulaire du poste effectue la livraison des différents projets informatique et s’assure que le client soit enchanté !

Senior Business Systems Analyst - Individual IT
industries: Insurance
description:
At Equitable Life of Canada, we realize that your work life is not just about performing a job; it's about being part of a workplace that helps you grow and reach your full potential. Within our friendly and collaborative work environment, we recognize that the key to our growth and success is a dedicated, motivated and customer-responsive staff. Join Equitable Life today.


Reports to:
Manager, Quality Assurance and Business Systems Analysis – Individual Insurance Technology


Department:
IT


Flexible Work Arrangements Available:
Full-time remote working is available due to Covid-19. In the future, post pandemic, this role will require some onsite work on a hybrid basis


The opportunity


At Equitable, Individual Insurance Technology is a talented and engaged team with a passion for innovation and high performance.

We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst who has a passion for delivering high quality, sustainable solutions. Someone who has a proven track record building and working within an Agile environment.

If you are looking for an opportunity to apply your business systems analysis expertise, and bring forward your innovative ideas, then come join our team.



Here’s What We’re Looking For




You have a passion for technology and you love to understand how things fit together.

You enjoy working with all levels of an organization.

You are a team oriented bridge builder and improve strength of team through coaching and mentoring.

You inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to our business partners.

You learn voraciously, stretch your thinking, share your knowledge and educate others.

A willingness to embrace change and witness amazing things – from the inside.

You thrive being a strong, analytical problem solver mixed with a whole lot of common sense and practicality

Strong collaborator with a willingness to help where help is needed




What You’ll Do




Collaborate with Business Owner and Delivery Team to evolve and deliver the project vision 

Develop User Story Map 

Write concise and effective Epics, Features and User Stories 

Define precise and accurate User Story acceptance criteria in the form of Specifications by Example 

Lead workshops to capture and define functional and non-functional requirements as structured User Stories 

Provide guidance to junior/intermediate staff, specifically Agile methodology and best practices 

Provide analytical support, recommendations, and analysis to our business stakeholders 

Fully understand and support business and technical requirements 

Proactively put forward ideas that speak to project objectives (e.g., development, testing solutions, and tools). 

Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other artifacts 

Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance and user acceptance testing 

Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issue 

Gain knowledge in own area, stay abreast of technology trends and developments, develop expertise in Equitable Life services, applications, infrastructure, analytical tools and techniques, business domains and their products and services. 

Troubleshoot production support issues as needed and assist with root cause analysis and recommend solutions to rectify issues. 




What You’ll Need




Sound knowledge of Business Systems Analysis practice and industry best practice models

Minimum eight (8) full years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst in projects and production support environment

3-5 years of experience working within an Agile methodology

Experience with Microsoft Azure DevOps (or related)

Proven ability to lead and mentor junior/intermediate Business Systems Analysts

Customer and results focused. Able to understand and act based on client needs, assess risks, and achieve a valued result

Demonstrated ability in stakeholder analysis, elicitation, facilitation, requirements management and communication, requirements analysis and solution validation 

Innovative, Problem-Solving and Analysis ability to find new approaches to problem management

Possess solid problem solving and organizational skills

Ability to write and understand SQL queries

Ability to manage and balance multiple concurrent assignments and deadlines

Ability to find innovative solutions to business challenges

Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with experience writing business systems/functional requirements, use cases and process flows 

A passion for analysis and quality 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, College diploma or equivalent work experience

Awareness and understanding of cultural diversity



Nice-to-have



Experience in Life Insurance systems such as: Ingenium/Capsil 

Knowledge and Experience with Agile, Scrum, Kanban

CCBA or CBAP or working towards designation

Previous exposure/experience in financial services industry, specifically with financial reporting systems


To learn more about Equitable Life, we encourage you to explore our organization.

At Equitable Life, we are committed to providing equal access to employment opportunities across our organization. Please contact our HR team at click apply if you would like to receive our job postings in an alternative format or require an accommodation with the application process.

Other details

Reporting to the Senior Quality Assurance Manager, the BI QA Engineer will create and execute test cases to ensure the software products meet design specifications and product quality standards. The BI QA Engineer will test hands-on and follow established QA methodologies as well as being involved in other QA and project related activities. This position requires a highly motivated individual that is comfortable with rapid changes in direction and a fluid environment. The successful candidate should be detail-oriented, approachable, dependable, and reliable with good business sense and judgment.



What You'll Do




 Participate in the testing activities of the software to ensure the highest level of quality.

 Write and execute test cases, scripts and scenarios.

 Write moderately complex code/scripts to test systems.

 Identify and report defects, work with development team to ensure defects are resolved, and verify fixes.

 Create, maintain, or enhance existing test automation.

 Provide project and resource estimates required for the quality assurance effort of assigned projects.

 Work with other project team members to understand project requirements.

 Establish cooperative relationships to work efficiently with co-workers, and participate as a member of a Quality Assurance team




What You'll Need




1-3 years working as a QA software professional

Experience in Data Warehouse, BI reports, ETL Verification

Experience in Testing BI applications

Experience with web application testing

Experience using SQL Server and writing SQL queries

Experience with scripting or programming language(s)

Experience with issue tracking systems such as JIRA

ETL process

Data warehouse and data model

Data-related services in Azure

PowerBI

Scala

Python

job_title: Senior Business Intelligence and Reporting Analyst
industries: Banking, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
TD Description


Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here's our story: jobs.td.com
 


Department Overview


What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights. We believe in using every resource at our disposal to better serve our clients, and this includes our vast data.

The Business Intelligence group delves into our data, past and present, to develop crucial metrics and reporting functionality that better informs and optimizes key businesses decisions across the organization.

This is the team building the tools, reports, dashboards, cubes and scorecards that deliver and process vital data to business partners across the enterprise. 

Joining us in Business Intelligence & Reporting is an opportunity to advance and deepen your career and to help TD serve its customers in a way we never have before. 
 


Job Description


The successful candidate will be responsible for fulfillment supporting the growing needs of the Everyday Banking Group within the broader Marketing Technologies, Analytics and Insights group.
Your goal as a fulfillment analyst is to design and execute fulfilment processes to drive acquisition and retention across personal banking products. If you are detail oriented, driven by helping stakeholders understand data, obsessed with accuracy and continually strive to challenge the "process status quo" to make work flows run as efficiently as possible – this is the role for you.
Success in this role will be achieved by:
1. Translating key business objectives into accurate and efficient fulfillment workflows and processes
2. Ensuring execution is done efficiently and with excellence
3. Work in a consultative role to provide "value-added" insights in the form of recommendations and optimizations.
Your success will be predicated on your ability to forge strong partnerships, communicate effectively, deliver on-time, and continuously strive for increased efficiency.
Responsibilities:
o Qualify consumers and fulfill marketing offers
o Continuously improve processes and delivery by leveraging any and all analytical tools/techniques at your disposal
o Execute with excellence and accuracy
o Manage your project pipeline to ensure agreed upon timelines can be met
o Proactively provide analytical guidance to key stakeholders, based on deep understanding of the businesses, to understand and enhance marketing ROI
o Maintain a culture of risk management and control, supported by effective processes and sound infrastructure

 


Job Requirements

Skill Sets:

Familiarity with mass and direct marketing principles

Deep understanding of how offers get created, communicated to customers and fulfilled

Technical and detail oriented

Familiarity with TD and its products an asset

Conceptual understanding of how marketing campaigns are created by leveraging customer data from internal data warehouses through the use of programming tools such as SAS.

A project management mindset to help deliver on time to specifications

Team player while able to work independently

Pragmatic decision maker blending a mix of intellect, experience and street smarts

A profit driven mindset



Qualifications

4+ years of relevant experience in a direct marketing, consulting, analytics, or agency-side role in financial services/telecom (or other high-volume direct marketing industries)

Knowledge of SQL and SAS(Advance); knowledge of databases and data structures

Experience translating complex T&Cs in code (SAS) Asset

TD and PS&I , EDB experience an Asset

Familiarity with OMLC an asset

Experience with Python/Pyspark an asset

Degree in business, finance, science, statistics, engineering, or other quantitative discipline

Track record of delivering successful and initiatives on time and on budget





 


Inclusiveness


At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve.  If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

description:
Role and Responsibilities:




• Work directly with application development and support teams to gather requirements and guide Dynatrace implementation

• Interface with customer teams to integrate application's full infrastructure stack with APM and log monitoring tool to achieve end-to-end visibility

• Collaborate with Business and IT to design and implement performance benchmarks for each application, and report results

• Develop processes to proactively monitor and alert for critical business transactions and applications

• Deploy, configure and administer Splunk, Dynatrace and AppDynamics agents to a diverse set of environments including Linux, AIX, Azure Service Fabric, and Windows

• Verify monitoring tool configuration by overseeing the preparation of test data, testing and debugging of configurations to ensure proper monitoring is in production




Must Have Skills:




• Splunk Architecture

• Data On-boarding using Splunk

• Design and implement Splunk Dashboards and Scheduled reports Real time alerts for system health and threat detection

• Advanced SPL searching, Summary Indexing and Data Modelling

• Develop analytical insights using Splunk ITSI and Machine learning Provide support to Splunk data administration, data onboarding and configuration updates

• Should have worked in the latest version of Dynatrace (one agent)

• Possess hands on exposure in configuring host groups, management groups, tagging and naming rules, alerting profiles, process group detections

• Leveraging Splunk metrics, base searches for dashboards and other latest features in Splunk product




Nice to Have Skills:




• Experience in Banking domain and general architecture of banking applications

• Good in unix shell scripting

• Exposure to configuration automation tools like SALT, HPSA and collaboration tools like confluence, JIRA etc.

• High level knowledge in cloud concepts, agile and project management methodologies

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Gigamon Threat Insight is an enterprise network security product focused on providing capabilities that empower our customers to detect and track adversaries in real-time.

Our mission is to use the power of information to detect, track and dismantle hackers' means of attacking our customers. Our team has seen all sides of the equation, as attackers and defenders, in addition to the complex engineering required to solve these problems at scale. Our software helps security professionals get an unparalleled view into their networks, perform forensics on security incidents and build effective early warning systems.

Senior Infrastructure Engineers play a lead role in architecting and deploying scalable, resilient, and secure infrastructure, having a direct impact on the success of Gigamon moving forward. As a member of the Gigamon Operations & Infrastructure team, you will operate in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with engineers and developers.




Core Job Functions:


 Architect, implement and maintain production infrastructure

Work in a DevOps methodology, identify and address operational issues before they become reality

Automation of lifecycle management, physical data center and AWS

Quickly triage and resolve incidents, act as the primary point of contact and escalation

Monitoring and telemetry of multi-tiered services, producing useful information from data

Administration of Linux systems, network devices, and sensors

Implement & evangelize security best practices

Maintain documentation and provide support to Jr. infrastructure engineers


Job Requirements:


5+ years of experience in Unix systems administration

1+ years of experience in network administration

Experience in design and implementation of continuous integration & delivery environments and tooling

Experience in containerized environments and tools

Experience with change management software, Puppet is preferred

Experience designing, implementing and maintaining multi-tiered applications

Familiarity with the server-oriented open source eco-sphere

Primary Responsibilities:



Develop embedded software for commercial and passenger vehicle applications to meet cost, timing, and performance targets, and review, approve or modify production software designs

Ensure code and artifacts are maintained to guidelines

Lead and participate in technical reviews

Adhere to software engineering processes to support efficient and effective high-quality embedded software

Assess cost/benefit trade-off of technical solution and lead decision-making process 

Proactively support design validation teams in test plan reviews to ensure testing strategies and methods truly stress and verify design compliance and safety

Drive fast and thorough problem resolution through the use of team-oriented problem-solving tools, including 8D, 5-Why, Is-Is Not techniques






﻿Position Qualifications:



B.S. in Electrical, Electronics, Software or Controls Engineering (M.S. preferred)

5+ years of experience in the development of automotive embedded controllers (TI or NXP based)

Carry out in reading and debugging source code in C. Experience with MATLAB Simulink/Stateflow

Experience with embedded RTOS 

CAN, LIN, SPI, I2C communication protocol knowledge

Competent in supporting software languages (C#, python, .NET, Visual C++, etc.)

Proficient in working with requirement management systems (e.g. DOORs) as well as generating/gleaning Software Requirements from higher-level requirements (e.g. System Requirements)

Experience with hands-on Development and Laboratory equipment (function generators, logic analyzers, Debugging modules, advanced oscilloscopes

Experience with safety-critical software functions and ISO26262

Be hands-on in system-level and board-level testing






﻿Key Competencies:



Experience in taking designs from concept to requirements, to code, to test, to production implementation

Experience with use of and continued development of the Software Toolchains

Good understanding of PCB schematics and comfortable with basic hardware tasks (soldering components, adding jumpers, harness wiring, etc.)

Builds safety, quality, and compliance into all actions; committed to continuous learning and self-improvement

Action-oriented, displays behaviors that demonstrate ownership in the success of the company

Demonstrates focus on meeting both internal and external customer needs when identifying, prioritizing, and accomplishing tasks

Evaluates existing work processes and initiates practices to promote continuous improvement

Excellent communications and interpersonal skills – position requires strong interaction in a multi-functional team environment

industries: Marketing Services, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
About Vts



VTS is commercial real estate’s leading leasing, marketing, asset management, tenant experience, and data platform where the industry comes to make deals happen and real-time data comes to life. The VTS platform is revolutionizing the way that commercial real estate (CRE) is done — disrupting a $15 trillion industry by becoming the industry's modern operating system.

Our success is shown in our numbers—we hit "Unicorn" status in 2019 and today we have over 12 billion square feet of commercial space managed on VTS worldwide, and we’ve expanded to over 700 employees globally. It’s an exciting time to join the VTS team as we continue to grow rapidly and break records.

VTS maintains offices in New York City, London, Toronto, Chicago, and San Francisco.

To learn more about VTS and to see our open roles, visit us at vts.com or follow us on Instagram (@WeAreVTS), Twitter (@WeAreVTS), or LinkedIn.


How does this Position help VTS Succeed?


In this role, you will be a key member of the Data Operations team within the VTS Product organization. You will work within the Product organization and work cross-functionally to ensure and uphold data quality and data integrity standards for VTS’s critical datasets.


What Makes This Job Awesome?



Review and validate data entry work done by offshore and other internal/external teams

Raise concerns and help troubleshoot potential bugs on internal tools

Develop and refine guidelines for data operations processes across VTS (i.e. tenant linking)

Improve efficiency in manual data operations processes through technology-driven solutions

Facilitate cross-functional data-related initiatives between product, client success, and adjacent teams to ensure that VTS is delivering value to clients

Support Data Operations Manager to manage data operations processes across VTS

Develop deep domain expertise on VTS’s unique and valuable proprietary datasets to create actionable insights

Become an expert in critical CRE datasets (i.e. tenants, buildings, etc)



What Makes You a Great Fit?



Experience with data quality and validation processes in the CRE domain

Knowledge of project management tools such as JIRA

Proficiency in Google Suite Applications (i.e. Google Sheets, Google Slides, etc) and BI Tools (i.e. Looker)

Advanced analytics skills (i.e. SQL, Spreadsheets, etc)

Exceptional attention to detail and organization, with strong time management and project management skills

Data-driven mindset and decision making 

Strong verbal and written communication skills

0-2 years of experience working in a fast-paced corporate environment, preferably within the CRE industry




What VTS Values & How We Show It




Strive for Excellence -
 We know your potential is unlimited. Take advantage of our executive coaches and our training and career development programs available to all employees!


Be Customer Obsessed 
- We’re employee obsessed too! VTS offers competitive compensation, comprehensive health benefits (including dental and vision), pre-tax commuter benefits, and a 401(k) plan. Not to mention the fun stuff - monthly happy hours, wellness events, clubs, and team lunches!


Be Curious - 
Benefit from a culture that promotes new learning. VTS offers an education stipend to all employees!


Move as One - 
We work in an open floor plan to promote cross-functional collaboration.


Take Ownership - 
Be an owner of the company you’re building with our equity packages.


Appreciate the Difference - 
VTS embraces and celebrates diversity. We understand the importance of a strong work-life balance. We offer a flexible PTO policy, generous family leave program, and more!

VTS embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know at ta@vts.com

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Strategic Management Services
description:
Our client is seeking a Quality Assurance Tester to work within our clients Front Office development team on key reporting/dashboarding project within one of our Agile development teams.




The primary focus for this role is manual testing with a secondary focus on writing automated test cases & the execution automated test cases. The automation work is a distance second in the priority stack. Our manual testing is mainly comprised on manual black-box application testing, data validation testing (e.g. data quality/completeness/timeliness) and lastly leveraging application logging to verify functionality and performance of client-applications and backend services.





Please note this job is based in Vancouver






Responsibilities:



Drive the end-to-end testing process and prioritize tasks accordingly to meet project delivery timelines

Create test plans and record detailed metric to track progress outcomes

Perform regression tests, develop new and maintain existing test cases both manual and automated

Analyze the results of tests and test coverage to determine the quality of the solution

Maintain existing and create new automated test cases









Required Skills and Experience



Bachelor in Computer Science or equivalent

3+ years hands-on test automation experience using Test automation tools like Ranorex or similar tools

Hands-on experience with IDE development tools

Proficient experience with SQL, XML and web services tools as well as understanding HTML

Experience with setting up robust test environments and configurations (Windows)

Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (TeamCity)

Software development experience in an Object Oriented environment , C# .NET

PL-SQL, T-SQL or SnowSQL queries to interrogate databases to validate data.

description:
We are looking for a passionate developer in reporting, business intelligence and data visualization!

Reporting to the Manager, Application & Database Operations, the Business Intelligence Developer will support & enhance existing BI projects and participate in net-new initiatives to drive new capabilities while improving the enterprise capability in reporting and analytics.

The BI Developer has knowledge or experience implementing analytics solutions and common services such as Data Governance and Data Quality in hybrid data architectures (cloud and on-premise).This position will occasionally be called on to advise and support database applications such as system-to-system integrations or as an advisor to data migration / data cleansing efforts.



Responsibilities



Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures

Participate in project planning sessions with multiple partners to analyze business requirements and outline the proposed solution

Develop technical specifications based on business requirements

Participate in design reviews, contribute to the design recommendations and incorporate the security requirements

Provide input to information data and flow

Understand and follow System Development Life Cycle methodology

Adhere to I/S control policies throughout design, development, and testing

Document the detailed application specifications

Translate technical specifications into application modules

Perform unit and integration testing



Qualifications



Computer Science degree or equivalent education and experience

Confirmed experience in building and deploying reports to either on-premise and/or cloud implementations of Power BI.

Excellent SQL skills for extracting data from relational databases and designing & implementing data marts using SSIS to extract, transform, and load (ETL)business-critical information into SQL Server databases from disparate sources

Hands-on experience building data analytical capabilities by using OLAP, SSIS, SSAS and Cubes

Deep level understanding in writing MDX / DAX for design and reporting purposes

Solid skills with the Microsoft technology stack (SSAS, SSRS, SQL Server, TSQL, MDX, DAX, Power BI, Power Pivot, Power Query)

Ability to create multi-dimensional and tabular models.

Creative and innovative problem-solver applying the best techniques that address data architecture, extraction, transformation, movement, storage, integration and governance of data.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both technical and non-technical scenarios.

Knowledge of or experience with ML enabled Data Management, Data Lakes and, IOT Integration and Analytics projects considered an asset.

Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.



About Teck



At Teck, we value diversity. Our teams work collaboratively and respect each person's unique perspective and contribution.

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

Teck is a diversified resource company committed to responsible mining and mineral development with major business units focused on copper, steelmaking coal, zinc and energy. Headquartered in Vancouver, Canada, its shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbols TECK.A and TECK.B and the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol TECK.

The pursuit of sustainability guides Teck's approach to business. Teck is building partnerships and capacity to confront sustainability challenges within the regions in which it operates and at the global level. In 2018, Teck was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index (DJSI) for the ninth straight year, indicating that Teck's sustainability practices rank in the top 10 per cent of the world's 2,500 largest public companies in the S&P Global Broad Market Index.

Learn more about Teck at www.teck.com or follow @TeckResources

Your application to this posting is deemed to be your consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of personal information for the purposes of recruitment. Teck respects the privacy of all applicants and the confidentiality of personal information.

industries: Insurance
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.




Working Arrangement


Hybrid



Job Description




The Opportunity


Responsible for design and implementation of global cloud network architectures.

This job description does not represent a comprehensive listing of job duties that are required of the employee performing this role. We reserve the right to change duties or assign additional duties at any time with or without notice.


People Leader Role:
 No



What We Offer



The opportunity to work at a large-scale global organization with a heavy focus on enterprise cloud technologies, automation, and acceleration of growth.



Must Have



Cloud network engineering hands on experience as a consumer of major cloud providers such as Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform.

Deep technical understanding of Microsoft Azure core cloud networking fundamentals and network security.

Advanced understanding and experience in large-scale global network infrastructures, topologies, load balancers, routing, and protocols.



Highly Desired



Infrastructure as code experience with tools such as Terraform, GitHub, Bash, Python, Perl, PowerShell, others.

Automation of network configuration.

Experience in establishing connectivity with business-to-business cloud and software as a service providers.

Experience in working with global network and internet service providers and co-located datacenter facilities, firewalls, WAN, MPLS, Express Routes.



Individual Accountabilities




Design, implementation, and support of global cloud network infrastructure based predominantly on Microsoft Azure.

Takes part in global projects, representing the cloud network engineering team.

Review and contribute to code for cloud network automation.

Selects, upgrades, and integrates new technologies; maintains existing technologies.

Leads and participates in the development of processes and documentation for new areas of work or knowledge.

Reviews and optimizes utilization and bandwidth across multiple geographically dispersed global networks and takes proactive action to address capacity, underutilization, and constraints.

Works with peer teams and business units on cloud platforms using SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS use cases.

Provides technical expertise in cloud network architecture to assist in business & technology initiatives.

Works with peer network engineering and operations teams globally to review services, design, and configurations. Contributes to maintain service levels and avoid disruptions.

Leads complex troubleshooting when required to resolve critical or escalated technical issues of impacted cloud infrastructure.

Actively engages in platform automation and orchestration from technical and process perspectives.

Participates in risk and security audits. Contributes to remediation efforts.

Proactively formulates and manages processes, defining how a reporting solution can use the platform, identify risks and issues.

Supports teams with uninterrupted service as they transition from legacy ways of working to adopt new best practices, frameworks, and technologies.




Job Requirements



Experience designing, implementing, and maintaining global cloud platforms.

Familiarity with agile and DevOps principles, test-driven development, continuous integration, and other approaches to accelerate the delivery of new features and software defined networks.

Attends advanced training sessions and is certified on multiple domains of expertise.

Constantly learns from both success and failure.

Mentors associate engineers and seeks coaching from experts.

Demonstrates all core skills, and good interpersonal skills for the role.

Good working and background knowledge of area of practice.

Participates in functional demos in new technologies and features.

Understands the corporate climate & culture.

Strong knowledge of the business.

Experiments with emerging technologies to help accelerate growth and optimize cloud platforms.

BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience.

Good organizational and problem-solving abilities that enable you to manage through creative abrasion.

Good verbal and written communication; able to effectively articulate technical vision, possibilities, and outcomes.



Decision Authorities



Able to achieve most tasks using own judgement.

Can lead smaller groups where required.

Good analytical skills, copes with complex situations through deliberate analysis and planning.



Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.





About John Hancock And Manulife



John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com .

 Hancock

 develop 

 and

 colour 

 , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Financial Services
description:
Vous serez membre d’un Squad qui a comme objectif d’innover et de développer de nouvelles façons d’intégrer des données et des sources de données à nos actifs, ainsi que de rendre disponibles les données pour nos clients et consommateurs. Nous avons pris le virage DevOps, et nous avons l’ambition d’accélérer notre transformation dans les prochaines années. Pour ce faire, on a besoin de toi, de ton attitude et de ton talent.







• Agir en tant qu’expert de référence dans tous les aspects d
’intégration technique et des flux de donnée
s.

• Design des solutions d’intégrations et de consommations de données au moyen d’ETL, d’API et/ou de Streaming Kafka incluant la portion de surveillance des applications (AppDynamics, Datadog, etc.).

• Accompagner les équipes de support applicatif et d’exploitation TI dans le diagnostic et la résolution de problèmes opérationnelles.

• Contribuer à l’automatisation des processus d’intégration continue, de mise à l’essai automatisée et de déploiement continu.

• Interagir avec les différentes parties prenantes afin de comprendre les besoins d’affaires. Responsable des éléments techniques et ‘NFR’ du ‘backlog’. Collaboration avec le/la gestionnaire de produit (‘PO’).

• Donner de la visibilité sur la dette technique.

• Proposer des interventions et correctifs permanents dans une perspective d’amélioration continue.

• Maintenir la connaissance technique des écosystèmes SOA, API, DataPower, Kafka et MQ, incluant les points d’intégration internes et externes (avec les applications consommatrices).

• Supporter les équipes d’architecture, de conception et de développement dans leurs activités de livraison de solutions.

• Participer activement à la planification 12 mois des projets de maintenance et d’évolution.

• Faire un suivi périodique des projets en mode réalisation.

• Travailler en collaboration avec l’architecte d’entreprise et concepteurs afin de créer le design de haut niveau d’une solution d’intégration de bout en bout en définissant les interfaces et le flux de données requis entre les applications et les activités liées aux processus organisationnels afin de soutenir les applications.

• Créer un inventaire de toutes les interactions inter-applications, les interfaces et les services en se fondant sur les diagrammes des activités et du flux de données.

• Définir les méthodes d’intégration à utiliser.

• Soutenir l’architecte de données dans la modélisation du flux de données entre les applications.

• Soutenir l’architecte de la sécurité dans l’établissement d’un modèle sécuritaire à utiliser pour l’intégration.

• Travailler en collaboration avec les directeurs de programme afin de s’assurer que la solution d’intégration est conforme au programme et aux cibles de l’architecture d’entreprise.





Profil recherché


Si tu te démarques par ton désir d’innover, ta curiosité, ton pragmatisme ainsi que ta capacité d’apprentissage et d’adaptation, tu es sans doute le membre que nous cherchons pour compléter notre équipe! Les données sont au cœur de notre organisation et la qualité de celles-ci permet de bien orienter les décisions d'affaires de l'organisation, mais aussi celles de nos clients pour leur avenir. Si tu as envie de partager ton expérience en données, si tu veux avoir un impact important et être au cœur du changement, tu es la personne parfaite pour nous!





Qualifications


• 10 années ou plus d'expérience pertinente.

• Baccalauréat ou maîtrise en informatique, génie logiciel ou l’équivalent.

• Bilinguisme (français/anglais).

• Expérience dans le rôle d’architecte et/ou concepteur senior dans la livraison de projets.

• Aptitudes naturelles de leader, d’influenceur, d’innovateur et de communicateur de grande envergure et dans une grande organisation.

• Maîtriser les concepts, technologies et solutions d’un écosystème moderne: Architecture par domaine, Micro-services, API, streaming, technologies Cloud, Flux de données temps-réel, Orchestration, « Straight Through Processing », de sécurité d’accès, élasticité, PaaS, Cloud, DevOps, etc.

• Connaissances des outils de développement logiciel en mode agile, de gestion du code source et DevOps (Jenkins, git-Bitbucket, Nexus, Docker, etc.).

• Connaissance des langages Java / Python.

• Expérience sur les technologies Unix/Linux, OpenShift, WebSphere, DataPower, Kafka et MQ.

• Expérience en développement sur les outils/technologies API Connect, WAS, RESTFul, Swagger, YAML, JSON, SOAP et XML.

• Expérience sur les technologies DevOps Jenkins et UrbanCode.

• Expérience dans la rédaction de documents techniques.

• Être disponible sur appel par rotation (24/7).

• Expérience de développement au sein d'équipes suivant les meilleures pratiques DevOps et d'intégration en continu.

industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
532109BR


Introduction


Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.


Your Role and Responsibilities


Data is the new currency. In an ever increasingly connected world where the amount of data generated every day is exploding, in the wrong hands, this data can be used for malicious intent. As more systems are being built on the cloud, businesses are struggling to protect and monitor their data environment. The IBM Security development team works on leading edge products and solutions to help organizations analyze their data environment to make sound decisions to ensure regulatory compliance and improve their data security. The research and development in this area is critical to IBM and represents a huge opportunity for growth in terms of revenue uplift and technology advancement.

Our developers participate in all aspects of software development, from inception and design through code implementation and delivery, contribute to and learn about all technologies utilized by the product across the different tiers and work closely with senior technical team members on high-level architecture and designs. As a Security Software Developer, you will be an integral part of the team responsible for developing new features for our new data security offering using the wide array of tools and technologies. You will work on a self-managing Agile team that cultivates creativity and challenges the status quo. You have an interest in learning and writing code in a variety of programming languages and/or different platforms, possess an innovative mindset and passion to push limits on finding new and inventive ways to work. Curiosity is a must!

As our team operates in a highly dynamic, Agile, squad-based development environment, you will have the opportunity to work on a closely knit squad with responsibilities covering the entire spectrum of software development (e.g. Research, Design, Prototype, Development, QA, Deployment, Support). Additionally, as a member of the L3 Development team, you will be also working with customers and Support team to investigate and implement software fixes and improvements, find ways to workaround issues and help building fixpacks.

The ideal candidate should have a good communication skills, passion for developing software using the latest web technologies as demonstrated by their contribution to open source projects, experimenting with new technologies and development of their own hobby applications. They should also have a keen interest in researching the latest data security trends and regulations, and a broad understanding of cybersecurity attacks. In addition, the ideal candidate must also have a relentless desire for continuous improvement through the learning of new things, be a champion of new ideas, continually explore new perspectives, and embrace going beyond their comfort zone even at the risk of failure or embarrassment.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




English Fluent (verbal and written)

Hands-on experience with at least three programming languages, such as Golang, Python, NodeJS, Java, C++

Knowledge of designing and implementing solutions based on microservices methodologies.

Knowledge with file access operations

Familiarity with message/queue systems, e.g., Kafka, Event Streams

Experience with working with traditional or modern data stores/services, e.g., Relational DBs (SQL), HDFS, NoSQL, and Cloud Object Stores

Strong academic foundation in Computer Science or related fields: Data structures, algorithms, networking

Strong communication skills and able to convey ideas and opinions to others.




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Some exposure with at least one modern web application framework (ReactJS preferably)

Familiar with protocols such as GRPC

Experience with design and optimization of traditional and modern data stores/services, e.g., RDBMS, HDFS, NoSQL, and Cloud Object Stores

Familiarity with Java/J2EE

Experience in enterprise-related development (multi-threading, scalability, performance)

Experience with automated infrastructure configurations and orchestration, e.g., Docker, Kubernetes

Experience with CI/CD tools, e.g., Jenkins, Travis

Experience building applications on cloud infrastructure, e.g., private clouds, public clouds

Experience with unit testing frameworks

Experience working in an agile team, e.g., Kanban

Familiarity with continuous delivery and continuous integration



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM is a leading provider of enterprise security solutions. Named by industry analysts as a leader in 12 security market segment categories, IBM Security is a multi-billion dollar business that is rapidly growing. In an industry focused on building walls, IBM Security is focused on creating an open, connected security ecosystem that leverages AI and cloud to help clients improve compliance, stop threats, and grow their business securely.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description:
The Opportunity:


The Business Systems Analyst performs a combination of three functions: business analysis, systems analysis, and project management. As a Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible for managing the customer relationship between IS, and one or more business areas, implementing new applications, as well as supporting and maintaining a portfolio of existing applications. A Business Systems Analyst may also provide guidance and direction to Systems Analysts and Developers.


Key Accountabilities:




 Manage the customer relationship between IS and specific business areas; Support, maintain, enhance and/or upgrade a portfolio of custom and package applications 

 Analyze requests for new functionality, and document business cases to justify new application investments; Understand the architecture of the applications within the groups portfolio 

 Develop estimates of effort for design of new, and/or modification to existing, application components 

 Design application components to automate and streamline business processes and functions; Develop and maintain technical specifications and documentation 

 Business area planning that includes scheduling and management of application projects 

 Plan, assign and monitor daily work assignments for Systems Analysts, Developers and Developer Analysts 

 Troubleshoot and repair problems that occur in the everyday use of an application 

 Develop cost estimates for the annual IS capital and sustainment budgets 



Other Details:




 Job location; Calgary, Alberta 

 Shift schedule: 5X2 (Monday to Friday – 8 hours/day) 

 Eligible for relocation pursuant to Canadian Natural’s Relocation Regular Policy 

 Competitive salary, stock options, stock savings plan and benefits 



Skills & Qualifications:




 Typically 10+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst and Systems Analyst, preferably supporting Thermal Operations with experience implementing an Application; SQL, database design and query tools such as Microsoft Access and/or SQL+ 

 Post-secondary degree in Computer Sciences; ITIL Certification is preferred 

 Demonstrated proficiency in business modeling, process modeling, data modeling, and effort/cost modeling and estimating; and exceptional Project Management skills 


Successful applicants must provide acceptable evidence of being fully immunized against COVID-19 (two doses of Health Canada approved COVID-19 vaccine, plus 14 days after your second vaccination) before a start date can be set.


Why Canadian Natural?


CANADIAN NATURAL is a senior independent crude oil and natural gas exploration, development and production company based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. Our strong, diversified asset base is comprised of a balanced portfolio of light, synthetic, and heavy crude oil and natural gas. Canadian Natural operates in Canada, the United Kingdom and Offshore Africa.

At Canadian Natural, we strive to live through our mission statement: "To develop people to work together to create value for the Company's shareholders by doing it right with fun and integrity." We are committed to a long-term presence in the communities where we operate. Our activities create value by providing employment, business development opportunities, revenues to governments that contribute to spending on goods and services, and essential resources for public services, including health, safety, education and training.

Over the last 30 years, we have grown from a Company with nine employees to over 10,000 employees. We have increased our production from approximately 400 BOE/d in 1989 to more than one million BOE/d today.

Safety is a core value at Canadian Natural. We conduct all of our operations in a way that identifies, minimizes and mitigates harm to the health and safety of employees, contractors, the public and the environment.

Canadian Natural Resources Ltd- “Canadian Natural” is a publicly traded company on the TSX and NYSE as CNQ.

March 21, 2022. 
 Apply now!

description:
Address



YSC - 2 Sheppard Avenue East



Job Family Group



Technology



Primary Role Function



Accountable for the design, development, testing and support of applications utilized in Lines of Business strategies.

Delivers mapping documents and data modeling based on business requirements

Writes high quality and well-documented code according to accepted standards

Participates in project and team meetings interacting and collaborating with team members and other departments as appropriate

Contributes to successful completion of project deliverables

Provides support to team members, operation team and application business partners.




Knowledge





Thorough in-depth knowledge of design and analysis methodology and application development processes

Exhibits solid knowledge of data warehouses and Cognos

Programming experience with extensive business knowledge

University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent industry experience

Solid understanding of SDLC and QA requirements




Skills





Strong ETL experience and Data Warehouse development

Working Experience with SQL design/coding and Cognos

Experience with SSIS, SQL Server, Netezza, MS SQL

Credit Risk knowledge will be an asset

Strong analytical skills for complex problem solving

Quick learning skills and self-motivated

Possesses solid communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to carry out complex tasks and prioritize when multi-tasking


Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.



Assesses impact of design decisions to the computer solution/product/service being developed (i.e. performance, schedule, budget, downstream component/system impact, quality, etc.) and recommends alternate/creative solutions for mitigation/optimization if required.

Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.

Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.

Leads and implements initiatives as required to deliver business objectives.

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders and ensures alignment.

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.

Leads/conducts detailed code-reviews and provides feedback in a constructive manner.

Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.

Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers.

Assesses the costs and benefits for different solutions and recommend/decide on appropriate designs.

Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.

Supports production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis.

Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.

Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.

Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.

Supports the management of specific project deliverables & outcomes.

Identifies opportunities to strengthen the development capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks.

Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.

Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.

Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.



Qualifications:


Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and/or certification in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Advanced level of knowledge in domain.

Knowledge of software development practices, concepts, and technology obtained through formal training and/or work experience.

Knowledge of required programming languages and can code with little oversight.

Knowledge of technical/business environment and processes.

Understand functional aspects and technical behavior of the underlying operating system, development environment, and deployment practices.

Have facility with and understanding of the ecosystem that code operates in.

Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.

Influence skills - In-depth.

Data driven decision making - In-depth.



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

description:
Company Description



This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening


Technicolor Creative Studios is powered by world-leading visual effects, advertising, animation and games brands around the world; from Moving Picture Company, and Mr.X, to The Mill, and Mikros, to the recently-launched Technicolor Games.

Our studios have worked on the spectacular scenes and tiny details that make movies, advertising campaigns, animation and games truly mind-blowing. We’re the people behind creative delivery in countless blockbuster films such as 1917, The Lion King, The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge on the Run, Cruella, game animations for titles including Call of Duty, Resident Evil and Need for Speed and advertising campaigns for some of the biggest brands in the world including Apple, Nike, Samsung and Audi.

The Technicolor Creative Studios team is wildly creative, exceptionally talented and extremely passionate about the possibilities we make happen in our industry. We are looking for more of the very best talent to join us.


Job Description


The Engineer manages the development of the ongoing internal creative and technical training programs as well as the internal training platform and training tools using Technicolor technologies. They work closely with the HOD and Department Trainers to develop training outcomes, coordinate training technical resources across sites, project manage training programs such as new starter training, upskilling, cross-training, show-specific training, and masterclasses.


Responsibilities



Work with production teams to collect requirements for developing and scheduling up and coming show specific technical training

Develop, manage, and execute the studio’s training processes, platform, tools, and programs.

Plan, design and coordinate the development and the deployment of company-wide studio tools and their training programs.

Maintain the standards and be an administrator to the Learning Management System.

Assess, test, troubleshoot and maintain systems and platform in order to ensure the availability and integrity of training materials across sites.

Assist in the creation of new VFX Academy technical programs., in person learning and other development programs.

Oversee and enforce the standards and creation of department technical documentation.

Oversee the documented history of workflows used on current and past VFX shows.

Create and present proposals for new technological training initiatives to the training management.

Report to the Head of Creative Training and Development.

Act as an administrator to the video sharing platform



Qualifications



Bachelor’s in Computer Engineering or relevant field

Is an excellent communicator, both written and verbal. 

Worked in VFX for 5+ years.

Can work independently within an organization to get information proactively.

Previous experience in a training organization.

industries: Leasing Non-residential Real Estate
description:
Job Category




Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!



The opportunity


Reporting to the Engineering Manager we are looking for an ETL-savvy 
Senior Data Engineer
 to join and help lead our growing team; someone who thrives in an autonomous and dynamic environment. You will build new data products and features in collaboration with multiple teams, solving complex data problems in resolution, linkage, and classification. You will be a subject matter expert on how data sources and data science models are combined to create output servicing our applications.



What’s In It For You




Impact and exposure.
 Data is the future and our present. You will apply and grow your skills in big data, functional programming, machine learning, and data science helping to advance engineering efforts targeted at problems not yet solved in the industry. This is a newly acquired, innovative and responsive product team undergoing an exciting transformation and alignment with Altus. This is a chance to join an engineering team as they ramp up their work, reach and impact; and a chance to define and build out your role. You will have your voice heard as you work across teams and independently to implement best practices and build exciting new solutions.


Career Development.
 You want to be part of a global company that is forward-thinking and setting the standards in Real Estate technology. Your career opportunities will increase as we continue to scale as a company and as a team, including the chance to grow your skills, and your influence on this team or on another product team.


As our new Senior Data Engineer you will focus on:



 Design and development. You will contribute to the architecture and implementation of our knowledge graph. You will write high-quality code, participate actively in code reviews, and consistently help to ship software. You will design workflows in Scala. 

 The data pipeline. You will lead the integration of new data, the improvement of existing data, and the productionalization of machine learning and data science efforts. You will create frameworks that ensure ongoing, consistent quality, maintenance, optimization, and operation of the data pipeline. 

 Collaboration. You will work closely with the R&D team to design, build and improve the complex data layer; and provide ongoing feedback to the product team on improving graph quality and coverage. You will play a critical role on the team and at Altus to meet the current and anticipated needs of our clients. You will increase data accessibility and foster data-driven decision-making in the global CRE industry. 




Our New Senior Data Engineer Has




The knowledge. You share our belief that as data engineers, our job is to put together a transparent and holistic view of the world from a data perspective. With 5+ years in software development, you are deeply familiar with best practices in Computer Science, building B2B products, developing and advancing workflow, and working with big data and machine learning. Ideally, you have exposure to graph technology.

The technical expertise. You have strong working and conceptual knowledge of building and maintaining custom analytical solutions and data pipelines. You have experience using Scala, and Java or Python as well as Apache Spark or another distributed data processing framework (Beam, Flink).

The relationship-building expertise. You have an appreciation for cross-team collaboration, particularly with our data scientists and API engineers. You can influence work in a multi-functional team environment with rapidly changing priorities under tight deadlines. You have flexible communication and documentation skills, confidence in making presentations, and can leverage communication tools. You can translate technical data and development concepts for a non-technical audience. 

The drive to continuously improve. You can anticipate, understand, and respond to the needs of internal teams and external clients, and you are driven to meet or exceed their expectations. You are a forward thinker and can innovate solutions to keep the data products - and the business - moving forward.



Come realize your potential at Altus Group!


Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

description:
We are seeking a Systems Engineer to join our offices in either British Columbia or Alberta.

Responsible for repairing, installing, maintaining, troubleshooting and upgrading wireless access points/controllers, mobile computers, MDM, RFID systems, software and other related AIDC equipment. The technician assesses user training needs and trains users in effective use of standard applications; makes recommendations regarding hardware and software use; prepares documentation and provides user assistance to OCR Canada customers.



About The Role




 Stage, configure, install, troubleshoot and maintain wireless access points/controllers, mobile computers, MDM, RFID systems, software and other related AIDC equipment

 Stage and configure mobile computers such as handhelds, tablets, wearable and vehicle mounted terminals based on customer requirements

 Evaluates repair requests, determines extent of needed service and exercises considerable judgment in continuing with the service or forwarding extensive requests to supervisor or suppliers.

 Wifi design and troubleshoot customer networks using wireless site survey software and equipment based on customer requirements

 Run CAT6 cabling and crimp RJ45 ends using tools and test equipment

 Install access points, controllers, RFID hardware, vehicle mount devices, network switches and IDF cabinets

 Make recommendations and provide expertise based on experience, technical knowledge, observations while onsite and data gathered from hardware and software tools

 Create documentation/reports based on configuration and onsite performed

 Support Sales team members on customer calls or visits

 Comfortable working in elevated platforms, training to be provided
