 Keeps up to date on new equipment and software training and OEM certifications to continue to have OCR Canada stay compliant for each OEM technical requirement as laid out in their partner agreements.

 Travel within Canada and rarely USA for work, assistance with larger projects and/or training



Relationships and Roles



 Maintain and Develop relationships with customers to ensure the proper support.

 Maintain and Develop relationships with sales department to assist and support them with OCR Canada customer needs.

 Maintain and Develop relationships with OEM SE, repair and technical staff.

 Work with fellow OCR Canada Technicians to cross train on knowledge of various types of equipment.

 Work with the OCR Canada programming team to understand the integration of our software with hardware




Preferred Characteristics




 Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills

 Excellent computer skills

 Proficient in MS Office products

 Intermediate/Advance networking knowledge

 Experience with Wifi design and troubleshooting

 Basic/Intermediate knowledge of RFID technology

 Able to multitask and prioritize tasks

 Comfortable working with their hands and using tools

 Strong interpersonal, organizational and communication skills (both verbal and written)

 Comfortable in a high pressure environment

 Willingness to constantly learn and adapt to new technology

 Professional telephone manner

 Commitment to customer satisfaction, retention and loyalty

 Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

 Must be fluent in English

 Bilingualism a Plus (Quebec French)




Office And Or Other Responsibilities




 Responsible for clean service technical area and service area

 Responsible for Inventory required to complete assigned jobs/projects assigned to them

The company goes to market with industry-leading websites, technically trained sales professionals, and solution architects. We are looking to continue our growth through the expansion of our core assets, new marketing, and product initiatives, and acquisition of additional capabilities. Job description


Staffmax is hiring a Senior Software Engineer for one of their client in Canada. this is fulltime remote opportunity.


Responsibilities



Job Duties



Develop highly interactive, user friendly, and feature rich applications.

Work directly with Product Managers, Product Owners, User Experience, Quality Engineers, Principal Engineers, and Operations teammates to define, create, enhance, maintain, and deploy applications.

Constantly use best practices by building APIs, creating and maintaining unit tests, applying modern frameworks and design patterns, actively reducing technical debt, and continuously delivering by merging/releasing consistently to the mainline branch.

Complete complex tasks with minimal amount of oversight or supervision.

Occasionally plan, design, and estimate software engineering efforts.

Lead design and architecture discussions with other engineering teammates.

Guide and contribute towards evolving the application architecture.

Help others to learn and grow in their skills.



Our Technical Stack



Angular

TypeScript

C#

Ruby

Git, TFS

MS SQL, MySQL, NoSQL

Linux, Windows

Kubernetes, Amazon Web Services, and Serverless



Qualifications/Requirements


• 6 or more years professional software development experience in Ruby or TypeScript.

• 4 or more years professional software development experience in MS SQL or MySQL.

• Experience in a collaborative team environment delivering scalable, secure, and highly available SaaS applications

• Experience working in a continuous integration environment.

• Ability to write high-quality, modular, maintainable, and secure code.

• Experience with testing best practices, including unit and integration tests.

• Ability to work well within a team environment and be self-starting and self-sufficient.

Desired Characteristics


• Experience with processing payments in a high-volume environment.

• Experience with payment facilitation integration (stripe / world pay).

• Experience with message broker software (ie RabbitMQ).

• Experience with .net core

• Experience with serverless computing

• Experience with RESTful APIs and HTTP protocols.

• Exhibits a deep respect for the craft, and values building software sustainably by using modern techniques and industry best practices.

• Experience breaking monoliths into domain specific micro services.

• Experience with object-oriented design, ability to apply software patterns, and consuming event-driven applications using REST APIs within a microservice architecture.

• Ability to communicate clearly and collaborate effectively with other teammates of different software disciplines and technical skill sets.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services

description:
We’re looking for an individual to contribute to our talented team of computational imaging software engineers as we prepare to bring DepthIQ™ – our passive, single-sensor depth platform – to market. This is a unique opportunity to apply your experience in computational imaging and computer vision across a wide variety of use cases that leverage imaging and depth data in markets spanning mobile, consumer, industrial and automotive.





Who are we and what do we do?


We have a passion for developing solutions at the intersection of 2D imaging and depth. AIRY3D has developed DepthIQ, a 3D computer vision platform that consists of a Transmissive Diffraction Mask and computational imaging software that can give any CMOS image sensor the ability to provide depth information.





What are we looking for?


To be successful in this role, you must bring computational imaging and multi-threaded software architecture experience in equal measure to apply research results to novel solutions showcasing the unique possibilities and advantages of DepthIQ. We’re looking for someone to mentor others, setting an example of “what good looks like” for the software design, development, and deployment process. And who is keen to roll up their sleeves and contribute wherever necessary.





What you will do:


The Core software team is responsible for maintaining and enhancing our processing pipeline architecture as well as porting our advanced image reconstruction and depth extraction algorithms. Responsibilities include optimizing and refining DepthIQ, maintaining the image and depth processing pipeline, and extending our SDK to support compelling proof-of-concept applications that highlight the capabilities and advantages of our approach.





Requirements



What you bring to our team



At least 5 years experience developing computational imaging solutions

Strong preference will be given to candidates with proven experience with software development in depth and computer vision solutions

Solid technical background in image processing techniques such as image filtering, feature extraction, image enhancement, and image segmentation

Good experience with optimized and multi-threaded processing pipeline

A Master's Degree in Computer Science specializing in image processing, computational photography, computer vision

Experience with OpenCV, OpenCL, git, gtest, GitLab

Expert in C++, Python, and object-oriented programming

Attention to architectural considersations such as portability to embedded devices, real-time performance and efficient memory usage is required






Bonus points



Experience with mobile camera applications

Experience with industrial 3D applications

Practical experience with deep learning approaches to computer vision / computational imaging






What’s it like working in our team?


We believe in creating disruptive technology in a workplace with great work ethics. We truly enjoy what we are doing and the diversity of those we work with, all while having fun and not taking ourselves too seriously! We offer a flexible schedule, vibrant Montreal (Mile End) location, health insurance, stock options and a Team Incentive Plan.

We are looking for a talented engineer and passionate team-player to join the Ownr team as a 
Senior Software Engineer
. You'll join a scaling team, designing the next evolution of our platform as we move to provide extensive new capabilities to business owners, and work alongside a close-knit group of ambitious engineers, product managers, and designers.

Your experience will contribute to the functionality, reliability, and delivery of our constantly-evolving Node/React-based applications, leveraging the latest JavaScript-based tooling and best practices. You will also have an opportunity to learn and expand our infrastructure and DevOps pipelines. As part of a young and growing team, you will have daily opportunities to lead and mentor other developers, exercising your skills as a well-rounded cross-functional contributor and technical leader, uniquely in both startup and enterprise environments.





What will you do?



Work with a team of skilled JavaScript developers creating a rapidly evolving consumer-facing platform.

Lead the design and delivery of a significant portion of the software that supports the business, and for monitoring and maintaining that software in production.

Collaborate and organize cross functional partners to turn ambiguity into a practical technical reality.

Work with modern tooling throughout, whether that's something currently part of our stack, or something new that you assess needs to be added to reliably deliver the desired user experience.

Create intuitive, robust and reusable applications using modern frameworks.

Be responsible for finding opportunities to iteratively improve our technology, paying down technical debt as a habit.






About you



You embrace an owner's mindset: continually striving to make an impact; investing time, energy, and capital as if they were your own; and understanding that no part of the business is outside the scope of your position.

You have significant production JavaScript experience, and have formed clear opinions about how different development patterns and practices can both negatively and positively impact your ability to be productive in a codebase, and by extension, the reliability of a business' software platform.

You’re a creative problem solver that can develop a plan, take ownership of tasks, and are outcome focused.

You’re passionate about mentoring and coaching other engineers, and have a practiced ability to spot when help is needed and tactfully provide guidance to get things unstuck.

You behave proactively when confronted with unforeseen challenges and complexity in your projects. Your team members can clearly understand the state of your work, your delivery plans, and your ideas for improving the business’ software, technology processes, and team culture.






What do you need to succeed?



Must have



4+ years of solid hands-on programming experience, with a sizable portion in JavaScript, TypeScript, GraphQL, React, and Postgres.

Experience organizing development teams, mentoring junior developers, and working with non-technical stakeholders.

Experience writing automated tests, from unit tests to end to end tests, and have some knowledge of JavaScript-based testing frameworks.

Experience with source control (e.g. Git + Github) and modern software delivery techniques and tools, including pull requests.

Experience with DevOps best practices and some knowledge in setting up and configuring cloud computing infrastructure.

Experience building production systems, with an understanding of the deployment, monitoring, and security best practices required to run production software.






Nice to have



Post-secondary degree or diploma in a computer or design related program.






About Ownr


At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We're on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.






﻿
About RBC Ventures



RBC Ventures Inc., a subsidiary of the Royal Bank of Canada, is going beyond banking to create meaningful solutions that touch every Canadian. We are building new ventures, acquiring growing firms, making investments and partnering with organizations that share our vision. The results are products and services that solve problems and make lives better. For more information, visit RBCVentures.ca.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
About HashiCorp



At HashiCorp, we’re building a generation-defining infrastructure software company, powered by our core principles and a growing team of talented, committed professionals working together to help organizations seamlessly transition to and operate in the cloud. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in San Francisco, 85 percent of our employees work remotely, strategically distributed around the globe. From our inception we built the company with a remote-first approach because we believe talent has no boundaries.

Product Security Engineer

HashiCorp is a fast-growing startup that solves development, operations, and security challenges in infrastructure so organizations can focus on business-critical tasks. Our open source software is used by millions of users to provision, secure, connect, and run any infrastructure for any application. The Global 2000 uses our enterprise software to accelerate application delivery and drive innovation through software.

We are looking for Product Security Engineers to help scale our product security function, which works closely with engineering & product management to ensure that security is appropriately addressed across the HashiCorp suite of cloud and self-managed products. This role will report to our Director of Product Security.

Security at HashiCorp is a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.



In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Include




Contribute to secure architecture and design of HashiCorp products.

Work across various product and engineering teams to prioritize security features and bugs, and ensure implementation and mitigations.

Monitor threats and vulnerabilities impacting HashiCorp products and services; triage reported vulnerabilities, identify mitigations and assess/communicate associated risk.

Plan & execute security assessments (dynamic testing, static testing, code review, etc) and threat modeling of HashiCorp’s products, services, and associated cloud infrastructure.

Build and implement security solutions across the product life-cycle, such as standalone security tools, CI/CD pipeline integrations, product security features/fixes, etc.

Act as SME on multiple information security areas (e.g. security architecture, application security, threat modeling etc.)

Assist in execution of 3rd-party audits, penetration tests, and bug bounty programs.

Contribute to the creation and delivery of security training.

Research emerging attack vectors and techniques.


We are looking for talented self-starters with 4+ years of security experience. We will consider experienced engineers with less security-specific experience but the desire to learn!


You may be a good fit if you have knowledge and experience around:



Product / service architectures in modern cloud environments (IaaS, SaaS, PaaS).

Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Modern engineering practices, processes, and tools, particularly related to the Go programming language and ecosystem.

Secure development practices, and integration into broader engineering activities.

Secure operations practices, specifically wrt. cloud environments.

Application and infrastructure security testing methodologies and tools.

Security design / architecture and threat modeling.

Vulnerabilities (old and new), and options for defense / mitigation.

Product vulnerability management lifecycle.

Security audits, penetration tests, and/or bug bounty programs.

Cryptography and cryptographic libraries.


HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be. Interested, and think you might be a fit? Apply today!

HashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.

For more information regarding how HashiCorp collects, uses, and manages personal information, please review our Privacy Policy.

industries: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Analyst, Business Intelligence



GTA (Hybrid)



 






Introduction


We’re hiring a Business Intelligence Analyst for our client, a large international organization focusing on research

development, production, and commercialization of innovative therapeutic solutions. This is a full-time permanent opportunity in Greater Toronto Area with a hybrid work schedule.

The BI Analyst will be responsible for compiling, analyzing, and reporting sales data for global rare disease products. This position will monitor and analyze competitive activity, customer, and market trends providing actionable insights to the sales and marketing teams. Contributing to the development of sales plans and objectives this role will act as a “subject matter expert” of data extraction and analysis for departments requiring expert knowledge in building data dashboards.


 






Responsibilities



Create analysis reports for sales, including shipping data. Examine monthly, quarterly, and annual sales reports to identify sales patterns and areas for improvement, comparing actual sales data to revenue projections and expectations.

Assess the company’s budget vs sales performance. Examine budget and compare it to actual sales results to identify divisions that are not meeting projected sales goals.

Responsible for all CRM reporting to ensure the Sales Manager have detailed insights into the sales activities of the team. Effectively use historical sales data and market trends to develop forecasts and projections. Develop reports showing expected sales and the potential effects of new strategies to aid in decision-making. Work closely with management personnel to develop forecasts and examine the potential revenue effects of various proposals.

Regularly prepare reports and presentations for executives and other company leaders. These reports may include data on market performance, competitor research, general sales trends, and sales team performance.

Act as a Subject Matter Expert to the Information Technology team to share expertise and best practices for BI data extraction and creating dashboards.

Perform all work in accordance with established regulatory, compliance and safety requirements.

All other duties as assigned, including ad hoc reporting as needed.


 





Requirements:



Bachelor’s Degree in Business or computer science. 

2+ years of analyst experience, preferably in the pharmaceutical industry.

Extensive experience assessing data sets and identifying patterns and opportunities for improvement.

High-level math skills and the ability to translate mathematical information into concise reports.

Strong attention to detail.

Effective projection and forecasting skills.

Excellent presentation skills. 

Demonstrated leadership skills and experience.

Committed to a strong team working environment; well-developed interpersonal skills, and ability to interact effectively with staff at all levels.

Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Highly organized; able to work under pressure and to strict timelines.

Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Project) and Veeva/ IQVIA OCE CRM software.

Expert in developing dashboards in Power BI 



 






What We Offer


Why apply through Brunel? Finding the next step in your career can be a fulltime job in itself. We manage the process for you: from submitting your resume to coordinating interviews to extending offers and assisting with on-boarding. We’ll get you going while you get on with the job.





About Us


Brunel has a reputation for working with some of the best in the business. That’s what we continually strive for. Over 45 years, we’ve created a global network of interesting clients and talented individuals working together through a vast array of services.

industries: Retail
description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada


Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.

The Senior Developer role will be a part of the MAPD team at Canadian Tire Financial Services (CTFS). The Developer's primary role is to design, develop, implement, and support web application solutions for all business units supporting our acquisition application.  The MAPD team supports Credit card customer acquisitions and application forms.

To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Senior Developer position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.

An ideal candidate is a self-motivated, agile and innovative individual. You are a problem solver with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives. You are a collaborative team player with superior influencing skills, relationship building skills and a senior driven technologist who knows how to put his experience to work



What You’ll Do



The Senior Developer's primary role is to design, develop, and support the release of applications at Canadian Tire Financial Services (CTFS). You’ll research, investigate, recommend and drive solutions by participating in project definition and prioritization, determining solutions alternatives, creating conceptual designs and detail design of solutions that meet the business requirements and align with key strategies.



Your Key Accountabilities Include




 Coordinate with architects and developers to create roadmaps for digital capabilities 

 Understand business requirements, constraints and current situation to propose solutions 

 Work with delivery teams to ensure solutions align with proposed roadmaps and architecture 

 Develop solutions by preparing and evaluating workflow solutions 

 Evaluate and recommend solutions for analytics, fraud prevention and credit decisioning 

 Assist delivery teams to solve problems and provide decision support to deliver a solution 

 Design, develop and communicate designs with primary focus on Integration, Web technologies, Mobile, J2EE platforms and Service Oriented Architecture 

 Support, enhance and maintain a key and vital banking system 




What You Bring

 

 University or College degree in computer science/engineering, or equivalent work experience 

 Experience in managing an environment of change and ambiguity 

 Strong capability in building, launching and managing projects/programs that drive results 

 Excellent development background with 4+ years of IT experience 

 More than 2 years of experience in an Agile environment 

 Experience in System Architecture, Design and Integration 

 Strong experience in the following:


 React JS 

 JavaScript 

 JUNIT 

 Jira and Confluence 





The Following Are An Asset

 




 Web Content Management with understanding of tagging, analytics, segmentation, testing, personalization, and Digital Asset Management (AEM) 

 Mobile Device Management / Mobile Device Gateway 

 Android Development (Cordova, Android Studio) 

 Angular JS 

 MQ Series/JMS 

 Websphere, HIS 

 Oracle, JDBC 





About Canadian Tire Corporation



As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .

CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Ontario-Oakville

Permanent

Full-time

Mar 8, 2022, 12:31:14 PM

job_title: Lead Senior Financial Analyst - Global Fortune 500 Firm ** Big 4 Strong IFRS with CPA a MUST!
description:
Position Title: 
Lead Senior Financial Analyst





Client Details:


Our client is a Global Publicly Traded Company that focuses on Manufacturing of Motorized Products and Vehicles. Our client has a fantastic +4.0 Glassdoor Employer rating with an amazing Culture and one Canada’s Best Employers for New Grads





﻿Role Summary:


Our client is looking for Lead Senior Financial Analyst with Main duties of assisting with analysis and preparation of reports in monthly closing, forecasting and annual budgeting for the Company





Key Job Responsibilities:






Prepare reports for use by the President and other Company Executive and Parent Headquarter Divisions as required.

Support monthly closing and analysis of variances to budget and forecast.

Prepare balance sheet for the annual budget and all rolling forecasts.

Assist business with achieving budget/forecast timelines and review of items loaded into SAP (via EPM).

Responsible for fixed asset closing on month ends, including comparison to CAPEX plan and reconciliation with WorthIt system.

Prepare bridge between US GAAP and IFRS for comparative financial reporting purposes.

Assist with J-sox walkthrough and testing as required.

Ad hoc projects as necessary





Location:

GREATER TORONTO AREA, Ontario  ** HYBRID WORKING MODEL **




Salary Range:

Based on experience





Requirements:



Qualified CPA designation (or in process)

Degree/Diploma: Business related degree (BBA, BCOM, or BA)

3 – 5 Years’ experience in Finance/Accounting related roles

Previous experience in distribution, or Manufacturing industry in sales and finance an asset.

Proficiency in report writing, finance and accounting principles, as well as proficiency with office software applications such as SAP and Microsoft Office are required.

A mindset for continuous improvement, and proactive to accomplish tasks

job_title: Software Development Engineer (AI/ML Solutions Engineering), AI/ML Solutions
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Are you passionate about solving customer problems at scale? Do you want to build and innovate to deliver software that will help customers more effectively solve business problems with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning? If you have a passion for helping transform and accelerate a customer’s ability to gain value from the cloud, join the AWS Solutions team!

The AWS AI/ML Solutions team helps customers solve problems by packaging AWS AI and ML services with real-world use cases. We are looking for a world-class software developer to build and develop solutions focused on helping jump-start customers’ cloud management capabilities. You will work with product managers, customers, and your team to deliver AWS Solutions, software assets and build an open-source community that drives AI/ML innovation on AWS.

At Amazon, we hire creative developers who are passionate learners, mentor each other, and are motivated to take on new challenges. You will dive deep into the details of the business, operations, and engineering. You’ll need strong judgment and programming skills. You will also have to be obsessed with delivering the most customer-centric experience on the planet. You’ll need to invent and simplify, which is what we do every day in Amazon. We are looking for individuals who can look at problems in new ways and develop simple solutions to complex problems.

Collaborates with others to define and implement optimal, complete solutions based on stakeholder needs.

Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the AWS cloud.

Develop complex technical solutions into production quality single-click deployments.

Applies and generates best practices in multiple technical domains using AWS and third-party technology products and services.

Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within AWS.

Key job responsibilities

Collaborates with others to define and implement optimal, complete solutions based on stakeholder needs.

Participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the AWS cloud.

Develop complex technical solutions into production quality single-click deployments.

Applies and generates best practices in multiple technical domains using AWS and third-party technology products and services.

Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within AWS.




Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 Bachelor's degree in computer science related fields OR 1+ years equivalent experience in software development




Preferred Qualifications




 Experience with AWS management, governance, security, and serverless services

 2+ years of Machine Learning experience

 Familiarity with data pipelines and data solutions

 Mastery of the tools of the trade, including familiarity with modern programming languages (Java, JavaScript, C/C++, Python) and open-source technologies

 Expertise in many disparate technologies, ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between

 Knowledge of professional software engineering practices and best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, CI / CD, testing and operations

 Able to work in a diverse team

 Demonstrated creativity and judgment in developing exceptional experiences to customers

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role

 Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1971532

job_title: Software Development Engineer, People eXperiences Technology (PXT)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Job Summary




DESCRIPTION


Come join us in our journey to deliver solutions for one of the most complex domains in People Technology. We own and deliver technology to compute employee pay, globally, for all of our current and emerging businesses. At the core, we are in the business of analytics - real-time and batch-driven - over data collected from IoT devices, usually time clocks. We own our own high-availability authoritative services to support this processing, and require the ability to work from authoritative, replay-able, auditable "truth" for any point in an employee's timeline, since the HR landscape is littered with post-dated and pre-dated changes. Our business rules are complex and arcane, varying by role, business, and jurisdiction. We are solving all of these problems at Amazon scale, an order of magnitude larger than supported by any commodity solutions and growing exponentially.

You should be a passionate, results-oriented, experienced software developer. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a relentless focus on the customer experience and want to build something new rather than just maintain someone else’s code, then this role is for you.

Successful candidates will be strong leaders who can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and have a consistent track record of delivery. The People Tech business requires creative engineering balanced with high quality and customer focus.

Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Amazon leaders: - Exhibits excellent judgment


 Has relentlessly high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo)

 Is able to dive deep and is never out of touch with the details of the business or the technology

 Expects and requires innovation of her/his team

 Has passion and convictions and the innate ability to inspire passion in others

 Strong results orientation

 Thinks big





Basic Qualifications




 Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design

 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.

 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience




Preferred Qualifications




 5+ years’ industry experience as a software development engineer

 Experience with full stack development

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

 Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions


By submitting your application here, you can apply once to be considered for multiple Software Engineer openings across various Amazon teams. If you are successful in passing through the initial application review and assessment, you will be asked to submit your career and personal preferences so that our dedicated recruiters can match you to the right role based on these preferences.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

If you are successful in passing through the initial application review and assessment, you will be asked to submit your career and personal preferences so that our dedicated recruiters can match you to the right role based on these preferences.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.



Company
 - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

Job ID: A1971910

Full Stack Software Engineer






What’s the opportunity?





Are you passionate about coding, technical challenges and growth? Are you an intermediate full stack software engineer who has 3-5 years of experience?




We’re hiring a Full Stack Software Engineer to help us scale our venture-backed insurtech startup.





Why us?





YouSet is revolutionizing the insurance industry by combining technology, data and human expertise. We’re on a mission to build the most efficient and most loved insurance platform in Canada.




In less than 4 minutes, our powerful technology screens the market to help you save 29% on average on your home and car insurance and get you covered instantly, online.




To date, we’ve helped over 50 000 users shop for their insurance with an average of 4.9 stars in online reviews.





What will you be responsible for?





- Develop end-to-end solutions and iterate with ease on self-contained projects (frontend and backend).




- Design and build interfaces using ReactJS and other modern frontend technologies.




- Design robust and scalable architecture that interacts simultaneously with multiple internal and external services in NodeJS.




- Build improvements upon our deployment tools and automatic processes.




- Collaborate with a team of software engineers, insurance brokers and marketing specialists.





What will you be working with?






Typescript

React

Material UI

Styled components

Mobx

NodeJS

Restify

MongoDB

Google Cloud Platform (GCP) 

Webpack

and more. 






What type of person are you?





-Results-oriented: you’re focused on your objectives and work steadily to achieve them.




-Motivated: you’re entrepreneurial, you like challenges and you don’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves with a “let’s get it done” attitude.




-Analytical: A proven ability to build prototypes and take a data-driven approach to product development, testing and measuring new ideas very quickly





Do you have what it takes?





-A strong background in Full Stack development role (3-5 years)




-Experience in medium/large sized web app development hosted on a cloud platform (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure).




-A passion for developing user-facing web/mobile applications and building engaging user experiences.




-A thorough understanding of frontend system architecture and design at scale (ReactJS experience is a definite bonus).




-Experience building REST APIs (NodeJS experience is a definite bonus).




-Experience with oriented programming language




-You're comfortable with databases both conceptually and in implementation. Familiarity with MongoDB is preferred.





What’s in it for you?




﻿




Competitive compensation with stock options 

Build something massive and create an impact

Flexible hours and vacations

Remote work or downtown Montreal office space 

Flexible start date (but the sooner the better!)





This opportunity is for a full-time position in a high-growth startup, with increasing responsibilities as we grow.





Do you picture yourself working with us? Don't miss your chance and apply today!

** OPEN TO ANYONE IN CANADA OR THE USA ** 





About Knock Knock 





Knock Knock Games is on a mission to make it possible for anyone to make their own game on the blockchain as NFT, and work with the Creator Community to build a universe of games and experiences with the playable Vy NFT.





Vy Worlds
 is a Web3 gaming platform designed for the next billion blockchain gamers. Vy Worlds feature 
Vy
 NFT characters and exist within the 
Vy Verse
. We believe that User Generated Content (UGC) is already an important part of the gaming market (think ROBLOX, Minecraft, Fortnite’s Creator Mode) and is poised to become an essential part of the crypto gaming ecosystem in the future.

 

Our platform, Vy Worlds, makes it simple to make games, simple to play games, and simple to share games.





Simple to make games: Our game creation editor is no-code and is being designed so that anyone can create their own game.

Simple to play: We build games where people spend their time. Using web technology, we can be on a wider variety of platforms, including our own web platform.

Simple to share: Games like Minecraft and ROBLOX are complicated to set up and play with friends. For our platform, it only takes a web link to start playing with friends, no installs or setup are required. We want our platform to feel like a social network where players can invite friends and follow creators/players they like.






﻿Our Values: 






Keep teams small and move fast.

Be an owner: take ownership of your work.

Be weird: have a unique perspective.

Community first: work with the community to create something great together.


 

Job Objective

We are looking for a talented Senior Gameplay Engineer who can help take Vy Worlds to the next level. You will be joining a small team of engineers focused on making a frictionless, User-Generated Content (UGC) focused, NFT powered game into fruition. The game is currently in Alpha with multiple playable game modes and a creator mode. 

 


What You Will Do: 



Help launch a new NFT-focused game in early 2022. 

Primary objectives for this role: 

Build and own the development of a number of core gameplay features for the Vy Worlds platform.

Ideate, direct, and polish the look and feel of the game. 

Secondary objective: If you are interested in blockchain development, there will be opportunities to learn and grow with us for this project.

Work with the team to ensure cohesion between all features in the game.


 

 


What You Need to Succeed:



Key Skill: are you able to the below, or excited to learn how to do the following?




Deep experience with game development on console/PC or mobile. We are building a game building platform like ROBLOX for web3, so we need serious technical chops on the team to build out the game building tools and the game modes themselves.



Desire to learn new technologies and work on a variety of systems at a time.


We are a fast-moving startup, so we need people who want to ship features without a lot of hand-holding from leadership.

Strong communication skills, both technical and non-technical, as part of your job will be working closely with other departments to implement changes needed in the game. 

Strong problem solving skills: you able to work with all members of the team to communicate ideas, foresee future problems and brainstorm actionable solutions. 





Perks: Unlimited vacation, fully remote, Work-From-Home subsidy, monthly socials, insurance coverage.




Location: Remote in the USA OR Toronto, Canada

STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW)



 Requirement 



Global Affairs Canada (GAC) requires the professional services of one (1) Business Analyst Level 3 under the Task Based Informatics Professional Services Supply Arrangement (TBIPS).


 Background The mandate of Global Affairs Canada (GAC) is to manage Canada's diplomatic and consular relations and development assistance and to encourage the country's international trade. GAC is head quartered in Ottawa, and maintains a presence throughout Canada through regional offices and a network of trade commissioners working in International Trade Offices across the country. Outside Canada, GAC operates an extensive network of missions (embassies, high commissions, and consulates), honorary consulates, and other representational offices.



The spread and complexity of Canada’s representation abroad has a profound impact on the nature and scope of the Department’s Information Management (IM) and Information Technology (IT) environment. The design, implementation and operation of IM/IT services are affected by the extent to which Canada’s employees working abroad are spread around the world; by the enormous differences encountered in diverse public infrastructures and technologies available internationally; and by the competing interests of host countries. Numerous employees at missions are locally-engaged, bringing a variety of cultural, linguistic and security complexities to daily operations abroad.

The international environment in which GAC carries out its mandate has always been extremely challenging. IM/IT is deployed in settings which are geographically dispersed, structurally inconsistent, frequently hazardous, and disrupted by unexpected events both natural and man-made. Regardless, it is imperative to provide an extensive and effective worldwide communications and information sharing platform for all GAC clients and stake holders worldwide.


 Scope of Work 



GAC is undertaking a transformation to provide a transformative Digital workspace. In support of this initiative, GAC will be migrating GAC’s Electronic Document and Records Management (EDRMS) solutions ( InfoBank , SGDE-EDRMS, iRIMS ) to the GoC EDRMS Enterprise solution, GCdocs , or SharePoint, or a combination of both. The initial phase of this project focuses on the migration of Classification Structures and Physical Objects to GCdocs , and the next phase will be the migration of the Documents (electronic files) from both the EDRMS solutions and shared drives to GCdocs / SharePoint.

The Information Management and Technology (IM/IT) Bureau at GAC requires the professional services of one (1) Senior Business Analyst – Level 3 to work on-site on Information Management projects and operational initiatives and be the Lead in the migration of GAC’s EDRMS solutions to GCdocs / SharePoint.


 Tasks and Deliverables

 Tasks 



As directed by the Project Authority and under the direction of the Business and Technical Leads, the consultant will be tasked to perform the following:


 Analysis of the Legacy Records Management system functionality to provide direct mappings, or recommend work around, to similar functionality in GCdocs – Physical Objects. 

 Analysis and standardization of metadata in baseline and custom database fields to provide appropriate mapping to GCdocs – Physical Object fields, and GCdocs or SharePoint for electronic files. This will require the Business Analyst to provide detailed requests to the Data Base Engineer (DBE) to produce custom reports on metadata. The reports will be analyzed to produce required change requests for acceptance by the Records Managers team. 

 Analysis and modification of Classification structures to prepare for export / import into GCdocs Classifications to support Physical Objects or to GCdocs or SharePoint for electronic files. This will require the Business Analyst to provide detailed requests to the Data Base Engineer (DBE) to produce custom reports on Classification metadata. The reports will be analyzed by the Business Analyst to produce other reports on required and or recommended changes. 

 The Business Analyst will conduct meetings with the IM / RM teams to review and discuss required changes in support of the migration, and document acceptance of all change requests. Knowledge of the Legacy Classification Structures, RICS and DRATS is a definite asset to complete this task. 

 The Business Analyst will produce detailed requirements in support of the change requests, to the Data Base Engineer, to be used to create scripts to apply changes for the required changes prior to the export for migration. The Business Analyst will review these change requests to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the changes made by the scripts. 



The proposed resource will also perform some, or all of the following tasks:


 Evaluate business processes, define requirements, uncover areas for improvement and develop and implement solutions. 

 Perform requirements analysis. 

 Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and produce useful documentation to support future development and testing of the solutions. 

 Document and communicate the results of your efforts. Gain consensus as required. 

 Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. 

 Ensure that solutions meet business needs and requirements. 

 Conduct meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. 

 Serve as liaison between stakeholders and users. 

 Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects. 

 Provide leadership, training, coaching and guidance to junior staff. 

 Prioritize initiatives based on all business needs and requirements. 

 Deliverables: 



Deliverables requested in support of the migration and IM / RM activities may include, but are not limited to:


 Business Requirements documents (functional, information, security) 

 Options analysis documents 

 Business case documents 

 Business process documents 

 Performance measurement reports 

 Gap analysis documents 

 Process improvement recommendations documents 

 Change and impact analysis documents 

 Presentations 

 Status reports 

 Completion of Business Intake Forms BIF (for software) 

 Completion of Initiative Request Forms IRF 

 Business Case documents (for others) 

 Completion of COTS/SaaS Intake Forms (TBD) 



Additionally, Monthly Status Reports will be provided to the Project Authority indicating project status.

Documentation is to be prepared and submitted using Microsoft suite of applications and tools, unless otherwise specified.


 IM / RM ENVIRONMENTS 

 RDIMS ( eDOCS ) Solutions: InfoBank , SGDE-EDRMS 

 GCdocs Enterprise Solution 

 Teams / SharePoint 

 Shared Drives (ELF – Enterprise Level Folders) 

 Location of Work 



The office / work location is on GAC premises located at 4200 Labelle, but the contractor may also be required to work off-site as situations require (e.g. Covid ). Access to IM/IT systems and infrastructure to work onsite and remotely will be made available as required.

The contractor is required to attend meetings and will perform activities at GAC and may be asked to attend meetings at other GAC offices and partner departments (e.g. PSPC, SSC, TBS) in the National Capital Region and is responsible for his / her own transportation and related expenses. Whenever possible, the contracto r shall attend these meetings virtually.

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Course Hero 
is scaling!

We are looking for a Staff ML Software Engineer who can help us build an end-to-end platform for scaling machine learning (ML) experiments, ML microservices deployment, and configuration management of ML models. You&CloseCurlyQuote;ll be a part of the Machine Learning Product Engineering team at Course Hero and collaborate cross-functionally to ship ML products that personalize learning experiences for students and help educators create unique course content. The scalable ML systems you build will enable our product designers to bring intelligent data products to the Course Hero platform.

A Course Hero Staff ML Engineer is a technical leader who provides mentorship for team members, drives execution on key projects, and participates in the continuous improvement of our software systems. We expect you to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, and adapt to ever-changing business needs. You can view these videos to learn more about our engineering culture, and our company mission.


Here are some ways you&CloseCurlyQuote;ll make an impact:



Architect, create, and maintain a scalable platform for training, deploying, and monitoring ML models, microservices, and APIs in modern containerized cloud environments.

Automate various steps in ML workflow, from model training, inference, and deployment. 

Build prototypes/web apps to rapidly experiment on various versions of ML algorithms and DNN architectures for optimized content recommendations to our customers.

Partner with ML engineers, data scientists/engineers, and product engineering teams to understand business needs, find the right solution to a problem, and ship products.




Are you our next Staff ML Platform Engineer?



You have 8 years of experience working as a software engineer, with 2-3 years on a Machine Learning focused product or infrastructure.

You have 3-5 years of experience writing Python code in production 

Demonstrated knowledge of SQL/NoSQL databases, RESTful APIs, and docker-containerized microservice-based architectures.

Experience with the AWS ecosystem including ML frameworks like Athena, S3, EMR Spark, Sagemaker, Tensorflow.

Experience with Docker, Kubernetes or similar orchestration and configuration management




Nice to have:



Exposure to a variety of machine learning algorithms (both supervised and unsupervised) and/or experience working with ML teams in the past

BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Math

Passionate about education




Benefits & Perks!



Competitive salary and stock options

Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)

401(k) program with match

Education Reimbursement

Quarterly team events and outings (Sporting Events, Escape Rooms, Go-Kart Racing, Karaoke, Bowling and much more!)

Free lunches twice a week, on-site cafe discount, plus an endless snack and drink supply

Onsite gym – Pacific Shores Center – Classes – Pool – Spa – Rock Wall - Massages!

Commuter benefits, shuttle service from Redwood City, and cell-phone allowance

10K Local Move Program to move within 10 miles of our office

16 weeks of paid leave for maternity or paternity

8 hours per quarter paid time for volunteering for a cause of your choice

Front row seat to Master Educator lectures – check out videos on our LinkedIn Career Page




Equal Employment Opportunity Statement (EEO)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and  inclusion within our company.  We will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender  identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status,  veteran status, or  ability status. We will ensure that individuals who are differently abled are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment as provided to other applicants or employees. Please contact us to request accommodation.


About Us:


Course Hero is on a mission to help students graduate, confident and prepared. The online learning platform offers over 60 million course-specific study resources created by and for students and educators, as well as 24/7 tutor help. More than 65,000 verified college educators use Course Hero to collaborate with other faculty and share resources to hone new strategies for instruction. Everyday, students, educators and tutors help more than 20 million students make every study hour count.

We have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty, and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we&CloseCurlyQuote;re onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as one of the 
2021 Top 100 Best Places to Work in the Bay Area

, 

Top 50 Best Paying Companies in the Bay Area

, 

Top 100 Most Transparent Companies
, and in the 
Top 50 Most Transformational Companies in Education Technology
. Read up on some of our recent 
news coverage

,
 
blog

,
 and learn more 
about us
 to see what it is like to work with our team.

Join us on our mission!

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What We Offer



Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!


Expectations and Tasks


Multi Cloud Engineers are tasked with researching tools and solutions to help SAP better manage its growing multi cloud footprint. You'll work across shared service departments, lines of business and global teams to deliver high quality customer service and ensure operational deliverable goals are met. Running proof of concepts for selected tools to verify they satisfy the requirements of the SAP Multi Cloud team and its customers. Upon successful completion of a PoC you will assist with architectural design for production implementation while taking into consideration operational goals as well as compliance to SAP standards. Architectural designs should be done with a focus on security with a goal of secure by default design rather than looking at security after the fact. You're equally at home explaining recommendations to lines of business as you are discussing the technical approaches with architects. You are highly resourceful, have a combination of focus, flexibility, self-motivation, integrity, and desire for the team and company’s success.



Education And Qualifications




BS degree in Computer Science (or related technical field); or equivalent practical experience in technical field

2+ years of experience with public cloud delivery (GCP, AWS, AZ preferred)

Experience related to architectural design and IT security

Experience with Java 8+, Spring Boot Framework and any frontend framework.

Experience collaborating and influence others to improve architectural design, operational processes, and security posture

Must be a great human being and possess a mindset of change, while not being afraid to fail

Familiarity with open source cloud, applications and public clouds (e.g. GCP, AWS, Azure)



We are SAP


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.


Our inclusion promise 


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.



EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability



Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
