description:
Customertimes has been going through tremendous growth in North America. We are a Platinum Salesforce Partner with a global presence and are looking to add experienced Salesforce Developer to our growing team in Canada. Come be part of the Customertimes movement and work on some exciting projects!




You will be working on complex enterprise projects, helping our customers to design world-class Salesforce applications for their evolving CRM requirements. You will design and develop customized solutions within the Salesforce platform. This role also involves meeting with project managers, analyzing project objectives, coding new Salesforce applications, creating customer workflows, maintaining user roles, and troubleshooting application errors.

 


Required qualifications:



 


·  5+ years of experience with Salesforce in a development or configuration capacity

·  Deep knowledge of information technologies (Database, Business Intelligence, Infrastructure, Networks, Web & Integration software)

·  Knowledge of Salesforce Best Practices using Apex and Visualforce

·  Experienced in web technologies like HTML, XML, CSS, JSP, WSDL & SOAP

·  Experience in using SOQL, Salesforce Lightning, Process Builder, Lightning components for UI, Visual Workflows

·  Valid Salesforce Certifications

·  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Management Information Systems

 

This is a full-time remote position. Being on the market for 15 years, we are independent and financially stable, and also 100% remote (occasional travels might occur for this role when permitted).

description:
Do you love, live and breathe Marvel?

Stellar Creative Lab is hiring top talent for a New Streaming Series for Marvel Studios.

At Stellar Creative Lab we are animation! We hire stars – work with the best in the industry - work with us!

Summary:

Stellar Creative Lab is hiring a Junior Pipeline TD, who can bring his or her talent and brains to the design and development of a facility-wide CG-Animation Production Pipeline. Working with peers and facility supervisors the Pipeline TD contributes to the design and implementation of tools and techniques that empower digital artists to work efficiently by making difficult tasks easy and easy tasks even faster.

The role requires a strong understanding of both software engineering and CG-production of the shelf tools and workflows. Communication and collaboration are key from design to development in an agile environment.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:


Provide assistance and support for Production members.

Wrangler and debug issues in the Render Farm.

Develop new and support existing tools, for all stages in production.

Help document tools and workflow.

Debug and problem-solve technical issues.

Follow Stellar Coding standards and rollout procedures.

Communicate and collaborate with the Pipeline team members.

Assist with other tasks within the global production technology needs.



Your Experience, Talents and Abilities:


1+ years of experience developing code in the CG industry.

Production experience coding in Python scripting language is a must.

Production experience with Maya, Nuke, Houdini or other industry software.

Production experience with a Render Farm, preferable Deadline.

Previous experience in Version Control Systems, preferable Git.

Eligible to work in B.C.



In response to the COVID - 19 pandemic, Stellar Creative Lab is able to offer the following benefits:


the option to work at the studio as well as remotely across British Columbia

ongoing health and safety training

support for your ergonomic workspace at home

industries: Retail
description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada


Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.

Our Production Control team is looking for a dedicated Business Analyst to join Canadian Tire. As the successful incumbent in this role you will be involved with every facet of the operations within the distribution centre such as product slotting, inventory management, manpower planning, capital projects, change management and process improvement to name a few.

The environment is fast paced and requires an individual who has good organizational skills, sound analytical ability, capacity to communicate at all levels of the organization, and the ability to work in a team or independently. The Business Analyst will be responsible for investigating and analyzing business processes and systems with the objective to develop and implement process improvement initiatives using Canadian Tire Project Management Methodology

To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Production Control Business Analyst position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.



What You’ll Do




 Develop, maintain and support databases and reports to enable daily Production Control activities 

 Perform data analysis to generate operational and ad-hoc reporting to determine or support business decisions. 

 Identify, document and implement business opportunities that contribute to the continuous improvement of processes and decision making within the team and the AJBilles Distribution Centre 

 Carry out detailed root cause analysis and investigation on various Distribution Centre processes, functions and material handling systems 

 Develop business requirements, business cases and cost benefit analyses for assigned projects 

 Develop and design new business and systems processes 

 Provide support to develop divisional and departmental plans and strategies 

 Develop and deliver communication within change management methodology to key stakeholders 

 Create and maintain documentation and schedules for initiatives 

 Provide project status updates and informal updates on an as needed basis to stakeholder groups 

 Participate in initiatives that contribute to the development of new Resource placement strategies and coordinate and support their rollout 

 Upgrade, automate, and/or improve existing reporting and analytic tools as needed 

 Work with IT and the Operations Planning team to address requirements of the team 




What You Bring




 Strong MSAccess and VBA skills – Additional programming languages and Database knowledge an asset 

 Proficiency with MS Excel (pivot tables, charts) 

 Power BI development experience an asset 

 Knowledge and experience with PPA and EDW tables 

 Self-directed with good time management skills 

 Post-Secondary education in Business, Logistics, Industrial Engineering, or related experience 

 Thorough understanding of Supply Chain processes (3 to 4 years’ experience) 

 Understanding of Project Management methodology 

 Demonstrated planning, report writing, presentation and communication skills 

 Experience with labour and process measurement techniques 

 Experience in the execution of business case investigations and problem solving processes, systems and workflow 

 Experience in CTC Distribution operations, systems and processes, and material handling systems 




About Canadian Tire Corporation



As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .

CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

industries: Software Development, Internet Publishing, and Financial Services
description:
Company Description



Since we first opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely – and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take a payment and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together. So we expanded into software and started building integrated, omnichannel solutions – to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, run a busy kitchen, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. And across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow all in one place.

Today, we’re a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex commerce operations, sellers just starting out, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers scale, so do our solutions. We all grow together.

There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a business that is big, meaningful, and lasting. And we are helping sellers around the world do the same.



Job Description



Mobile Test Engineering team develops frameworks, infrastructure, and tooling to ensure that mobile tests are fast, reliable, and easy to create. We strive to automate testing as much as possible so that the need for manual QA testing is minimal and ensure that the quality of existing tests are higher.

We're looking for folks who are excited to solve problems and find solutions that empower hundreds of mobile developers to ship high-quality code faster. You will be part of a team who partners closely with other mobile platform teams to support the entire mobile development lifecycle as well as all the mobile product engineering teams. This is a high force multiplier, cross-functional team aiming to enhance the development experience for all mobile developers within Square.



You Will




 Develop and maintain frameworks for high level testing capabilities.

Develop tooling and metrics to understand what is being tested and how it is tested.

Maintain and optimize the infrastructure to run tests both locally and on CI.

Create and evangelize processes to help enforce test quality.

Own the success of your team's projects, and deliver quantifiable results.

Work with world-class, experienced, and dedicated engineers.




Qualifications




Have at least 3+ years of experience working in the iOS ecosystem.

Be proficient in Objective-C or Swift for development (we use both).

Enjoy working on mobile apps at all levels – from networking up to user interfaces and whatever's in between.

Respond to customer feedback to improve our frameworks and tools.

Have an eagerness to share your ideas, and openness to those of others.

Quickly and easily articulate issues and what needs to be done to resolve them




Additional Information



We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.

We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. 

Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page. 



Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.


Perks


We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:


Healthcare coverage

Retirement Plans

Employee Stock Purchase Program

Wellness perks

Paid parental leave

Paid time off

Learning and Development resources



Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD54566975, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD54566975 is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Sales
 Job Details 




Role Description



Also known as a " Pre -Sales Engineer" or "Sales Consultant," the Solution Engineer is responsible for presenting product offerings and architecture in the best light to prospects and customers, to evoke confidence in company’s technology infrastructure, and to remove all technical objections in the sales cycle. To accomplish this, the Solution Engineer must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and/or sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value. Our Core Solution Engineers work across different product offerings (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc...) to help our clients find the best Solutions for their business.



Your Impact




Understand the customer's needs, and establish Salesforce's product as the best solution that solves the customer's challenges

Build and present customized demos of Salesforce products

Convey deep understanding of the customer's technology as it pertains to Salesforce's solutions

Participate in all appropriate product, sales, and procedural trainings and certifications to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position

Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by management

Respond effectively to RFPs

Ability to travel based on territory alignment and region




Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor's Degree Required

Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in varied political environments

Solid oral, written, presentation, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills




Preferred Qualifications




Salesforce Certifications

Previous experience as a solution/sales engineer for a technology company or related experience

Knowledge of related applications, relational database and web technology

Basic programming experience in HTML and other web based technologies




About Salesforce



Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas-a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

industries: Movies and Sound Recording
description:
Company Description


Technicolor Production Services is the division with Technicolor which contain Technicolor’s world leading Visual effects and Animation brands such as MPC, The Mill, and Mikros.

Technicolor’s brands have worked on the spectacular scenes and tiny details that make movies, advertising campaigns and Animation movies truly mind-blowing. We’re the people behind the effects in countless blockbuster films like The Lion King, The Spongebob Movie: Sponge on the Run and advertising campaigns for clients such as Samsung, Audi, Nike and Apple. We are constantly looking for the best talent in the world, enthusiastic people that come in everyday to be a part of some of the best work in the industry. Technicolor’s artists are wildly creative, uber talented and passionate about the possibilities of VFX, Experiential, Animation and Technology. When you join the team, you’ll be working with and learning from the most skilled people in the business.


Description



Job Description


We are looking for a Senior DevOps-minded engineer to join our team based in our Montreal office. You will help design, build and deliver reliable solutions that are supporting technologies which underpin our visual effects production network. Working with our global Software and Systems Engineering teams, you will help to improve the speed, reliability, and security of our production infrastructure.

MPC has been a global leader in visual effects for over 25 years, delivering some of the most technically challenging and widely recognized movies in production today. This opportunity allows you to deliver technology and services to our global teams in Systems and Production.

In this dynamic and fast changing environment, we need creative thinkers and pragmatic problem solvers who have the ability to communicate ideas, collaborate, and take initiative. Building solutions that will ensure a successful delivery of technology used to create the next award winning imagery in the visual effects industry.


Primary Responsibilities



Champion of best development and automation practices

Design, architect and build tools, workflows and technologies to help us manage our existing Systems infrastructure, both on-prem and in the cloud

Manage initiatives and execute tasks in collaboration with local and remote team members

Work with and mentor more junior members of the team to help resolve issues and solve problems



Qualifications



Skills and Experience



Proven experience in a DevOps and software development role

BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field

Knowledge of Python, or any other scripting language

Experience with DevOps stack from implementation to maintenance

Linux system administration knowledge

Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines

Experience building and maintaining system configuration automation and building test automation

Experience administrating and supporting infrastructure for high load and large number of users and tasks

Experience with source control, in particular Git, and associated best practices

Experience in using and building tools that integrate with Jira

Understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies

Ability to work in a flexible and changing environment



Desired Additional Skills



Experience with networking, firewall, web technologies and security protocols

Experience with building monitoring and reporting infrastructure

Experience with container technology



Personal Attributes



A passion to automate everything

Extremely organized with good communication and documentation skills

Excellent attention to detail, and ability to analyze complex problems and workflows

Deadline orientated with ability to prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment



Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to talent@thefocus.com and we'll be happy to assist.


TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.




Working Arrangement


Hybrid



Job Description



We are looking for Sr Product Analysts to join our Digital Transformation office.

In this role, you will support the Lead Product Owner in representing the voice of the business and voice of the customer by driving business needs within a particular squad to ensure business and end-user satisfaction. You will contribute to the realization of Value Stream strategy, vision, and OKRs by aligning and prioritizing business goals with actionable results.

You will drive efficiencies by expanding customer reach and reducing manual processes.



Key Accountabilities




Voice of the Business, Customer, and End-User 



Supports the Product Owner in representing the voice of the business and voice of the customer within the squad to ensure business and end-user satisfaction

Maintains a good understanding of business, customer, and end-user pain points, needs, and preferences

Maintains a good understanding of relevant personas and customer journeys in order to advocate for the ideal experience

Understands industry, competitive and general business trends to enable strategic planning and delivery of outcomes in alignment with segment priorities

Ensures the voice of the customer/stakeholder is prominent and accurate in the definition of user stories



Value/Backlog Management



Drives the strategy, planning and delivery of key capabilities aligned to the Value Stream customer journey at the squad level, including features

Work with squad to define hypotheses, run experiments (surveys, concept testing, analytics tools, A/B testing), and analyze data to make decisions on user stories that influence the direction of delivery

Builds and grooms the user story backlog for one or more squads (prioritizing based on value)

Ensures the backlog is visible, clear and understood by all squad members

Incorporates feedback from stakeholder demos, interviews, user research, and engineering into the squad backlog



Squad Alignment & Communication



Specify and effectively communicate desired outcomes for current and future capabilities

Reviews and contributes to the value stream roadmap

Drafts the squad’s specific objectives and key results (OKRs) in alignment with those of the value stream




Job Requirements




Minimum of 7+ years of experience as a Product Analyst or Product Owner

Stakeholder management and communication skills in defining outcomes, communicating progress, and facilitating planning meetings

Good level of knowledge and understanding of area of practice

Good knowledge of the business

Good knowledge of digital enterprise enablement technologies and practices

Excellent analytical skills, copes with complex situations through deliberate analysis and planning

Data, NPS and customer analytics experience is an asset

Key Responsibilities:


• Design and develop applications, system-to-system interfaces and complete software solutions

• Implement solutions that meet performance, scaling and security goals

• Instrument services to provide insight into performance and emerging issues

• Manage servers across multiple environments and regions, deploy updates, migrate databases and build scalability and robustness solutions

• Guide architectural decisions and technical implementation topics

• Analyze requirements and estimate efforts, timeline, dependencies and risks

• Participate in design and code reviews

• Contribute to enhance the development process

Required Skills:

• Minimum of 6 years’ experience in the development of cloud or server-side products, within a professional software development organization

• Strong Experience in Java/PHP

• Strong zeal to learn PHP and start working ASAP

• Experience in the development of custom software solutions (as opposed to deployment of off-the-shelf solutions only)

• Experience in developing Microservices

• Strong problem solving and analytical skills

• Solid software design knowledge – you should know how to create software that is extensible, reusable and meets desired architectural objectives

• Good foundation in software design concepts, design patterns, algorithms and data structures

• Practical experience with source control systems, task and requirements management systems

• A degree in Computer Science, or similar, or equivalent experience

• Excellent communication skills, both oral and written

• Available to work in the PST timezone (remote work and work-from home is acceptable, especially in the short term; later, frequent local interaction preferred)

 


Preferred Optional Skills:


• At least 5 years’ overall relevant professional experience

• Experience with building and managing software packages or server images

• Expertise related to public clouds like Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS and their tools

• Experience working with cloud-based server environments

• Experience in managing Linux-based infrastructure

• Experience in designing, and implementing scalable and resilient RESTful API services

• Experience in writing documentation and creating design diagrams

• Experience in managing servers, networks, and infrastructure with broad knowledge of the following: networking, servers, virtualization, security, availability, resiliency, redundancy, alerting, and monitoring

• Experience in C#, C++, Python or Scala

• Familiarity with “Infrastructure as Code” tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, Azure Resource Manager

• Familiarity with databases, such as Redis, Cassandra, MySQL or PostgreSQL

• Understanding of Service Discovery, Inter-Service Communication, Service Deployment and Service Orchestration frameworks

• Good knowledge and experience with Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins

• Experience with test automation and test frameworks

• Solid practitioner of the Agile/Scrum development process, ideally with test-driven development, DevOps and continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD)

• Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Packer, Vagrant, Vault or Consul

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
On behalf of our client, Procom is seeking a CloudOps Analyst for a 6 month contract in Calgary, AB.



CloudOps Analyst Responsibilities



Core Responsibilities



Support SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) initiatives to prevent incidents and reduce problems.

Proactively build out infrastructure as code solutions and any other required AWS/Azure services using automated process.

Proactive Problem management and analytical skills required for Incident resolution and recommendations

Deploy AWS infrastructure with CloudFormation or similar tools that build CloudFormation (CDK, SAM, Serverless, Terraform, etc.)

Snowflake, Tableau and Alteryx end user support and operations

Create new and improve existing automated process, aiming to maximize the speed of delivery for AWS/Azure assets/services while minimizing planned and unplanned outages.

Practice agile principles, theories, and techniques.

Operations and support of our Linux RedHat & Windows operating systems, including security compliance, and maintaining documentation.

Empower other support teams using automation.



A typical day



Collaborate in cross-functional teams of Architects, Engineers and Analysts Product Management, Quality Assurance and Operations Support.

Troubleshooting operational issues, providing technical solutions to operational problems and incidents – end sure communication and support

Contributing to new products implementation, implementing existing products and services, and providing the overall upkeep and maintenance of designated areas of the data ecosystem.

Incident and Problem management on day to day basis where focus is on RCA (Root Cause Analysis) and proactive initiatives and automation.





CloudOps Analyst Mandatory Skills





Strong background in systems analysis/administration, at least 2 years of relevant experience including support of Linux & Windows OS, and implementation of highly available or disaster recovery solutions.

Strong mindset around reliability and incident prevention, with at least 2 year of experience implementing cloud, infrastructure, application, and/or database monitoring solutions.

At least 1 year of CI/CD pipeline implementation experience, including Cloud infrastructure deployment and automation using AWS CloudFormation related tools.

Experience with Snowflake and IICS (ETL/ELT methodologies)

Relevant AWS and/or Microsoft Azure certifications (Cloud Practitioner, Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer, etc.)

Experience with Apache Airflow, Database Systems and Data Streaming will be considered as an asset.

Experience with at least two of the following languages: Python, SQL, Javascript

A related post-secondary degree or diploma (Information Technology or Computer Science degree preferably).

Agile certifications (SCRUM, Kanban) will be considered as an asset.

Strong written and verbal communication skills; capable of working across multiple stakeholders and IT teams.




CloudOps Analyst Job Location


Calgary, AB


CloudOps Analyst Assignment Length


6 Months

Global IQX is looking for software engineers that are enthusiastic, interested in exploring new technology, enjoy developing innovative products, and love being part of a team. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow, whether that’s working with new technologies or making the next career step – then perhaps we’re exactly what you’re looking for.




We’re looking for people who want to flourish and take responsibility. What you’ve done is less important that what you aspire to, and are capable of.




Patterns, design, architecture and quality are important to us. You’ll also learn about our business and get to provide solutions to some of the biggest players in Group Insurance space.





Duties will include



Design database models (tables, relationships, constraints, and indices).

Develop persistence layer classes (JPL) and domain entities using Java and Hibernate.

Expand functionality on the core engine framework.

Implement XML-driven infrastructure for new products.

Assess technical feasibility of feature proposals.

Develop client-side UI and components using JavaScript and related technologies.

Conduct code-reviews and mentor developers.






Qualifications



Computer Science / Engineering related university / college degree or higher.

Java-based development is a must (using Spring, Hibernate, Generics, Lamdba Expressions, Streams, and Collectors).

Experience with relational databases and schema design (writing SQL, HBM mappings, and HQL queries).

Experience with XML technologies (such as XSD, XSLT, XPATH, SAX, and STAX).

Very knowledgeable in object-oriented design, design patterns, multi-threading and concurrency.

Experience with responsive web design using JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, HTML, and CSS.






Technology Stack


AWS, Azure, Ansible, Bash, Bootstrap.js, Docker, Eclipse, ElasticSearch, Git, Hadoop, Hibernate, Java 8, JQuery, Kibana, Lucene, MySQL, Node.js, Oracle, SASS, Scala, Spring, SVN, Tomcat, Vue.js, XML, XSD, XSLT.




Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under Global IQX’s accessibility policies. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.




COVID-19 considerations: Global IQX has protocals in place to ensure a safe working environment.

description:
Software QA Engineer 





Client: Technology Company

Role: Software QA Engineer

Duration: 12 month Contract

Salary : Negotiable

Location: Mississauga – In Office




Our client, a Technology Company, is looking to hire a Software QA Engineer for a 12 Month Contract Position-- experience with POS (Point of Sale) or Payment cards.





Your new role


· Setup integrated environment, conduct system integrated test; maintain the quality standards for our company's products and integrated solutions.

· Develop, modify, execute, and maintain automated test scripts and test cases.

· Conduct PCI DSS / PA-DSS Compliance tests, security tests, volume/performance, and stability tests.

· Consult with product development engineers in resolution of problems.

· Follow release management process to ensure quality and consistency between software release version.

· Develop, modify, and execute software test plans, create, execute, and maintain automated test scripts and test data.

· Maintain testing tools and documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software.

· Analyze test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action.

· Ensure quality of system integrated environment, components, and the overall transaction processing.

· Set up System Integrated Test Environment and Maintain it to ensure functionality of products in Petroleum Customer Environment before release/delivery of products:

· Setup test environment, configure products, including hardware, software, and databases. etc.

· Perform software validation and verification to ensure that application meets requirements and functions correctly.

· Develop and maintain the automated test tools, test scripts to facilitate and automate product regression test cycle.

· Perform pre-certification and/or certification test activities with processor

· Perform PCI DSS / PA-DSS Compliance Testing to ensure products compliance.

· Perform volume/performance and stability tests

· Provide support to ensure that delivered products or solutions are functioning as per customer requirements:

· Provide assistance to Customers and internal resources to investigate UAT or production issues for in-depth problem analysis, determination, and resolution.

· Maintain required documentation to ensure project information is available to the company and customer.





What you’ll need to succeed 



Four year degree in Computer Science or a related field desired.

5+ years of experience in software quality assurance software/product validation.

5+ years of experience in Manual software testing.

3+ years of experience in Mobile Application testing.

5+ years of experience with Windows operating system.

3+ years of experience with Automation software testing, highly desired.


Experienced in POS (Point of Sale) and Cards (Payment Cards)


Basic understanding of Linux Operating System directory structure.

Strong verbal, written, and communication skills.






What You’ll get in Return


The client is offering a Contract Position with a Competitive salary and an opportunity to grow your Portfolio in an exciting Industry.





Interested? 


If you’re available and interested in this role, please reply to this email as soon as you can attaching your updated resume and hourly rate/salary requirement.

description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!


We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.



The Role


Proofpoint has created the world's best cloud-based email security and archiving solutions and we are always working on improving and extending our product capabilities. Founded in 2002, the company is based in Sunnyvale, California, in the heart of Silicon Valley.

We are looking for co-op students to work alongside our seasoned developers in our downtown Toronto office (remote until office reopens). These positions are within the engineering team responsible for our cloud-based Proofpoint Email Archive, a software-as-a-service solution featuring an advanced service-oriented architecture with distributed grid search and large-scale storage infrastructure to meet the demanding needs of thousands of users from among the largest businesses in the world. You will spend the co-op work term on projects alongside talented, experienced professionals, gain practical experience in an agile software development environment and get a chance to see what it is like to work for a dynamic, NASDAQ-listed company.

The ideal candidate is someone who is agile and who quickly comes up to speed in a fast-paced technical environment and can adapt to new technologies rapidly.



Job Requirements




Fluent in one at least Java, .NET, C#, C++, XML

Understanding of OO concepts/methodologies

Experience with UNIX/Linux, Windows/.NET

Passion for learning inquiry and problem solving

Excellent written and verbal communication skills


It's a plus if you have these skills


Database skills

JUnit/ NUnit frameworks

MS Exchange and Active Directory

Web services (REST/SOAP)



Candidate Profile


You have the ability and interest in working 
full time
 (a maximum of 
37.5
 hours/week) in our Toronto office or remotely until it is safe to work in office. You are currently pursuing an 
undergraduate degree 
and are successfully maintaining an above average GPA. This internship is scheduled to start in May 2022 and run through August 2023.


If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

job_title: ICC Design Authority System Engineer RER
industries: Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Nous créons des innovations intelligentes pour relever les défis de la mobilité d’aujourd'hui et de demain. Nous concevons et fabriquons une gamme complète de systèmes de transport, des trains à grande vitesse aux bus électriques et trains sans conducteur, en passant par les solutions d'infrastructure, de signalisation et de mobilité digitale. Nous rejoindre, c’est intégrer une communauté internationale de plus 75 000 personnes qui se consacrent à la résolution de problèmes de mobilité concrets et à la réalisation de projets internationaux ayant un impact local durable.

Avec des activités croissantes au Canada pour répondre à la demande grandissante de transport durable, Alstom recherche des candidats motivés qui nous aideront à tirer parti de notre expertise et à l'appliquer localement. Nous avons l'énergie et l'esprit d'une start-up avec les fondations d'une entreprise multinationale de classe mondiale qui encourage la collaboration, l'esprit d'entreprise, la créativité et le respect de l'environnement. Notre offre aux employés comprend des opportunités de développement de carrière et de vastes perspectives de mobilité interne à travers le monde.


Objet de l’emploi (Ingénieur Système ICC en Autorité de Conception)


Le but est d’accomplir un mandat d'Ingénieur Système ICC (Integrated Control Center) en Autorité de Conception (Design Authority) dans le cadre de différents projets ICC qui fournissent généralement un système ICC composé d'au moins un produit ICONIS et d'au moins l'un des sous-systèmes suivants : SCADA (Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition), ATS (Automated Train Supervision) et MSM (Maintenance and Security Management).

Il est important de mentionner que l'Ingénieur Système ICC en Autorité de Conception, devra combiner un rôle de leadership avec un rôle technique, d’un côté, coordonner plusieurs Ingénieurs Système pour assurer la conformité de la solution Système à travers les Sous-Systèmes et autres composants, d’un autre, assurer la correspondance entre les spécifications (requis) et les descriptions de contexte opérationnel ainsi que leur conformité aux besoins et attentes du Client, tout en gardant un nombre minime de spécificités projet (en anglais, GAP).

Dans une première phase, l'Ingénieur Système ICC en Autorité de Conception, participera à la définition des spécifications détaillées du projet RER. Dans une deuxième phase, correspondant aux étapes ultérieures du projet RER ou d’autres projets futurs, son mandat sera étendu à un rôle complet d'Ingénieur Système ICC en Autorité de Conception, tel que décrit ci-dessous.


Contexte:


Chez Alstom, un ingénieur système ICC est généralement impliqué au début et à la fin du cycle de développement en V d'Alstom, plus précisément pendant les phases de spécification et d'architecture du système, d'intégration et de validation, d'un projet ICC donné. Une autre partie importante du mandate consiste à examiner la documentation des sous-systèmes et à fournir un soutien aux équipes des sous-systèmes pour assurer la cohérence des sous-systèmes avec l'ensemble du système. L'Ingénieur Système ICC en Autorité de Conception doit, en plus, assumer la responsabilité de la solution globale.

Le Projet RER vise à livrer un ICC basé sur un Système composé de plusieurs sous-systèmes tels que : Système de Contrôle de Trafic qui est en fait un ATS (Supervision Automatique des Trains), SCADA (Contrôle de Supervision et Acquisition de Données), MS (Système de Gestion des incidents), SIM (SIMulation environment), IPS (Integrated Playback System), GCS (Global Common Services) qui est en fait un middleware.

Étant donné qu’à l’état courant du projet RER les requis Système ainsi que l’architecture globale sont définis à un très haut niveau, le but principal de l’Équipe Système sera de les détailler davantage, de confirmer la fonctionnalité finale et d’ajouter les détails de conception (design) nécessaires.

À terme, dans le cadre des étapes suivantes du projet RER ou dans le cadre de projets ICC ultérieurs, l'Ingénieur Système ICC en Autorité de Conception, assumera un ensemble complet de responsabilités, telles que définies ci-dessous.


Objectifs


Coopérer avec d’autres Ingénieurs Système pour assurer la cohérence de la solution système à travers les Sous-Systèmes et autres composants.

Conseiller et participer aux activités d’architecture système

Coopérer avec les équipes de CyberSécurité et Safety, pour identifier les risques et proposer des mitigations

Coopérer avec les équipes Sous-Système à la définition et l’implémentation des interfaces cross-fonctionnelles

Conseiller et participer à la rédaction et la mise à jour des spécifications Système, en veillant à ce que toutes les exigences soient réalisables et mesurables ; rédiger des Documents de Contexte Opérationnel (dont les User Stories) et les présenter aux autres équipes.

Conseiller et participer au processus d'intégration des versions livrées par des différents sous-systèmes, les produits Alstom et les interfaces externes

Conseiller et participer au processus de validation du système et/ou du sous-système dans son ensemble (en incluant les différents sous-systèmes, les produits Alstom et les interfaces externes) et s'assurer qu'il répond à toutes les exigences, conformément à la documentation d'Alstom et au contrat initial avec le Client.


Mesure d’attente des Objectifs


Respecter tous les indicateurs de projet QCDP (Qualité, Coût, Délai, Performance de livraison)

Obtenir l'approbation du Client pour tous les documents créés/mis à jour, liés aux spécifications, à la conception, à l'intégration et à la validation du projet

Atteindre tous les objectifs globaux d’Alstom


Responsabilités



Rôle de leadership :






 Coordonner les activités d’Ingénierie Système, reliées à la Conception (Design), pour assurer la cohérence de la solution Système à travers les Sous-Systèmes et les autres composants




 
Conseiller ou participer de façon globale:
 






 Concevoir une solution système en ligne avec les besoins du projet







 Identifier les spécificités projet (en anglais GAP) et les solutions possibles pour les combler







 Discuter les solutions système avec le Client







 Gérer les solutions système tout au long de l'exécution du projet







 Gérer les interfaces internes et externes







 S'assurer que les composants de la solution sont développés correctement







 Définir les règles des applications ainsi que le processus d'ingénierie







 Déterminer la stratégie de migration et de déploiement du système







 Intégrer les composants de la solution dans le système fonctionnel




Conseiller et participer aux Spécifications du système et/ou du sous-système et conception de l'architecture :






 Rédiger les spécifications du système et/ou du sous-système (exigences) et la description du contexte opérationnel







 Mettre à jour la documentation de conception en fonction des revues internes (par les pairs) ou des commentaires des clients







 Mettre à jour et clarifier les spécifications (exigences) lors des phases de conception, de développement et de présentation des maquettes







 S'assurer que l'architecture et la conception du système sont conformes aux exigences RAM, sécurité, qualité et cybersécurité




 
Conseiller et participer à l’Intégration système et/ou sous-système :
 






 Valider les procédures techniques définissant l'intégration du système, des sous-systèmes et des interfaces externes







 Assurer le suivi et fournir des conseils sur toutes les activités d'intégration entre le système, les sous-systèmes et les interfaces externes




 
Conseiller et participer à la Validation du système et/ou du sous-système :
 






 Suivre et fournir des conseils sur toutes les activités de validation au niveau du système, envoyer les anomalies identifiées aux sous-systèmes si nécessaire







 S'assurer que le système et/ou le sous-système est conforme à toutes les exigences du système et au contrat client d'origine ainsi qu'à toute autre exigence implicite en résultant




Support et suivi de la traçabilité des exigences, à partir du niveau système, jusqu'aux sous-systèmes et aux interfaces externes



 Compréhension de l’industrie 


Connaissance de l’industrie ferroviaire, ATS, SCADA, système de gestion des incidents, centre de contrôle


 Exigences en matière d’études 


Baccalauréat en génie électrique, en automatisation ou l’équivalent

Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) ; Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs Professionnels de l’Ontario (PEO) serait un atout


 Expérience technique 


5 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie ferroviaire

10 ans d’expérience en ingénierie système (spécifications système, architecture système, intégration de systèmes)

5 ans d’expérience avec des grands systèmes de centre de contrôle (transport, énergie, pipeline et similaires) et leurs défis d’intégration typiques

3 ans d’expérience avec au moins un produit ICONIS (ATS CF, ATS CT, S2K-AGUI, S2K-UHMI


 Aptitudes et compétences comportementales et techniques 


Solides compétences relationnelles et interpersonnelles

Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite, en anglais et en français, ainsi que d’excellentes compétences en présentation

Capacité de comprendre et d’écrire des scénarios opérationnels (User Stories)

Capacité de prise de décision technique, jugement judicieux, leadership, résolution de problèmes

Expérience avec Windows et Windows Server.

Expérience avec MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Connaissance des outils de gestion de la configuration (Clearcase, Perforce)

Connaissance de VM Ware, principes de base de SQL Server

Connaissance des principes de cybersécurité

Connaissance des principes Agile


 Lieu de travail 


Montréal (Québec), Canada.

À l’occasion, dans d’autres provinces canadiennes (c.-à-d. l’Ontario) ou à l’étranger, pour aider à différentes activités d’intégration et aux essais sur le terrain


Heures de travail



Selon la politique des Ressources Humaines d’Alstom



Vacances



Selon la politique des Ressources Humaines d’Alstom


English Translation Below


Purpose of the Job


To fulfill an ICC (Integrated Control Center) Design Authority System Engineer mandate within the context of different ICC Projects which typically deliver one ICC System consisting of at least one ICONIS Product and at least one of the following subsystems: SCADA (Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition), ATS (Automated Train Supervision) and MSM (Maintenance and Security Management).

It is important to mention that the Authority Design System Engineer combines a leadership role with a technical one, the first one including coordination of other System Engineers in order to ensure consistency of the system solution across subsystems and other components while the technical one aiming to ensure that specifications and operational context descriptions are consistent, meet the customer’s needs and expectations (within the context of the contract) while minimizing the product gaps.

In a first phase, the ICC Design Authority System Engineer will participate in detailed specification definition on the RER Project. In a second phase, the mandate will be to perform a complete ICC Design Authority System Engineer role in subsequent phases of RER or other subsequent ICC Projects, as described below.


Organisation Structure


Alstom Transport, Americas Region, DI&S (Digital & Integrated Systems) Organization, ICC Department, ICC Project Architect Team


Organisational Reporting


Hierarchically reporting to the ICC System Engineer Manager or ICC Engineering Manager

Functionally reporting to the PrEM (Project Engineering Manager) or equivalent Engineering Leader on the assigned project


Network & Links


Alstom Systems & Products Community

Alstom Methods & Tools Community

Metrolinx RER project:


 Project Core Team 

 System Team 

 Integration Team 

 Validation Team 

 Product Team 

 Customer 

 Interface Partners 



Project EHS Manager/Coordinator or RC EHS Manager/Engineer


Context:


At Alstom, an ICC System Engineer is typically involved at the beginning and at the end of Alstom’s development Vee-cycle, more precisely during the system specification & architecture, integration and validation phases of a given ICC Project. Another important part of the mandate is to review subsystem documentation and provide support to subsystem teams to ensure consistency of subsystems with the overall system. On top of all that, the Design Authority System Engineer, has the responsibility of the overall solution.

The RER Project is aiming to deliver an ICC based on a System consisting of several subsystems, as follows: Traffic Control System which actually is an ATS (Automatic Train Supervision), SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition), MS (Management System), SIM (SIMulation environment), IPS (Integrated Playback System), GCS (GTCS Common Services) which is actually a middleware.

Since, at the present state of the RER Project, the System requirements and the System architecture are still at a very high-level, the entire focus of the System Team in the following two years will be to detail further the initial requirements, to confirm final functionality and to follow up with the necessary design.

Eventually, within the following stage of the RER project or during subsequent ICC Projects, the ICC Design Authority System Engineer will be required to assume a complete set of responsibilities, as defined below.


Objectives:


To coordinate with other ICC System Engineers to ensure consistency of the system solution across subsystems/components.

To advise or participate in system architecture activities.

To coordinate with safety and cybersecurity teams to ensure the mitigation of risks.

To coordinate with the subsystem teams the cross-functional interface.

To advise or participate at writing and updating System specifications, ensuring that all requirements are achievable and measurable; to write Operational Context Documents (including User Stories)

To advise or participate at the integration process of the released versions of the different subsystems, Alstom Products and external interfaces

To advise or participate at the validation process of the System as a whole (including different subsystems, Alstom Products and external interfaces) and ensure it meets all the requirements, as per Alstom documentation and per customer original contract


Measurement


Meet all the Project QCDP (Quality, Cost, Delivery Performance) indicators

Receive customer approval for all the created/updated Project Specification-, Design- and Integration and Validation-related documents

Meet all the Alstom-related objectives


Responsibilities


System Engineer leadership role:


 Coordinate design-related system engineering activities to ensure consistency of the system solution across subsystems/components 



Advise or participate in overall system engineering activities:


 Design system solution in line with project needs 

 Identify project gaps and evolution path for solutions 

 Discuss system solution with the customer 

 Manage system solution throughout project execution 

 Control internal and external interfaces 

 Ensure solution components are developed properly 

 Define application rules and engineering process 

 Determine system migration and deployment strategy 

 Integrate solution components into functional system 



Advise or participate in System specifications and architecture design:


 Write System specifications (requirements) and Operational context description 

 Update design documentation based on internal (peer) reviews or customer comments 

 Update and clarify the specifications (requirements) during the design, development, and mock-up presentation phases 

 Ensure the system Architecture and design complies with the RAM, Safety and Cybersecurity requirements 



Advise or participate in System integration


 Validate technical procedures defining the integration of System, Subsystems and external interfaces 

 Follow-up and provide advice on all the integration activities between the System the Subsystems and external interfaces 



Advise or participate in System validation


 Follow-up and provide advice on all the validation activities at System level, dispatch identified anomalies to Subsystems if necessary 

 Ensure that the System complies with all the System requirements and the original customer contract as well as with any other implicit requirements resulting thereof 

 Support and follow up on Requirements Traceability, starting from the System level, to subsystems and to external interfaces 




Business Understanding


Railroad industry knowledge, ATS, SCADA, Management System, Control Center


Educational Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, Automation, or equivalent

Member of Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) and/or Professional Engineers of Ontario (PEO) an asset


Technical Knowledge / Experience


5-year experience in Railway industry

10-year experience in System Engineering (System Requirements, System Architecture, System Integration)

5-year experience with large Control Center Systems (Energy, Pipeline and similar) and their typical integration challenges

3-year exposure to at least one ICONIS Product (ATS CF, ATS CT, S2K-AGUI, S2K-UHMI)


Behavioural And Technical Skills / Competencies


Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and French, as well as excellent presentation skills

Ability to understand and to write User Stories (Operational scenarios)

Ability of technical decision making, sound judgment, assertiveness, problem solving

Experience with Windows and Windows server.

Experience with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Knowledge of configuration management tools (Clearcase, Perforce)

Knowledge of VM Ware, SQL server basics

Knowledge of CyberSecurity principles

Knowledge of Agile principles


Job Location 


Montreal (QC) Canada.

Occasionally, in other Canadian provinces (i.e. Ontario) or abroad, to assist at different integration and field-testing activities


Hours of Work


In accordance with the Alstom’s Human Resources policy.


Hours of Work


In accordance with the Alstom’s Human Resources policy.

industries: Computer Games
description:
Almost 20 years ago, our founder decided to start a mobile game company and called it IUGO, which in Latin means “to connect”. His vision was boldly to do just that; connect people through mobile games. Today we are the longest standing mobile games company in Canada with a wide variety of games under our belts including The Walking Dead: Road to Survival, PvPets, Middle-earth: Shadow of War and many more. Our team is full of intelligent and passionate foodies, beer connoisseurs, thrill seekers, musicians, fitness fanatics, leaders, dreamers and of course - GAMERS! For pictures and more information about our space and culture, check out our Instagram and the career page on our website.  




https://iugogames.com/careers/ 

https://www.instagram.com/iugogames/





COVID-19 Protocol:


Our employees are currently given the option to either work remotely from home, OR from the studio. Our entire interview and onboarding process can be completed from the comfort of your own home. All applications will be considered. 
Please note, IUGO is open to filling this role with a remote candidate. We offer local, Canada-wide, and Global options for candidates. 






RESPONSIBILITIES






Develop games for the iOS and Android platforms in C++, using Xcode and our proprietary mobile platform.

Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of programmers, artists, producers, and designers.

Support the maintenance and execution of games as an online service.






REQUIREMENTS






Expert level programming in modern C++.

Strong foundation in logic and computer science, including areas such as algorithms, data schemas, back and forward compatibility and optimization.

Exceptional problem solving abilities.

Excellent communication (spoken and written) and team collaboration skills.

Self-motivated, organized and able to excel in a fast paced, dynamic team environment.






IDEAL CANDIDATE






Professional software engineering experience in game development or another industry.

BSc/MSc in Computer Science or qualifications in a related technical discipline.

Development experience with iOS, Android, Obj-C, Java or Xcode.









PERKS OF WORKING AT IUGO






3 weeks paid vacation & 4 personal days per year (earn up to an extra week)

Epic Fridays with catered lunch & afternoon social hour with drinks

Game consoles, tables & a tonne of board games

Lifestyle bonus for your favourite activity

Company parties, traditions & team building events

Transit subsidy 

Extended benefits package 

Lunch & learns, massage chair, fully stocked kitchen, vitamix blender, company swag, team lunches and flexible work from home policy.





IUGO is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and equitable workplace, and inclusive environment for all existing and potential employees. Employment decisions are based on candidate qualifications and business need, not race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, political belief, religion, creed, marital or family status, medical condition, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, prior criminal conviction or any other protected class in accordance with federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.





Follow Us!


Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/iugomobile/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/iugogames/

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Site Reliability Engineer





Here at mthree, we pair talented graduates with leading global businesses. We’re always on the lookout for ambitious graduates to join the mthree Alumni Graduate Program, kick-starting your tech career within an entry-level SRE role and working onsite with a leading fintech organization in Montreal, Quebec.




Our 24-month graduate program begins with 4-8 weeks of paid training and career coaching, where you’ll learn everything, you need to hit the ground running as a software developer.

After you've completed the paid training, you'll have the opportunity to fast-track your career at a global investment bank or leading tech company.





Profile: 



Interested in distributed systems and working with highly scalable and reliable services.

Like to work in a fast-moving environment and you aren't afraid to change things to make them better.

Enjoy new technological challenges and solving hard problems.

Believe a team working well together is smarter than the single smartest person on that team.

Have grit, drive and a deep sense of ownership.

Working closely with engineering/development teams to design, build, and maintain systems.

Troubleshooting issues across the entire technology stack: hardware, software, application, and network.

Identifying and driving opportunities to improve automation for our platforms; scope and create automation for deployment, management, and visibility of our services.

Proactively identifying and addressing systems reliability risks.

Working alongside existing global and regional team members on a follow-the-sun basis.

Represent the RPE organization in design reviews and operational readiness exercises for new and existing services. Skill Set

Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot problems and debug to identify root cause.

Hands on experience on enterprise tools such as AppDynamics, Grafana, Splunk, Dynatrace.

Experience with Ansible, GitHub or any automation/configuration/release management tools.

Automation-related experience is particularly valued using scripting languages such as python, bash, perl, ruby.One higher level language is desired.

 Awareness of, and ability to reason about modern software and systems architectures, including load-balancing, databases, queueing, caching, distributed systems failure modes, micro services, Cloud, etc.





 
Pre-requisites:



Practical experience running large scale systems is an advantage. Qualifications/Criterion

Bachelor’s Degree, BE/ Btech





 
What you’ll receive:



Fully paid, in-depth and interactive training with a diverse group of like-minded graduates, delivered by experts with working knowledge of the field.

A competitive graduate salary

Pay increases every 6 months

A complete well-being program and full benefits package

Ongoing training and pastoral care

Invaluable industry experience and the opportunity to start a career in a desirable and competitive industry





DIVERSITY:


We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each and every individual who contributes to making mthree the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within mthree and with our partner companies, and we’re proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish by promoting a strong culture of equality but most importantly, inclusion. We never want people to change - only add to the amazing mix of people that work for mthree.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
We’re Coinbase. We’re the world’s most trusted way to join the crypto revolution, serving more than 89 million accounts in more than 100 countries.

Our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web 3.0 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.


Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:



You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. 

You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. 

You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.

You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.

You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.

You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. 


Coinbase is seeking Staff Software Engineers (Frontend) to join our Web3 Platform & Applications team. We formed the Web3 Platform & Apps team to start this year with the mission to enable 1B+ people to safely and securely use Web3 every day. We’ve seen great momentum across the org so far: we’re shipping at a high velocity across Wallet and the main Coinbase App, reaching all-time high metrics, and expanding our ambitions to go even bigger

If you're excited by the problem space of designing and delivering engaging user experiences, building performant user interfaces, and building trustworthy financial systems, we should talk!



What You'll Be Doing




Articulate a long term technical direction and vision for maintaining and scaling our web and mobile platforms.

Create trustworthy user experiences by building interfaces that are simple, easy to comprehend, performant and reliable using modern tools like React, React Native, Typescript, React Navigation, Jest and Webpack.

Turn our vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter by working with engineers, product managers and senior leadership.

Mentor and train other team members on design techniques and coding standards.

Add positive energy in every meeting, and make your coworkers feel included in every interaction.




What We Look For In You




You have at least 8 years of experience in software engineering and at least 7 years of experience in developing web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript and modern, component-based JS frameworks like React. 

You've developed and shipped user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks.

You’re familiar with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability.

You’re familiar with product and design lifecycles, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.

You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.




Nice To Haves




You've worked on front-end teams in the finance or security space

You have at least 1 year of experience in developing React Native mobile apps or helped move existing native apps to React Native


ID: G1829

Please note that for employees based in the US, Philippines, Canada or Singapore, if your role requires you to be present in a Coinbase office or if you choose to be physically present in a Coinbase office or sponsored location, participate in any in-person gathering (including offsites) or engage in business travel sponsored by Coinbase, you will be required to be fully vaccinated (as defined by applicable law). Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other cloud provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. AWS Platform is the glue that holds the AWS ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, AWS Platform is always innovating with the customer in mind. The AWS Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second.

Do you get excited working on new challenges every day? Do you like to problem solve, drive solutions and influence what features should be launched for customers? AWS Business Operations team is looking for a talented business intelligence engineer who can support driving deep insights, create forecasts, develop business metrics, ETL jobs and continuous improvement using the analysis. You will work with cross-functional teams across the company such as Accounts Receivable, Accounting, Operations, Customer Service, Development teams on a daily basis.



Responsibilities




 Develop tools, dashboards, queries, reports, and scripts that will automate recurring tasks for BizOps while ensuring data quality and integrity. Ensuring accuracy of data and data analysis is of utmost importance.

 Identify, design and develop data source discovery efforts across databases and identify data/table links/joins between data/table sets. Uphold highest standard for ETL jobs/Queries/Code/Scripts.

 Manage stakeholder requirements, feature requests, solution life-cycle management, write 1-pagers/6-pagers/PRFAQ before new solution/automation launches.

 Work on Continuous Improvements to translate business requirement into proof of concept, project resource, and timeline estimate.

 Work with technical teams/software-developers across geographies to ensure accurate and sufficient data inflow in systems or data-warehouses used by BizOps.

 Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.

 Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover areas of opportunity and present written business recommendations.




About Us



Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance

Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Learn and Be Curious. We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Inclusion and Diversity. Our team is diverse! We drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. These range from groups such as the Black Employee Network, Latinos at Amazon, Indigenous at Amazon, Families at Amazon, Amazon Women and Engineering, LGBTQ+, Warriors at Amazon (Military), Amazon People With Disabilities, and more.

Learn more about Amazon on our Day 1 Blog: https://blog.aboutamazon.com

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an




Basic Qualifications




 B.S. degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar quantitative field

 3+ years work experience in BIE in a big data environment

 Experience using SQL to analyze data in a database or data warehouse and be able to use a major programming (e.g. Java/C) and/or a scripting language (Perl, Unix shell) to process data for modeling

 Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Tableau, Qlik, Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, etc.)

 Experience working with a wide range of predictive and decision models and data mining techniques, as well as tools for developing such models

 Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders

 Advanced proficiency in Excel.

 Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines

 Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles

 Ability to figure things out without a road map, transform organizations, as well as break the mold in terms of ways to re-frame and solve problems.

 Experience working with disparate data sources and turning them into a unified solution




Preferred Qualifications




 5+ years of work experience of analyzing and interpreting data as a business intelligence engineer, data engineer, or at a similar capacity.

 Master’s degree or higher in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related quantitative discipline

 Experience with creating and building predictive/optimization tools that benefit the business and improve customer experience

 Advanced knowledge of programming languages and operating systems, such as Java, Python, Power BI, or Linux, Python, etc.

For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us
