Job ID: A1658224

industries: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
Summary

 
The Apple Media Products Engineering team is one of the most exciting examples of Apple’s long-held passion for combining art and technology! These are the people who power the App Store, Apple TV, Apple Music, Apple Podcasts, and Apple Books. And they do it on a massive scale, meeting Apple’s high expectations with high performance to deliver a huge variety of entertainment in over 35 languages to more than 150 countries.


These engineers build secure, end-to-end solutions. They develop the custom software used to process all the creative work, the tools that providers use to deliver that media, all the server-side systems, and the APIs for many Apple services.


Thanks to Apple’s unique integration of hardware, software, and services, engineers here partner to get behind a single unified vision. That vision always includes a deep commitment to strengthening Apple’s privacy policy, one of Apple’s core values. Although services are a bigger part of Apple’s business than ever before, these teams remain small, forward-thinking, and cross-functional, offering greater exposure to the array of opportunities here.

 

Key Qualifications

 
5+ years of programming experience, preferably in Java, Scala.


Proficiency in data processing using technologies like Spark Streaming, Spark SQL, or Map/Reduce


Expertise in Hadoop related technologies such as HDFS, Azkaban, Oozie, Impala, Hive, and Pig


Proficiency with databases and SQL is required


Expertise in developing big data pipelines using technologies like Kafka, Flume, or Storm


Experience with large scale data warehousing, mining or analytic systems


Ability to work with analysts to gather requirements and translate them into data engineering tasks


Aptitude to independently learn new technologies

 

Description

 
As a senior member of the Data Engineering team, you will have significant responsibility and influence in shaping its future direction. This role is inherently cross-functional and the ideal candidate will work across disciplines. We are looking for someone with a love for data and ability to iterate quickly on all stages of data pipeline. This position involves working on a small team to develop large scale data pipelines and analytical solutions using Big Data technologies. Successful candidates will have strong engineering skills and communication, as well as, a belief that data driven processes lead to great products. You will need to have a passion for quality and an ability to understand complex systems.

 

Education & Experience

 
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Information Systems.


Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

Zorang technologies is a customer experience consulting firm that gives digital solutions through strategy, implementation and support so that data is seamlessly transferred to customer’s systems.




You can read more about us at :

2. https://zorang.com/




As part of the Zorang consulting team, your primary role would be to get to the heart of customer issues, diagnose problem areas, design innovative solutions and facilitate deployment resulting in client

delight.




You are someone who is good at:


Designing and developing application using Java Enterprise and Hybris and ensure compliance


with application development standards


Configuring, designing, building, and test the application or technology architecture components


and classes


Collaborating with other developers, designers, and architects to make sure that the


configuration and custom components meet application requirements and performance goals


Contributing to ensuring high quality of code by performing unit testing and following best


practices


Documenting the code during development to ensure maintainability

Fixing any defects and performance problems discovered during testing and provide regular


status of each assigned tasks and escalate issues as necessary

What do you bring?


Minimum 2 – 8years of Hands-on development experience in SAP Hybris e-commerce


platform (B2C and B2B platforms)


Strong hands-on experience in customizing Hybris based e-Commerce Applications,


Hybris CMS, and e-commerce suite. Hybris implementation experience with SAP

integration with backend


Experience in Product Data modeling, catalog structure, and workflow

Hands on experience in developing highly scalable REST/SOAP web services based


systems, publishing and consuming web services


Solid knowledge of web technologies such as Java, J2EE, Hibernate and Spring.





Why Zorang?




You will love working with us because at Zorang, our team members:


Have access to health insurance and other benefits.

Have complete ownership and accountability for outcomes in their job functions

Are respectful and curious about other’s opinions

Work where they want – this is a fully remote job, so you get to work at your favorite place, be it a cafe, mountains, or from the comfort of your home!

Have unlimited scope of growth, because we value each other's suggestions and get chance to work on them!

description:
Sr. Software Developer

Crypto FinTech

Canada (Remote)










MPA has been retained by Canada’s leading cryptocurrency exchange platform to source a Sr. Java Developer to join their team in Toronto (Remote). You would be joining an organization which is at the forefront of the crypto and digital currency revolution.

As one of the most trusted crypto platforms they pride themselves in providing top-notch security, convenient funding options, and unmatched customer service for their users.




We are looking for a Senior Java Developer that has a passion for technology and not just someone who is writing code. The technological landscape is continually changing and the ideal candidate for this role will not only be able to aid in the development of the platform, but be able to suggest new tools and frameworks that will help the business continue to grow into the future.




Who you are





You have 6+ years Java development experience

You have strong knowledge of Spring Framemwork, microservice system architecture

You have a strong understanding of security including JWT, Keypairs, and encryption

You have a strong understanding of databases including sql/nosql, postgres





Nice to haves





CI/CD Pipelines with automated testing using Jenkins or similar

Experience working with trading platform or other high performance systems

A good understanding of trading concepts including Market/Limit orders, FOK, IOC

A good understanding of networking including message queues, rate limiting

C++ and Python Development experience

AWS/cloud services and architecture experience

Cryptocurrency knowledge

KYC/compliance knowledge





Why Join?





Competitive salary package

Leading health benefits

Paid personal and sick days

Educational support program

The opportunity to work at a start-up that is on the cutting edge of a new and growing industry!





To find out more about this position please send an up to date resume to conall.anderson@mparecruitment.ca

React Native Developer

Responsibility:
•	You will design, develop, modify, debug and/or maintain software code according to functional, non-functional and technical design specifications.
•	You will follow our software engineering standards, applicable software development methodology and release processes, to ensure code is maintainable, scalable, and supportable, and demo the software products to stakeholders.
•	You will investigate issues by reviewing/debugging code, provide fixes and workarounds, and review changes for operability to maintain existing software solutions.
•	You will work within a team, collaborate and add value through participation in peer code reviews, provide comments and suggestions, and work with cross functional teams to achieve goals.
•	You will assume technical accountability for your specific work products within an application and provide technical support during solution design for new requirements.
•	You will be encouraged to actively look for innovation, continuous improvement, and efficiency in all assigned tasks.
 
Required Skills:
•	Bachelor's degree in Science/IT/Computer Science or equivalent
•	3+ years experience developing in React Native
•	Demonstrable experience with the Spring framework components - Spring Boot, MVC, Integration, Security, etc.
•	Strong understanding of RESTful APIs and open systems
•	External APIs/react native module integration
•	React Native Application build & packaging (.ipa, apk )
•	Experience with DevOps and CI/CD tools

Why you will love this job:
•	You will be challenged to design and develop new software applications.
•	You will have the opportunity to work in a growing organization, with ever growing opportunities for personal growth.

Should have 5+ years Experience in SDET.

Core skills on Java/J2EE

Hands on Experience on Spring Framework and SQL.

Good coding/debugging skills.

description:
A10 Networks seeks a Systems Engineer to partner with our Regional Sales Director in a pre-sales and post-sales technical role, showcasing A10 Networks' product solutions-setting up demonstrations and explaining features and benefits to customers - and designing and configuring products to meet specific customer needs. In additional to technological aptitude, and the ability to learn quickly and stay current, the ideal candidate's interpersonal, presentation and troubleshooting skills evoke passion and confidence.


 Your day-to-day 



Develop and execute a plan that accelerates A10 Networks technology adoption

Drive the pre-sales cycle from pitch to demonstration to successful evaluation

Provide technical pre-sales support for sales teams

Assist develop and implement specific account penetration strategies

Design complex solutions and be a part of the building of quotations for customer sales presentations

Provide guidance/assistance in deployments, technical training, and industry seminars and/or trade shows

Develop relationships with the sales teams, partners and customers in support of A10 Networks sales objectives

industries: Internet Publishing
description:
Our team, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, is looking for impact-focused, entrepreneurial engineers ready to bring their ideas and make a difference. We apply our engineering skills and business savvy to solve challenges at the intersection of business and innovation in many of today’s most exciting industries and products. These include Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Games, Workplace, AI and many more. We are engineers, and we write scalable, high performance code across Facebook's products to ship new solutions that address partners’ opportunities and challenges. We also design and deliver technical solutions critical to our partners’ success. In doing so, we help partners realize the full value of working with the Facebook family of apps focusing on helping them grow their business with us while reducing the effort and investment to leverage our platforms. As a Partner Engineer, you will get the opportunity to see the business impact of the solutions you build with our partners. You will get to learn and build on different tech stacks and languages. You will use your entrepreneurial passion and the freedom that the role provides to create your own opportunities and choose how you make an impact. In short, it’s like being the engineering lead in a startup. Role Types:We have a few different role types available in Partner Engineering depending on your interests and skill sets as follows: Partner Engineer: This role includes a combination of partner-facing time to understand their technical and business needs and then code solutions to address those needs. That coding output can be in the form of APIs, product integrations or tools to help partners and Facebook achieve mutually beneficial outcomes.Systems & Tools Engineer: This role is primarily coding on internal systems & tools to help us operate more efficiently in Partnerships and deliver more value to our partners. There is a range of projects including partner management systems and tools, video/news/music content management systems, API/platform management and much more.-------Notre équipe, Global Partner Engineering & Tech, est à la recherche d'ingénieurs axés sur l'impact et l'esprit d'entreprise, prêts à apporter leurs idées et à faire la différence. Nous appliquons nos compétences en ingénierie et notre sens des affaires pour résoudre des problèmes à l'intersection des affaires et de l'innovation dans de nombreux secteurs et produits comptant parmi les plus passionnants du moment. Il s'agit notamment de Facebook Watch, Marketplace, Instagram Shopping, Oculus, Portal, Jeux, Workplace, IA et bien d'autres. Nous sommes des ingénieurs, et nous écrivons du code évolutif et performant sur l'ensemble des produits Facebook pour expédier de nouvelles solutions qui répondent aux opportunités et aux défis des partenaires. Nous concevons et fournissons également des solutions techniques essentielles à la réussite de nos partenaires. Ce faisant, nous aidons nos partenaires à tirer le meilleur parti de leur collaboration avec la famille d'applications Facebook en les aidant à développer leurs activités avec nous tout en réduisant les efforts et les investissements nécessaires pour exploiter nos plateformes. En tant qu'ingénieur partenaire, vous aurez l'occasion de voir l'impact commercial des solutions que vous construisez avec nos partenaires. Vous aurez l'occasion d'apprendre et de construire sur différentes piles technologiques et différents langages. Vous utiliserez votre passion pour l'entrepreneuriat et la liberté que vous offre ce poste pour créer vos propres opportunités et choisir la manière dont vous aurez un impact. En bref, c'est comme être l'ingénieur en chef d'une startup. Types de postes :Nous avons plusieurs types de postes disponibles dans l'ingénierie des associés/associées, en fonction de vos intérêts et de vos compétences : Ingénieur associé/associée : Ce poste consiste à passer du temps avec les associés/associées pour comprendre leurs besoins techniques et commerciaux, puis à coder des solutions pour répondre à ces besoins. Ce codage peut prendre la forme d'API, d'intégrations de produits ou d'outils pour aider les partenaires et Facebook à atteindre des résultats mutuellement bénéfiques.Ingénieur des systèmes et outils : Ce poste consiste principalement à coder des systèmes et des outils internes pour nous aider à fonctionner plus efficacement dans les partenariats et à offrir plus de valeur à nos partenaires. Il existe une gamme de projets comprenant des systèmes et des outils de gestion des partenaires, des systèmes de gestion du contenu vidéo/nouvelles/musique, la gestion des API/plateformes et bien plus encore.

Partner Engineer | Ingénieur associé/associée Responsibilities:



Deeply understand Facebook apps and products (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, video, games, payments) and their underlying implementation | Comprendre en profondeur les applications et produits Facebook (par exemple, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, Portal, Workplace, vidéo, jeux, paiements) et leur mise en œuvre sous-jacente

Write and ship reliable, scalable, and efficient code | Rédiger et expédier du code fiable, évolutif et efficace

Be a subject matter expert in relevant project/product and technology areas. Build and improve solutions in collaboration with engineering, product, and cross functional partners | Être un expert en la matière dans les domaines pertinents du projet/produit et de la technologie. Construire et améliorer des solutions en collaboration avec l'ingénierie, le produit et les associés/associées transversaux/transversales

Identify and surface insights using metrics on product usage to increase adoption and provide new solutions that address the needs of our partners | Identifier et faire émerger des idées en utilisant des statistiques sur l'utilisation du produit pour augmenter l'adoption et fournir de nouvelles solutions qui répondent aux besoins de nos partenaires

Use broad range of technical and soft skills to build productive relationships with our partners, and independently resolve complex technical and business needs while contributing to partner documentation | Utiliser un large éventail de compétences techniques et non techniques pour établir des relations productives avec nos associés/associées, et résoudre de manière indépendante des besoins techniques et commerciaux complexes tout en contribuant à la documentation des associés/associées

Use expertise and product insight to deliver high-quality project/integration/partner engagements, while influencing product roadmap to meet the business needs | Utiliser l'expertise et la connaissance des produits pour fournir des engagements de qualité en matière de projets, d'intégration et de partenariat, tout en influençant la feuille de route des produits pour répondre aux besoins de l'entreprise

Guide workflow changes, and gain consensus from stakeholders while driving toward solutions | Guider les changements de flux de travail et obtenir le consensus des parties prenantes tout en recherchant des solutions

Respond and maintain effective communication with industry partners and internal stakeholders | Répondre et maintenir une communication efficace avec les partenaires industriels et les parties prenantes internes

Work with partners to develop a long- term strategic plan, grounded on business objectives, and manage partners during integrations with Facebook’s platform products and ensure value creation | Travailler avec les partenaires pour développer un plan stratégique à long terme, fondé sur les objectifs commerciaux, et gérer les partenaires pendant les intégrations avec les produits de la plateforme Facebook et assurer la création de valeur

Represent Facebook and our products, APIs and tools in partner meetings and industry events including F8 | Représenter Facebook et ses produits, les API et outils lors de réunions d’associés/associées et d'événements industriels, notamment le F8

Understand organizational structure and cross functional team dynamics and is able to get support from those teams as needed | Comprendre la structure organisationnelle et la dynamique des équipes interfonctionnelles et être capable d'obtenir le soutien de ces équipes si nécessaire

Build and manage strong working relationships with technical counterparts. Mentor and share knowledge with peers, creating positive atmosphere amongst team | Construire et gérer de solides relations de travail avec les homologues techniques. Assurer le mentorat et partager les connaissances avec ses pairs, en créant une atmosphère positive au sein de l'équipe

Willingness to travel approximately 20% of the time | Volonté de voyager environ 20 % du temps



Minimum Qualifications:



4+ years of experience as a software engineer building and shipping products or equivalent experience | Plus de 4 ans d'expérience en tant qu'ingénieur logiciel pour la création et la livraison de produits ou une expérience équivalente

B.A./B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent degree or experience | B.A./B.S. ou M.S. en informatique ou diplôme ou expérience équivalente

Experience with open source languages such as PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin or C# | Expérience des langages open source tels que PHP, Python, Ruby, Objective-C/C++, Swift, Java, Kotlin ou C#

Knowledge of the Web technology stack (for example HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS) | Connaissance de la pile technologique Web (par exemple HTTP, HTML, JavaScript, CSS)

Experience with software design and architecture | Expérience en matière de conception et d'architecture de logiciels

Experience communicating technical concepts to non-technical audiences | Expérience en matière de communication de concepts techniques à des publics non techniques



Preferred Qualifications:



Experience with REST APIs and developer platforms | Expérience des API REST et des plateformes de développement

Experience working on multi-person code bases including open source or personal projects | Expérience de travail sur des bases de code multi-personnes, y compris des projets open source ou personnels

Experience with open source contributions (especially as part of larger projects) | Expérience des contributions open source (notamment dans le cadre de projets plus importants)

Experience contributing to developer and platform documentation | Expérience en matière de contribution à la documentation des développeurs et des plateformes

Client/partner-facing and/or experience communicating to an audience is preferred | L’expérience en matière de contact avec les clients/partenaires et/ou de communication avec un public est préférable

Experience working with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, GCP | Expérience en matière de travail avec des plateformes d’informatique en nuage telles que AWS, GCP

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Marketing Services, and Software Development
description:
Description




Join our WINNING team as a Digital Analytics Manager


When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. 
And just announced
, the 
return of the 4-day work week
 from May 30th through Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” is taken to new heights. Even today, while working remotely, our culture is strong and our team is connected!

Do you love empowering product, marketing and engineering teams through data analysis and insights? If so, then CARFAX may be your best career move! The CARFAX Digital Analytics Manager will be leading a team of analysts who consistently deliver actionable insights that drive value for the business. This person is the subject matter expert for Marketing Analytics platforms that help collect, interpret, report, and govern tags for various products that CARFAX has to offer. This person has a proven track record of data story-telling that influences and inspires at all levels of the organization.



As a Digital Analytics Manager, You Will




 Manage and build a team of analysts to support internal stakeholders with analysis, insights, reporting and tag/privacy governance

 Define, articulate, and execute the data analytics strategy across all marketing and consumer experience channel

 Empower marketing and product teams to make better and faster data-driven decisions

 Develop regular communication, presentations and reporting on metrics, insights, product performance and ROI analysis 

 Analyze data from large data sets into clear insights and present information to technical and non-technical audiences 

 Connect multiple data points in new ways to make sense of complex and ambiguous situations

 Assist leadership with data strategy, business planning and presentation development 

 Stay well-informed of enterprise data, analytics, and the privacy industry to identify opportunities and maintain governance




To Be Considered For This Role, You Will Need




 10+ years of experience with Marketing Analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics, GA, Adobe Launch, GTM DMP, CDP)

 7+ years of experience in an analyst role at a large-scale organization

 3+ years of leadership experience, managing and coaching a team of analysts

 Experience leading/managing implementations of Martech tools/technologies across large-scale organization

 Deep knowledge/experience with data schema, digital analytical tools, and tag management systems 

 Ability to influence, challenge and collaborate with leaders in Product, UX, Marketing, BI, Engineering

 Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to influence and inspire

 Results oriented – strong focus on achieving revenue, conversion, sales, and other marketing goals. Ability to use metrics to manage programs and measure success

 Proactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership. Identifies what needs to be done and has a bias toward action.

 Proficient at programming in languages like SQL, R and/or Python 

 Experience building business models and forecasting is a plus



Offers of employment may be conditional upon providing evidence of COVID-19 full vaccination.




About CARFAX



CARFAX, a unit of IHS Markit (NYSE: INFO), helps millions of people every day confidently shop, buy, own and sell used cars with innovative solutions powered by CARFAX vehicle history information. The expert in vehicle history since 1984, CARFAX provides exclusive services like CARFAX Used Car Listings, myCARFAX, CARFAX History-Based Value and the flagship CARFAX Vehicle History Report. CARFAX is a nationally recognized top workplace by The Washington Post and Glassdoor.com. Based in London, IHS Markit is a world leader in critical information, analytics and solutions.

CARFAX is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. It is the policy of CARFAX to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons regardless of race, color, sex, pregnancy, religion, national origin, age, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, military status, disability or handicap, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, CARFAX will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. We maintain a drug-free workplace. We are a participant in E-Verify.

description:
Multiple permanent Atlassian (Jira/Confluence) Developer roles working with a growing technology company in a hybrid work model in Toronto or Montreal


Multiple permanent Atlassian Developer roles

Growing organization with global clients

Hybrid work model, suitable for someone located in Montreal or Toronto






What & Why:


This is a great time to join this organization as they look to grow their Atlassian support team. You will own the administration and support of JIRA and Confluence to meet users needs. You will be responsible for requirements gathering, implementing business process workflows in JIRA and Confluence and promoting best practices while advising teams on how to get the most out of the Atlassian tool suite.





Who:


Our client is a successful multi-national technology company that has been ranked on various “best place to work” lists. The company has a dynamic culture and a very people-oriented business approach. The people at this company are diverse and values based. This role will need to sit in Montreal or Toronto as it will be in the office in a hybrid model, ~2 days a week.





You:


You will bring the following education, skills and experience to the role:


5+ years of experience in the area of systems engineering

4+ years experience working with Linux, J2EE applications, databases/SQL, web applications, SOA/web services and mobile platforms

4+ years experience architecting, installing, configuring, and customizing Atlassian tools

3+ years experience with Jira, Confluence, and BitBucket

3+ years of experience developing custom plugins and integrations with Jira

3+ years of experience with Git

Strong Knowledge of Atlassian Cloud, Atlassian server and Data Center versions

Demonstrable experience with doing cloud and server migrations, as well as competitor migrations to the three different Atlassian platforms

Two Atlassian certifications or demonstrable experience to pass the exams






Next Steps:


If the sound of this opportunity excites you, and you’re confident that it’s a good fit for your experience and career goals, then we’d love to hear from you! Please send your updated resume to us by applying to this posting and one of our awesome team of recruiters will be in touch.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
About The Job:


The Sama R&D team is focused on delivering integrated solutions solving the most complex Machine Learning problems for over 25% of the Fortune 50. We use advanced practices to build scalable, secure, and efficient solutions covering multiple aspects of Machine Learning and AI, from data ingestion to annotation and building and operating Machine Learning models. 

As a Software Developer, you will work with our team of talented Scientists, Researchers, and over 3,000 of our Annotation Agents in Africa to advance the Sama annotation platform, empowering our customers and Annotators to rapidly and accurately identify and extract features in images, videos, and Lidar systems. With a commitment to your customer and driven by a mission to expand opportunities for low-income populations, you will use your outstanding development skills to deliver compelling solutions in an incremental, lean, and self-driven environment.

Our ideal candidate also has a strong interest in Machine Learning, especially from a Software Engineering perspective. As part of our AI team, you will play a key role in productizing and improving our Machine Learning pipelines, making our advanced annotation platform smarter and more scalable. 





Key Responsibilities:



You will be a key player in building and improving our automated training and deployment platform.

You will own the design, implementation, and maintenance of the components of our internal Machine Learning platform, including data pipelines, tools, and deployment infrastructure.

Through proper implementation and delivery, you will work collaboratively with Product Management and ML Developers to deliver the best products and solutions to our customers.






Minimum Qualifications:



3+ years of industry experience in Software Development

Expertise with Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Azure)

Proficiency in Python or another back-end language (Go, Scala, Java, etc.)

Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes

Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines

Comfortability working with a distributed team






 Preferred Qualifications:



Industry experience in productizing and deploying machine learning models at scale

Graduate degree in Software Engineering, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Image Processing, or a related field

Bonus: Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Pytorch






About Sama:


25% of the Fortune 50 trust Sama to deliver secure, high-quality training data and validation for the technology teams driving humanity forward. From self-driving cars to smart hardware, Sama fuels AI. Founded over a decade ago, we’re experts in image, video, and sensor data annotation and validation for machine learning algorithms in industries including automotive, navigation, AR/VR, biotech, agriculture, manufacturing, and e-commerce. Our staff are driven by a mission to expand opportunity for low-income people through the digital economy, and our social business model has helped lift over 50,000 people out of poverty.


Featured in Forbes: How Ethical Is Your AI?

Sama Honored on Inc. Magazine’s Annual List of America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies — the Inc. 5000






Our Culture:


Sama is quite unique. We are a technology company with a social mission. People that thrive in a high-growth environment, love working on the bleeding edge of technology, and really care about having a positive impact on the world are a great fit for the Sama culture. Our core values are grit, integrity, humanity, and GTD (Get Things Done).





Our Benefits:


Sama offers competitive compensation commensurate with experience and a full benefits package, including: medical, dental, and vision insurance, long-term disability insurance, life, and AD&D insurance, employer-matching Group RRSP, generous holiday, and vacation policies, sabbaticals, a monthly fitness stipend, and professional development opportunities.





At Sama, we take pride in being a diverse and equal opportunity employer.

Company Information 





JDRF Electromag Engineering Inc. is a research-intensive product development company located in Port Credit, Mississauga, Ontario. Our mission is to reduce global GHG emissions by creating affordable Smart Lighting for commercial buildings. 

We have developed a breakthrough technology that will transform the commercial smart lighting industry and have a measurable impact on global GHG emissions. 

As a member of our engineering team, you will join what we believe is the most exciting clean-tech story in Canada. You will be part of a close-knit and innovative group that works with cutting edge technology aimed at energy conservation including machine learning, edge-computing and data fusion, with focus on making this world a better place for future generations. 

General Description 

We are currently looking for someone to join our team in the capacity of a Mobile Developer. The ideal candidate is bright, has a can-do attitude, a commitment to lifelong learning, and demonstrates a passion for technology research and development. 





Key Responsibilities 






Design, development and deployment of mobile applications 

Develop application programming interfaces (APIs) to support mobile functionality 

Contribute to and maintain the full stack solution 

Contribute to the software and system architecture 

Participate in code reviews 

Produce high quality design documentation 

Develop and execute system and unit tests 

Remain up to date with the terminology, concepts and best practices for coding mobile apps 

Work closely with colleagues to constantly innovate app functionality and design 






Position Requirements 






A Bachelor of Computer Engineering / Computer Science Degree 

Over 2 years of experience in mobile application development for Android and iOS 

Programming languages such as Kotlin, Swift, SwiftUI, C# .NET, ASP.NET, MVC, or Razor pages, Microsoft SQL Server (MSSQL), HTML / CSS / JSON or Sass / JavaScript and associated tools 

Experience implementing Azure platform-as-a-service IoT solutions, including device gateways, digital twins, functions, the storage, analysis, and processing of data, and backend enterprise integration 

Ability to recognize Azure IoT service configuration settings within the code portion of an IoT solution 

Experience in performing specific IoT coding tasks in at least one Azure-supported language (such as C#, Node, C or Python) 

Experience in microservices, web services and server-side frameworks 

Good understanding of the security development life cycle and application performance best practices 

Experience with DevOps tools 

Strong analytical and communication skills 

Knowledge of Xamarin is beneficial 

Knowledge of Angular or React is beneficial 

Experience with Unix/Linux is beneficial 





We value diversity and inclusion and encourage applications from all qualified candidates. We will accommodate applicant’s needs throughout the recruitment process. Please reach out to us at selim.ziade@jdrfelectromag.com If you have accommodation needs.

description:
Supply Chain Data Analyst



Siemens Healthineers is building tomorrow’s talent. 
Shape the future with us.

We are looking for dedicated and talented people who tackle ever-changing challenges, customer needs, and questions from colleagues with clever concepts and creativity. We embrace change and work with curious minds re-inventing the future of work. Join us and let us focus together on what’s truly important: making lives better with new ideas and the latest technologies around the world.

Why you’ll love working for Siemens Healthineers;



Freedom and a healthy work-life balance – Embrace our flexible work environment with flex hours, telecommuting and digital workspaces.

Be part of exciting and innovative projects that help solve some of the world’s most significant health problems.

Engaging, challenging, and fast evolving, cutting edge technological environment.

Opportunities to advance your career.

Competitive total rewards package.

Rewarding vacation entitlement with the opportunity to buy and sell your vacation depending on your lifestyle.

Contribute to our social responsibility initiatives focused on access to education and technology, and sustainability, making a positive impact on communities. 

Participate in our celebrations and social events.

Opportunities to contribute your innovative ideas and get paid for them!

Employee perks and discounts.

Diversity and inclusivity focused.

Siemens Healthineers is proud to be a Great Place to Work-certified company® in Canada for 2020-2021, 2021 Best Workplaces in Ontario™, and 2021 list of Best Workplaces™ for Women.



As a leading medical technology company, Siemens Healthineers enables healthcare providers to increase value by empowering them on their journey towards expanding precision medicine, transforming care delivery, improving the patient experience, and digitalizing healthcare. Siemens Healthineers is continuously developing its product and service portfolio, with AI-supported applications, digital services and clinical Point of Care diagnostic products, that play an increasingly important role in the next generation of medical technology. These new applications will enhance the company’s foundation in in-vitro diagnostic, image-guided therapy, and in-vivo diagnostics. Siemens Healthineers also provides a range of services and solutions to enhance healthcare providers’ ability to provide high-quality, efficient care to patients.

Siemens Healthineers in Canada stands for engineering expertise with a pioneering spirit in exploring and developing business opportunities to help healthcare providers achieve their goal of improving outcomes while reducing costs. Our 800 employees in Canada located across Canada and 54,000 worldwide, work together to deliver solutions for healthcare providers, resulting in 70% of medical decisions being influenced by the technologies we provide.


Our impact:




 70% of critical clinical decisions are influenced by the type of technology we provide.

 More than 31 million Canadians benefit from Siemens Healthineers products every year.

 An average of 85,000 Canadians per day receive treatment or tests from a Siemens Healthineers device.

 Siemens Healthineers participates in 30 healthcare research collaborations in Canada and around the world.



https://www.healthcare.siemens.ca/healthcare-company-profile/about

As the supply chain data analyst, you will work with supply chain team members to create reports, dashboards and tools to enable efficient and responsive supply chain business operations


What you will do:




Obtain data from multiple sources

Analyze data to identify opportunities and highlight issues

Extensive experience with SAP

Familiar with database structure

Accuracy and attention to detail




Some nice to haves: 




Experience with Microsoft Power BI

Experience with other data analytics software applications such as Qlik, JMP, Alteryx, and Tableau

Experience with supply chain operations

A Bachelor degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering or Statistics



In our continued commitment to prioritize colleague health, comply with customer/business partner requirements, and help preserve our business continuity, Siemens Healthineers requires employees, contractors, and business partners to be fully vaccinated with relevant dose(s) of a Health Canada approved vaccine for all new hires by their start date.

“Fully vaccinated” means it has been 14 days after receiving the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (i.e. two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series), and which may include, at the Company’s discretion, any further doses in accordance with Health Canada guidelines.

Exemptions will only be granted for medical reasons or on the basis of a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We are currently seeking a 
Senior Business Operations Analyst
 to join our Strategic Planning Team under our Business Operations department in Burnaby, Calgary, or Toronto. This role is also available to remote candidates across Canada, excluding Quebec.


What your team does:


The Strategic Planning Team focuses on Strategy Design, Execution Planning, Monitoring, and Governing the Strategy - we are passionate about great strategy and decision-making. We strive to be objective and unbiased while presenting strategic options and recommend the path forward. The Strategic Planning Team team has a positive, gritty, and supportive culture. We look for curious people that build partnerships across the business, enjoy finding solutions to ambiguous challenges, and love influencing stakeholders towards a common goal -- especially while using their strong analytical, financial, critical thinking and communications skills to outline the road ahead! In our work together, we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and above all, collaborative.


Who you are:


We are currently seeking an exceptional Sr. Business Operations Analyst to join our Strategic Planning team within the Business Operations department. This is a unique opportunity for a mission-driven individual to join a dynamic, collaborative, and fast-paced team environment. You have strong analysis and modeling skills, are deeply data-driven, relentlessly curious, and have demonstrated the ability to balance the details against the bigger picture. You will bring creative and forward-thinking solutions to tackle today's most pressing business issues, and collaborate with leaders across the organization to develop strategies that prepare us to be successful in the future.


What you’ll work on:



 Help develop executive presentations on various strategic and operational topics for various Clio audiences (all levels of management) 

 Ability to present complex concepts to senior leaders. You are able to look at a problem from 20,000 feet and see its macro impact and at the same time be able to dig into detailed data to develop your understanding at a micro-level. 

 Conduct broad research (internal + external) and evaluate environmental trends, assessing core capabilities, competitor profiling and completing gap analyses; publish distilled insights and findings and serve as a champion for recommended opportunities. 

 Help identify trends and indicators in data streams and reports to inform strategic decisions or guide new investments in under- or unrepresented markets. 

 Analyze the health of the business and interpret key performance metrics. 

 Utilize your financial analysis skills to assess and make strategic recommendations that drive profitable business decisions. 

 Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviours, and are aligned with company strategy and objectives. 




What you may have:



 Undergraduate degree in business, finance, economics, or a relevant discipline 

 4+ years of experience at a top-tier management consulting, fintech and/or growth stage software company 

 Experience with data analysis and BI tools (including Looker) 

 Ability to leverage superior analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills for the purposes of delivering business insights and strategic recommendations. 

 Strong financial acumen. 

 Strong, professional written and verbal communication including the ability to communicate complex findings in a structured and clear manner. 

 Comfortable to work in ambiguity with a bent towards fast execution and iteration; 

 Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills, excellent written and verbal communicator; 

 Excellent organization, time management, and prioritization skills. 

 Self-motivated, independent, and deadline-oriented. 




Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion . We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers .


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies . In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering



Job Purpose




General Summary



 The design, development, and support of audio drivers for Qualcomm’s next generation of automotive entertainment systems

 Working within a local team and with remote developers on debugging multimedia software and implementing new automotive features

 Exercising some creativity to troubleshoot technical problems or deal with novel circumstances.

 Using deductive problem solving to solve moderately complex problems; most problems have defined processes of diagnosis/detection



Principal Duties & Responsibilities


 Design, implement, test, document, and support SW for new automotive audio features

 Assess and debug customer issues and coordinate with the Qualcomm Customer Engineering team

 Work closely with team lead and peers

 Collaborates with others inside project team to accomplish project objectives.

 Adapts to changes and setbacks in order to meet deadlines.

 Gathers, integrates, and interprets information specific to a module or sub-block of code from a variety of sources in order to troubleshoot issues and find solutions.

 Stays focused and deals with setbacks in a timely manner.

 Seeks out learning opportunities to increase own knowledge and skill.

 Completes assigned coding tasks to specifications on time without significant errors or bugs.

 Resolves straightforward software issues and bugs within a reasonable amount of time.

 Prioritizes project deadlines and deliverables with close supervision.

 Provide regular written and verbal status on current issues with local leads and remote developers as needed

 Is receptive to others' suggestions about ways in which a problem can be addressed differently.

 Escalates technical issues to an appropriate party (e.g., project lead, colleagues).

 Networks with colleagues within domain to gain insight, ideas, and connections.

 Participate in test development and test automation to increase test coverage benchmarks

 Work with research and development group to integrate and commercialize new applications





Preferred Qualifications




Candidate should be detail-oriented, strongly analytic, highly organized, and results-oriented

Strong communication skills (written and verbal), ability to work with teams across multiple disciplines and multiple time zones

Strong knowledge of C/C++ programming with a demonstrated ability to deliver commercial-grade SW

Good understanding of low-level software/hardware interface design and debugging, especially in a multi-threaded, real-time environment

Knowledge in one or more of the following operating systems: Android, QNX, Automotive Grade Linux, Greenhills Integrity

Practical experience with industry standard software development tools: SW/HW debuggers, code revision control systems (git, Perforce), IDEs and build tools

Practical experience with virtualization technologies and/or para-virtualized device drivers is a strong asset

Preferred experience in audio domain


Understanding of audio frameworks (QNX MMF/io-audio/Dev-A, OpenMAX, Android Multimedia Framework, Android Player (NuPlayer/StageFright), Android Audio System (AudioFlinger, Audio Policy manager, Audio HAL), Linux ALSA Architecture, GStreamer, etc)

Experienced with implementing and working with audio processing pipeline for media applications (playback, capture, transcoding, streaming, voice call, analog audio codecs, software defined radio, etc)







Education




Minimum Qualifications


Bachelors - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering, Bachelors - Information Technology

+++ ENGLISH VERSION FURTHER BELOW +++





ESKI compte deux marques qui desservent différents marchés: PixMob et Safeteams. Notre mission est de faire vivre des expériences mémorables à travers nos technologies portées. PixMob sert à créer des effets lumineux immersifs durant des spectacles et événements, intégrant ainsi l’audience dans les jeux de lumière. Safeteams est notre plus récente invention. Ce produit permet le traçage de contacts et est doté d’un outil d’analyse de contagion efficace.




Le design et l’innovation sont au cœur de notre ADN. L’agilité est un élément essentiel de notre culture, car notre domaine d’activité requiert des ajustements fréquents pour demeurer à l’avant-garde des tendances. Notre équipe partage quelques traits communs, dont une grande curiosité intellectuelle, l’humilité et la recherche de l’excellence. Nous formons une mosaïque complémentaire de cultures, personnalités et croyances, dont plusieurs ont eu des parcours non standards. Nous travaillons fort et célébrons nos succès avec conviction.




Les deux dernières années ont certainement été la plus difficile de nos 16 années d'histoire de l'entreprise. Mais nous avons pu passer à travers cette période et maintenant que les événements live reviennent à la vie, nous sommes plus que jamais engagés dans notre mission: Rassembler la collectivité.





Notre pile technologique



Backend: Python, Node.JS

Frontend: ReactJS, Redux

Base de données: MongoDB, Redis, InfluxDB, ElasticSearch, Kibana

Infrastructure: Google Cloud Platform, Amazon AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform






Votre rôle dans notre équipe



Créer, mettre à l'échelle et maintenir notre infrastructure cloud (﻿au moins une connaissance intermédiaire de GCP et une connaissance avancée d'AWS requises)

Mise en œuvre et maintenance du CI/CD en utilisant Gitlab, CircleCI et AWS CodeDeploy

Répondre aux alertes et résoudre les problèmes du système

Déployer les mises à jour, des corrections, des tests et des outils d'automatisation

Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les développeurs de logiciels pour conteneuriser les systèmes / applications existants 

Assurer la fiabilité, la disponibilité et l'évolutivité de notre infrastructure

Optimiser notre infrastructure en termes d’utilisation des ressources

Gérer des règles de pare-feu et de la mise en réseau pour sécuriser l'environnement Google Cloud






Vous êtes fait pour ce rôle si vous correspondez aux critères suivants



Un baccalauréat ou maîtrise en informatique ou expérience équivalente

Un minimum de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que ingénieur DevOps, administrateur système ou gestionnaire des infrastructures

De l’expérience avec 

plateformes de cloud computing (GCP, AWS)

technologies container et orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)

l’administration de systèmes Linux et compréhension des réseaux, des pare-feu, etc.

Pratiques d'infrastructure en tant que code

diverses bases de données (SQL, MongoDb, Redis, Elastic, etc.)

la conception et la mise en œuvre d'API ReST

la conception et en codage dans diverses langues (Python, Go et Javascript)

informatique sans serveur

la méthode Agile: TDD et tests unitaires, itération, refactoring et programmation par paires






Ce que nous offrons



Un contrat permanent avec une rémunération compétitive

4 semaines de vacances payées + 5 journées de maladie par année 

Un horaire flexible

Une culture d’entreprise stimulante et inclusive, dont vous participerez à l’évolution au fil du temps

Une assurance collective attrayante

Égalité des chances pour tous, quel que soit le sexe (f/h/x)

Des collègues de travail créatifs et brillants





_________________




ESKI is composed of two brands that service various markets: PixMob and Safeteams. Our mission is to provide memorable experiences through our wearable technologies. PixMob helps create immersive crowd lighting experiences at live entertainment events, making the audience part of the show. Safeteams is our most recent invention. This product provides an effective automated contact tracing and contagion analytics capabilities.




Design and innovation are at the heart of our DNA. Nimbleness is an essential component of our culture, as our field of work requires frequent adjustments to remain at the forefront of trends. Our team shares a few common traits, including a thirst for knowledge and knowhow, humility and striving for excellence. Together, we form a mosaic of cultures, personalities and beliefs, and several of us have had non-traditional career paths. We work hard and celebrate with conviction.




The past 2 years have definitely been the toughest in our 16 year company history. But we prevailed and now that live events are coming back in full swing we’re more than ever committed to our mission: Creating togetherness. 





Our technology stack



Backend: Python, Node.JS

Frontend: ReactJS, Redux

Databases: MongoDB, Redis, InfluxDB, ElasticSearch, Kibana

Infrastructure: Google Cloud Platform, Amazon AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform






Your role on our team



Building, scaling and and maintaining our cloud infrastructure 

CI/CD implementation and maintenance using Gitlab, CircleCI and AWS CodeDeploy

Responding to alerts and resolving system issues

Deploying updates, fixes, testing, and automation tools

Working closely with software developers to containerize existing systems/applications 

Ensuring reliability, availability and scalability of our infrastructure

Optimizing our infrastructure in terms of resource usage 

Managing firewall rules and networking to secure Google Cloud environment






You are the person for this role if you fit the following criteria



B.Sc in Computer Science, related field or equivalent professional experience

Minimum 3 years of professional work experience related to DevOps engineering, SysAdmin or infrastructure management

Advanced knowledge in…

Cloud Computing Platforms (at least intermediate GCP and advanced AWS knowledge required)

container and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)

Linux Systems Administration and understanding about networking, firewalls etc

infrastructure as code practices

software and design and coding skills in a variety of languages (Python, Go and Javascript)

serverless Computing

Agile methodology: TDD and unit-testing, iteration, SCM, Refactoring, Pairing

Variety of databases (SQL, MongoDb, Redis, Elastic, etc)

ReST API design and implementation






What we offer



A permanent contract with a competitive compensation package

4 weeks of paid vacation + 5 personal days per year 

Flextime

A dynamic and inclusive company culture, which you will help evolve over time

A competitive collective insurance

Attractive career opportunities

Equal opportunities for all, regardless of gender (m/f/x)

Creative and brilliant colleagues
