The Company: 
As part of Copper Surgical, Insception Lifebank is Canada's largest and most experienced cord blood program. A market leader, Insception Lifebank is committed to providing clear and balanced education to assist Canadian families make an informed decision regarding cord blood banking options.





The Position: 
We’re looking for highly motivated 
Dynamics 365 CRM Developer
, at our head office in Mississauga, ON. Reporting to the IT Manager, the CRM Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and supporting applications in CRM and .NET, encompassing all IT development needs. This position is a one-year contract position. Availability outside standard business hours is required. 





Key Accountabilities:



Design and development of new features in existing applications and/or new software solutions that support customer and business requirements.

Work with key stakeholders to produce business requirement documentation in line with development best practices as well as regulatory requirements.

Produce standardized and detailed design specifications.

Work in a team environment on development and deployment of applications in .NET using different project tools

Produce unit test plans to demonstrate understanding of the required results and test individual projects. Develop integration unit tests.

Participate in code reviews both as a reviewer and reviewee

Provide software development mentoring and assistance for junior developers

Work within time and resource constraints to meet deadlines. Identify and communicate issues with project deliveries

Participate and provide feedback to post-implementation reviews, and root cause analysis

Second level support to all internal software applications: troubleshoot and resolve system issues; act as the knowledge expert on these applications

Lead and assist in all development and application projects, working closely with department leaders and stakeholders.






Requirements: 



Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.

6+ years’ experience in coding, testing and system analysis using C# .NET, ASP.NET MVC, Web API and web services.

Experience working with Dynamics 365/CRM SDK to build plugins, custom workflows (C#).

Experience developing custom applications and integrations directly with the Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power Platform and Azure.

6+ years’ experience with client-side development in Dynamic 365 and Power Platform, JavaScript frameworks, Smart connect 

6+ years’ hands-on experience with SQL Server, SSRS, SSIS.

Working knowledge of integration between Power Platform, Power Automate, Power BI, Customer Voice, Office 365 and other Microsoft apps 365.

Understanding of MailChimp Platform and API, Marketo or other marketing tools.

Working knowledge of source control systems such as GIT.

Good understanding of build automation software.

Understanding and experience in a regulated health care environment, an asset.

Understanding and working knowledge of MS Dynamics GP is an asset.

Understanding and experience with project methodologies such as SCRUM, AGILE would be an advantage.

Strong organizational skills, flexibility, and adaptability.

Ability to work flexible hours as required.

Strong work ethic, integrity, and positive attitude





Insception Lifebank is an inclusive employer, and we encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the human rights codes throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially. We appreciate and review all applications, however, only those qualified for an interview will be contacted. 

For more information, visit: www.insception.com and https://www.coopersurgical.com/

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
We’re Coinbase. We’re the world’s most trusted way to join the crypto revolution, serving more than 89 million accounts in more than 100 countries.

Our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web 3.0 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.


Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:



You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. 

You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. 

You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.

You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.

You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.

You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. 


Coinbase is seeking Staff Software Engineers (Frontend) to join our Web3 Platform & Applications team. We formed the Web3 Platform & Apps team to start this year with the mission to enable 1B+ people to safely and securely use Web3 every day. We’ve seen great momentum across the org so far: we’re shipping at a high velocity across Wallet and the main Coinbase App, reaching all-time high metrics, and expanding our ambitions to go even bigger

If you're excited by the problem space of designing and delivering engaging user experiences, building performant user interfaces, and building trustworthy financial systems, we should talk!



What You'll Be Doing




Articulate a long term technical direction and vision for maintaining and scaling our web and mobile platforms.

Create trustworthy user experiences by building interfaces that are simple, easy to comprehend, performant and reliable using modern tools like React, React Native, Typescript, React Navigation, Jest and Webpack.

Turn our vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter by working with engineers, product managers and senior leadership.

Mentor and train other team members on design techniques and coding standards.

Add positive energy in every meeting, and make your coworkers feel included in every interaction.




What We Look For In You




You have at least 8 years of experience in software engineering and at least 7 years of experience in developing web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript and modern, component-based JS frameworks like React. 

You've developed and shipped user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks.

You’re familiar with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability.

You’re familiar with product and design lifecycles, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.

You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.




Nice To Haves




You've worked on front-end teams in the finance or security space

You have at least 1 year of experience in developing React Native mobile apps or helped move existing native apps to React Native


ID: G1829

Please note that for employees based in the US, Philippines, Canada or Singapore, if your role requires you to be present in a Coinbase office or if you choose to be physically present in a Coinbase office or sponsored location, participate in any in-person gathering (including offsites) or engage in business travel sponsored by Coinbase, you will be required to be fully vaccinated (as defined by applicable law). If you receive an offer, you will receive additional information about the grounds and process for an exemption.

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.



 Job Category 
Sales
 Job Details 




Role Description



Also known as a " Pre -Sales Engineer" or "Sales Consultant," the Solution Engineer is responsible for presenting product offerings and architecture in the best light to prospects and customers, to evoke confidence in company’s technology infrastructure, and to remove all technical objections in the sales cycle. To accomplish this, the Solution Engineer must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and/or sales skills, including the ability to solicit business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, configure and effectively demonstrate the solutions that address these requirements and provide business value. Our Core Solution Engineers work across different product offerings (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc...) to help our clients find the best Solutions for their business.



Your Impact




Understand the customer's needs, and establish Salesforce's product as the best solution that solves the customer's challenges

Build and present customized demos of Salesforce products

Convey deep understanding of the customer's technology as it pertains to Salesforce's solutions

Participate in all appropriate product, sales, and procedural trainings and certifications to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position

Attain quarterly and annual objectives assigned by management

Respond effectively to RFPs

Ability to travel based on territory alignment and region




Minimum Qualifications




Bachelor's Degree Required

Ability to work as part of a team to solve technical problems in varied political environments

Solid oral, written, presentation, collaboration and interpersonal communication skills




Preferred Qualifications




Salesforce Certifications

Previous experience as a solution/sales engineer for a technology company or related experience

Knowledge of related applications, relational database and web technology

Basic programming experience in HTML and other web based technologies




About Salesforce



Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas-a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes World's Most Innovative Company five years in a row and one of Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.


 Accommodations 


If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .


 Posting Statement 


At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.


Salesforce.com
 and 
Salesforce.org
 are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. 
Salesforce.com
 and 
Salesforce.org
 do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. 
Salesforce.com
 and 
Salesforce.org
 will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with 
Salesforce.com
 or 
Salesforce.org
 .

Salesforce welcomes all.

job_title: Développeur Angular Sénior - IBM iX, services-conseils IBM
industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
530633BR


Introduction


Menez IBM vers l'avenir en traduisant les exigences systèmes dans la conception et l'élaboration de systèmes personnalisés dans un environnement agile. Le succès d'IBM est entre vos mains au fur et à mesure que vous transformez les besoins d'affaires essentiels en code et que vous stimulez l'innovation. Votre travail fortifiera mondialement IBM et ses clients, par la collaboration et l'intégration de code dans les systèmes d'entreprise. Vous aurez accès à la formation, aux outils et aux technologies les plus récents, et à un cheminement de carrière illimité avec le chef de file mondial de la technologie. Venez chez IBM et ayez un impact à l'échelle planétaire!

Votre rôle et vos responsabilités

Nous sommes à un tournant de l'histoire où l'impact de la technologie sur les entreprises est suffisamment important pour transformer l'ensemble de leur mode de fonctionnement. La convergence des nouvelles technologies exponentielles telles que l'IA, le cloud, la mobilité, l'automatisation, l'internet des objets, la blockchain et la 5G ont le pouvoir de changer les modèles d'entreprise, de réinventer les processus et de réimaginer la façon dont nous travaillons tous.

IBM Consulting a pour vocation d'aider ses clients à gérer l'ampleur des changements nécessaires pour rester en tête et à innover sans relâche. Nous établissons des relations solides avec nos clients et créons ensemble des solutions à l'intersection de la stratégie, de l'expérience, de la technologie et des opérations. Nous agissons en tant qu'agents du changement : nous donnons aux clients les moyens d'élaborer une stratégie et de mettre en œuvre leur vision, ce qui leur permet d'évoluer à grande échelle avec rapidité et clarté.

Chez IBM iX au sein du groupe de transformation de la clientèle et de l'expérience d'IBM Consulting, nous sommes des pionniers réalistes, soucieux d'imaginer et de créer des solutions numériques de bout en bout axées sur le client final. Nous appliquons une conception centrée sur l'humain et des méthodologies agiles pour repenser la manière dont nos clients travaillent et s'engagent auprès de leurs clients, et pour donner rapidement vie à ces solutions numériques axées sur l'expérience. Voulez-vous faire partie de l'équipe qui définit l'avenir de l'expérience des supporters des équipes sportives professionnelles ? Que diriez-vous d'aider les institutions de services financiers à se transformer à l'ère de la transformation avec l'accélération de l'innovation numérique stimulée par le changement de comportement des clients dû à la pandémie ? Et qu'en est-il de l'aide apportée aux compagnies pétrolières et gazières pour améliorer la sécurité et la productivité des travailleurs sur le terrain ? C'est votre chance de faire partie d'une équipe où tout ce que nous faisons a un impact mesurable à grande échelle.


Tâches Et Responsabilités


En tant que Développeur-maître Angular Sénior chez IBM iX (sous IBM Consulting), vous êtes un membre de l'équipe qui permet de concrétiser la conception du produit de notre client dans les délais impartis et de manière sécurisée, fiable, réutilisable et évolutive. Grâce à votre expérience agile au sein d'organisations centrées sur le produit, vous êtes l'un des membres de l'équipe travaillant aux côtés d'une équipe de livraison pour assurer la fourniture réussie d'applications web et mobiles et d'autres expériences numériques de première mise sur le marché.Vos responsabilités en tant que Développeur-maître Sénior sont les suivantes :



Gérer le développement complet de logiciels pour nos clients, de la conception au déploiement, dans le cadre de leur transformation numérique, en assurant l'alignement sur l'architecture actuelle et en développement.

Participer aux réunions quotidiennes de la mêlée et fournir une orientation technique aux autres membres de l'équipe.

Collaborer avec les parties prenantes et les concepteurs d'architecture pour s'assurer que la solution est conforme aux exigences et à la stratégie. Participer à l'examen et à la sélection des technologies (langages / cadres et bibliothèques).

Appliquer les modèles de conception, les normes de codage et les meilleures pratiques pour produire un code sûr, fiable, réutilisable et évolutif.

Identifier, trier et analyser les causes profondes des problèmes spécifiques au développement.

Intégrer des implémentations d'interface utilisateur avec des API sécurisées et non sécurisées.

Travailler avec les parties prenantes internes et clientes pour définir et clarifier les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles.

Aide à l'estimation et à l'effort requis pour construire les composants clés

Préparer, documenter et présenter la conception et la documentation technique

Exercer un leadership technique grâce à son expertise en la matière et à sa connaissance du domaine

Contribuer à l'amélioration des processus, en signalant tous les problèmes et en contribuant activement à leur résolution

Animer des réunions et des séances de travail régulières avec les membres de l'équipe de développement et les différentes unités commerciales afin de traiter les questions en cours qui nécessitent une compréhension ou une analyse plus approfondie

Contribuer à l'élaboration du cadre architectural et de la conception



Votre profil



Vous apprenez rapidement et vous vous adaptez : vous pouvez vous familiariser avec de nouvelles technologies rapidement, de manière approfondie et avec confiance, en vous appuyant sur des concepts que vous comprenez déjà.

Vous avez un style de travail interactif : vous vous épanouissez en travaillant à la fois en équipe et individuellement lorsque cela est nécessaire, y compris avec des équipes mondiales et extraterritoriales pour la mise en œuvre.

Vous êtes un communicateur hors pair : vous avez fait preuve d'excellence dans la communication et la présentation d'informations complexes à des parties prenantes tant techniques que non techniques.

Vous êtes un gourou de l'estimation des tâches : vous pouvez rapidement évaluer l'effort relatif d'une tâche de développement, en tenant compte des ambiguïtés et de la complexité, en vous appuyant sur votre vaste expérience professionnelle antérieure.

Vous avez le sens de l'initiative et un grand souci du détail : vous effectuez des examens de code de qualité par des pairs et vous avez des exigences élevées et un grand souci de la réussite et de la satisfaction des clients. 

Nous recrutons dans les villes principales du pays. Les candidats retenus pour un poste à Montréal, QC, doivent être parfaitement bilingues en anglais et en français. 



Expertise professionnelle et technique requise


Qualifications Requises


Les candidats retenus seront en mesure de démontrer les caractéristiques suivantes :



Diplôme de Bachelor dans un des domaines suivants : informatique, ingénierie, MIS ou domaine connexe.

3-5 ans d' expérience dans la technologie ou dans un domaine connexe , avec une expérience pertinente dans les projets numériques centrés sur l'utilisateur. 

Expérience des technologies dedéveloppement web, notamment HTML, CSS, JavaScript, ainsi que de l'utilisation d'un ou plusieurs des outils Angular, React, Vue.

Expérience des technologies multiplateformes telles que Flutter, ReactNative, NativeScript.

Expérience avec un des deux systèmes NodeJS et Java

Familiarité avec l'intégration et la prise en charge de fonctionnalités fournies par des SDK ou des bibliothèques externes (par exemple, push, analytique, CMS).

Maîtrise de l'utilisation d'un système de gestion du code source tel que Git, ainsi qu'une connaissance pratique des pratiques devops (par exemple, l'intégration/livraison continue).

Compréhension des modèles de conception, de l'optimisation, de la sécurité des API et des meilleures pratiques de codage sécurisé.

Expérience dans la création de solutions pour le web responsable et mobile

Compréhension du cycle de vie du développement logiciel et des principes de mise en œuvre agile

Connaissance des systèmes de conteneurs comme Docker et de l'orchestration de conteneurs comme Kubernetes

Maîtrise des outils de gestion des projets agiles (par exemple, Confluence et Jira).

Une parfaite maîtrise de l'anglais.



Expertise professionnelle et technique privilégié


Qualifications Supplémentaires




Maîtrise ou l'équivalent;

Maîtrise du français




Ce que nous offrons




Une culture d'entreprise axée sur le travail d'équipe, qui met l'accent sur le bien-être et l'inclusion des employés, avec des commentaires constructifs et des possibilités d'apprentissage continu, y compris le développement des compétences en matière de gestion par l'intermédiaire de la Leadership Academy d'IBM

Rémunération compétitive, avantages sociaux complets et conditions de travail flexibles. Nous continuons à développer nos avantages et nos programmes, offrant ainsi un soutien, des conseils et une couverture parmi les meilleurs pour un personnel diversifié

Un tout nouveau bureau IBM situé au cœur du centre-ville de Toronto, au 16 York Street (ouverture en décembre 2021)




La méthode IBM



En Tant Qu'IBMers


Chez IBM , nos méthodes de travail définissent qui nous sommes et nous permettent d'atteindre notre objectif.



 Nous établissons un lien de confiance

 Nous collaborons pour réussir

 Nous évoluons avec une inlassable curiosité

 Nous innovons dans un but précis

 Nous livrons avec impact

 nous encourageons la diversité des perspectives (voir plus ci-dessous)




La diversité chez IBM


Chez IBM, nous encourageons la diversité des perspectives et nous nous engageons à apporter un large éventail de points de vue, d'expériences et de compétences à notre travail afin de favoriser un environnement véritablement inclusif. Nous encourageons fortement les candidatures de tous les candidats qualifiés qui représentent toute la diversité des communautés à travers le Canada. Cela inclut, sans s'y limiter, les peuples autochtones, les personnes issues de communautés noires et raciales diverses, les personnes handicapées, les personnes issues de communautés sexuées et sexuellement diverses et/ou les personnes ayant des identités transgenres. IBM est fier d'être un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances et s'engage également à respecter toutes les pratiques d'emploi équitables concernant la citoyenneté et le statut d'immigration.

Doit avoir la capacité de travailler au Canada sans parrainage.

A propos de l'unité commerciale

IBM Services est une équipe de conseillers d'affaires, de stratégie et de technologie qui conçoivent, construisent, et exploitent des systèmes de base et des services qui constituent l'épine dorsale de l'économie mondiale. IBM Services fait équipe avec les plus grandes entreprises du monde dans plus de 170 pays afin de bâtir des affaires plus intelligentes en repensant et en réinventant par la technologie, avec ses méthodologies axées sur les résultats, son portefeuille de pointe et son expertise en recherche et en activités de calibre mondial qui mènent à une innovation axée sur les résultats et à une excellence durable.

Votre vie chez IBM

Envie d'en savoir plus? Prêt à résoudre certains des défis parmi les plus uniques au monde? Et prêt à façonner l'avenir de millions de personnes?

Si c'est le cas, il est alors temps de vous joindre à nous, d'exprimer votre individualité, de laisser le champ libre à votre curiosité et d'explorer de nouvelles possibilités.

Chaque IBMiste (ou IBMiste potentiel comme vous) dispose d'une voix, trace son propre chemin et propose son expertise en vue d'aider à cocréer et à enrichir notre histoire. Ensemble, nous avons le pouvoir d'apporter des changements significatifs, de modifier la structure de nos clients, de la société et d'IBM elle-même, d'avoir un effet vraiment positif et de faire de ce monde un meilleur endroit pour tous.

Le moment est venu de définir votre carrière.

À propos d'IBM

La plus grande invention d'IBM, c'est l'IBMiste. Nous sommes convaincus que la mise en application de l'intelligence, de la raison et de la science nous permet d'améliorer l'activité économique, la société et la condition humaine, en donnant vie à la puissance d'un nuage hybride ouvert et d'une stratégie d'IA pour nos clients et nos partenaires du monde entier.

Ayant réinventé sans relâche depuis 1911, nous ne sommes pas seulement l'une des plus grandes entreprises au monde, nous sommes aussi l'un des plus grands employeurs en TI et en services-conseils, avec de nombreuses entreprises du classement Fortune 50 s'appuyant sur IBM Cloud pour gérer leur entreprise.

Chez IBM, nous sommes fiers d'avoir été parmi les premiers à adopter l'intelligence artificielle, l'informatique quantique et la chaîne de blocs. C'est le moment de vous joindre à nous et de devenir un innovateur technologique responsable et une force au service du bien dans le monde.

Énoncé du lieu de travail

Pour obtenir de l’information supplémentaire sur les critères d’emplacement, veuillez contacter le recruteur après avoir soumis votre demande.

Vous et IBM

IBM s'engage à créer un milieu diversifié et est fière de souscrire au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, ausexe, à l'identité ou à l'expression de genre, à l'orientation sexuelle, à l'origine nationale, à la génétique, à la grossesse, aux handicaps, à l'âge, au statut de vétéran ou à d'autres caractéristiques. IBM s'engage également à se conformer à toutes lespratiques équitables en matière d'emploi à l'égard du statut de citoyen et d'immigrant.

description:
Location: Ottawa, ON, Canada Job Type: Contract Date: 2/25/2022 Job ID: 9D858025225 Category: Information Technology

David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to staff a talented Business Analyst on a 1-year contract with a strong possibility of extension. The successful incumbent will be an experienced BA who gathers requirements and presents options/recommendations across a suite of FMBO applications and systems to support the successful migration of data/information flows from legacy ESB (EAI) to new ESB (Mulesoft).


The Role:



Consult with stakeholders to define business requirements that must be met by new or enhanced IT applications and business processes

Perform business process analysis, assess best practices for process improvement, and recommend solutions

Conduct independent analysis activities through active engagement with stakeholders

Facilitate workshops with technical and non-technical resources and document functional/nonfunctional solution requirements

Document data models and use cases

Prepare detailed specifications documents that will be used to evaluate, select, and test solutions

Formulate user acceptance test plans and coordinate testing; conduct testing if needed

Be able to handle the scope of projects so that project needs and schedules are met while also delivering the expected value to the business unit

Develop and deliver communications to clients and stakeholders




The Ideal Candidate:



University degree or college diploma in computer science, engineering, or business administration

5 years of demonstrated experience in business analysis

A minimum of 3 years of demonstrated experience defining and implementing data models and use cases for complex IT solutions

Experience in modeling business processes using a notation standard in an appropriate business process modeling tool

A minimum of 3 years of demonstrated experience clarifying complex concepts or proposals in terms that are appropriate to the audience

Demonstrated experience in facilitating workshops with technical and non-technical resources to document functional and non-functional solution requirements

The ability to acquire an Enhanced Reliability Security Clearance is required.

Demonstrated industry certification such as International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA), Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) designation would be considered a strong asset



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to David Newark, Consultant, Information Technology. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.



If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian-owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, over four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!



Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

job_title: Développeur Angular Sénior - IBM iX, services-conseils IBM

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Req ID: 243442

Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide


 Objet de l’emploi (Ingénieur Système ICC ATS) 


Le but est d’accomplir un mandat d'ingénieur système ICC (Integrated Control Center) ATS dans le cadre de différents projets ICC qui fournissent généralement un système ICC composé d'au moins un produit ICONIS et d'au moins l'un des sous-systèmes suivants : SCADA (Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition), ATS (Automated Train Supervision) et MSM (Maintenance and Security Management).

Il est important de mentionner que l'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS se concentrera sur le sous-système ATS qui, selon le contexte du projet, s’appelle parfois aussi CS (Control System) ou TCS (Traffic Control System).

Dans une première phase, l'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS participera à la définition détaillée des spécifications du projet RER. Dans une deuxième phase, correspondant aux étapes ultérieures du projet RER ou d’autres projets futurs, son mandat sera étendu à un rôle complet d'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS, tel que décrit ci-dessous.


 Contexte: 


Chez Alstom, un ingénieur système ICC est généralement impliqué au début et à la fin du cycle de développement en V d'Alstom, plus précisément pendant les phases de spécification et d'architecture du système, d'intégration et de validation d'un projet ICC donné. Une autre partie importante du mandate consiste à examiner la documentation des sous-systèmes et à fournir un soutien aux équipes des sous-systèmes pour assurer la cohérence des sous-systèmes avec l'ensemble du système. L'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS se concentre sur le sous-système ATS mais participe également aux activités système, liées à l'ATS.

Le Projet RER vise à livrer un ICC basé sur un Système composé de plusieurs sous-systèmes, comme suit : Système de Contrôle de Trafic qui est en fait un ATS (Supervision Automatique des Trains), SCADA (Contrôle de Supervision et Acquisition de Données), MS (Système de Gestion), SIM (SIMulation environment), IPS (Integrated Playback System), GCS (Global Common Services) qui est en fait un middleware.

Le rôle principal de l'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS sera de définir l'architecture du système ainsi que la conception détaillée du sous-système ATS et éventuellement, dans la phase ascendante du cycle en V, de suivre et de soutenir les activités d'intégration et de validation du même sous-système. À l'occasion, selon les résultats de la validation, l'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS devra mettre à jour les spécifications ou les documents de conception, déjà existants.

À terme, dans le cadre des projets ICC ultérieurs, l'Ingénieur Système ICC ATS assumera un ensemble complet de responsabilités, telles que définies ci-dessous.


 Objectifs 


Rédiger et mettre à jour les spécifications système du sous-système ATS, telles que les documents SuRS et SuHMID, en veillant à ce que toutes les exigences soient réalisables et mesurables ; rédiger des Documents de Contexte Opérationnel (dont les User Stories) et les présenter aux autres équipes.

À l’occasion, mettre à jour les sections liées à l'ATS dans les spécifications système, telles que les documents SyRS, SyHMID, SyAD, SyID

Participer au processus d'intégration des versions livrées par des différents sous-systèmes, les produits Alstom et les interfaces externes

Participer au processus de validation du système et/ou du sous-système dans son ensemble (en incluant les différents sous-systèmes, les produits Alstom et les interfaces externes) et s'assurer qu'il répond à toutes les exigences, conformément à la documentation d'Alstom et au contrat initial avec le Client.


 Mesure d’attente des Objectifs 


Respecter tous les indicateurs de projet QCDP (Qualité, Coût, Délai, Performance de livraison)

Obtenir l'approbation du client pour tous les documents créés/mis à jour, liés aux spécifications, à la conception, à l'intégration et à la validation du projet

Atteindre tous les objectifs globaux d’Alstom


 Responsabilités 



 Globalement: 



 Concevoir une solution système en ligne avec les besoins du projet

 Identifier les spécificités projet (en anglais GAP) et les solutions possibles pour les combler

 Discuter les solutions système avec le Client

 Gérer les solutions système tout au long de l'exécution du projet

 Gérer les interfaces internes et externes

 S'assurer que les composants de la solution sont développés correctement

 Définir les règles des applications ainsi que le processus d'ingénierie

 Déterminer la stratégie de migration et de déploiement du système

 Intégrer les composants de la solution dans le système fonctionnel




 Spécifications du système et/ou du sous-système et conception de l'architecture : 



 Rédiger les spécifications du système et/ou du sous-système (exigences) et la description du contexte opérationnel







 Mettre à jour la documentation de conception en fonction des revues internes (par les pairs) ou des commentaires des clients

 Mettre à jour et clarifier les spécifications (exigences) lors des phases de conception, de développement et de présentation des maquettes

 S'assurer que l'architecture et la conception du système sont conformes aux exigences RAM, sécurité, qualité et cybersécurité




Intégration système et/ou sous-système :



 Valider les procédures techniques définissant l'intégration du système, des sous-systèmes et des interfaces externes

 Assurer le suivi et fournir des conseils sur toutes les activités d'intégration entre le système, les sous-systèmes et les interfaces externes




 Validation du système et/ou du sous-système : 



 Suivre et fournir des conseils sur toutes les activités de validation au niveau du système, envoyer les anomalies identifiées aux sous-systèmes si nécessaire

 S'assurer que le système et/ou le sous-système est conforme à toutes les exigences du système et au contrat client d'origine ainsi qu'à toute autre exigence implicite en résultant



Support et suivi de la traçabilité des exigences, à partir du niveau système, jusqu'aux sous-systèmes et aux interfaces externes


 Compréhension de l’industrie 


Connaissance de l’industrie ferroviaire, ATS, SCADA, système de gestion des incidents, centre de contrôle


 Exigences en matière d’études 


Baccalauréat en génie électrique, en automatisation ou l’équivalent

Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) ; Membre de l’Ordre des Ingénieurs Professionnels de l’Ontario (PEO) serait un atout


 Expérience technique 


5 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie ferroviaire

10 ans d’expérience en ingénierie système (spécifications système, architecture système, intégration de systèmes)

5 ans d’expérience avec des grands systèmes de centre de contrôle (transport, énergie, pipeline et similaires) et leurs défis d’intégration typiques

3 ans d’expérience avec au moins un produit ICONIS (ATS CF, ATS CT, S2K-AGUI, S2K-UHMI


 Aptitudes et compétences comportementales et techniques 


Solides compétences relationnelles et interpersonnelles

Excellentes compétences en communication orale et écrite, en anglais et en français, ainsi que d’excellentes compétences en présentation

Capacité de comprendre et d’écrire des scénarios opérationnels (User Stories)

Capacité de prise de décision technique, jugement judicieux, leadership, résolution de problèmes

Expérience avec Windows et Windows Server.

Expérience avec MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Connaissance des outils de gestion de la configuration (Clearcase, Perforce)

Connaissance de VM Ware, principes de base de SQL Server

Connaissance des principes de cybersécurité

Connaissance des principes Agile


 Lieu de travail 


Montréal (Québec), Canada.

À l’occasion, dans d’autres provinces canadiennes (c.-à-d. l’Ontario) ou à l’étranger, pour aider à différentes activités d’intégration et aux essais sur le terrain

English Version Below:


 Purpose of the Job 


To fulfill an ICC (Integrated Control Center) ATS System Engineer mandate within the context of different ICC Projects which typically deliver one ICC System consisting of at least one ICONIS Product and at least one of the following subsystems: SCADA (Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition), ATS (Automated Train Supervision) and MSM (Maintenance and Security Management).

It is important to mention that the ICC ATS System Engineer’s focus will be the ATS subsystem and that, depending on project context, customer preference or other reasons, the latter might sometimes be also referred as CS (Control System) or TCS (Traffic Control System).

In a first phase, the ICC ATS System Engineer will participate in detailed specification definition on the RER Project. In a second phase, the mandate will be to perform a complete ICC ATS System Engineer role in subsequent phases of RER Project or other ICC Projects, as described below.


 Organisation Structure 


Alstom, Americas Region, DI&S (Digital & Integrated Systems) Organization, ICC Department, ICC Engineering Team


 Organisational Reporting 


Hierarchically reporting to the ICC System Engineer Manager or ICC Engineering Manager

Functionally reporting to the PrEM (Project Engineering Manager), ATS leader, or equivalent Engineering Leader on the assigned project


 Network & Links 


Alstom Systems & Products Community

Alstom Methods & Tools Community

RER project:


 Project Core Team 

 System Team 

 Design Team 

 Integration Team 

 Validation Team 

 Safety Team 

 Quality Team 

 Product Team 

 Tech Center (Development and Subsystem Validation teams) 

 Customer 

 Interface Partners 



Project EHS Manager/Coordinator or RC EHS Manager/Engineer


 Context: 


At Alstom, an ICC System Engineer is typically involved at the beginning and at the end of Alstom’s development Vee-cycle, more precisely during the system specification & architecture, integration and validation phases of a given ICC Project. Another important part of the mandate is to review subsystem documentation and provide support to subsystem teams to ensure consistency of subsystems with the overall system. The ICC ATS System Engineer focuses on ATS Subystem but also participates to ATS-related System activities.

The RER Project is aiming to deliver an ICC based on a System consisting of several subsystems, as follows: Traffic Control System which actually is an ATS (Automatic Train Supervision), SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition), MS (Management System), SIM (SIMulation environment), IPS (Integrated Playback System), GCS (GTCS Common Services) which is actually a middleware.

The main role of the ICC ATS System Engineer will be to define the system architecture and the detailed design of the ATS Subsystem and eventually, on the ramping phase of the Vee-cycle, to follow up on, and support the, integration and validation activities of the ATS Subsystem. Occasionally and following the tests results, the ICC ATS System Engineer will be required to update already existing specification or design.

Eventually, within the context of subsequent ICC Projects, the ICC ATS System Engineer will be required to assume a complete set of responsibilities, as defined below.


 Objectives: 


To write and update System specifications of the ATS Subsystem, such as SuRS, SuHMID documents, ensuring that all requirements are achievable and measurable; to write Operational Context Documents (including User Stories) and present it to the other teams.

To, occasionally update ATS-related sections in System specifications as SyRS, SyHMID, SyAD, SyID

To participate at the integration process of the released versions of the different subsystems, Alstom Products and external interfaces

To participate at the validation process of the System and/or Subsystem as a whole (including different subsystems, Alstom Products and external interfaces) and ensure it meets all the requirements, as per Alstom documentation and per customer original contract


 Measurement 


Meet all the Project QCDP (Quality, Cost, Delivery Performance) indicators

Receive customer approval for all the created/updated Project Specification-, Design- and Integration and Validation-related documents

Meet all the Alstom-related objectives


Responsibilities


Overall:


 Design system solution in line with project needs 

 Identify project gaps and evolution path for solutions 

 Discuss system solution with the customer 

 Manage system solution throughout project execution 

 Control internal and external interfaces 

 Ensure solution components are developed properly 

 Define application rules and engineering process 

 Determine system migration and deployment strategy 

 Integrate solution components into functional system 



System and/or Subsystem specifications and architecture design:


 Write System and/or Subsystem specifications (requirements) and Operational context description 

 Update design documentation based on internal (peer) reviews or customer comments 

 Update and clarify the specifications (requirements) during the design, development, and mock-up presentation phases 

 Ensure the system Architecture and design complies with the RAM, Safety, Quality and Cybersecurity requirements 



System and/or Subsystem integration


 Validate technical procedures defining the integration of System, Subsystems and external interfaces 

 Follow-up and provide advice on all the integration activities between the System the Subsystems and external interfaces 



System and/or Subsystem validation


 Follow-up and provide advice on all the validation activities at System level, dispatch identified anomalies to Subsystems if necessary 

 Ensure that the System and/or Subsystem complies with all the System requirements and the original customer contract as well as with any other implicit requirements resulting thereof 

 Support and follow up on Requirements Traceability, starting from the System level, to subsystems and to external interfaces 




 Business Understanding 


Railroad industry knowledge, ATS, SCADA, Management System, Integrated Control Center


Educational Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, Automation, or equivalent

Member of Ordre des Ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ) and/or Professional Engineers of Ontario (PEO) an asset


Technical Knowledge / Experience


5-year experience in Railway industry

10-year experience in System Engineering (System Requirements, System Architecture, System Integration)

5-year experience with large Control Center Systems (Energy, Pipeline and similar) and their typical integration challenges

3-year exposure to at least one ICONIS Product (ATS CF, ATS CT, S2K-AGUI, S2K-UHMI)


Behavioral And Technical Skills / Competencies


Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills

Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and French, as well as excellent presentation skills

Ability to understand and to write User Stories (Operational scenarios)

Ability of technical decision making, sound judgment, assertiveness, problem solving

Experience with Windows and Windows server.

Experience with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)

Knowledge of configuration management tools (Clearcase, Perforce)

Knowledge of VM Ware, SQL server basics

Knowledge of CyberSecurity principles

Knowledge of Agile principles


 Job Location 


Montreal (QC) Canada.

Occasionally, in other Canadian provinces (i.e. Ontario) or abroad, to assist at different integration and field-testing activities


 Hours of Work 


In accordance with the Alstom’s Human Resources policy.


 Holiday Entitlement 


In accordance with the Alstom’s Human Resources policy.

Alstom is the leading company in the mobility sector, solving the most interesting challenges for tomorrow’s mobility. That’s why we value inquisitive and innovative people who are passionate about working together to reinvent mobility, making it smarter and more sustainable. Day after day, we are building an agile, inclusive and responsible culture, where a diverse group of people are offered opportunities to learn, grow and advance in their careers, with options across functions and geographic locations. Are you ready to join a truly international community of great people on a challenging journey with a tangible impact and purpose?


Equal opportunity statement:


Alstom is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all our employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local law.

Job Type: Experienced

job_title: Data Lake Software Engineer - Data Lake Engineering - Toronto
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Job Description




 OUR IMPACT 


Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. Our team, Data Architecture, is focused on the firm’s data strategy.

Data Lake Engineering is responsible for the Firm’s strategic repository for enterprise data. Technology teams across the Firm are clients, participating in providing and consuming data to and from the lake. Developers on the team create and manage the software that manages the data in the lake, ensure entitlements are enforced appropriately, data is milestoned, and is available for query on multiple target warehouse platforms.


 YOUR IMPACT 


As a Data Lake Engineer, make data a strategic asset for the enterprise by providing a platform that enables the structuring, management, integration, control, discovery, usage, and governance of our Data Assets.



How You Will Fulfill Your Potential




 All roles in Data Architecture offer the opportunity to work directly with various senior stakeholder across Technology Division and their Business sponsors

 The Data Lake is being adopted by technology teams across the Firm at a very high rate. As a result, the platform is still growing and evolving. As a developer on the Data Lake team, you will work with the latest technologies such as Apache Spark, Flink, Hive, Presto, Kafka, Elastic Search, and Akka to build complex distributed applications to handle large data sets

 Collect requirements, and assess technical feasibility of their requests of your clients and adjacent technology platforms

 Participate in design, build out, and maintenance of a distributed, multi-region, scalable, resilient platform. Collaborate with core engineering consumers and the BU aligned development community at large to analyze and resolve escalations

 Collaborate with other team members across region

 Your clients’ background range from very technical engineers, to more functional and business facing analysts and managers. Partner with other engineering teams to understand technology offerings and how they can be applied and leveraged as part of our solutions




Basic Qualifications




 3+ years of experience with software development is needed 

 2+ years of experience with Java with a good grasp of Java development 

 Object Oriented Analysis and Design skills and familiar with design patterns 

 Good understanding of distributed system 

 Good understanding of database technologies 

 Working knowledge of scripting languages, Linux, Networking protocols, security and file systems 

 Strong technical skills, analytical mindset, self-motivated, independent, creative, can solve interesting and sometimes difficult technical problems under time pressure and resource constraints 

 Commercially focused; seeks to understand the requirements and how they will benefit our clients, stakeholders, and business 

 Experience with all stages in software development lifecycle: inception, analysis, design, development, review, testing, and deployment 

 Experience building and sustaining long-term relationships with clients and colleagues in a diverse global organization 

 Judgment to prioritize and escalate issues in order to influence objectives and outcomes 

 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including experience working directly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders 




Preferred Qualifications




 Experience with Hadoop and its ecosystem, including Spark, MapReduce, and Flink 

 Experience with AWS 

 Experience with developing Elasticsearch, and Sybase IQ 




About Goldman Sachs



The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world.

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Vet.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We are currently seeking a 
Senior Business Operations Analyst
 to join our Strategic Planning Team under our Business Operations department in Burnaby, Calgary, or Toronto. This role is also available to remote candidates across Canada, excluding Quebec.


What your team does:


The Strategic Planning Team focuses on Strategy Design, Execution Planning, Monitoring, and Governing the Strategy - we are passionate about great strategy and decision-making. We strive to be objective and unbiased while presenting strategic options and recommend the path forward. The Strategic Planning Team team has a positive, gritty, and supportive culture. We look for curious people that build partnerships across the business, enjoy finding solutions to ambiguous challenges, and love influencing stakeholders towards a common goal -- especially while using their strong analytical, financial, critical thinking and communications skills to outline the road ahead! In our work together, we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and above all, collaborative.


Who you are:


We are currently seeking an exceptional Sr. Business Operations Analyst to join our Strategic Planning team within the Business Operations department. This is a unique opportunity for a mission-driven individual to join a dynamic, collaborative, and fast-paced team environment. You have strong analysis and modeling skills, are deeply data-driven, relentlessly curious, and have demonstrated the ability to balance the details against the bigger picture. You will bring creative and forward-thinking solutions to tackle today's most pressing business issues, and collaborate with leaders across the organization to develop strategies that prepare us to be successful in the future.


What you’ll work on:



 Help develop executive presentations on various strategic and operational topics for various Clio audiences (all levels of management) 

 Ability to present complex concepts to senior leaders. You are able to look at a problem from 20,000 feet and see its macro impact and at the same time be able to dig into detailed data to develop your understanding at a micro-level. 

 Conduct broad research (internal + external) and evaluate environmental trends, assessing core capabilities, competitor profiling and completing gap analyses; publish distilled insights and findings and serve as a champion for recommended opportunities. 

 Help identify trends and indicators in data streams and reports to inform strategic decisions or guide new investments in under- or unrepresented markets. 

 Analyze the health of the business and interpret key performance metrics. 

 Utilize your financial analysis skills to assess and make strategic recommendations that drive profitable business decisions. 

 Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviours, and are aligned with company strategy and objectives. 




What you may have:



 Undergraduate degree in business, finance, economics, or a relevant discipline 

 4+ years of experience at a top-tier management consulting, fintech and/or growth stage software company 

 Experience with data analysis and BI tools (including Looker) 

 Ability to leverage superior analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills for the purposes of delivering business insights and strategic recommendations. 

 Strong financial acumen. 

 Strong, professional written and verbal communication including the ability to communicate complex findings in a structured and clear manner. 

 Comfortable to work in ambiguity with a bent towards fast execution and iteration; 

 Strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills, excellent written and verbal communicator; 

 Excellent organization, time management, and prioritization skills. 

 Self-motivated, independent, and deadline-oriented. 




Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion . We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers .


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies . In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

industries: Banking and Financial Services
description:
Address



100 King Street West



Job Family Group



Technology

Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products.



Manages complexity across business value, technology, and interaction models.

Possesses a deep understanding and problem solving ability of various complexities.

Develops innovative approaches to create solutions to resolve problems and significant issues.

Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business.

Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.

Contributes to the development of the seed funding request by ensuring project scope and benefits are clearly articulated and risks are identified.

Enables groups to successfully accept changes by informing stakeholders of their implications; recommends actions as appropriate.

Prepares and delivers presentations for senior leaders.

Acts in a larger project planning capacity.

Audits the quality of reports submitted by analysts and provides related coaching and support.

Supports the Request for Information (RFI) or Request for Proposal (RFP) with vendors if required.

Leads the preparation of end user reference materials and prepares end-user training materials.

Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs.

Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions.

Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses.

Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known.

Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.

Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets.

Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.

Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them.

Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.

Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency.

Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders.

Provides analytical support and insights.

Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO.

Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.

Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.

Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.

Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.

Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications:

Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique.

Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases.

Demonstrates writing and documentation skills.

Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support.

Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.

Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.

Influence skills - In-depth.

Data driven decision making - In-depth.



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources Services
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, Canada Job Type: Permanent Date: 3/2/2022 Job ID: MG27759232 Category: Information Technology

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to seek a Senior Business Analyst. The successful candidate will have an established track record in business analysis or system development, be technically proficient, and be flexible to adjust to various projects when necessary. This is a permanent, Full-Time Opportunity for candidates in the Calgary area.


The Role:



Collect, analyze, and prioritize business requests.

Initiate, design, and implement business process modification.

Maintain, enhance, and upgrade database and applications from end-to-end operational perspective.

Liaise with business and technical teams on user interface and platform development.

Proactively work with other departments to drive innovative technology solutions.

Manage, test, and implement system development projects.

Provide ad hoc reports and supports as required.




The Ideal Candidate:



A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Management Information System, or related field.

4+ years of experience in business analysis or software development.

Development or analysis experience in financial industry will be a strong asset.

Proficient with MS Access, VBA, Power BI, SQL Server, JavaScript, HTML, Python etc.

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a timely and accurate manner.

Details and results oriented with strong prioritization and organization skills.

Adaptable to a fast-pacing environment.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Manuela Gongora, Recruiter, Aplin Information Technology. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.



If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian-owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, over four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!



Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security
description:
About Netskope



Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security.

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events (pre and hopefully post-Covid) and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive. Visit us at Netskope Careers. Please follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter@Netskope.



Job Description



As a member of the Netskope Pre-Sales Engineering team, you will act as a force multiplier for the sales engineering community by designing, building and maintaining the tools that help the pre-sales customer-facing engineering team differentiate our technology, achieve higher win rates and technical closure in support of acquiring new accounts. Your efforts will be directly responsible for helping to demonstrate Netskope’s unique market-leading capabilities in order to meet and exceed customer requirements. You will be responsible for maintaining a framework for automation, self-service, auto-remediation systems and delivering software and new tools within that architecture. You will be interfacing with our customer-facing field team, product management team, engineering and operations teams to understand their inputs, timelines, goals and requirements. Through these interactions, you, in close partnership with the Global Solution Architect team, will design and develop tools that will most effectively help expand the value of the Netskope platform through and with other 3rd party integrations and help our customers get operationalized quicker. You will work closely with functional leaders and subject matter experts in developing these tools and solutions.



Responsibilities




Design, develop and maintain automation, self-service, and other systems and tools based on industry best practices and automate existing operations workflows

Own, define, communicate, and manage change management (release) process to develop and implement new applications/code and updates to existing applications/code

Design, develop and maintain an automation framework for deployment, customization, upgrades, and monitoring through modern DevOps tools (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Jenkins, and/or Kubernetes)

Work with engineering and product management teams to ensure that the features planned meet internal and external requirements.

Educate others on how they can learn and leverage Netskope’s APIs

Evangelize at a variety of industry events by developing and leading technical seminars, hands-on labs and participation in panel discussions

Testing the stability and functionality of the applications

Technical leadership, setting best practices including integration and application development, deployment, testing and iterative refinements

Writing documents and providing technical training for staff

Maintaining the security and integrity of the application software

Own the end-to-end technical success process to better optimize and track our organization's operational metrics and deliver regular insights to the business.

Codify existing pre-sales activities and research potential opportunities to increase efficiency via new systems, tools, and/or processes

Track and analyze key metrics of the technical sales team’s performance and effectiveness to help management drive better decisions

Build and maintain customized solutions and automated workflows that support business requirements and drive key business decisions




Required Skills




Minimum of 5 working years of proven software development experience and automating production environments/infrastructure

Strong knowledge in various scripting and programming languages (Javascript, PowerShell, Python, PHP, BASH, Go, React, NodeJS) UI Frameworks - AngularJS, React and PHP

Knowledge of modern authentication and authorization protocols such as SAML/OAuth/OpenID Connect and user provisioning methods such as SCIM

Hands-on experience working with multiple cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure. Appropriate certifications of expertise are a plus.

Strong background in cloud environments: containers, Docker, Kubernetes, API gateways

Experience building tools and automation that eliminate repetitive tasks.

Experience with continuous integration and deployment automation tools such as Jenkins, Ansible, etc.

Have experience with modern virtualization technologies (Docker, KVM, AWS, OpenStack or any orchestration platforms)

Understanding of networking and network virtualization required.

Working experience and knowledge of operating systems) and databases

2+ years previous development experience working with Salesforce CRM platforms, application development skills (Salesforce Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Developer certifications a plus)

Experience writing Visualforce and Apex classes and triggers

Experience source control tools such as Git/GitHub/Gitlab, SVN, or Perforce.

Must be able to work independently as well as work as part of a fast-moving team




Education




Relevant Bachelor’s degree; preference for computer science or related degrees


Netskope respects your privacy and is committed to protecting the personal information you share with us, please refer to Netskope's Privacy Policy for more details.

industries: Staffing and Recruiting, Biotechnology Research, and Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
description:
Job Overview




Hiring for Statistical Programmer 2 (Remote): can be based anywhere in USA/ Canada



With sufficient experience assume the role of a Lead Statistical Programmer for CP studies only with support from senior programming staff.

Plan, execute and oversee all programming activities on a study, including but not limited to, resource estimation, working within budget, meeting timelines, maximizing quality, interaction with other departments and the client, etc.

Develop and maintain SAS programs to create SDTM and ADaM datasets and TFLs, and perform QC of SDTM, ADaMs and TFLs

Produce Define XML/PDFs, Analysis Results Metadata (ARM), annotated eCRFs and Reviewers Guides to support SDTMs and ADaMs

With support from senior programming staff, develop specifications for SDTMs and ADaM datasets

Review SAPs and TFL shells from a programming perspective for studies with support from senior programming staff

 Respond to QA and client audits with support from senior programming staff

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in mathematics, statistics, computing, life science, health science, or related subjects.

Experience and/or education plus relevant work experience, equating to a Bachelor's degree 




Experience



Minimum Required:


Typically 1 - 2 years of SAS® programming experience in the CRO or Pharmaceutical industry, or an equivalent combination of education and Kxperience to successfully perform the key responsibilities of the job

Knowledge of CDISC requirements
