job_title: Senior Angular Developer - IBM iX, IBM Consulting
industries: Computer Hardware Manufacturing
description:
530633BR


Introduction


As an Application Developer, you will lead IBM into the future by translating system requirements into the design and development of customized systems in an agile environment. The success of IBM is in your hands as you transform vital business needs into code and drive innovation. Your work will power IBM and its clients globally, collaborating and integrating code into enterprise systems. You will have access to the latest education, tools and technology, and a limitless career path with the world’s technology leader. Come to IBM and make a global impact!


Your Role and Responsibilities


We are at a tipping point in history where the impact of technology on business is significant enough to transform the whole way that business operates. The convergence of new exponential technologies such as AI, cloud, mobility, automation, IoT, blockchain, and 5G have the power to change business models, reinvent processes, and reimagine the way we all work.

At IBM Consulting, we help clients navigate the scale of change needed to stay ahead and relentlessly innovate along the way. We build strong relationships with clients and co-create solutions at the intersection of strategy, experience, technology, and operations. We act as change agents: empowering clients to both strategize and execute their vision, which allows them to evolve at scale with both speed and clarity.

At IBM iX, the customer and experience transformation group of IBM Consulting, we are renegades and realists who focus on envisioning and creating end-to-end digital solutions that are focused on the end customer. We embody human-centric design and agile methodologies to rethink the way our clients work and engage with their customers and rapidly bring these experience-led digital solutions to life. Do you want to part of the team that is defining the future of fan experience for professional sports teams? How about helping financial services institutions transform in the age of disruption with the acceleration in digital innovation spurred by changing customer behaviour due to the pandemic? And what about helping oil & gas companies improve worker safety and productivity in the field? This is your chance to be a part of a team where everything we do drives measurable impact at scale.


Role & Responsibilities


As a Senior Frontend Angular Developer at IBM iX (under IBM Consulting), you are a team player that enables our client's product vision to come to fruition on time and in a secure, reliable, reusable, and scalable way. With your agile experience working in product-centric organizations, you are a team player working alongside a delivery team to ensure the successful delivery of web and mobile apps and other first-to-market digital experiences. Your responsibilities as a Senior Frontend Developer are as follows:



Managing the complete software development for our clients from concept to deployment in the context of their digital transformation, ensuring alignment to both current and developing architecture

Contribute to daily scrum meetings and providing technical direction to other team members

Collaborate with business stakeholders and architects to ensure solution aligns to requirements and strategy. Participate in the vetting and selection of technology (languages / framework / libraries)

Apply design patterns, coding standards, and best practices to produce secure, reliable, reusable and scalable code

Identify, triage, and perform root causes analysis on development-specific issues

Integrate UI implementations with secure and unsecure APIs

Work with internal and client stakeholders to define and clarify functional and non-functional requirements

Aid in the estimation and effort requirement to build key components

Prepare, document and present technical design and specification material

Exercise technical leadership through subject-matter expertise and domain knowledge

Contribute to process improvements, voicing any concerns and actively contribute to their resolution

Facilitate regular meetings and working sessions with development team members and different business units to address ongoing issues that require further understanding or analysis

Aid in the development of architectural framework and design



Who You Are



You're a quick and adaptive learner: you can pick up new technologies quickly, thoroughly, and confidently, based on concepts you already understand

You have an interactive work style: you thrive when working both in teams and individually when needed, including global and offshore teams for delivery

You're an outstanding communicator: you have demonstrated excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

You're a task estimation guru: you can quickly size a development task's relative effort, taking into consideration ambiguities and complexity by drawing from your extensive previous work experience

You have ownership and a strong attention to detail: you perform quality peer code reviews and have high standards and strong dedication to client success and satisfaction 

You’re keen on technology trends: you’re a magnet for learning and keeping up with the latest and greatest business and technology trends, and apply this to your work

You inspire: you mentor and lead junior developers on your delivery team(s)

We are hiring in major cities across Canada. Candidates considered for a Montreal, QC position must be fluently bilingual in both English and French.




Required Technical and Professional Expertise



Successful candidates will be able to demonstrate the following characteristics:




Bachelor's degree in one of the following areas: computer science, engineering, MIS or related field

3-5 years of experience in technology or related field, with relevant experience in user-centric digital engagements 

Experience with web development technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript as well as experience with one or more of Angular, React, Vue

Familiarity with cross platform technologies such as Flutter, ReactNative, NativeScript

Familiarity with integrating and supporting features provided by external SDKs or libraries (e.g. push, analytics, CMS)

Proficient in usage of source code management such as Git, as well as working knowledge of devops practices (e.g. continuous integration/delivery)

Understanding of design patterns, optimization, security and secure coding best practices

Experience in creation of solutions for responsive web and mobile

Understanding of the software development lifecycle & agile delivery principles

Proficient in agile delivery management tools (e.g. Confluence and Jira)

Fluent in English




Bonus Qualifications


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise



Masters degree or equivalent

Fluent in French



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.


Being You @ IBM


IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources Services
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, Canada Job Type: Permanent Date: 3/2/2022 Job ID: MG56857932 Category: Information Technology

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our client to seek a Business Analyst. The successful candidate will have an established track record in business analysis or system development, be technically proficient, and be flexible to adjust to various projects when necessary. This is a permanent, Full-Time Opportunity for candidates in the Calgary area.


The Role:



Collect, analyze, and prioritize business requests.

Initiate, design, and implement business process modification.

Maintain, enhance, and upgrade database and applications from end-to-end operational perspective.

Liaise with business and technical teams on user interface and platform development.

Proactively work with other departments to drive innovative technology solutions.

Manage, test, and implement system development projects.

Provide ad hoc reports and supports as required.




The Ideal Candidate:



A Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Management Information System, or related field.

2+ years of experience in business analysis or software development.

Development or analysis experience in financial industry will be a strong asset.

Proficient with MS Access, VBA, Power BI, SQL Server, JavaScript, HTML, Python etc.

Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a timely and accurate manner.

Details and results oriented with strong prioritization and organization skills.

Adaptable to a fast-pacing environment.

Strong verbal and written communication skills.



If you are interested in this position and meet the above criteria, please click the Apply button to send your resume in confidence directly to Manuela Gongora, Recruiter, Aplin Information Technology. Visit our website at www.aplin.com to view our job opportunities, career tips, and tools. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


WE APPRECIATE YOUR INTEREST IN DAVID APLIN GROUP.



If this is your first introduction to us, we invite you to become one of our satisfied candidates. David Aplin Group has been Canadian-owned since 1975. Our professional consultants are passionate about helping you find a fulfilling job or career and ensuring your complete satisfaction with our process. Our proven track record, over four decades long, is largely due to our team of highly skilled and successful specialists. Through superior service and a commitment to long-term relationships, we provide deep specialization in core areas for complete recruiting and HR solutions across Canada - all from one source. We look forward to exceeding your expectations!



Learn more about David Aplin Group and view all of our current job opportunities, career tips, and tools at www.aplin.com.

industries: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Siemens Healthineers travaille au développement des talents de demain. 
Façonnez l’avenir avec nous.

Nous sommes à la recherche de personnes dévouées et talentueuses qui sont en mesure de relever des défis en constante évolution ainsi que de répondre aux besoins de clients ou aux questions de collègues en appliquant des concepts intelligents et en faisant preuve de créativité. Nous favorisons le changement et travaillons avec des personnes animées par la curiosité qui réinventent l’avenir du travail. Joignez-vous à nous, et ensemble, nous nous concentrerons sur ce qui est vraiment important : améliorer la vie avec de nouvelles idées et les plus récentes technologies à l’échelle mondiale.

Pourquoi vous aimerez travailler pour Siemens?



Liberté et conciliation travail-vie personnelle : adoptez notre environnement de travail souple et bénéficiez d’un horaire flexible, du télétravail et d’espaces de travail numériques.

Participez à des projets passionnants et novateurs qui visent à résoudre certains des problèmes de santé les plus importants au monde.

Environnement mobilisateur et stimulant qui évolue rapidement et comprend une technologie de pointe.

Occasions de faire progresser votre carrière.

Droit aux vacances intéressant et possibilité d’acheter des vacances ou de vendre celles auxquelles vous avez droit, selon votre mode de vie.

Contribution à nos initiatives de responsabilité sociale centrées sur l’accès à l’éducation et la technologie et la durabilité, tout en ayant une incidence positive sur les collectivités. 

Collaborer à nos célébrations et à nos événements sociaux.

Occasions de partager vos idées novatrices et d’être rémunéré pour celles-ci!

Avantages et réductions pour les employés.

Accent mis sur la diversité et l’inclusion.

Siemens Healthineers est fière d’être une entreprise certifiée Great Place to Work® au Canada pour la liste 2020-2021 et de figurer sur la liste Best Workplaces™ pour les femmes en 2021.



Chef de file en matière de technologie médicale, Siemens Healthineers aide les fournisseurs de soins de santé à accroître leur valeur en les soutenant dans leurs efforts relatifs au progrès de la médecine de précision, à la transformation de la prestation des soins, à l’amélioration de l’expérience du patient et à la numérisation des soins de santé. Siemens Healthineers élargit continuellement son éventail de produits et de services, avec des applications fondées sur l’intelligence artificielle, des services numériques et des produits diagnostiques au point d’intervention qui jouent un rôle de plus en plus important dans la prochaine génération de technologies médicales. Ces nouvelles applications renforceront les bases de l’entreprise dans les domaines du diagnostic 
in vitro
, des interventions guidées par image et du diagnostic 
in vivo
. Siemens Healthineers propose également une gamme de services et de solutions visant à renforcer la capacité des professionnels de la santé à offrir des soins efficaces et de haute qualité aux patients. 

Siemens Healthineers au Canada est synonyme d’expertise en ingénierie. Dotée d’un esprit pionnier en matière d’exploration et de création d’occasions d’affaires, elle aide les fournisseurs de soins de santé à atteindre leur objectif, soit l’amélioration des résultats combinée à la réduction des coûts. Nos 800 employés canadiens situés partout au pays et nos 54 000 employés partout dans le monde travaillent ensemble pour proposer des solutions aux fournisseurs de soins de santé, ce qui fait en sorte que 70 % des décisions médicales sont influencées par les technologies que nous offrons.


Nos 

retombées :




 Le type de technologie que nous fournissons influence 70 % des décisions cliniques cruciales.

 Chaque année, plus de 31 millions de Canadiens profitent des produits de Siemens Healthineers.

 En moyenne chaque jour, 85 000 Canadiens reçoivent un traitement ou subissent des tests à partir d’un appareil de Siemens Healthineers.

 Siemens Healthineers collabore à 30 projets de recherche en soins de santé au Canada et partout dans le monde.



https://www.healthcare.siemens.ca/healthcare-company-profile/about


Fonctions et responsabilités




Concevoir, développer, mettre en œuvre et consigner les logiciels d’application pour l’application de test sanguin portatif epoc Host d’Epocal.

Utiliser les technologies applicables, notamment : C#, .NET, Xamarin/Mono, Visual Studio, Android Studio, Eclipse, SVN, Git, Java, tests unitaires.

Contribuer aux activités d’architecture logicielle et de conception.

Avoir de l’expérience en développement d’applications mobiles, un atout.

Effectuer la conception et le développement d’interfaces de données.

Avoir une connaissance du développement d’applications logicielles dans des environnements multifil et de l’utilisation de protocoles de communication réseau.

Assumer la responsabilité de l’exécution des tâches assignées.

Compiler des documents techniques sur les fonctionnalités du logiciel.

Produire des résultats pouvant être considérés comme précis et fiables sans examen détaillé.

Avoir une connaissance approfondie des procédures de développement du cycle de vie des logiciels d’Epocal, et en assumer l’entière responsabilité.



Remarque : Les fonctions ne se limitent pas à celles énumérées ci-dessus. D’autres tâches peuvent être attribuées, au besoin. Toutefois, des accommodements raisonnables seront mis en place lorsque possible, en fonction de la conjoncture économique.


Principales personnes-ressources




Relève du gestionnaire principal, logiciel Host

Soutient l’équipe logicielle sur le plan technique et en fournissant des pratiques logicielles cohérentes 

Coordonne, avec le personnel technique (ingénierie et scientifique), le développement de solutions logicielles pour les produits Epocal, y compris les besoins internes (p. ex, le projet « outils analytiques »)

Soutient les systèmes et les politiques d’assurance-qualité de l’entreprise au moyen de l’assurance-qualité des logiciels et de l’entreprise, ainsi que d’interfaces avec le service des Affaires réglementaires




Exigences relatives à l’emploi




Nécessite un degré d’analyse indépendante des exigences et une liaison avec des sources internes et externes 

FDA/BPF/ISO – environnement d’exploitation fortement réglementé 

Bonnes compétences organisationnelles

Bonnes habiletés en communication à l’oral et à l’écrit

Excellentes habiletés d’analyse et interpersonnelles




Compétences et exigences (formation et expérience)




Baccalauréat en génie lié aux logiciels et/ou dans une discipline connexe et/ou combinaison équivalente d’études et d’expérience technique acceptable pour Epocal

De 3 à 6 années d’expérience de travail connexe

Expérience dans un environnement réglementé (ISO, FDA), de preference

Compétences en génie logiciel et solide connaissance de multiples technologies



Siemens Healthineers a récemment annoncé les prochaines étapes de son engagement continu à accorder la priorité à la santé des collègues, à se conformer aux exigences des clients et des partenaires commerciaux, et à contribuer à assurer la continuité de ses activités. Siemens Healthineers exigera des employés, des entrepreneurs et des partenaires commerciaux qu’ils soient entièrement vaccinés avec la ou les doses pertinentes d’un vaccin approuvé par Santé Canada pour tous les nouveaux employés avant leur date de début.

« Entièrement vacciné » signifie avoir reçu la série complète d’un vaccin contre la COVID-19 ou une combinaison de vaccins contre la COVID-19 approuvée par Santé Canada (p. ex, deux doses d’une série de vaccins à deux doses, ou une dose d’une série de vaccins à dose unique) et avoir reçu la dernière dose de vaccin contre la COVID-19 il y a au moins 14 jours

Des dérogations ne seront accordées que pour des raisons médicales ou sur la base d’un motif protégé par la législation applicable en matière de droits de la personne.

 Siemens Healthineers

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Telecommunications
description:
About Us




Backed by a 50-year legacy of engineering excellence, reliability and industry-leading customer service, Telesat has grown to be one of the largest and most successful global satellite operators. Telesat works collaboratively with its customers to deliver critical connectivity solutions that tackle the world’s most complex communications challenges, providing powerful advantages that improve their operations and drive growth.




In addition to our state-of-the-art global, geostationary satellite fleet, Telesat Lightspeed, our Low Earth Orbit network scheduled to begin service in 2022, will revolutionize global broadband connectivity by delivering a combination of high capacity, security, resiliency and affordability with ultra-low latency and fiber-like speeds.




Telesat also provides industry-leading technical consultation and support services to satellite operators, insurers and other industry stakeholders around the globe.




Privately held and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada, with offices and facilities around the world, Telesat’s principal shareholders are Canada’s Public Sector Pension Investment Board and Loral Space & Communications Inc. (NASDAQ: LORL). For more information, visit www.telesat.com.




PURPOSE OF JOB




The Software Quality Analyst will ensure quality compliance of Telesat Lightspeed System through effective and regressive software testing. Reporting to the Software Integration and Testing Manager – they will be responsible for performing product, integration and regression testing on the state-of the-art software suite built over Cloud native platform.




MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:





Review user stories, acceptance criteria and business objectives of the product under development

Create and maintain test plans and individual test cases

Execute test cases and document defects using approved standards, processes and tools

Collaborate in requirements review and ensure appropriate test cases traceability

Report results and recommends to key business stakeholders / groups on the quality of the product, software development lifecycle processes and the risk pertaining to product quality

Investigate and assist in the resolution of common and complex issues, incidents, and problems

Collaboratively works with peers, vendors, internal and external stakeholders

Participate in agile ceremonies for estimation, demos and retrospectives

Support Business stakeholders during User Acceptance testing





Education & Experience Required




Mandatory skills


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering or equivalent practical experience

At least 2+ years of relevant industry experience working in software testing

Experience of testing enterprise applications and services (Rest/gRPC/GraphQL)

Experience in writing test plans and test scenarios

Experience in identification and preparation of test data

Experience in writing SQL scripts

Experience in web services testing using tools like Postman and SoapUI

Basic understanding of Cloud computing

Familiarity with Agile philosophies

Strong written and oral English communication skills

Familiarity with test management tools such as Jama Connect, Jira Zephyr

Experience with accessibility testing





Decision Making


In this role, the incumbent will have to make day to day testing related decision for optimizing the quality of the software product under testing.





Supervision Exercised


This role has no direct reports.






The successful candidate must be able to work in Canada and obtain clearance under the Canadian Controlled Goods program (CGP)
job_function: Quality Assurance, Information Technology, and Engineering

job_title: Senior Policy Analyst, (Small Modular Reactor Unit)
industries: Environmental Services, Research Services, and Public Policy Offices
IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Description



Software Engineers build Laserfiche products and services using skill and judgement to create software implementations that meet targeted requirements. Code written by software engineers must be robust, testable, maintainable, readable, and efficient and include unit tests. Software Engineers work on a team with other engineers and members from a variety of roles. They also collaborate when needed with Technical Support engineers to support customers, present their work in informal and formal settings, and review the work of their peers.

The process automation service teams help Laserfiche customers moving up the digital transformation pyramid. Software is developed to reduce repeatable human tasks, and streamline business processes that involve both internal and external participants. Multiple products are developed in this area, including no code form design, business process modeling, workflow design, reporting/dashboards and various toolboxes that are critical to digitize customers’ processes. What stands out is highly interactive, intuitive user interface design that leverages the most innovative web technologies, providing customers an easy-to-understand environment for their daily routines.

Laserfiche is the leading SaaS provider of intelligent content management and business process automation. Through powerful workflows, electronic forms, document management and analytics, the Laserfiche® platform accelerates how business gets done, enabling leaders to focus on growth across the enterprise.

Laserfiche pioneered the paperless office with enterprise content management. Today, Laserfiche’s cloud-first development approach incorporates innovations in machine learning and AI to enable organizations in more than 80 countries to transform into digital businesses. Customers in every industry—including government, education, financial services, healthcare and manufacturing—use Laserfiche to boost productivity, scale their business and deliver digital-first customer experiences.

Laserfiche employees in offices around the world are committed to the company’s vision of empowering customers and inspiring people to reimagine how technology can transform lives.



Responsibilities Include




Write and test code for existing and new programs

Utilize software engineering standards, processes, and techniques

Create, maintain, and support documentation of functionality and processes

Record and document code changes using source control management

Participate in peer-group reviews of designs, code, and documentation

Communicate technical feasibility of design ideas

Contribute to the completion of milestones associated with specific projects

Present work-in-progress and released functionality in informal and formal presentations

Collaborate with Technical Support engineers to solve issues that may be caused by a software defect

Adhere to the Laserfiche software development standard

Work independently to complete assignments with minimal supervision or guidance 


What You'll Need: 



2-5 years of experience

BS, Masters or equivalent experience in Computer Science or a related technical field

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and debugging skills

Strong organizational and communication skills

Strong ability to collaborate with and support fellow engineers

Strong ability to collaborate with and support test engineers, user experience designers, technical writers, project managers, product managers, and technical support engineers

Skill with object-oriented programming (such as in C#, C++, Java)

Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish objectives

Ability to quickly learn and apply new software technologies


Click 
here
 to learn more about Life at Laserfiche

industries: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, Staffing and Recruiting, and Truck Transportation
description:
WHO WE ARE?

Imagine playing a role to create products that save people's lives. At Mustang Survival, you can. The Mustang Survival brand represents leading edge extreme environmental protection for elite users including special operators, coast guards, fighter jet pilots, fishermen, sailors, paddlers, and even NASA astronauts. Our mission is bold, "We Save Lives for a Living", and requires courageous leaders. If you want a career that is challenging, energizing, and rewarding, come join us to push the boundaries of survival technology to deliver the ultimate user experience on the water through inspired technical solutions.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

The Business Analyst will be a key participant in executing the Wing Group & Mustang Survival’s technology transformation program over the next year. The organization is making a significant investment by implementing modern, connected, and enterprise-wide systems as part of a multi-year program. The Business Analyst will work directly with business stakeholders to define business needs, solution requirements, research and propose solutions, and manage these solutions through to completion. This position will be heavily supporting a Netsuite implementation across the company this year with a focus on supporting the Finance, Purchasing, & HR teams.



Responsibilities




Present solutions to the Identified problems and work with relevant stakeholders to implement the solutions

Develop Reports to ensure the Management team has the information they need to make decisions

Troubleshoot application issues with the users & design documentation to prevent future issues.

Work with stakeholders to define pain points and objectives within the business while clearly synthesizing and communicating these problem statements and the business objectives to relevant stakeholders

Collect and synthesize the functional, technical, and transitional requirements

Work with stakeholders to document and reengineer business processes

Manage projects through to completion

Support users during implementation with training materials and problem-solving




Qualifications & Requirements




Post-Secondary Degree (preferably a B.Sc. Computer Sciences or Business)

Minimum of 3 years of experience working in information technology or business analysis.

Experience designing reports for multiple stakeholder groups

Ability to adapt and work well in a continuously changing environment

Ability to assess user requirements and develop solutions to streamline operations

Ability to explain requirements & technology needs with users, managers, and executives

Ability to train others in software applications and create training resources for users

Ability to breakdown and diagram complex cross-functional processes

Proactively seeks opportunities to broaden and deepen knowledge base and proficiencies

Organized and effective at managing high workloads and cross-functional project teams

Strives to understand the organization's direction, structure, and department requirements

Experience with Netsuite, Payroll Applications, and Celigo

Preferable experience with HTML, CSS, Javascript, SQL, Visio, Jira

Must have prior experience in process modeling, requirements gathering, API integrations, software testing.

Bonus if you have domain knowledge in Accounting, Purchasing, HR, & Payroll.


Value

About Cognizant



Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
We’re Coinbase. We’re the world’s most trusted way to join the crypto revolution, serving more than 89 million accounts in more than 100 countries.

Our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web 3.0 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.


Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:



You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. 

You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. 

You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.

You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.

You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.

You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. 


Coinbase is seeking Staff Software Engineers (Frontend) to join our Risk Platform team. Our goal is to accelerate growth by enabling Coinbase to effectively and confidently manage the financial threats to both the business and to our users. We have a unified platform that centrally manages all sources of Risk for Coinbase in a connected manner and this enables us to make personalized decisions with a high degree of precision and with high speed.

If you're excited by the problem space of designing and delivering engaging user experiences, building performant user interfaces, and building trustworthy financial systems, we should talk!



What You'll Be Doing




Articulate a long term technical direction and vision for maintaining and scaling our web and mobile platforms.

Create trustworthy user experiences by building interfaces that are simple, easy to comprehend, performant and reliable using modern tools like React, React Native, Typescript, React Navigation, Jest and Webpack.

Turn our vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter by working with engineers, product managers and senior leadership.

Mentor and train other team members on design techniques and coding standards.

Add positive energy in every meeting, and make your coworkers feel included in every interaction.




What We Look For In You




You have at least 8 years of experience in software engineering and at least 7 years of experience in developing web apps and shipping user-facing features with JavaScript and modern, component-based JS frameworks like React. 

You've developed and shipped user-facing features using component-based UI frameworks.

You’re familiar with current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, security and usability.

You’re familiar with product and design lifecycles, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.

You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers.




Nice To Haves




You've worked on front-end teams in the finance or security space

You have at least 1 year of experience in developing React Native mobile apps or helped move existing native apps to React Native


ID: G1829

Please note that for employees based in the US, Philippines, Canada or Singapore, if your role requires you to be present in a Coinbase office or if you choose to be physically present in a Coinbase office or sponsored location, participate in any in-person gathering (including offsites) or engage in business travel sponsored by Coinbase, you will be required to be fully vaccinated (as defined by applicable law). If you receive an offer, you will receive additional information about the grounds and process for an exemption.

Commitment to Equal Opportunity

Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations[at]coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here).

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how data will be processed as part of the application procedure for applicable locations is available here. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

industries: Marketing Services, Banking, and Retail
description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada

Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.

Our Production Control team is looking for a dedicated Business Analyst to join Canadian Tire. As the successful incumbent in this role you will be involved with every facet of the operations within the distribution centre such as product slotting, inventory management, manpower planning, capital projects, change management and process improvement to name a few.
The environment is fast paced and requires an individual who has good organizational skills, sound analytical ability, capacity to communicate at all levels of the organization, and the ability to work in a team or independently. The Business Analyst will be responsible for investigating and analyzing business processes and systems with the objective to develop and implement process improvement initiatives using Canadian Tire Project Management Methodology
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Production Control Business Analyst position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.
What you’ll do
- Develop, maintain and support databases and reports to enable daily Production Control activities
- Perform data analysis to generate operational and ad-hoc reporting to determine or support business decisions.
- Identify, document and implement business opportunities that contribute to the continuous improvement of processes and decision making within the team and the AJBilles Distribution Centre
- Carry out detailed root cause analysis and investigation on various Distribution Centre processes, functions and material handling systems
- Develop business requirements, business cases and cost benefit analyses for assigned projects
- Develop and design new business and systems processes
- Provide support to develop divisional and departmental plans and strategies
- Develop and deliver communication within change management methodology to key stakeholders
- Create and maintain documentation and schedules for initiatives
- Provide project status updates and informal updates on an as needed basis to stakeholder groups
- Participate in initiatives that contribute to the development of new Resource placement strategies and coordinate and support their rollout
- Upgrade, automate, and/or improve existing reporting and analytic tools as needed
- Work with IT and the Operations Planning team to address requirements of the team
What you bring
- Strong MSAccess and VBA skills – Additional programming languages and Database knowledge an asset
- Proficiency with MS Excel (pivot tables, charts)
- Power BI development experience an asset
- Knowledge and experience with PPA and EDW tables
- Self-directed with good time management skills
- Post-Secondary education in Business, Logistics, Industrial Engineering, or related experience
- Thorough understanding of Supply Chain processes (3 to 4 years’ experience)
- Understanding of Project Management methodology
- Demonstrated planning, report writing, presentation and communication skills
- Experience with labour and process measurement techniques
- Experience in the execution of business case investigations and problem solving processes, systems and workflow
- Experience in CTC Distribution operations, systems and processes, and material handling systems
About Canadian Tire Corporation

As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn.

CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

industries: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
Summary

 
Be a part of the team that delivers an outstanding reading and listening experience to millions of Apple users every day. Does crafting new features that bring together software, hardware and services for your users excite you? 


The Apple Books team is looking for a passionate engineer to help us bring the next generation of book and audiobook experiences to iOS, macOS and watchOS.

 

Key Qualifications

 
Excellent problem solving skills

Knowledgable in software architecture design, coding and debugging

Strong grasp of Swift, knowledge of SwiftUI, Objective-C or JavaScript a plus

Strong ability to write performant and accurate multi-threaded code

Ability to communicate optimally, both written and verbal, with multi-functional teams

Passion for quality and attention to detail

Ability to independently learn new technologies

 

Description

 
At Apple we don’t just build products. We build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of our people and their ideas that encourage the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. 


As an engineer on the Apple Books team, your primary responsibility will be high-level UI development, but you'll often find yourself working at different levels of the stack in order to pull off challenging features. You should feel comfortable moving fluidly from network programming to framework and application development. You'll be maintaining and improving not just the Books app, but also its supporting frameworks and system services. You'll also be responsible for debugging and delivering the best possible application performance and adopting the best testing practices to help you find and fix bugs early. 


As the face of the Apple Books app running on iOS, macOS and watchOS, every engineer on our team can have an enormous impact on the product we ship. We promote innovation and new technology to further improve our creative output. Multifaceted, inquisitive people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. 


We're looking for a dedicated and passionate person to join our amazing team, if you feel this is you, we'd love to hear from you.

description:
Description:* o Develop high-level system requirements, based upon the end user needs and/or stated requirements. o Analyse and decompose systems-level requirements and allocate requirements and design margin across sub-system elements. o Advocate for design to cost, design for test, and design for manufacture approaches throughout the organization for effective productization of commercial space systems. o Develop and ensure proper documentation of technical and interface requirements. o Develop and ensure proper documentation of high-level system and subsystem design. o Develop verification and test plans. o Understand and assess design issues, determine appropriate resolutions, and work with the team to address. o Troubleshoot system behaviour anomalies, determine root cause, and the appropriate technical resolution. o Review, analyse and interpret telemetry from deployed system with context and understanding of the system development life cycle.

Then go into lower tier sub system requirements where they define what the product must do based on the concept of operations 4) Minimum 2+ years as a lead on a project or subsystem (work package) so that they are able to take ownership and thrive. NICE TO HAVES:

Familiarity with mission-critical software, Matlab/Simulink, and computer-aided design tools would also be a benefit.

Excellent verbal, written communication skills are essential to this position.

Degree in Aerospace, Mechanical, Electrical, Computer Systems Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent experience

Or someone who has proven experience working as a Systems Engineer without Masters Degree

Need to have a passion for space

Experience Level:* Expert Level ***DISCLAIMER: Candidates will be required to relocate to the Greater Toronto Area***

industries: Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
What You Do At AMD Changes Everything



At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.


Systems Design Engineer - 143721




The Role



As part of the RTG Product Validation team, the System Design Engineer leads the post-silicon product validation and system debug efforts of AMD’s latest dGPUs.



The Person



We're on the lookout for a highly motivated, innovative individual with a keen interest in finding and resolving silicon/platform issues!



Key Responsibilities




 Create and implement validation test plans focusing on product level regression testing, report coverage plan and perform debug experiments 

 Improve and optimize the test methodology and strategy with automation for more effective and efficient test execution 

 Perform system-level debug to narrow down the issues to various HW/SW blocks 

 Own and drive multi-functional engineering efforts to root cause of sightings and verification of fixes 

 Develop validation strategies, pioneer hardware/software validation improvements 




Preferred Experience




 Knowledge of computer hardware architecture (CPU/APU, graphic cards, memory, bus logic, and display technologies) and software architecture (driver/bios) 

 Hands-on experience with laboratory equipment (i.e., oscilloscopes and logic analyzers) 

 Solid understanding of circuits design, software (driver/bios) architecture 

 Hands-on debug experience with dGPU/APU, motherboards, memory interface, bus logic 

 Critical thinking skills, be able to craft experimental testing for debugging purposes 

 Programming/Software development knowledge with experience with scripting languages such as Ruby/Python/Perl 

 Excellent organizational and communication skills 

 Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems 

 Knowledge in display technology an asset 




Academic Credentials




 BS. in Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent experience

industries: Software Development and Computer and Network Security
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!


We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.



The Role


We are looking for co-op students to work alongside our seasoned developers in our downtown Toronto office (Remote until office re-opens). This position is to join the UI team responsible for our cloud-based Proofpoint Email Archive, a software-as-a-service solution featuring an advanced service-oriented architecture with distributed grid search and large-scale storage infrastructure to meet the demanding needs of thousands of users from among the largest businesses in the world. You will spend the co-op work term on projects alongside talented, experienced professionals, gain practical experience in an agile software development environment and get a chance to see what it is like to work for a dynamic, NASDAQ-listed company.

The ideal candidate is someone who is agile and who quickly comes up to speed in a fast-paced technical environment and can adapt to new technologies rapidly. You should be interested in web development, working with modern web technologies and building great user interfaces to become a knowledgeable web developer.

full time

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

job_title: Développeur en ingénierie de la fiabilité des sites (SRE)
industries: Banking
description:
La Banque Nationale poursuit la mise à niveau technologique la plus importante de son histoire. Nous revoyons nos systèmes et nos processus afin de les simplifier et de les aligner davantage aux besoins de notre clientèle.




Viens travailler au sein d’une équipe multidisciplinaire qui gère et livre les projets Web & Mobile!




Tu adores la technologie? Tu aimes travailler sur des projets concrets? Tu es curieux de nature et aimes challenger les idées en place?




Si tu es un(e) passionnée à l’énergie contagieuse, que tu fais preuve d’initiative et aimes travailler en équipe, on t’invite à lire ce qui suit!





Description



Tu es un acteur dans notre révolution DevOps et tu as pour tâche créer des applications et services en mode "Infra as code" qui répondent aux objectifs d'affaires tout en assurant leur évolution de manière durable

Tu es une personne appliquée (hands-on), ayant une mentalité Agile.

Tu connais tous les champs du DevOps et tu es un expert dans le design d’applications résilientes. Ton but est d'automatiser et industrialiser l'assemblage et la livraison de code en Production!

Tu as une expérience préalable de quatre années de développement java.






Ton rôle:


En tant que développeur en ingénierie de la fiabilité des sites, tu es un spécialiste dans le développement et la gestion d’actif critique résilient. Tu participes activement à la réalisation de notre vision DevOps en intégrant les meilleurs pratique SRE. Concrètement, tu travailles avec le gestionnaire d’actif à faire évoluer les applications les plus critique à la Banque en utilisant certains outils des catégories suivantes:


Collaboration (JIRA/Confluence)

Gestion de code source (SCM : Git)

Serveurs d’intégration continue (Jenkins 2 avec concept de pipeline as code, CircleCI)

Builds en continu (Maven, Groovy, Ant)

Tests en continu (SauceLabs, Selenium)

Inspection de code en continu, pour dette technique/vulnérabilité de sécurité (Veracode)

Gestion d’artéfacts (Nexus)

Rapport et tableaux de bords (SonarQube)

Outils de provisionnement et d’orchestration (Docker/k8s)

Terraform, Ansible/Python

Monitoring des applications (AppDynamics, Datadog ou équivalent) pour mesurer toutes ces belles applications et s’assurer qu’elles délivrent la valeur d’affaire attendue à nos clients

Connaissances considérées comme un atout: Déploiements Continus; Test automatisés; Monitoring applicatif; Docker (connaissances de base) ; Kubernetes; Google Kubernetes Engine, AWS






Prêt à entreprendre tes ambitions? Postule sans tarder!

Describe Regulatory in Pharma

 





Regulatory in Pharma refers to Product Development Regulatory, Pharma Technical Regulatory and Drug Regulatory Affiliates group.  

These groups are accountable for Submissions (CTAs, INDs, MAAs, Variations, Annual Reports, etc.) from Roche to Health Authorities. 

Submission required capabilities include Planning, Tracking, Archiving, Content Creation, Publishing, Submitting to HA, Product Registration among others.






Business Analyst: 




﻿




Analyze business scenarios that may potentially be solved by the implementation of automated systems and/or modifications to business processes. 

Provide expertise in the identification, evaluation, design, development, and deployment of systems and/or processes. 

Play key role – as part of the project team or M&E – in delivery of solutions that are cost-effective, sustainable, and meet business requirements. 

Accountable for documentation, which may include, but is not limited to: 

User Requirements 

Functional and/or technical specifications 

Process flow diagrams 

Training documentation and/or work instructions 

Depending on the application and/or function, may configure system settings and/or options 

Provide consultation to customers regarding enhancement/improvement of current solutions and implementation of new solutions – both systems and processes 

Facilitate and/or support customers in UAT planning and execution 

Participate in and advise roadmap discussions; a key member of vendor assessment teams 

Drive resolution of business or systems issues

Machine Learning Engineer




2022/03/08





Please send your CV and cover letter to
: hiring@multiversecomputing.com

Multiverse Computing

Multiverse is a well-funded deep-tech company. We are one of the few world companies working with Quantum Computing.

We provide hyper-efficient software for companies from the financial industry wanting to gain an edge with quantum computing and artificial intelligence. Our main verticals are fraud detection, credit scoring assessment, and financial optimization.

Our team of experts is world-renowned for innovative approaches to intractable financial and macro-economics problems. We work with quantum hardware and quantum-inspired methods to build machine learning solutions that exceed the predictive power of the current best solutions. 





The position is based in Toronto.





As a Machine Learning Scientist, you will


Join a world-class team of Quantum experts with an extensive track record in both academia and industry.

Work with Fortune-500 customers from government and private sectors.

Collaborate with the founding team in a fast paced startup environment.


Tackle high value open problems from industry.



Collaborate with quantum experts to design and implement new machine learning models.






Required Qualifications


Masters degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field.

Strong background in machine learning, both theoretical and practical.

Advanced knowledge of Python, Scikit, and TensorFlow.

Industry experience.

Experience using git, unit testing, and docker.

Ability to work with a diverse team of people, both in-person and through online resources.

Perfect command of English language





Preferred Qualifications


PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field.

Expertise in unsupervised machine learning.

Ability to work independently and hit the ground running.





Exceptional Qualifications


Knowledge of quantum physics / quantum computing.

Ability to write patent applications.

Ability to write grant proposals.





Perks & Benefits


Potential to grow into long-term opportunities.

Generous benefits package.

Progressive Company. Happy people culture.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Here at mthree, we pair talented graduates with leading global businesses. We’re always on the lookout for ambitious graduates to join the mthree Alumni Graduate Program, kick-starting your tech career within an entry-level Software Developer role and working onsite with a leading fintech organization in Montreal, Quebec.




Our 24-month graduate program begins with 4-8 weeks of paid training and career coaching, where you’ll learn everything you need to hit the ground running as a software developer.




After you've completed the paid training, you'll have the opportunity to fast-track your career at a global investment bank or leading tech company.





Role Description:



Currently we are looking for recent STEM graduates willing to work as System Integrators and mostly using Python Scripting, SQL Database, Linux operating system and little bit of C++.

If successful, you’ll work with a leading Investment Bank, located in Montreal, as a System Integrator Engineer.

An Integrator is not a software developer, a real integrator is business savvy, great leader, communicator and a doer - not a mere thinking, which is the job of a visionary. The main duty is to help convert ideas into actions and positive results.

A systems integrator specializes in bringing together component subsystems into a whole and ensuring that those subsystems function together, a practice known as system integration. They also solve problems of automation.

Systems integrator are rolling out changes to production and integrational files and automated testing frameworks.






What you need
:


Bachelor of Science, Engineering or Technology, or STEM related

Strong proficiency with Linux/UNIX commands

Strong understanding of SQL/Sybase

Excellent communication and relationship building skills

Self-motivated, enthusiastic and flexible team player

Good troubleshooting skills, logical thinker, customer focused

Candidate is required to be proactive in resolving immediate problems while balancing the need to keep on track the strategic initiatives.

Ability to perform under pressure without losing composure is key






 



What you’ll receive:



Fully paid, in-depth and interactive training with a diverse group of like-minded graduates, delivered by experts with working knowledge of the field.

A competitive graduate salary

Pay increases every 6 months

A complete well-being program and full benefits package

Ongoing training and pastoral care

Invaluable industry experience and the opportunity to start a career in a desirable and competitive industry





DIVERSITY:


We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each and every individual who contributes to making mthree the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within mthree and with our partner companies, and we’re proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish by promoting a strong culture of equality but most importantly, inclusion. We never want people to change - only add to the amazing mix of people that work for mthree.
