industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Cynet Systems, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Job Title Python Developer Job Location Montreal, QC Job Type Full Time Perm Direct Hire Job Description The candidate should have strong scripting experience with Python. Strong OOPS Object Oriented Programing concepts with hands on experience. Preferred strong understanding of all message types on FIX messaging protocols. Proficient knowledge of basic coding principles. Hands on Knowledge on XML SOAP CPS Message Queue based communications. Hands on experience with development and test automation tools frameworks. Strong hands-on knowledge of UNIX Linux environments. Should have experience working with Databases like Sybase DB2. Hands on Experience working with source control tools like Perforce GIT etc. Hands on Experience working with defect tracking using tools like Jira ALM etc. and continuous integration systems. Ability to partner with peers and management team to continuously improve testing methods process techniques and use of tools. A quick learner being able to adapt to a fast-paced heterogeneous environment and acquire necessary knowledge. Knowledge of trading life cycle with exposure to trading and matching engines will be preferred. Strong basic understanding of capital markets electronic trading order flow and execution FIX protocol would be good to have. Detail oriented and be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Strong verbal and written communication.

Solutions Developer





VersaFile Inc. is a Vancouver-based technology services and software company providing intelligent content and process automation solutions. This includes managed services, strategic consulting, implementations and commercial software. Our purpose is to generate outcomes that make a difference by making our solutions easy, highly functional and quick to value.




We are looking for a 
Solutions Developer
 to provide development expertise in building high-performing enterprise applications in the IBM stack. As a Solutions Developer, you will be developing, maintaining, and enhancing features in a JavaScript environment for our customers in IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation and IBM Case Manager. In addition, you will work closely with your team and project management to ensure quality implementation of the design.




Our ideal candidate will be a technically savvy individual who has extensive experience with implementing or architecting enterprise solutions on multiple projects.





Responsibilities:



Reviewing design requirements from customers and translating them into solutions.

Collaborate in a small team to provide business solutions through design and programming of intelligent automation solutions in IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation and IBM Case Manager.

Balance technical and business requirements when designing solutions.

Write well-designed, testable, and efficient code.

Provide input to Project Managers on project planning and estimating.

Participate in identifying and creating re-usable assets to improve efficiency and consistency of delivery across projects.






Technical Skills



Strong Development Skills in all or some of these technologies: Javascript with Applications; React Framework; Angular; Dojo; Github; NodeJS

Enterprise Software Experience

Experience in Agile development 






Soft Skills



Ability to solve complex and ambiguous technical problems using experience, creativity, and sound judgment.

Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently.

Ability to understand the functional design and project requirements.

Leadership to understand how to proactively resolve issues or collaborate with the client and team.

Excellent communication skills.

Ability to understand and interpret complex technical documentation.

Proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget.






Nice to Haves:



FileNet & Dojo frameworks

Backend Frameworks: Java, NodeJS or Python

Knowledge of OpenShift, Kubernetes and Containerization

Experience with NoSQL and/or Elasticsearch databases

Experience in: Legacy BPM, Case Manager, FileNet, BAW






Key Attributes and Qualifications:



4-year Computer Science or Engineering Degree (preferred) or equivalent experience

Demonstrated good judgment in making decisions.

Fluent in English and eligibility to work in Canada are pre-requisites.






Type:



Full-time permanent






Perks:



Competitive salary

Comprehensive health and benefits plan

Quarterly bonus program

RRSP Program

Cell Phone and Home Internet Program






To Apply:



Please submit your Cover Letter and Resume.






We thank all applicants for their interest, and we will contact you for an interview if you are short-listed as a candidate.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer Games
description:
As a Software Engineer Co-op, your daily is a healthy mix of coding, code reviews and discussions about the design and implementation of your work. You are proficient at Java or Kotlin and need minimal help with the programming languages. Having other programming languages in your engineering arsenal will be an asset. The work that you do meets the quality bars and coding styles set by the team all meant to keep quality high, debugging easy and bugs in check. Writing tests is important and all your changes have accompanying test cases.

In the hands of integrators, you are open to feedback and ensure that defects are addressed and conversations happen around usability, stability all the while working towards bettering yourself, the team and the product. As more new features come in or we look to enhance our technology stack, you will look at how to design the solutions so that they fit well into our big picture through collaborative brainstorming with your peers.

You are curious, like to engage with team members learning about their work and how your work all fit together. Having fun in a team atmosphere and engaging with your team members in different locations goes a long way to being a software engineer in an evolving technology space. It is part of your career and part of being on a collaborative team.



Responsibilities




 Roughly 70% to 85% hands-on coding 

 Create and work on large-scale distributed gRPC and REST-based backend service creating new features and updating existing ones 

 Resolve defects during testing, pre-production, production and from the live environment 

 Work with multiple integrators working on multiple different platforms who use the features you create to complete user facing features 

 

 Skills / Experience 




 Pursuing a Computer Science or related Software Engineering education 

 Experience developing software in Java or Kotlin 

 Experience online services (through REST or gRPC) 

 Experience and understand working with cloud technology 

 Experience technologies such as AWS, Redis and more 

 Take direction, plan, iterate and then accomplish it 

 Experience software engineering testing concepts 

 Experience developing software projects (personal or from work) 

 Experience with source control systems such as GitLab 

 

 Bonus: 




 Experience with one or more scripting languages such as Python 

 Experience with other languages such as Go, C++ or C# 

 Experience working with remote teams 


What's in it for you…


 A paid internship 

 Game credit perks 

 Intern events to connect the EA community 


We ask that you are legally authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis during the 8-month Co-op. Sponsorship is not available for this position.

industries: Accounting
description:
Address



100 King Street West



Job Family Group



Technology

Understands that the success of a developer is to understand the core business processes of the business unit and business requirements as well as the architecture patterns and technology strategy (e.g., Transformation, SmartCore, DevOps). Conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements. Writes, configures, and integrates code to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy. Understands the implications of various components (including technology strategy & architecture) to the overall design of a program, system, or eco-system. Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security). Works toward the objective of defect free software. Ensures that systems functionally meet requirements, align with architecture and promote the development of common assets. Supports the resolution of production issues and problems. Makes recommendations to improve BMO processes & systems.



Principal Responsibilities




 Effectively manage work slate and development environment with focus on Agile methodology, DevOps and overall timely / quality deliveries.

 Decomposes business requirements and translates them into detailed design specifications and code.

 Interacts with key business & technology stakeholders to define, analyze, and deliver requirements that reflect the needs of both the business and end-customers

 Handle and manage multiple technology work-streams in parallel to deliver to the book of work

 Participate in technical design, solution design, and code reviews

 Successfully completes all project phases (initiation, planning, execution, control, closure)

 Integrate with emerging technologies to identify best of breed solutions and implement various POCs to assess integration into other projects

 Designs solutions, writes code, performs unit testing, develops appropriate artefacts / documentation, and facilitates final delivery.

 Devises new algorithms and data structures for target environment and platform attributes in alignment with architectural patterns.

 Builds solutions that are supportable, scalable and achieve our aspiration of common assets.

 Recommends or automates approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes and/or systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.

 Provide strategic technology direction to meet or exceed required levels of functionality and to ensure compliance with risk management, security, and audit requirements.

 Understands and converts user requirements into high quality functional solutions, with involvement in the full lifecycle of the project

 Supports L3 production issues, includes independently completing root-cause analysis and diagnosis

 Communicate effectively with developers, system analysts and other IT stakeholders.

 Collaborates with stakeholders to understand and unite business goals and user goals.

 Ensure quality through adherence to technical best practice, feedback and paired programming

 Collaborate and build relationships with other domain architects, development teams, partners, and internal business stakeholders.


Front Office


 Proactively identify operational risks / control deficiencies in the business

 Review and comply with Firm Policies applicable to your business activities

 Escalate operational risk loss events, control deficiencies and risks that you identify to your line manager and the relevant risk and control functions on a timely basis.




Basic Qualifications



JOB SPECIFICATIONS AND QUALIFICATIONS


 7+ years of experience in coding, application development in Financial Services using Java, Spring framework, REST Services, JavaScript, Apache.

 7+ years of prior experience in technology development in capital markets

 7+ years of experience in Relational Database development in SQL Server, Oracle, DB2 or equivalent

 5+ years of prior experience in direct interactions with users and application stakeholders in Financial Services

 5+ years of experience in integrating with high speed messaging systems like Solace, Kafka

 Proven capabilities in effective management of tasks, multi-tasking, delivery focus and hard working

 Ability to meet application needs without sacrificing deadlines and quality

 Ability to collaborate and work effectively within a global team

 Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent degree.




Other Required Qualifications




 Strong team player, open minded to consider novel approaches to solving difficult problems.

 Energetic - Willing to work hard and drive initiatives to success.

 Self-motivated - Driven to get results, takes initiative and needs minimum oversight.

 Strong written and verbal communication skills

 Takes ownership and accountability for their own work

 Aligns immediate needs with long-term strategies




Suggested Qualifications




 BI Analytic Tools experience a strong plus

 Experience with Kafka, Solace, AWS a huge plus

 Experience with Shell scripting, Python and Machine learning technologies a strong plus

 Cross Capital Markets and/or Investment Banking experience is a strong plus.


AUTHORITIES, IMPACT, RISK


 Awareness and knowledge to partner with our client inside banking and digital channels implementation teams with cloud migration, machine learning, agile transformation, micro services architecture, pair programming

 Participate and drive the design, approach and technologies used for implementing projects and functionalities, in line with the Capital Markets Technology strategy.

 Meet the project timelines while still maintaining a high-quality standard required without impacting or delaying business needs.


KEY RELATIONSHIPS


 Compliance and other functional teams

 Application Development Team, Business Analyst and PMs

 Capital Markets and I&CB Data Strategy, Architecture and Technical Strategy Teams


WORKING CONDITIONS


 The work supports business users that requires quick turnaround, decision making and constant communication.

 Working with business/front office users requires meticulous attention to detail and the ability to "think outside the box" in.


We're here to help

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one - for yourself and our customers. We'll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we'll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other's differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
You



You love to build great products and enjoy the challenge of delivering iterative solutions that provide value each step of the way. You enjoy working closely with partners across the business and within your team to solve problems and are equally comfortable working independently. You are comfortable participating in the full SDLC. You know what it takes to maintain existing products and make them better every chance you get. If finding issues and fixing them with robust well-structured code are among the talents that make you tick, we would like to hear from you.



Us



Fieldpoint is the developer of Fieldpoint Software an advanced service management application for time & billing, job costing, professional services automation, and service management with resource scheduling, mobile access, and customer billing.

The development team ensures that our customers always receive high-quality software that transforms their business. Ours is a dynamic working environment that thrives on teamwork, individual skills, and focused effort to get the job done. We continually strive for excellence in ourselves, our products, and our services.

EverCommerce [Nasdaq: EVCM] is a leading service commerce platform, providing vertically-tailored, integrated SaaS solutions that help more than 600,000 global service-based businesses accelerate growth, streamline operations, and increase retention. Our modern digital and mobile applications create predictable, informed, and convenient experiences between customers and their service professionals. Specializing in Home & Field Services, Health Services, and Fitness & Wellness industries, EverCommerce solutions include end-to-end business management software, embedded payment acceptance, marketing technology, and customer engagement applications.



Where



Our office is located in Oakville, Ontario – near the QEW and 403. Fieldpoint’s in-office activities are currently limited. Our staff is working from home, so our initial interviews will be conducted online via phone or ZOOM. Plans for returning to the office will proceed in accordance with physical distancing and other health recommendations.



What You’ll Be Doing




Design, write, maintain, improve, and test our web and mobile applications.

Assist our customer support team by providing explanations and resolutions to complex problems reported by our users.

Effectively contribute suggestions and new ideas to enhance performance and usability.

Research and develop new solutions using new technologies to enhance our existing software applications.

Report to a Team Leader and/or Development Manager.

Willingly take on other tasks as required.




Must Haves




 Skills & Experience: 



 Degree or diploma in Computer Science/related field OR equivalent work experience

2+ years of software development experience in a web-based environment

Proficiency in .NET, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, ASP.Net, and SQL

Experience with version control software and processes

Able to configure and maintain Windows Servers & Services including IIS & MS SQL

Ability to learn quickly

Comfortable working at a small, dynamic company

Can translate business goals into actionable work assignments with minimal direction

Use best practices to document and write quality software, with a commitment to standardization and predictability.

Effective presentation and documentation skills.

Encourages and accepts personal feedback

Can use judgment to solve problems where protocol might not exist




Nice To Haves




Experience working in an Agile development environment

Working knowledge of HTTP, SOAP and RESTful services

Desire to debate and explore new technologies

Web & Mobile technologies such as: Xamarin, Sencha, Angular, React

Design and develop comprehensive automated unit and regression tests

Design and develop comprehensive CI/CD solutions




Benefits And Perks




Flexibility to work where/how you want – in-office, remote (during Covid), or hybrid

Continued investment in your professional development

Robust health and wellness benefits

RRSP; 100% match up to 1.5%

Monthly wellness stipend

Start with 15 days of PTO, 11 holidays, 2 floating days and a day off to volunteer each year

Employee Stock Purchase Program

Staff Enrichment (happy hours, lunches, company culture activities and competitions)


EverCommerce is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We look forward to reviewing your credentials and getting to know more about your experience!

industries: Banking and Financial Services
description:
Address



100 King Street West



Job Family Group



Technology

We are seeking enthusiastic, passionate professionals for Engineering/Technical Development Lead positions with extensive experience and focus on development management, hands-on software development, leadership, solution design, digitization, cloud and SDLC (agile and waterfall). Candidate will be required to participate development of enterprise grade applications through a team of onshore and offshore professionals. She/he would also contribute to BMO’s digitization Cloud strategy with focus on innovation and leveraging emerging cloud native services to meet the rapidly evolving needs of our customers. BMO’s Commercial and Corporate Banking Technology team is leading the way at a Bank where our Purpose is Growing the Good and Being Bold. We demonstrate those values every day. Be part of the action – where we have challenging discussions about how to align those customer requirements to the right technology solutions and services. Help evolve the BMO’s core digitization platform, leveraging emerging best practices and tools, securely connected to our strategic suppliers, providing a platform for innovation to an entire Bank.



Responsibilities



Working in a close-knit technical team, the role will:



Lead design and development of critical technology functions across Sales & Origination, Underwriting, Booking, Portfolio Management and Risk Management technical platforms

Manage development process

Design and develop technical solutions impacting the business

Ability to adapt to and develop on both on-premise and cloud applications

Hands on technical expertise is expected




Required Core Skills





Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated development lead experience with focus on designing / configuring secure and scalable architecture patterns and technology solutions

Evaluates new technologies for fit with the program/system/eco-system and the associated upstream and downstream impacts on process, data, risk (e.g., security).

Working experience with Angular/ Node JS / Javascript/typescript , J2EE and/or .NET, Python, Oracle and Postgres and expertise in at least one of them

Hands on with cloud technologies – ideally AWS

Hands on experience with AI and Data (preferred)

Ability to work in a structured environment, practicing both Waterfall and Agile development model

Ability to work with distributed onshore and offshore teams




Other Skills





Strong interpersonal and communication skills

A critical thinker with strong research and analytics skills

Self-motivated with a positive attitude and an ability to work independently and/or in a team

Able to work under tight timelines and deliver on complex problems.

Hands-on with multiple technology with ability to adopt to new tools and technologies



We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Description



Le ou la gestionnaire du développement logiciel chez UKG dirigera une équipe de développement logiciel expérimentée au sein du groupe Moteurs de planification et de prévisions. Ce groupe développe et maintient des applications logicielles sur la base de méthodes mathématiques et analytiques avancées (recherche opérationnelle) afin de résoudre des problèmes complexes dans le domaine de la prise de décisions. Le ou la gestionnaire du développement logiciel veille à ce que les produits logiciels soient livrés dans les délais impartis et avec une excellente qualité. Il ou elle fera partie de notre équipe internationale de gestion de l’ingénierie au sein d’UKG Dimensions, notre dernière plateforme SaaS/Google Cloud.


 Soutenir le processus de développement logiciel Agile (Scrum)

 Responsable de l’efficacité de l’équipe de projet et de son évolution vers une autogestion complète par le biais de l’accompagnement et de la collaboration avec l’équipe Scrum

 Travailler en étroite collaboration avec d’autres gestionnaires et directeurs afin de planifier et de livrer des projets de développement logiciel de haute qualité dans les délais impartis et d’assurer une responsabilité collective de l’excellence technique des solutions

 Collaborer avec d’autres équipes au sein de l’organisation responsable de la qualité et travailler de manière transversale avec d’autres parties prenantes clés dans le bureau de développement, de gestion des produits et de gestion des projets Haut degré de gestion matricielle et capacité à influencer les autres

 Établir des meilleures pratiques en matière de développement logiciel

 Comprendre les implications techniques des problèmes/obstacles et définir l’orientation de manière efficace

 Collaborer activement avec d’autres équipes dans différentes régions géographiques afin d’assurer la réussite de l’entreprise et d’éliminer les obstacles

 Capacité à naviguer dans une grande organisation et des processus complexes tout en améliorant les processus


Exigences


 Baccalauréat en ingénierie / informatique ou une expérience équivalente

 Bon niveau de bilinguisme français/anglais

 Plus de 5 ans d’expérience dans un rôle de gestion dans le domaine du développement logiciel, une exp/rience de l’assurance qualité, ainsi que dans la gestion d’équipes distantes/extraterritoriales son des atouts

 Expérience dans la gestion du développement d’applications Web

 Plus de 5 ans d’expérience pratique dans le développement logiciel

 Expérience dans un environnement Agile (Scrum) exigée

 Capable de résoudre des problèmes et situations divers, complexes et ambigus

 Une expérience dans le domaine de l’architecture infonuagique multicouche serait un atout

 Une connaissance/expérience dans la recherche opérationnelle, machine learning ou des domaines connexes serait un atout


Profil de l'entreprise

À UKG, notre priorité, ce sont les gens. UKG combine la force et l’innovation d’Ultimate Software et de Kronos en réunissant deux cultures primées axées sur les employés. Nos employés forment un groupe extraordinaire de gens talentueux, énergiques et innovants qui ont à cœur bien plus que le travail. Nous nous efforçons de créer une culture d’appartenance et une expérience pour les employés qui les responsabilisent. UKG compte plus de 13 000 employés dans le monde et est reconnue pour sa culture organisationnelle inclusive. Êtes-vous prêt.e à être inspiré.e? Apprenez-en plus au www.ukg.com/careers.

Égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi


Ultimate Kronos Group est fier d’être un employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi et s’engage à maintenir un milieu de travail diversifié et inclusif. Tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans égard à la race, à la couleur, à la religion, au sexe, à l’âge, au handicap, à l’état matrimonial, à la situation familiale, à l’orientation sexuelle, à la grossesse, à l’information génétique, à l’identité de genre, à l’expression de genre, à l’origine nationale, à l’ascendance, au statut de citoyen, au statut d’ancien combattant et à tout autre statut protégé par les lois fédérales, provinciales ou locales contre la discrimination.


Accommodement aux handicaps


UKG s’engage à fournir un accommodement aux personnes handicapées durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue. Si vous avez besoin d’un accommodement durant le processus de candidature et d’entrevue, veuillez communiquer avec nous à

description:

job_title: Deep Reinforcement Learning and Optimization Researcher
industries: Software Development, Wireless Services, and Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Machine Learning Researcher



Job Overview




General Summary


Qualcomm AI Research is looking for world-class researchers in deep learning, to join a high-caliber team of engineers inventing machine learning technology to provide best-in-class solutions while running with the most efficient use of power, memory, and computation.

Members of our team are part of a multi-disciplinary core research group within Qualcomm which spans software, hardware, and systems. Our members may simultaneously contribute to technology deployed worldwide by partnering with our industry-leading businesses across mobile, compute, automotive, cloud, and IOT. Our research team has demonstrated first-in-the-world research and proof-of-concepts in areas such model efficiency, neural video codecs, video semantic segmentation, federated learning, and wireless RF sensing (https://www.qualcomm.com/ai-research), has won major research competitions such as the visual wake word challenge, and converted leading research into best-in-class user-friendly tools such as Qualcomm Innovation Center’s AI Model Efficiency Toolkit (https://github.com/quic/aimet).

The R&D work responsibility for this position focuses on the following


 Fundamental machine learning research in the area of ML combinatorial optimization and its applications.

 Study of methods to integrate learning with search to solve important industrial problems such as efficient computation, resource allocation, and optimal network architecture.

 Research the relation of learning methods to classical optimization and search theory to develop new theoretical ideas to guide algorithm development.

 Identify new applications that benefit from the increased power to solve complex optimization problems.

 Apply solutions toward systems innovations for model efficiency advancement on device as well as in the cloud. This includes auto-ML methods for model compression, quantization, architecture search, and kernel/graph compiler/scheduling with or without systems-hardware co-design.





Ideal Candidates For This Position Will Demonstrate The Following




 Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.

 2+ years Systems Engineering or related work experience.





Other Desirable Skills




 PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

 Extensive experience in deep neural networks (e.g. CNN, RNN, Attention/Transformer, GraphNN) and deep reinforcement learning.

 Expertise in machine learning theory and optimization methods (e.g., reinforcement learning, dynamic programming, stochastic tree search methods such as MCTS, unsupervised learning), as well as fundamentals in classical optimization problems (e.g., shortest path, TSP, min-cut) and solutions (e.g., Djikstra, Held-Karp)

 Proficiency in designing, implementing and training DL/RL algorithms in high-level languages/frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe). Designing the network for an embedded device is a plus.

 Track record of research excellence and high-quality publications (e.g. ICLR, NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, SysML).

 Experience helpful in: Model compression / quantization / optimization for embedded devices; Neural Architecture Search / kernel optimization; Computer vision; Audio and speech / NLP; Deep Generative Models



Physical Requirements


Frequently transports between offices, buildings and campuses up to ½ mile.

Frequently transports and install equipment up to 5 lbs.

Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g. standing or sitting).

Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.

Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers and vendors both in person and remotely.





Education




Minimum Qualifications


Masters - Computer Engineering, Masters - Computer Science, Masters - Electrical Engineering



Work Experiences



6 months of experience developing and/or optimizing machine learning models, systems, platforms, or methods

2+ years Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering, or related work experience.



Skills




Certifications:




Education




Preferred Qualifications


Doctorate - Computer Engineering, Doctorate - Computer Science, Doctorate - Electrical Engineering



Work Experiences



1+ years experience with machine learning research related to new models, systems innovations, platforms, or methodology ,2+ publications at a machine learning conference ,1+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above). ,2+ years experience working in a large matrixed organization.



Skills



AI Frameworks, Creating the New and Different, Deep Learning, Developing Prototypes, Machine Learning, Mathematical Modeling, Python


Applicants
: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to 
accommodationsupport

job_title: Full Stack Engineer (Data Team) (All Levels) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
industries: Internet Publishing
description:
About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


Get to Know Our Team 


The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.


The Opportunity 


In this role, you will be involved in the design, architecture, coding, testing and operations of our global-scale software systems to support the innovation and technical excellence that the rapidly changing field of online travel requires.


In This Role, You’ll Get to 




Design, develop and operate the solutions used by millions of people every day

Big Data and Machine Learning processing pipelines

Data Driven changes to the application

Constantly look for ways to improve our products, code-base and development practices

Write great code and help others write great code




What You’ll Need To Succeed




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Information Systems/Engineering/related field or relevant experience

Strong coding ability with more than 2 years experience

Experience or willingness to learn JavaScript/Scala/Spark/Kafka and related technologies (if not already known)

Able to quickly and effectively read code

Good understanding of algorithms and data structures

Ability to separate hype from reality




It’s Great If You Have




Any experience with ‘Big Data’ technologies / tools

Any experience with JavaScript client and Server-side technologies is a plus

Strong experience in JVM languages (Java / Scala in particular)

Experience working with Lambda Architectures

Experience working with open source products

Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

Experience using Git



A few of the technologies we use:

React, Scala, Play, Spark, Kafka, Couchbase, Hadoop, Impala, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Grafana, MSSQL

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Cysiv is a fast-growing pioneer in the cybersecurity field of Security Operations Center (SOC)-as-a-Service. Based in Dallas and Ottawa, we offer our team the energy of a start-up combined with the stability of an established company – plus awesome remote and flexible work arrangements.




Cysiv provides employees with a great opportunity to make an impact and rapidly accelerate their careers. With us, you’ll have the chance to expand on your skillset while paving the way for the future of cybersecurity.





We take care of our team with comprehensive benefits, company-sponsored retirement plans, health/wellness perks, and more.

We believe in empowering our people – you’ll have the opportunity to build and shape the company’s future in a significant way.






As a DevOps Engineer you will:



Work with the development teams to design and support our security products and platforms

Provide guidelines and best practices for DevOps, Continuous Delivery, Automation and Software delivery best practices within our development teams

Roll out major changes to infrastructure and provide Tier 2/3 support during maintenance windows

Support a SaaS service which may require irregular work hours at times and on call support during North American business hours

Document day-to-day activities in our ticketing system






 As a DevOps Engineer you have:



5+ years of hands-on experience with deploying and integrating complex systems with a variety of operating system environments

2+ years’ experience with Google Cloud Platform and one or more other leading public, private and hybrid cloud infrastructures (IaaS, PaaS)

Advanced scripting experience (e.g. bash & python)

Familiarity with DevOps tooling for development and deployment (e.g. Docker, Jenkins, Kubernetes, helm, terraform)

In depth experience with running production workloads. (e.g. Monitoring, capacity planning, new service deployments, pod debugging)

Web Development skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript along with Web libraries

Experience with Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Redis and other data indexing and searching applications





Cysiv provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Cysiv does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

industries: Software Development
description:
We are looking for a Senior React Native developer interested in building performant mobile apps on iOS and Android. You will be responsible for architecting and building these applications and coordinating with the teams responsible for other layers of the product infrastructure. Building a digital product is a highly collaborative effort, and as such, a strong team player with a commitment to perfection is required.




Company




If it lives on a screen in the digital world, we build it.




From websites to mobile apps to media campaigns and everything else in between, we build it all with humanity to delight your customers and rapidly achieve returns on your digital investment. Our team is there every step of the way to bring that experience to life. Because to us, digital is more than a medium, more than a lifestyle – it is life.




How you’ll make an impact





Build pixel-perfect, buttery smooth UIs across both mobile platforms.

Leverage native APIs for deep integrations with both platforms.

Diagnose and fix bugs and performance bottlenecks for performance that feels native.

Maintain code and write automated tests to ensure the product is of the highest quality.

Transition existing native mobile apps to React Native.

Work with the quality team to ensure traceability from requirements through to unit tests and deployed application





The role of a React Native Developer requires:





Firm grasp of the JavaScript and TypeScript languages and their nuances, including ES6+ syntax

Knowledge of functional programming and component architecture

Ability to write well-documented, clean JavaScript cod

Rock-solid at working with third-party dependencies and debugging dependency conflicts

Strong familiarity with native build tools, like XCode, Gradle Android Studio

Understanding of REST APIs, GraphQL, the document request model, and offline storage

Experience with automated testing suites, like Jest or Mocha

Experience reading and understanding C++ code for cross-platform mobile libraries








Thrillworks is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity. We do not tolerate discrimination of any kind, as we believe in Diversity & Inclusion as a way to build stronger and successful teams. Accommodation is offered to all candidates upon request.




No agency calls.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Elastic is a search company built on a free and open heritage. Anyone can use Elastic products and solutions to get started quickly and frictionlessly. Elastic offers three solutions for enterprise search, observability, and security, built on one technology stack that can be deployed anywhere. From finding documents to monitoring infrastructure to hunting for threats, Elastic makes data usable in real time and at scale. Thousands of organizations worldwide, including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, Microsoft, The Mayo Clinic, NASA, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon, use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Founded in 2012, Elastic is a distributed company with Elasticians around the globe and is publicly traded on the NYSE under the symbol ESTC. Learn more at elastic.co.

As a Senior Web Developer at Elastic on the Marketing web development team, you'll be working collaboratively in a distributed working environment delivering valuable features for our web infrastructure that powers elastic.co. Elastic.co is our primary channel to communicate with potential and existing customers on how the power of search can solve their biggest challenges. We support stakeholders across the company and are working to facilitate a high quality customer experience at scale. We’re seeking a talented web developer and communicator to help push the our webteam and team to new heights.



What You Will Be Doing




You will be working on the application and backend layer that powers our flagship website, elastic.co. You will be working on enhancing our resiliency, introducing new functionality, and collaborating with engineering teams across the company to ensure we are delivering a first-class experience to our customers. 

You will collaborate with and mentor international teammates in a mostly text-based, asynchronous, remote-first team environment with occasional video calls and yearly conferences. You’ll be hands-on with the team and codebase, reviewing work, and providing constructive feedback.

You will help define the team’s overall technical strategy, collaborating on a product roadmap, and then breaking it into technical deliverables. You’ll act as an important and communicative part of an engaged and spirited team.



Our Team Style



We appreciate articulate and “humble people who want to grow as part of a team.

We welcome diversity in all forms. We embrace strange and risky ideas and appreciate characters of all sorts.

We hold each other accountable and work to a high standard. We take pride in the frequent, safe, and graceful delivery of innovative and valuable features.

We embrace open communication and challenge. We appreciate positivity and vigilance and strive for autonomy, trust, and personal and professional growth.


Our web application stack is primarily in Node.js, Next.js, with integrations to various platforms, both first and third party.





What You Will Bring




Previous experience building production web applications at scale, taking thorny problems and crafting high quality, working software solutions to them.

Experience in fullstack web development and managing infrastructure to support high availability, security, and scalability. 

Excellent practical judgement. You know how to prioritize, when to collaborate and ask for help, and when to be independent.

Measured and articulate written and spoken communication skills. You work well with others and can craft concise and expressive thoughts into correspondence: issues, investigations, documentation, and onboarding material.

An interest in learning new tools, languages, workflows, and philosophies that can help you grow. You can function well in an environment that drives towards change.


If this sounds interesting, we would love to hear from you! Please include whatever info you believe is relevant: resume, GitHub profile, code samples, blog posts and writing samples, links to personal projects, etc.



Additional Information - We Take Care Of Our People



As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.


Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary 

Health coverage for you and your family in many locations

Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles

Generous number of vacation days each year

Double your charitable giving - We match up to $1500 (or local currency equivalent)

Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love

Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave

job_title: Director of Supply Chain, Data & Advanced Analytics
industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
On behalf of our retail client, we are recruiting for a Director of Supply Chain, Data & Advanced Analytics.




The Director of Supply Chain, Data & Advanced Analytics will utilize data to provide a robust customer experience. This will be achieved by utilizing our great data technology (Snowflake, Airflow, PowerBI, etc), a partnership with our data engineers, & a variety of data practices (Reporting, Advanced Analytics, Data Science, etc).






What you’ll Start with 



• Leverage internal and external data sources to launch new operational forecasting models to our Distribution, Fulfillment and Logistics teams ahead of peak 2022

• Build a consolidated executive dashboard that will enable our leadership team to know what’s happening across our Supply Chain in real-time

• Design, optimize and lead the development of quantitative analysis and self-serve reporting solutions while spearheading the development of recommendations to optimize operational processes and performance






What You Will Do:




Vision & Strategy


• Create roadmaps to augment data and implement BI, Data Science, and ML

• Prioritize development work in balance with Operational efficiency

• Develop and oversee the pipeline of new analytics projects/initiatives from design to implementation





Stakeholder Management


• Work with SC leadership and other department heads to understand business priorities and identify business analytics, reporting requirements and new initiatives

• Manage Executive & Analyst level stakeholders to communicate & roll out roadmap. As well as collect requirements & feedback on upcoming or released products

• Communicate results and educate stakeholders through insightful visualizations, reports and presentations





Team Management


• Lead the development process of the roadmap

• Define team priorities, balance workload while providing development and growth opportunities

• Build, lead and champion a team of Supply Chain Data Scientists of different experience levels.

• Define team priorities, balance workload while providing development and growth opportunities.

• Hiring, training, coaching, mentoring, and providing direction/guidance on an ongoing basis to all direct reports






What You Will Need:



• Postgraduate Degree in Engineering, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or equivalent experience

• 10+ years of experience in a Data Role - Data Engineering, Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or other quantitative disciplines

• Advanced user in key BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Alteryx, etc) and familiar with Cloud Technology and Warehousing Solutions: Snowflake, AWS, Azure, etc.

• Advanced SQL

• Experience with Agile methodology and concepts to manage team’s workload and projects effectively

• Excellent relationship builder and collaborator with a natural ability to influence all levels of the organization using strong communication skills to bridge business strategy with technical know-how

• Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and challenging the status quo for continuous improvement






What Would Help:



• Supply Chain and/or Retail experience

• Data Science Languages (Python, R, Javascript)

• Experience with ETL development, data modeling, data warehousing, and databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets across different DB platforms

job_title: SW - System Performance Tool Developer (Toronto OR Remote)
industries: Software Development, Wireless Services, and Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
Company



Qualcomm Canada ULC



Job Area



Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Software Engineering



General Summary



As a System Performance Tool Developer, you are responsible for working with a team on developing tools to monitor, capture and visualize internal states and operating elements of a complex and high performance CPU architecture. You will collaborate with hardware designers, performance analysis teams and modeling teams. In this role, there will also be an opportunity to engage broadly with our customers and third parties on enablement of new platforms, and optimizations in our microarchitecture.



Role And Responsibilities




Design, develop and maintain software tools for the purpose of verifying performance and compliance of products at the system level

Participate in the design and definition of system hardware monitoring in future products

Collaborating with performance modelling teams and competitive analysis teams to participate in the focus of performance debugging

Assist in the definition of future server class SoCs and platforms by identifying opportunities for enhancement of data collection and presentation 

Assist in identifying skills requirements and building a team of engineers working on production software readiness, customer workload performance analysis, workload creation, compiler components and collaborating with other teams on bring-up/debug/diags

Participate in the hunt for compiler optimizations for server class platforms, focused on ensuring that existing Operating Systems run well, while identifying strong opportunity for enhancements that can improve performance





Preferred Qualifications




BASc/BSc (or greater) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or similar program with a focus on Software Engineering.Excellent programming skills with demonstrated experience in C/C++ and build systems

5 years+ of demonstrated software engineering experience

Strong software design skills with deep understanding of Object Oriented design principles

Solid grasp of Computer Architecture concepts, including high performance server class architecture, weak memory models, and server platform design/constraints

Good foundational understanding of CPU architecture components such as data fabrics, I/O devices, power management, UEFI

Experience in silicon performance monitoring, performance counters and analysis tools such as Linux perf, Intel VTune and collaborating with performance teams

Experience in working with Linux Open Source projects and toolchains

Experience developing software for server platforms and platform bringup

Strong understanding of code optimization, memory management, concurrency and multi-threading, and experience in software performance analysis

Additional qualification asset: Experience with SIMPoint, or, Checkpoint Restart in User Space (CRIU) implementations





Physical Requirements

Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day.

Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely."

job_title: SENIOR SOURCING ANALYST - Life and Health Services
industries: Insurance
description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.




Working Arrangement


Hybrid



Job Description




SENIOR SOURCING ANALYST - 

 Life and Health Services 


The Senior Sourcing Analyst reports to the Category Manager and is responsible for the end-to-end execution of the sourcing & onboarding process. The Senior Sourcing Analyst will support the Category Manager who manages the initiatives and facilitate among all stakeholders. It is expected that the individual will bring experience in 
 Life and Health Services 
sourcing (medical/paramedical/travel services) to contribute to the development and application of sourcing best practices across the organization.



Individual Responsibilities




Support cross-functional teams to execute on small to medium value/complexity sourcing projects

Identify sourcing opportunities by pro-actively engaging the business unit stakeholders

Conduct detailed analysis and develop relevant sourcing and negotiation strategy for assigned projects

Generate and leverage market and supplier intelligence and data for development of sourcing and negotiation strategies

Work with business partners on a consultative basis to collect and finalize specific business requirements necessary to evaluate and select suppliers

Establish deal teams for large sourcing engagements

Submit RFx (RFI, RFQ, RFP or e-Auction) requests to suppliers and make recommendations to the business partners on which providers will meet the commercial print or digital communication needs

Develop terms sheet based on negotiation strategies, with input from the business partners

Participate during the contract negotiation process, with consultative support, as required, from legal and risk

Track, monitor, and manage sourcing and contracting agenda across the category including progress, risk, and procurement impact development and realization

Interface directly with business partners and vendor/contract managers 

Perform other related strategic sourcing activities and participate in special projects as assigned




Job Requirement




Sourcing experience is required

Special consideration for candidates with experience in Life and Health Services sourcing (medical/paramedical/travel services; Group Benefits ) 

Excellent analytical skills with the ability to develop complex cost model and come up with actionable cost-optimization recommendations

3+ years of progressive business experience in strategic sourcing and/or global supply chain management related to commercial print or digital communication

Undergraduate degree (business preferred)

Passion for the success of the procurement operating model

Problem analyzer and decision maker – effectively searches and uses industry and market insights; able synthesize, and present complex information in a value-added form; attention to detail; evaluates feasibility and practicality of ideas and options; takes ownership and makes timely recommendations

Experience in creating and executing sourcing strategy

Experience in identifying savings and value in a procurement function

In-depth knowledge of sourcing and procurement principles and best practices

Experience with supplier contractual terms and conditions to mitigate legal and business risk

Experience with sourcing and procurement systems and tools

Technical and professional knowledge – demonstrated understanding and application of procurement and contracting principles and best practices

Team builder – builds strategic partnerships with internal clients and vendors; builds buy-in and engagement with key stakeholders

Skilled communicator – communicates complexity with clarity and ease; articulates a clear view of concepts, ideas, and objectives; able to interface with different stakeholders at all levels; represents the company externally with confidence; skilled in both oral and written communication

Collaborator – shares resources and leverages knowledge across the organization; builds and nurtures an extensive network

Strong customer service orientation – adept at cultivating and sustaining value-add business partnerships with internal stakeholders at a senior executive level

Work in a cross-functional global team environment and collaborate effectively across different organizational levels, functions, businesses, and geographies to realize procurement goals

Focused on managing and meeting conflicting objectives priorities

Ability to move others towards a position (point of view), with or without authority, by setting expectations and communicating expertise and a compelling rationale with an enterprise-wide mindset

Commitment to continuous improvement




Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.





About John Hancock And Manulife



John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly’s edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers’ applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly’s customers include many of the world’s most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.

We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.


Salesforce QA Engineer


We’re looking for a Salesforce QA Engineer to join the team responsible for the design, architecture, and development of our business systems infrastructure. We manage the systems that encompass the entire buyer’s journey from initial lead through marketing, sales, renewal, accounting, customer success and advocacy using tools including Marketo, Salesforce, Aria, NetSuite, and Zendesk. The ideal candidate will work closely with GTM Systems developers, admins, and architects to define stories, acceptance scenarios, test plans/cases, and advocate for best practices that improve our core business systems’ software quality. Ideal candidates will come from a strong business/technical background, have the ability to understand complex business requirements and technical architectures, and have the programming/automation skills to drive our testing infrastructure. This role is supported by the Sr. Manager, Go-to-Market Business Systems and will work remotely.

This role is limited to non-US only.



What You'll Do




Drive testing and validation of systems configuration and development, improving our testing processes along the way.

Define features, acceptance scenarios, and test cases.

Build the testing framework for our platform and write automated tests.

Own and develop testing tools and strategies, as well as manage test data.

Advocate for customer experience through consistency and simplicity.

Work with developers to ensure test cases are reflected in code and automated tests.

Identify opportunities to use end-to-end tests to provide greater value and confidence around our Business Systems software.

Advocate for practices and tools that promote quality, such as solution design, effective unit testing, etc.

Identify relevant quality metrics for the team like error rates and thresholds.

Advocate for, implement and monitor tools that provide alerting on those metrics.

Investigate defects and produce minimum viable test cases to reproduce them.

Support frequent deployments to production.

Participate in the planning and analysis of business requirements for system changes and enhancements.

Help foster a culture of pride and obsession around delivering quality software.

Improve the overall quality and completeness of documentation.




What We're Looking For




3+ years experience as a Salesforce QA or similar role

Strong Proficiency with Salesforce and the overall platform in a Lightning-based environment.

Demonstrable experience with a complex Salesforce org which requires testing of automation capabilities such as workflows, process builder, flows, validation rules and custom code development.

Deep knowledge of Salesforce permissions, roles, and logical formulas.

Understanding of and the implications of testing 3rd party apps from the AppExchange within SFDC as well as integrations with external 3rd party applications (such as Marketo, LeanData, Outreach, Zendesk, ZoomInfo, Bizible, etc.).

Ability to meet deadlines, communicate delays, and clarify ambiguous requirements.

Exceptional communicator, strong attention to detail and organizational skills.




It Would Be An Added Bonus If You Have Experience In ANY Of These




We value a variety of voices, so this is not a laundry list.


Experience working with one or more of the following: Steelbrick/CPQ, Apttus/CLM, Marketo, Bizible, LeanData, Outreach, Gainsight, Zendesk, Xactly, or Drift

Familiarity with marketing automation platforms (Marketo, Eloqua, Pardot, Hubspot, etc) and marketing funnel automation for tracking.

Prior experience in a SaaS or usage/consumption-based business.

Solid understanding of B2B Lead-to-Quote and Quote-to-Cash processes and how these processes are managed in a Salesforce.com environment.

Current Force. com Certification, Trailhead profile, or Salesforce community involvement.



Why Fastly?



We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand. 

We love distributed teams. Fastly’s home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is in our DNA. 

We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location). 

We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful -- every day. 

We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we’re not ‘one size fits all’. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about. 


We’re always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit, please apply!


Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. 



Employment decisions at Fastly are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Fastly encourages applicants from all backgrounds.



Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.



Fastly collects and processes personal data submitted by job applicants in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Please see our privacy notice for job applicants.
